text: The food is good... not that good but good... and I am all about supporting local business... however with that said I will NEVER EVER order from them again cause the Italian gruff man that takes the orders knows NOTHING about customer service, he yells over the phone he has a complete lack of knowledge when it come to customer service, politeness, respect and or anything regarding interactions with the public.  He is rude and needs to sit the fuck down and let someone else take orders if he wants return business.  This review is long over due since this is not the first time this mean rude MFer has disrespected me and my family. I will not be subjected to this blatant BS just for a pizza... there are too many places in this area for us to ever interact with this ahole again.  I didn't want to give him any stars but there's no option for that... can you say a slice with a side of shittiness... no thanks... please go jump off a bridge.

I'm currently at the airport in philly. the service at terminal e is not very good. check number 2270 started off asking for a beer  not sure what I wanted  ordered came in a real big glass then realized there were small pint size  bartender never ask what size I wanted just gave me larger size just to run up tab. then I ordered food ask if fries came with she said no then I ask for side of fries. when food came philly came first just set in front of me never said anything g walked away I said I was suppose to get fries sId on there way philly was more bread then meat was not very good. when fries got there they were not a side but an appetizer  i was talking with customer next to me about size and borrowed menu fries were 8 dollars wow I said excuse me to the bartender that was standing with her back turned doing paperwork so she could leave she said that's the only way they came I said I ask for a side but she never told me they only came that way again felt like the were just trying to run the tab higher. I said I dont want them she said ok took fries and dumped them in trash never sorry or anything.  so she said to me a bit later have a good day and took her stuff and left. so I ask the next bartender for a manager. manager came I explained the problem as I was talking the girl bartender came up and I told her that I've been in service industry for years and said you should ask what size beer and explain that they dont do sides. as I was asking some other bartender that was ringing up a item in pos system said everyone else does the same thing with a attitude. I said I beg your pardon manager said dont worry about her. really  that employee should be fired. anyway I said I really deal like your just trying to get as much as you can from me because I'm at airport he said that's correct. wow again. I will never eat there again and worn everyone watch out they dont care about you. sorry was hoping for a better experience.  manager did adjust my large beer and buy me one but still deal cheated. I've never done a review before has to be bad for me to rant like this.

I was actually really surprised to not like this place because I love Chinese food and have heard great things and read great reviews. The service was awesome but the food really wasn't. I wanted to like it so bad that I feel guilty for writing it but I have to be honest. The service and staff were amazing ( totally sweet and accommodating to our baby. It's a tiny place but they squeezed us in with a high chair and were very nice!) but the food was just ok. Pot stickers were tasty. I had pork chow fun with no gravy and it was relatively flavorless and kind of greasy. I don't usually say food is greasy cause I don't usually mind it and also it's like duh it's Chinese food did you think you were eating healthy? But it was like too much. Maybe better with the gravy? But the gravyless looked so yummy in the pictures! Husband got roasted duck with stir fried noodles and honestly it tasted the same as mine other than the flavor of the duck. Kinda flavorless and greasy. So weird considering all the great things I've heard! An off night? Got the wrong dishes? Maybe but two dishes being not tasty is odd I could see one but both...hmmm?! I will give them another shot though considering all the good I've heard and hope for a different experience.
Bouncers keeping everyone outside when it's not even that busy inside. Not worth the wait. Tons of other places around to go to! :)

The food was ok at best, the portions will most likely not leave you with leftovers.  We ordered delivery, overall it was fast. The gentleman who answered the phone sounded more curt than welcoming.  After asking for our address he cut us off the first time we gave it then hung up on us midway through the second. We called back thinking it was an accident, he brushed it off like it wasn't an issue. We gave our address and order then he quickly ended the call without a thank you or goodbye.   
We will search for a place who actually wants our business in the future.

The food, drinks and service were sub-par. Upon ordering out drink, we were told that we had to order food as well which was not part of our plan and was not something that was mentioned prior to us being seated.

Super disappointed and frustrated with the service at this place. I began ordering and the lady, while leaning over as if to fall asleep on the counter, rudely interrupted to let me know everything was pre-made. It was as if I literally pulled her out of her nap. I was excited about trying this place but abruptly left after the miserable service. Get another job lady, maybe where you can sleep on the job for real.
Not impressed at all over priced terrible service and just doesn't taste good. I love pizza and was excited to try this place but it was a huge disappointment

We hired this company to do a new house deep clean after renovation . I was very disappointed and infuriated to see a lot of the drawers and shelves were not cleaned. Floors looked horrible and worse than before . Unbelievable.
The pizza was okay, but the place was dirty (even though it was after the lunch rush) and the staff was unfriendly and unhelpful. There are better pizza options in the area.

Food was bland, and also poor customer service. 

Also, what in the world is up with your privacy notice? Information is collected and given to third parties outside of Europe? And you charge €10 (not $10 USD) as entitled "by law" if someone wants to find out what information you have on them? I think you either copy and pasted this, or you're fabricating these so-called laws.

This is straight from their website:

"The information you provide to us may be accessed by or given to third parties some of whom may be located outside the European Economic Area who act for us for the purposes set out in this policy or for other purposes approved by you. Those parties process information, fulfil and deliver orders, process credit card payments and provide support services on our behalf. We may also pass aggregate information on the usage of our website to third parties but this will not include information that can be used to identify you. 
Where you have consented when providing us with your details, we may also allow other companies in our group, to contact you occasionally about products and services which may be of interest to you. They may contact you by e-mail. If you change your mind about being contacted by these companies in the future, please let us know at sales@sparkschinachef.com. 
Finally, if our business enters into a joint venture with or is sold to or merged with another business entity, your information may be disclosed to our new business partners or owners. 
Countries outside the European Economic Area do not always have strong data protection laws. However, we will always take steps to ensure that your information is used by third parties in accordance with this policy. 
Unless required to do so by law, we will not otherwise share, sell or distribute any of the information you provide to us without your consent. 

ACCESSING AND UPDATING

You are entitled to see the information held about you and you may ask us to make any necessary changes to ensure that it is accurate and kept up to date. If you wish to do this, please contact us at sales@sparkschinachef.com. We are entitled by law to charge a fee of £10 to meet our costs in providing you with details of the information we hold about you."

I absolutely did not like it. I'm not hard to please but I kind of expected the ribs to be "fall off the bone" tender...not tough, stuck on the bone, and slathered in what tasted like ketchup. Very disappointed for what I paid.

We have been going to Bloomingdale Animal Hospital for as long as we have had dogs, 10+ years, for their low prices and location convenience. But after the way they treated an emergency situation, we will NEVER go there again. I don't know if it was lack of education on their part or lack of care, but either way, I will never trust them with my animals again. We have a miniature Dachshund who is 10 years old and one morning woke up screaming crying in pain, I rushed her to the vet right away and they took blood work, exams, and gave me anti inflammatory medicine and pain killers. After paying an arm and a leg, they told me they have no idea what's wrong with her and to check back in after a week. A few days later her pain was getting worse and not better, so I rushed her back in to get re-examined. After paying another arm and a leg, they told me it could be cancer but they are not completely sure, and she might have to be put down and just upped the medication and sent me on my way. Thank goodness my Dachshund got worse over the weekend, because this place was unavailable so I rushed her to the ER Vet Blue Pearl, where within minutes they diagnosed her with a COMMON DACHSHUND DISEASE CALLED IVDD. They immediately got her on the correct medication and treatment process and within weeks my dachshund was better, happy, and healthy. BLOOMINGDALE ANIMAL HOSPITAL TOLD ME SHE MIGHT DIE- and if they would have accurately diagnosed her the first time she would have been better weeks earlier instead of sitting in unimaginable pain. They either didn't care about my dachshunds life and wanted the extra money, didn't know a common disease which worries me about their overall education, or didn't take the time to genuinely care about my dachshunds pain. DO NOT GO TO THEM, YOUR DOGS CARE IS WORTH PAYING SLIGHTLY MORE SOMEWHERE ELSE.

We bought the membership program for plumbing, electrical and air conditioning. They would come out periodically to check, but it was only just an excuse to try to sell us new and unnecessary parts. 

After calling to cancel the $35 per month charge, I was told I had to send a written request by email or regular mail, and it would take 30 days for it to be cancelled. Of course that means they get another payment out of me. 

30 days?  Sleezeb. Look at the reviews of this company both here and at BBB. 

IN ANSWER TO YOUR COMMENT. 

When we had the condenser fan stopped due to lightening in our air conditioning, we again had to listen to a selling speel before he would replace it. This was a unit that was less than 5 yrs old because it was still under warranty for the original installation. 

High pressure sale. Greatly inflated prices 

You came out once about our heater during your annual checkup in 2016.  We were told there was a tiny gas leak which he fixed after first telling us all about the expensive systems that we should buy before fixing it. The heater is still working fine in 2018.  Plus he looked at our air intake on the heating/cooling intake. Found a birds nest, but he said he was unable to get it out, they suggested punching a hold in the side wall for a new intake system. I went to hardware store, bought a snake, and cleaned it out myself  

Take a look at the BBB reviews of this company.

This review is for the true religion store. After owning several true religion jeans i purchased a pair from this store that bagged out after wearing for just over an hour and it started to lose shape. I called the store and explained the issue and advised that i removed the tags to wear the jeans but needed to return or exchange them due to them bagging out after such a short time. I was advised there is no way to return or exchange jeans once the tag is removed and i was referred to read the return policy on the receipt. I again explained i own several jeans the same size and have not had this issue before . How would i know the jeans would not fit so poorly unless I wore them? $130 is too much to not be able to return of something does not work. Another true religion store accepted the jeans and could not believe it was so stretchy.  They explained there are quality differences in jeans made for outlet locations.

Was recommended this place by a hotel employee while visiting Philly on my last day of the trip.  First thing I noticed was how quiet it was.  There were a few others dining there but the music was very low, which kind of made the vibe uncomfortable.  Our waiter (I think his name was David) hovered way too much for my liking as if we were a nuisance.  I ordered the lamb sliders and mac and cheese.  They were both delicious and cooked to perfection.  Once the bill arrived it was combined for me friend and I.  (why do restaurants assume to female friends who are dining wouldnt be paying separately?)  Anywho, I asked, can you separate the bills.  To which David replied I can do it myself and itemize the bill and list which card was paying for which, this REALLY ticked me off.  So as I sat there trying to separate each of our orders, drinks and taxes he literally stood over my should, not to offer any assistance but to rush me.  We felt like we were intruding just by dining there.  Plus side, is there were great picture ops on the deck.IF I return when visiting Philly again, I'd definitely ask for a different waiter.

In on business so I stopped in cause it's near by. Walked an was confused on where to go and what to do no one was there to greet me so I sat at the bar. It is Monday night, but there wasn't really anyone there and a couple of dirty tables that were never cleaned, even before I left. Food was adequate, could be much better if the chef cared about the plates before they went out of the kitchen. Wont be going back. Waitress/ bartender was very nice.
Who gives ketchup and mayo packets when you are dining in... low brow... and, what is in the packet tastes distinctly different than what is on my plate. Don't bother. Worth a walk to anywhere else.
Yes they food is good but the service is very slow and the drive thru takes way too long sometimes I want chic fil a before I got to work but they take too long and I won't get to work on time

Seafood dept. knife was so dull it ripped the tuna he said no one would let him sharpen knife. I find that hard to believe  I fished for tuna most of my life awful to see fish destroyed like that. He was fine with it I left it on the shelf. Will shop elsewhere. Capt. Dissapointed

I stopped by at Char West since I didn't want to sit and dine for a meal. I didn't walk to the end of the wharf to check out the other options. I made the mistake of not checking the yelp reviews, and went ahead and ordered. I had the grilled fish sandwich with fries. Not very flavorful but it did the job. Well...a few hours went by, and I started feeling nauseous. I concluded that it was the fish that was upsetting my stomach. I felt like this the rest of the weekend, and tonight the nausea finally got the best of me. 
I don't recommend getting seafood from this spot, but there's plenty of other options that may be okay. You'll have a seat with a good view of the sea at the very least!

Went to this Subaru to replace a tire that had a nail in it, they claimed they could not help me and sent me on my way. Later the dealership I bought my car from originally tried to contact them to fix the situation but this dealership refused to help and claimed that they did not have access to my tire. The end result is that these people tried their best to screw me over and not help me and did so with a smile on their face. If you absolutely have to go here I recommend not believing a single word they say.

Good ole Ardiocese charging $20 to enter? For upkeep? The place has weeds all over the place,  trash and construction cones thrown around, exterior wall is badly deteriorated. $5 a person from all the people entering everyday wouldn't take care of the "upkeep"???

Wish we could give this dealership a 5 star. We have been a customer since 2006. Unfortunately, due to a lack of communication I have to give them a 2 Star. This past weekend we felt that we were basically held hostage at the dealership for over 5 hours to complete our deal when it should have taken an hour. We are residence in Alabama. However, we called our sales person, Brad, down at Maher Chevrolet to get a deal done for us. He is an exceptional salesman and it's because of him that I didn't grade this to a 1 star. We had been corresponding with him for weeks and was told we had been approved and to come get our truck. We sent the money down last Monday. We arrived this past Saturday to get the truck. We met Brad who told us he was passing us on to Matthew Berry, because we were getting a brand new truck. He is a new car salesman. We test drove the truck and we were glad with the deal. So we go inside to sign the paperwork. He advised they were printing it out. He went over Chevrolet Mylink and points and all of the usual. Then he leaves to check on the deal. He returns 30 minutes later to ask for references. We quickly wrote those down and he takes it again and then he disappears. Mind you we had been driving since 2:30 am, got there around 1pm. We are tired and want to get this done. He keeps coming back saying we are almost done. Then he asks for bank statements and proof of address. We printed all of that out. Mind you we have been there almost 3 hours now. We brought lunch with us in our cooler so we go and warm it up and eat it in the kitchen. He comes and finds us and says yet again they are almost done. We get done with eating and they still aren't done. We go to take a nap in our car that we drove up in for almost an hour. Brad comes walking by and he asks why are we still here. We tell him we have no clue. He goes to find out. Then Matthew comes out and says we are going with another bank then what we were approved for. So it's taking time to negotiate. This bank wants $900 more down then what we have already paid. He said he will be back. He comes back 10 minutes later and says we were able to get you approved through GM Financial now so no need to pay it. Then he says we are waiting to hear from them or we can just take the deal with the other bank and pay the additional $900. Mind you we have been here over 5 hours. With us leaving to return home at 4am we didn't have time to wait nor did we trust them at this point to return the next day. So we went ahead and wrote a check for the $900, signed and drove off. While we were in the finance office the kind financial lady was kind enough to let us know why we were there so long. She stated that her boss told the sales people that we were approved when all he received was a pre-approval. The deal should have gone to a different finance manager. That finance manager unfortunately didn't even see the deal until we got there even though they had our money 6 days earlier. She stated it was Matthew Berry's manager who kept us there and someone should have told us that the approval they thought they had wasn't a real approval. She further stated that she was working on a deal with GM Financial which the rep approved, but the manager at GM would not. She stated she asked them not to tell us. Yet again we didn't learn the first time. They came and told us. She advised she knew right away it wasn't approved. Yet that also wasn't relayed to us. In the end of all of this we finally were able to get the truck. Sadly, we were not able to visit our elderly grandmother or any family. Had they communicated then we could have left the dealership, took a shower, visited relatives and even took a cat nap. Instead we were kept hostage and lied to over and over. A manager came to say they were sorry. After being there for over 5 hours I'm sorry isn't going to cut it. People that do this on a daily basis don't know the difference between an approval and a pre-approval. When it was done one time you do it again. Get it together Maher!

Food is outstanding, but the decor and service are deplorable. We were a party of eight on a Thursday night with a 7pm reservation, and the restaurant was a ghost town. The uncomfortable chairs with the dollar store seat cushions  were from an average reception hall, the table uneven because of the extended leaves transforming a square table to round and unless you are seated by a window, you could be in any average restaurant. The staff were dressed for a rodeo, clumsy and untrained, randomly picking up and dropping off dishes. The trendy, hipster manager spent more time smiling at his cell phone than engaging with guests. The average price of an entree was $35 with an a-la-carte option for salad and garnish. The only included item was the bread that was as fresh as the rolls at the box grocery stores.  Again, while the entrees were well above average, the rest of this experience is labeled a tourist trap and I doubt locals visit often unless they have a disposable income and overlook the lack of attention or concern to guest experiences.

I normally love this place, but tonight my Sea Bass was not thoroughly cooked and they had to take it back to finish. I didn't notice it was under cooked until after a few bites and then I told our server. She completely agreed so that part was not a problem. I was just surprised that they took the fish off my plate and back to the kitchen to cook further instead of taking my entire plate. Having the rest of my food and my utensils on the plate with under cooked fish made me nervous. I also was surprised that they didn't offer some sort of complimentary food or price break. When the Sea Bass was returned to me it was over cooked. Not horrible but enough that it was somewhat dry and tough. I will probably never return to Brophy's after this experience. I also sampled the clam chowder and it was very salty. I think this restaurant has gone downhill. Too bad. It used to be a great restaurant known for their freshness.

WOW - what IDIOTS!! Came early to beat the crowd, 9am on a Thursday. Already both lanes backed up. Had to wait just to get to the kiosk. Then cars were going ahead of me out of order, then this truck pulls right in front of me from the outside lane on the right!! If that's not bad enough, this truck doesn't get in straight and had to back up, making me back up, and several cars behind me. So unorganized. I will not be coming back to this location. Talk about incompetence - good grief!!

Complete and total waste of my time and money.  I will never ever return.  New Patient appointment.

Front desk - the height of rudeness and completely unprofessional 

Doctor C. - more concerned with the revenue model than treating patients.

Office space itself was just disgusting.  Dirty, stained seating.

More to follow...

I don't like leaving poor reviews for restaurants, but unfortunately this location deserves one. 

You walk in and the only menu you can order from is a folded-up takeout menu that was somewhat greasy from previous patrons. The cashiers were cordial, but problems with the order either fell upon the cashiers taking the order incorrectly or staff making food improperly. 

I had multiple people in my party order everything from pizza to sandwiches to the wings and nothing was up to par. We were asked what sauce we wanted on the wings, but when the "wings" were served, they gave no sauce. When we asked them to fix it, we were given a dipping cup.

The sandwich was properly made, but it was somewhat undercooked and fell apart after the first bite. That could be the mark of a juicy sandwich, but in this case it was just shoddily put together.

The pizza itself was passable, but not terribly great for a namesake dish. The one silver lining had to be the drink machine, which really shouldn't ever be a silver lining for any situation.

The rest of the atmosphere was fine, if a little strange. There were an abundance of large TVs, but you would think at least one of them would be in Full HD (they aren't). The sliding glass door is always open, but I'm not sure why it was needed to begin with.

I don't know, it just seems like this whole restaurant just won't be worth most people's time. Yes, it really is that bad. Yes, you will probably regret it. Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, but that's the way Dan cooks his pizza.

This hotel hosts a pool tournament for our local league.  When I called to make my reservation the woman that I spoke with said that she was sorry but she was going to have to "break my heart" because they had no rooms left.  I told her thank you and got on Priceline to look for another hotel.  While searching I came across this hotel with rooms available but at a much higher price.  I booked it hoping that when I got to the hotel they would give me the advertised rate but when I arrived the price was actually higher!  On Saturday night they charged my $324 per night for a 3 star rated hotel with poor service, mediocre cleanliness, and limited access to food or drink.  They had posted security at the entrances of the tournament to make sure people were not bringing in there own food or drinks so we had to pay for theirs.

I ordered the tilapia and it came out almost completely raw. I then had to wait an extra 15 minutes for my food to come out. To top it off, they didn't offer us any discount or anything because of it. My mother ordered a shrimp dish and it had an excessive amount of garlic in it, to the point where she could hardly eat it. However, the waitress was still great.

I don't even want to give this place 1 star, but I have to in order to place this review.  This place is absolutely terrible. The host/hostess are so unprofessional and miserable. We first got seated after about 15 minutes of no one paying us any attention, then to get seated and never have a server come over. I had to get up to go find a server. We then had to wait about 20 minutes before we got our drinks.  The food was absolutely terrible. It was barely cooked and had no flavor.  We then went up to the patio bar after we ate to again wait another 20 minutes before someone even approached us. (And this is after making complete full on eye contact numerous times). The bartender was so rude and ignorant (her name is Tiffany). I have never in my life experienced what I experienced at this place this past weekend. Every single person that works there is so cocky, ignorant and rude.  It's so unbelievable. Asked for a manger as well, and they never came over to us to hear our complaints. Will NEVER be going back there.

We love the pizza here.  But, I'm giving two stars because they have a terrible pickup system for takeout.  Last Friday night I arrived at the time they told me to pick up my order.  I had to wait on a line for 10 minutes just to pay...and another 10 minutes before the overworked staff at the register gave me our order, which had been waiting and getting cold on the counter behind him that whole time. The other customers on line were complaining that their takeout pickup is always slow.  Every time we've gotten takeout from here the staff at the pickup counter seem stressed and disorganized.   If they could get it together I would give them 5 stars!

This place was recommended by a bartender at another restaurant we frequent, so figured it had to be good. Was disappointed overall to be honest. Outside of the great beer selection and service, the place was a real let down. Starting with the annoying flys that kept pestering us at the bar. Only to be followed shortly there after by the gnats that kept trying to share my beer with me. Sitting at indoor bar with a napkin over my pint is not what I expected. We order a couple of the apps only to be further let down. Too be honest I am not a fan German food, so take with a grain of salt. I for one have been there and done that and want waste my time doing it again.

I ate here as I stayed at the hotel it's connected to. For dinner I had the mushroom bisque with bread basket. The bisque itself was tasty, but lacking actual mushrooms and the bread came out cold and hard. The next morning I had breakfast with a colleague there and they never brought my toast out. I asked for my eggs well done and they came out still undercooked. The potato hash was the best thing about my meals here. Breakfast staff was nice, dinner staff not as much. Not worth the price IMO.

I really enjoy the food and pastries at St Louis Bread Co./Panera. However,  on my visit on 6/13/2018,I have never entered a location that was as messy as this place. Tables were not bussed and the floors were a mess. I'm looking at four tables in view that have trays. This location needs help.

I'll never eat there again. Not because the food or service was bad, but because I walked in at 9pm (there published closing is 10pm), and unbeknownst to me, just beat the manager locking the door. I asked for a table and the hostess suggested the bar, which I declined. She the said, "Let me see if the kitchen is still open." It was and she gave me a snotty look and seated me. I then heard the manager tell the kitchen, "We had another guy sneak in". I ordered their chili and a Caesar's salad, and the House Old Fashioned. The brisket in the chili had never seen smoke and was a bit fatty; if they don't use a bottled dressing for the salad, they should. If they do use a bottled dressing, they should switch. It was so overpowered by mayonnaise it was inedible. And the drink was too-too-too sweet. The waitress was great, and I tipped accordingly.

There was a girl that looked like she was high trying to get the attention of some guy working the kitchen for over 10 minutes. I think she worked here and was off the clock cause she made hearts at the manager/trainer that was surrounded by new employees. It was insanely cringy and annoying how she kept calling out to him and BEGGING him to give her an answer to something then saying pretty please and promise? PROMISE?!

Unprofessional. If I wanted dinner and a show, I'd go elsewhere. Not a good example for the new employees.

Very rude customer service.

I went to return an online item within 30 days with a receipt. The woman at customer service scans the item and says they don't sell it anymore and she can't take it back.

I pointed out it was within 30 days and I have a receipt, when purchasing there would be no way for me to know the store was going to stop carrying an item. I was so omg told rudly, it can't be done and NO solution was presented.

I asked for a manager and it was taken care of in 2 seconds by finding the item number through my online order. So not only can it be done, but the customer service representative was very rude through the whole process.

Horrible experience, courtesy (or lack of) from what appeared to be the owner. He will go out of his way to ruin your time, even if you aren't in his establishment anymore and you're on the beach. Definitely not ever returning or recommending this place to anyone.

Absolutely horrible bar service on my visit today. The service was so bad people were ordering multiple drinks when they finally got a chance to order because the wait was so long. Our office will no longer come back here for happy hours. After half an hour of waiting some in our group just gave up on getting anything. Once I was able to order my drinks the cocktail I ordered was very poorly made. If I hadn't already closed my tab and the wait wouldn't take forever I would've asked for another drink or my money back.

Every time you come in here it's a long long way today and 45 minutes 3/4 of the tables in there empty people are leaving quickly as they come in the door next time there's a 45 minute wait how about 40 people walked out of here you would think it would have enough sense to do something about that before they get run out of business

I've been taking my car here for inspections/oil changes and have never had any issues. I just went on 02/10/2018 for a routine oil change. They got my car in and out really quick, but came out and said I had a few things wrong. 

I was told my rear shocks were leaking and cupping/wearing my back tires faster than what's normal. They also said my serpentine belt was cracked. They said it would be about $600 for all the repairs. I was surprised because my car is fairly new (and still under warranty). I declined the repairs and made an appointment with Conicelli Nissan to have my car looked at--if there was something wrong with it, I knew my warranty would cover the repairs for both issues. 

Conicelli's mechanic got it up in the air and didn't find a single thing wrong with it. He said there was nothing wrong with neither my rear shocks nor the drive belt. He said my back tires weren't cupping and were actually in better condition than my front tires. 

Conicelli's mechanic told me the only way PA&T would make those recommendations was either due to a lack of experience/knowledge on their mechanic's part or because they were trying to take advantage of me and get my money. Either way, it left a bad taste in my mouth. PA&T won't be getting my business anymore.

This place is disgusting. Smells like a sewer and the bathroom was disgusting. No soap and the toilet was overflowing. They brought me the pork egg rolls when I had asked for the vegetarian. The waiter told me that I asked for the pork (I didn't, I've been vegetarian for 17 years) then refused to take the item off our bill. We all got sick after eating here too. Stay away!!

We probably wouldn't choose to stay here again, but it was ok.  Our first room, 304, has a horrible bed, thankfully John at the front desk was very accommodating and allowed us to change rooms. John gets a 5 star review from us, but this hotel only gets a 2 for being a bit run down.

I understand these type of restaurants normally don't have the best service, but this is by far the worst Vietnamese restaurant  I've ever been to.  The food was OK, but it doesn't cover the exceptionally bad service.  First, the server started taking our order, and half way through, walked away and started taking the order of another table.  Who does that??  We weren't even confused about what we wanted.  She just suddenly walked away. Second, we tried to order one of their avocado smoothies, and they said they aren't making any smoothies because they are busy.  Why do you even have it on the menu if you won't make it?  Your menu should be designed to handle the capacity of your restaurant.  Third, when the food finally came out, they just put it at the front of the table instead of in front of the person who ordered it.  

Definitely will not be coming back

Credit where due: a year ago, this review would have been 3 stars. Apartments have pest problems ranging from cockroaches to brown recluses. The cracked bathroom tiles are filled with dirt and mold. Residents are forced to opt-in to a $20/month service for someone to carry one bag of trash from their doorstep to the dumpster a couple of hundred feet away (whether they use it or not).

Management was sometimes slow to enforce policies, but was genuine and friendly, even offering free parking as an incentive for lease renewals. Now, a new management company is in town. It feels like they've waged war against residents.

They've started assessing parking fees mid-lease to residents who extended leases under the incentive of free parking. They've sent blanket threatening emails to residents for occasional & minor infractions by only a resident or two. The lease states guests may park on the property up to 7 days per month, but a recent group of guests were ticketed in just a few hours. The ticket stickers were difficult to remove and left permanent residue on the vehicles during hot summer weather. I called Post Ridge to inquire about why vehicles were ticketed and was told guests may park on surrounding streets. With the size of this property, the closest street parking is over half a mile away with no sidewalks along busy Hicks Rd.

This place has a lot of potential if management can shift their energy from penalizing residents to welcoming them.

We came here with confidence, giving the ratings on Yelp.... Big mistake! We had some crab cakes: tasteless and oily. Then lobster pasta and shrimp and scallops pastas: we are both pretty sure the seafood was frozen! A shame on a pier!!! Everything was literally tasteless, and the pastas were tasting like onion only. Finally, the wine was quite good, but served in cheap water glasses!!!! Sad and frustrating experience.... for 85$....

Looking forward to mani/pedi. Scheduled an appointment so I wouldn't have to wait. Showed up on time and waited till telling someone I had an appointment. They were doing a wedding party. 10 minutes later I was shown to a chair and put my feet in the water. Waited and waited
For 15 more minutes, no one even looked at me. Getting tired of waiting  so I got up and left. No one even noticed.

Sad that even with an appointment I was overlooked and no one seemed to care.  Poor service, wont be returning!

Absolutely awful. Poor accounting with room charges, using either inadequate systems at the front desk, or the staff is totally without a clue. My guess is both. Overcharged, duplicate charged, held accounts for days after departure; many of our friends and family for a wedding stay over the weekend and we are reaching out to ask them to check their credit/debit cards. The printed out sheets of your daily charges are not there and the staff could not or would not delve into. In nearly 60 years of travel and 40 of that military, it was so, so disappointing and added stress to our weekend. Took 45 minutes to get breakfast Friday morning, a staff of one, yes I said "1". Our room with inadequate temperature control (could not get the room higher than 67 one eve even though we had set for heat and set for 75). TV. Would not work. Had to call the front desk (had to guess the desk number as there are NO  informational books about the hotel and services). They sent up a service guy. Showed me how to unplug the cable in the back of the TV in order to get it to work when we turn it on. I am not kidding. Had to that for 4 days. The bathroom door is a sliding wood door that does not close entirely, NOR, does it lock. You want privacy, forget about it. My daughter and her husband were charged the same charges we paid for on their room previously, minus the room charge. They were charged an extra night of valet too on top of the duplicate charges. They billed the extra valet without telling them and eventually reimbursed without telling them 3 days later. I paid for their valet and restaurant charges when we left a day earlier. They, the front desk staff, did not believe them when they told them and would not check the payment made by me, they basically called them liars. My other son, the groom was overcharged,  it has not been corrected as they are on their honeymoon. The parents of the bride were overcharged $90 per night until exhaustively explaining to the staff at the desk the group rate they had agreed to. I am still waiting for a reimbursement of $179.32 in duplicate charges, I asked the General Manager to call. Crickets so far, guess it's not important to them. Avoid the Cambria,  it is new, but it is awful for service and is NOT ready for business. They need to do a stand down and get it together and get it right. General Manager, still waiting for the call, check with Rachael. Left  a message.  P.S. Horrible location from anywhere. Plus $38.24 for valet per night.  It was $35 until we got there and found it that was taxed as well. Sorry place.

I have some food allergies. I tried to ask the waiter questions.
He was snobby and supercilious and told me they catered to the general public.
The food portions were small - the bread was white bread out of a plastic bag, and it was pricey.
It might be ? a good bar, but certainly not a decent eatery!

This place has very rude service. Marcie, the hostess was incredibly rude to our party of 6. They told us we could not all sit together, which is fine, but then proceeded to tell us our check had to be all on one--yet we couldn't push our tables together. When we asked why she was incredibly rude and stared us down. Very unfriendly environment. Food was ok, will not go back.

I live in Brigantine NJ and with no exaggeration our Comcast cable and WiFi have been out at least 2 hours a day for the last two weeks..we have called more times than I can count and can't get a straight answer from anyone..the longest outage was 14 hours on 11-28 18...if anyone from this company a actually reads this, you just lost a 25 year customer...I gave you a 1 star rating because there's no 0.

Sticky tables, poor quality food. Looks like packaged ramen. Miso soup=bad broth. Restrooms are messy-no soaps or towels in dispensers. Don't bother-empty on a Friday evening-should have just walked out!

Really bad experience.  My first time visiting Solidcore; I arrived 10 minutes early and no one checked me into class or greeted me as a first timer.  I accidentally showed up to the Rittenhouse location when my reservation was for the Center City location.  100% my mistake, but I had no idea I was at the wrong location until after class started and the instructor kicked me out of class.  We were 3 exercises into the class and the instructor was calling out names for those signed up because a late-arriving student showed up and there were not enough machines.  My name was not called and I realized I was not at the right location.  The instructor yelled at me- through the microphone- to get off the machine immediately(!!).  An embarrassing and frustrating experience.  I think a class that is based on a set # of machines should have check-in before class, and late arriving students shouldn't kick out students when class is already in progress.

Terrible service aside from the trainee who got us started - sucks that it was his first day, he should literally get out now. Open seating but waited over an hour and never even got our food. At that point we left and ended up just grabbing a bagel for brunch. Worst service ever had. Would have been way better to wait in the lines of the actual good places around like biscuit love or pancake pantry. DO NOT COME HERE AWFUL.

First of all, the place is absolutely stunning... love everything about the looks, ambiance, etc (thus the 2 stars).  Went there for the food (not to golf) and the food and service were very disappointing.  Food showed up (after a long wait) quite cold despite the fact that they had food runners.  I would have mentioned this to our waiter but he was nowhere to be found.  Glad I went to experience the awesomeness of the place but I won't be returning.

My husband and I have been to this restaurant several times in the past. Each time we've come, the service has been incredibly slow (luckily, we never came in a hurry). Unfortunately, our most recent visit tops the others. We walked in on a Tuesday at 5pm and there wasn't anyone at the hostess stand. We wanted to sit in the bar area anyway, so we made our way downstairs and sat down. After about ten minuets of not being acknowledged by any of the three or four staff who were either at the bar or behind it, we decided to leave. As we were leaving a young woman said "bye, thank you!" And we looked at her and said "we didn't get served and never got acknowledged." She started to grab menus and we said "no, thanks. We're going somewhere else."  and left. Between the overpriced food and terrible service, we won't ever be coming back.

I came here a few weeks ago and was less than satisfied. The food was mediocre and the service was bad. I decided to give it another try but this will be my last. I ordered an omelette thinking that they should be pretty good in a place that features French food. The omelette was like a rubber ball with no seasoning, the bread(!) was stale and hard. My last visit here. If I could give it no stars, I would.

I've lived out in Spanish Springs for over 7 years. We used to go to this location once a month or so until the food quality and customer service tanked. We would go and have a bad experience so we would swear it off. About 6 months go by and we would try again, still awful. Servers change but yet the service still sucks. Is it the management? The owners? 
Whichever it is, we will never come back after tonight's terrible service. It took 45 minutes just to get my water (after politely reminding the server 3 times) until I finally walked up to the serving station and began to pour it myself before our server offered to take over. Food was mediocre and overpriced, took about 40 minutes to come out. All I could do by the end was just laugh about it, not worth making a scene. I wish we could get a decent restaurant in Spanish Springs, Bully's certainly isn't one.

This was my first time at Cheddars. I wanted a light meal and ordered the chicken tortilla soup. While the southwestern spices were nice, the tortilla strips were soggy and the soup was very, very salty. The server was accommodating and offered to bring something else, but by the time she came by to check on me, I was halfway done. On a whim, I decided to try the "new" Painkiller mini cake. It's supposed to be a coconut cake that has rum rizzled over it, topped by whipped cream, toasted coconut and a cherry. The cake was dry, and the rum flavor overwhelmingly  medicinal. I couldn't eat more than a couple of bites. Now, 20 minutes later, that medicinal taste strongly lingers. I do want to come back and try one of the regular entrees before passing full judgment, but this evening's meal was a real disappointment.

This location is absolute garbage in terms of service!!!!! Always slow, 80% of the time something is messed up in my order whether something is missing or not what I ordered, and there a few people that should not be behind he counter and interacting with customers due to their horrible attitude at any given time. Overall this location is just such a disappointment. Would give 0 stars, if possible.  I think this owner really needs to clean up this horrible excuse for "service"
This place has closed permanently. Went by tonight at 8 pm on Friday night 12/28/18 and  there was a for rent sign up in the window and place was empty/cleaned out.
We just finish our dinner at 101, I have to say, we don't want to go back anymore, they got new menu and raise the price and the portion is much smaller.

Went to Claim Jumper for my dad's birthday. Hostesses in front area were nice and there was only a quick wait for a party of 6. Only reason I am giving this 2 stars is the waiter was honestly the worst waiter I have ever had. I'm not sure if he was having a bad day but something was going on. Was so quick and not welcoming at all. I have felt more welcomed at 711 then he made us feel. Didn't greet us at first he just asked....want water after he stood there for a few seconds. I'm not sure if they shadow these quarters before putting them on there own but I recommend he be shadowed until he can do his job at a sub par level. If you go there do not get Julian's section. During dinner he disappeared so we called over a waitress cleaning her tables in the next section over. She was so nice and took care of us and was really nice. I think she could tell what we were dealing with since she offered to assist us with anything we needed. Food was ok and we had to send one dish back because it did not taste good. I have never stiffed anyone on a tip before but he would of definitely gotten it if I was paying luckily I wasn't.

I ordered here for lunch then I canceled my order but it ended up coming anyway so I just paid for it. The food tasted good but then I found a black hair so I called back and I told them I was apparently talking to the owner and he was so rude and starting arguing with me saying that that's not possible he even started yelling at me. at the end of the day I will not be going back here and I do not recommend anyone to go there the customer service what horrible and like I said I got yelled at for their mistake and I didn't get my money back. I'm so disgusted and disappointed what a waste of money

Nearly impossible to get an appointment. Recommend work that is not needed. Overcharge. Seemingly zero appreciation for long time customers who have bought multiple cars from them. I recently took my car in to have a rear view mirror Re-glued to the window. They said "yes, we can do this." We'll, turns out they could not and I ended up with  a  $350 bill for other little stuff. I will never go back. In fact, I'll not sadly not buy another Toyota because I so dislike our local service department. Sorry for the negative vibes - bu this is how I feel.
Food is good, but the customer service is horrible. Only one person serving, LOONG wait and the waiter was extremely rude to my family. Wouldn't come here again.

I would not recommend staying at the Marriott St. Louis Airport. My rating is only a 2 because of the great front-desk representative (Fatu) that was very polite and addressed our issue. The staff was pleasant, but here are my reasons:
1. Sheets, pillows, and comforter were stained
2. You can not get a hold of the front desk or "At your Service"
3. Poor quality room, you hear a lot! 
Day 1, as we prepped (disinfectant Spray and Lysol wipes) the room, pulled back the sheets to find a stain on the sheets, right next to where the pillows are, next looked at the comforter same issue. Called the "At your service", first and last time getting an answer, 
addressed the issue and asked for new sheets, totally forgetting to check the pillows! I will tell you why that was important in a minute. 
They remade the bed, and I quote "the pillows are new so they are fine".  
That night, woke up around 3 or 4 in the morning to barking dog above us, and guess who couldn't get a hold of the "At your Service"! 
Day 2, I woke up the next morning and realized that one of my pillows had black strains on it! Disgusting! We went about our day, left the pillow on the bed, hoping that when we came back it would have been changed out (We didn't not sign up for Marriott "Go Green". )Got back to room checked the pillows and the one that had the issue was still on the bed, stained side facing the headboard. Annoyed because this is Day 2 of our stay with stained bedding. Of course, I didn't not get an answer from the "At your service", instead I have to go downstairs to speak with someone! I will never stay at this hotel again!

My daughter has been a regular here for three years and I come with her every time I'm in town. 

We came here last Thursday and I spent $120 for 2 pedi's, a mani for her and a fill for me. Saturday morning, as I'm about to head home to San Diego, I notice a broken nail. I wasn't surprised, as the woman had made them incredibly thin. I went back to Star nails and Diana did a beautiful repair at no charge.

The following day FOUR more nails broke. Unfortunately I was back in San Diego. I called Star nails hoping to get a refund for the fill. I spoke to the owner who tells me my nails are breaking because they're old and that my nail tech had asked if I wanted to replace them with a new set. I tell her no they are not old and this was my first fill on this set. And no the tech did not ask to replace them, but if she had, I would've declined. I also told her I've been wearing acrylics for 40 years and it's rare that I break a nail. In this situation the nails were too thin and the tips were popping off despite how extra cautious I was. 

The owner refused to offer any solution or even an apology. Rather than refunding $18 to my card (or whatever they charge for fills), she chose to argue and lie and ultimately lose two regular customers.

If I can give it a -1 star I would, I fell sick eating this food twice. I always give any restaurant 2 chances and I did it here too.
Some people do like the food here, but it literally smells like days old food.
I am surprised how this place is still up and running
I don't know why this store has so much trouble getting decent help. Won't return until Zach it's gone. He has absolutely no concept of customer service in his attitude, appearance or demeanor.

When you try to explain to them that you don't want to cancel your contract, you just don't want it to renew they don't listen and just cancel it anyways and you end up having to pay a cancellation fee. If you want desk people that will listen to what you're saying don't go here.

My family and I were visiting New Orleans last week. We arrived Sunday evening and were tired and hungry so we went to Outlaw pizza because it was close to our hotel. The pizza was good but the waitress was less than friendly. After she brought our pizza I had to get up and ask her for napkins since she'd only given us 3 small napkins for 4 of us, 2 of which were kids. She looked annoyed that I asked her for napkins and she only gave me 2 more.  When we got our bill I noticed she charged us 1.00 for each of the cups of water she had brought us. This wasn't bottled water, we saw her fill the cups from the sprayer at the bar. Also we only ordered 2 waters for our kids, (a glass of wine for us) but she brought us 4 glasses. I was too tired to dispute the fact that she had charged me for water but it has bother me since.
Food was tasted awful and was not worth the price they're charging . Dint waste your time here.

Never again! I went here to get my hair washed and blow dried and curled out for a holiday business party. I thought I would save myself the time and get it done. Don't waste your money. I had to come home and reset my hair!

This mortgage company is a ripoff. Do not 
do bisiness with them at any cost. They have a " 2 Star " rating for a good reason! They are a bunch of incompetent crooks. I had the worst experience of my life trying to get a mortgage with Franklin American Mortgage.  Stay away from them, they are a terrible company!
Employees cussing chicken didn't taste fresh bathroom discussing smell like cigarettes

Went in this week to find out about having some work done , the kid sitting behind the counter was hiding behind something really !! never even saw him while we stood in the store waiting for help. I finally walked up to the counter and was a little startled when i saw him there, i asked him about the repair i needed and said i will get someone ... so the guys comes out of the back looking at me annoyed as i asked him about the work i needed he was rude, abrupt and i got the feeling he didn't care one way or the other , i was smiling and happy when i walked through the door and because of the very cold reception and unsure of his vague answers we received i will never return there, sadly i wasted my time after being warned ... should of listened.

This is the best place for carne asada.  Whether you want carne asada tacos or burritos a bowl its hands down the best place for carne asada. Last night boyfriend and I decided to try the location in Park Place Mall food court, and it was AMAZING. It was quick, we asked for the carne asada to be well done. Super picky when it comes to well done, don't like it burnt but I don't like chewing on pieces like fat. They took the portion of carne asada and made sure it was well done. Like I mentioned it was BOMB. So carne asada burrito deff recommend! Not only that but at the mall they do serve beer & margaritas coming soon, and you get free chips with order over $5. Definitely will be visiting the Park Place Mall location again soon!


Update: went back again, this time got the worst customer service ever. Went from a 5 Star to a 1 star. Telling me not to throw employees under the bus. All because I asked for meat to be cooked well done. And he said the meat is already done, I said they cooked it extra for me last time. And then he started off by rudely telling me not to throw employees under the bus. I said I didn't say when I came or who even didn't it. Then he continued to tell me it's not cool to throw employees under the bus because that's just not cool they could get in trouble. In trouble for cooking meat longer? Not only that but there was more customers behind me that we're just starting at him because they saw how rude he was being. I will not be returning here again. So thanks to the short man with a full beard and mustache you loose a customer and gain a negative review.

Horrible customer service.  I came through the drive thru on Saturday 08/25/18. placed my order and at the window was told to pull forward.  After waiting for 10 minutes on my food I called the phone number on the receipt to remind them that I was still waiting.  When I did finally get my food there wasn't even an apology or a thank you for your patience.  I went on corporates website to lodge a complaint and in less than a week I received a response stating that someone from the local franchise would contact me.  After a month I reached out to corporate again stating that I had never received a response.  Finally received a call from local franchise and it reinforces my belief that this franchise doesn't care about customer service.  I will take my business elsewhere and make sure all of my friends and family do the same.

Beers ordered several different times...out of them.  Then finally got the 4 th one ordered.  Appetizers and salad finally arrived with the burgers, which sucked and were overdone.  Waiter Jackson never checked in with us but went by table multiple times.  Do not come here

What I didn't like:
$15.00 parking per night
Only one bartender working at rooftop bar, 30 min wait for drink on all three days we were there.
Room was dark and dated, hard to believe this hotel is only 5 years old.  Deep gold and red walls, and deep green carpets don't really seem like a beach feel.  Rooms and entire hotel are just so dated.
LOUD LOUD LOUD!!!  Inside noise, outside noise, everywhere noise!
Breakfast is included, but it is probably one of the worst spreads I have seen.  Not much there and what was there was pretty gross.
What I did like:
Large balcony (for premium rooms).  That being said, we didn't spend much time out there because the traffic was incredibly loud and the birds would attack.
If I come here again I would probably stay at the new Wyndham across the street, it's beautiful.  I would not stay at Pier 60 again, and I would recommend it to friends.
No one sang , the food was cafeteria style, the atmosphere was not appealing . Sorry but I would not recommend this place

I really wanted to like this place, but there was just too much bad for me to rate the place higher than one star and would be very hesitant in ever returning based on my first time experience.  Most likely a one and done for me.

It all started when I ordered the Sunday Special of 10-Wings & a Pitcher of Beer for $15.99; not a great deal compared to other places, but it was what I wanted.  I ordered my wings extra crispy, naked, with sauce on the side; (I don't like soggy & under cooked wings, as most places have a habit of doing).  Two of the gents I was with, ordered wings as well, one ordered crispy, the other ordered them regular; and we all had different sauces and some with sauce on and some on the side. 

When our wings arrived, all three types of done-ness came out, but went to the wrong individuals.  My wings came out exactly how I DID NOT want them; they appeared to be light in color, texture and crispness, but seemed cooked enough to eat, and since I was hungry, I mistakenly dug in...Even though they were anything but extra crispy, plus they were smothered in sauce.  I didn't want to sit & wait for a corrected order to eventually come out, as my friends had all started to dig in and I didn't want them waiting on me...Huge mistake!.  

Halfway into the second gooey wing with blood/juice running out, I decided they were not safe to eat without being cooked longer, so instead of making a big deal out of it, I just simply ordered what I thought would be quick half pressed Cuban sandwich for dine-in and then asked for a to-go box for the remaining undercooked wings, so I could finish cooking them at home.   Side Note:  To finish them at home, I ended up baking them at 425-degs for 5-mins on each side, THEN to crisp them up, I had to broil them at 500-degs for 4-mins each side...18-mins of extra cooking, that is how flipping undercooked they were.  I was honestly shocked & disgusted how undercooked & dangerous they were, AND that they would serve them to a customer!!!

15-mins later my dine-in sandwich eventually arrived in a steamed up to-go box with soggy curly fries.  Since my friends were finished with their meals, finishing up their drinks, and asking for their checks, I figured I would at least eat the soggy fries and half of the Cuban while we waited.  When the checks arrived, I noticed my bill was substantial higher than everyone else's, even though I had ordered an additional meal, things were just not adding up.  After looking at all of our checks, I determined I was charged the normal price for wings & beer vs. the Sunday Special I had ordered.  The strange part was, my golf buddy's check was properly rung in depicting the Sunday Special, but Mine was not.  Plus, my check didn't even have the right type of beer I had ordered, so I'm not even sure if I got what I ordered.  My buddy realized I was getting pissed, (which is not like me AT ALL), so he ended up dealing with the bartender to get the check fixed, which allowed me to scarf down some of my reorder so no one had to wait on me.

Once my "corrected" bill was brought out, I decided I would give the bartender the benefit of the doubt and still leave a tip, (but only 18% vs. the 30% I typically tip bartenders/servers).  While signing my credit card slip, I noticed the recommended tip printed on the bill was more than what I had calculated it would have been; which caused me to break out the calculator and compare all of our bills to figure out why my bill was incorrect once again.  As it turned out, everyone else's recommended tip amount was properly calculated on their receipts; however, mine was not.  After further inspection, I discovered instead of ringing in the Sunday Special, as she had correctly done on my buddy's check, the bartender just simply applied an equivalent dollar amount discount; therefore, by doing so, the recommended tip on the receipt was calculated based on the original amount, (before she added a discount vs. ringing the Sunday Special in correctly).  I'm talking about less than a dollar difference, (so what's the big deal right?); however, at this point, it's the principle of the matter and adding insult to injury.  Out of all the ineptness on the restaurant's part and too much niceness on my part,  I'm getting squeezed for what equates to roughly another $0.60...Ain't happening!

Coming from the restaurant business and a sports bar at that, I have a VERY high tolerance for mistakes, typically appreciate my bartenders/servers, can tell if they are weeded or just lazy, and maybe all of this very well could have been honest mistakes made along the way of one visit by one customer out of many; (i.e., order coming out wrong, food being undercooked, waiting 15-mins for a reorder, reorder coming out in a to-go box with soggy fries, bill being rang in incorrectly, and the recommended tip printing out higher than it should have been because of being edited incorrectly).  2/3/18 @ 2:13pm / Check 75 / Table 61 / Server: KH

We have always enjoyed the food at Piper pub and Grill. We used Uber eats to order our dinner tonight. After ordering, with about 15 minutes passing, our order was declined. I called the restaurant to find out why. They simply stated they were too busy. I understand this can happen but we are still customers and had they wanted to turn off their Uber eats availability, they should have done so after our order was fulfilled. On top of that, the person I spoke to wasn't very nice. Very disappointed.

I used to love this place until I ordered pickup tonight. I asked for pho with no noodles and extra veggies.... def got extra noodles and barely any veggies.  And besides that it tasted like eating veggies in salt water... just awful. The spring rolls are usually tasty too but these were all gross and mushy.  Several of my friends have complained about getting sick after eating here as well.

This place is the worst!!!!!!! My husband and I go out a few times a week and no matter how bad it is will tip at least 20%, we left 13 cents. I ordered an IPA and was brought a stout twice. The manager told me it was whatever I think it is and was beyond rude! Then brought me a medium well burger that was bleeding twice! Both the food and service suck!!! Don't waste your time there.

If you have to self aggrandize yourself, then you really know you are in trouble. 
An example that comes to mind is when we were driving through South Carolina and stopped at a place that self titled themselves as having the best breakfast in the country. What we ended up getting was greenish steak and eggs and a crab omelet that sent the Girly into vomit mode. N'awlins Cafe & Spic is another example.
This is a place that should NEVER, ever serve food to people...ever. 
If you want gumbo that would make a geriatric go, "Hey! Where's the flavor?" then this might actually be a place you might want. 
And as someone else mentioned, they don't clean their shrimp too well.
All in all, you can pay less and get more and better all over the place. Keep walking.

Our primary vet referred us for emergent and specialty care.  Our 1st visit was terrific, Dr. Singleton was knowledgeable and thoughtful with exceptional bedside manner.  Her second visit was a surgeon consult for the same problem.  The surgeon and the oncologist were both excellent.  The clinicians on staff seem to be some of the best around; my rating is due to standard operating procedures and front desk training.  The front office staff, in my opinion, are disorganized and rude.  I'm not sure if it's because of my physical appearance or just the lack of customer service training, manager accountability to behavior expectations or what.  
Situation:  I called on Thursday for a refill for my fur baby. I was told they needed my primary care to send a script even though it was ordered by their MD and filled by their pharmacy. No problem, I called my vet and asked them to send one over.  Friday... Saturday I called to check status, it was received.  I called my vet again they faxed it over and emailed it.  I called to verify the script was received, it was.  A few hours later, I called to check status. They told me not to call them, they are busy, and they will call me when it's ready.  Sunday... Monday, I called her primary vet again and explained the situation, of course, they were appalled.  They called NorthStar and was told they didn't have a script to fill. My vet faxed the documents again and confirmed receipt, then called to follow up 6 hours later and was also told I would receive a call once it's ready in don't call us, we are busy tone.  My fur baby has now been without the only thing that gives her relief for 3 days, so I go to NorthStar at 8:35 pm to check on the status.  Initially, I was turned away and given the "we are busy" phase. I stayed and explained my disappointment, so they said for me to wait, they will fill the prescription but couldn't give me a time frame. Ok... I waited 45 minutes until they told me they were out of the medication and that is the reason I was never called.   But you want my 2,000 for a CT and biopsy?!?!? Nope, we'll find a dependable system that can support their patients past the initial visit.

The next day, I told my primary vet about the experience she called and they told her the rx had been filled and is ready for pick up?!?!? Really???? 

Anyway, I picked it up and front desk is still rude, folks were not apologetic or bothered in the slightest.  I will not spend any more of my money there, going to Banfield and UPenn from now on.

Great place for drinks -- but only drinks. I took a group of friends here for Taco Tuesdays. Two of us waited for 20 minutes for dry and salty tacos (i.e., shrimp, carne asada, chicken). We ended up throwing half the food away and walked out for dinner elsewhere.

We ordered take out for the first time. When I brought the food home I was extremely disappointed. The portions were tiny for the prices of the menu items. They were much much smaller than when we have eaten in the restaurant. The food was also not good at all. My daughter ordered a cheeseburger. She ended up throwing it away because the meat was overcooked and the bun was stale and hard. The fries that came with the meal were soggy and undercooked. It seems the food has gone down hill and I am not sure we will be eating at Applebees again.

I used to like this place, but it's under new management......terrible! In the past, I could always walk into this place when the old crew used to be here and they would always be busy, but  they would accommodate. Not these new people. Walked in today, waited at the front desk longer than you should ever have to when you are about to spend money somewhere. One guy nail tech was giving a pedicure and looked at me walk in, stand there and wait, and didn't inform anyone. Then the other nail techs looked at me and then waited to ask me what I needed. I said a manicure, and the nail tech that was giving a pedicure to another customer said "Can you come back in 25-30 mins?" I said ok, I will come back.(which I already at that point had NO intention of coming back) Then the other girl nail tech said, " Maybe you can, like, make an appointment next time." 

This place is garbage now that it is under new management. The staff is equally as bad. Very unfortunate, because I work in the West Shore business district and would come here on lunch every other week. International is a nice mall, but this place definitely brings the allure down. Hopefully, mall management can do something about it after enough people complain. This is coming from someone that has written, maybe one or two reviews in my 32 years of life. That's how strongly I felt about the situation that occurred today. Never again...

Not happy at all with the lack of service and promised follow-thru with their staff.  I've been going there ten years and have decided to leave based on my last experience.  I have called five times over the last fifteen days asking that the vet call me regarding something very simple that he wanted.  I was told he would get the message but have heard nothing. I was hung up on twice from staff with no call back.  Promises from them go unmet.  Not sure if vets know what is happening on the calls and with lack of follow through. Similar problems noted on Google review. The owners may want to record and monitor their calls unless they are getting the messages and think their time is too precious. BS with how much I have spent. Very unprofessional.

If your home is important to you, stay away from these people. We hired this woman yesterday to test her out for a new maid service, to replace our current maid who we thought was too slow and lazy, plus Sophie was immediately available (I see why now!). This woman is very hyper, careless and sloppy. She doesn't bill hourly, so she literally RACES through the job. Not only did she NOT clean thoroughly, but she damaged our newly remodeled home! She deeply scratched our new stainless kitchen sink, scratched my silver frame with our wedding pic, scratched our Wolf stove, put all the dirt and hair from her swifter down our kitchen drain, scratched our wood end table, left hair in the shower drain and did not scrub the mold off, left oil and streaks on ALL the furniture, did not clean our marble floor in the bathroom, did not clean the microwave as I had asked her to, did not clean our oven, did not dust the wood shelves or the items on them, and charged us $130 for 2 hours. (We have a small 2 bed, 2 bath.) I agreed to this price beforehand, because she said she would do a "deep cleaning." There was nothing deep about their cleaning. They didn't even clean the stainless appliances. (They say they bring their own cleansers, but had nothing for granite or stainless.)

She put everything back in the wrong place, so we have to rearrange it, and we are still finding streaks, hair and dirt everywhere. At least her assistant DID clean the two toilets, which in hindsight I would have just done myself to save our home. The rest of the house, I need to go back and dust and clean myself before our guests arrive tomorrow night. I have never been so upset about a cleaning lady in my life. It's as if she took her anger out on our home!

My husband says he gets upset every time he does the dishes and sees the deep scratch marks she left on our new sink, but there's no way to get rid of them. We will always regret the day we hired Sophie's cleaning service.

But at least we feel better about keeping our old maid. She may be slow, but she is careful and she cares about us and our home...

Took our dog in to this facility last Thursday night due to heavy breathing, lethargic, bloody nose, and weakness in her legs. I explained the symptoms to the vet.. We were originally told her symptoms were indicative of marijuana toxicity.  I felt like the vet was so focused on this  diagnosis of marijuana toxicity -  which was NOT the case at all.  

X-Rays and blood work were done and ultimately she was given an injection of prednisone for possible inflammation and sent home... She returned home with the heavy breathing and confusion. I was told to see a neurologist for further examination.  However, no medications were prescribed and $700 later we didn't have any clear answers. It went from possible lesions on the brain to possible valley fever - which she had been tested for by VCA in the past, possible cushings disease, etc. She had very high platelet count and we were also told high cortisol levels but no REAL explanation as to why. I have to say I came home with more questions than answers.   

I really wish that I had been told to get our dog to a higher level of care when she first arrived at your facility and that you weren't equipped for her type of emergency. I would have left immediately and taken her elsewhere where my money would have been spent more WISELY. She is no longer with us.  

It really feels like this facility bases care on the REVENUE they can bring in.   EVERYTHING at this facility feels like it's about money rather than the well being of your pet.  

Also, we were not informed that the person seeing our dog was a resident in training.

DO NOT STAY.I was absolutely blown away by this terrible hotel.  I have stayed here each  great time I visit (for years!) and it has gone downhill with every stay.  It is now in such disarray that it is now my last visit ever.  

I had a package that included valet parking for one night.  The second night would have been well over $40!  So I had to self park in a garage.  

The woman at the check in was NASTY and treated me like I was an annoyance with her snippy attitude!  I was so appalled that I almost took my luggage and gone to another hotel.  

The hallways are dark and dismal as well as beyond dated and worn.  Carpet is disgusting and worn.  The doors are black which just adds to this dismal appearance.  The room entries are all banged up!

Room:  Dark and dismal.  Once again carpet is very old and worn. Bulb out in the bathroom.  There are no USB ports in the room and I verified that with front desk.  Internet access is not free unless you are an SPG member and it is expensive!

I would recommend that you stay somewhere else unless this doesn't bother you.  

All in all, two nights here cost me close to $400 and it is actually worth about $100 for both nights.  

Can't wait to get out of here.
So disappointed. The food was inedible. Ended up throwing it away. I hope this was just an off night because it has been one of my favorite Chinese restaurants for a few years.

I always try to give them another chance and then another chance and then another chance...Mostly because they are right up the street. I always get the same terrible service. Don't get me wrong they are polite and when you are not happy they listen but they just don't do a good job. They up-sell you option making it sound like you are going to get a clean vehicle but it never happens. When I tell them I am not happy they send someone over to redo it but you shouldn't have to do that every time. I just gave up and drove off. I now drive all the way over to Watson rd to get my vehicles cleaned. It is unfortunate that I have to take that much time out of my day because basic services can't be met.

This was the first time I've visited this place. The food was good and I would've given them 4 stars but after finding that my credit card was charged an additional $5 for tip that I never left since it was a pickup order, I don't think I can go back.  Just some shady people there!

First I gotta tell you, I used to love eating here and even came in two days in a row while I was in town visiting family. This day I sat at the bar because I was by myself. I come to your establishment because I expect a quality meal in a nice atmosphere, but today I experienced something that I would have never expected of your fine establishment. There was a young woman sitting at the other end of the bar eating and talking rather loudly. She was in a Drago's shirt. It is not like I was trying to ease drop, you couldn't help but hear her, and if I heard her, I am sure other people could hear her to. Now granted it was slow, but what I heard her say made me question if I will ever come back. While the young lady was eating and talking loud she proclaimed that she liked to "crop dust" the restaurant while she was working and seating people at their table. She said she liked to do that "because they would not know where it came from". She then made a noise like flatulence. And started laughing. Now if you don't know what "crop dusting" is, it is a silent fart while walking by some unsuspecting people. I may expect this from a bar on Bourbon Street,  but not in your fine eatery. I thought long and hard if I should let you know about this and thought that a flagrant disrespect for the customers needed to be told.

Old soup, shrimp gumbo minus the shrimp, manager horrible manners, cook terrible, forced tips, informing us that the restaurant can't keep cooks, forced to sit in backroom up against wall, served guests chicken backs, breast n thighs, blamed guest for mishaps as far as food on bar, told that we could not order from menu, told that we could not purchase dessert due to a guest purchasing a cake from Sam's for the birthday girl.

I been here a few times and my daughter in law has always ordered a beer before and was carded. But last night she was turned down since she had a under 21 license bu she is 21.
