But the manager wouldn't accept a valid tennessee Id. No other restaurant has never turned her down. Well after showing mr manager the Davidson County web site and proved him wrong this is what he had to say.  I can turn down service to any one I want.  Well mr manager, let me inform you I have the right to spend my money where I want.  It will no longer be at your establishment.

Jason thank you for your reply 

I stand by my decision.  Your manager mishandled the situation.  The bottom line you had at least 3 other employees server her in the past. With the same id.  I am not coming back because you didn't server her. I am not coming back because of your manager and the way he handled the situation.  You should further post the rules and have all employees follow them.

Let's see where do I start? I fell into the fancy wording on Expedia say NEWLY RENOVATED I can see the effort to try and fix up this older hotel but they are falling far short of anything good. For starters it took about 30 min to check in do to only one person working behind the counter, and when I checked in the gave me a room that was already occupied by someone else. So I went back downstairs and they gave me another room the sink had what looked like black makeup smudged all around it, then the shower leaked more water than it sprayed out of the shower head, then the sliding door to the outside deck was broken off of the track and it took some force to get open. After all of that I thought okay nice bed nope back to sleeping on springs. What could be a nice hotel but is falling far short hope they can fix it up right one day.

This is the second time we ordered from this Honeygrow.  The first time the food just ok (lots of  ground pepper).  This time was interesting.  My wife ordered through grub hub at about 8:15 and the ETA was 8:50.  Then around 8:45 she checked and it said 9:13.  Then at 8:53 she checked again and it said 9:30.  We got a 'll title annoyed and she made me call them.  The girl that answered the phone stated that all the grubhub orders had already left the restaurant.  I asked if my order had even come through or if the driver had picked it up.  She said she wasn't sure and would get the manager.  The manager got on the phone and stated that all the grubhub orders were already picked up and there was nothing in the order window.  He said he was very sorry and that there was nothing he could do.  As I was starting to ask him if he could look up to see if our order even came through. He interrupted me and said "sorry there's nothing more I can do.  Goodbye." and then hung up on me.  I was not upset during the first call and was very nice and calm.  There was absolutely no reason for him to have hung up on me.  I called back very upset for getting hung up on before even getting to ask such a simple question and immediately asked to speak to the manager that just hung up on me.  The same manager got on the phone and immediately apologized to me saying that he didn't mean to hang up on me.  He also said that he hung up because he didn't really know what else he could do for me.  When I asked him if he could look up to see if our order ever even came through. He asked for my name.  I had to tell him 3 times the name was Kelly and he said that he's sorry.  He hasn't had any orders come through in at least 25 minutes.  I said that we ordered the food at about 8:15 which was over 25 minutes ago.  He asked me the name again and then said he didn't have the order come through on his screen.  He stated that he only had...named off 2 names...and then said Kelly.  I said to him that that was OUR name and OUR order.  At that point I thought that this might have been some kind of joke and that there was no way this was an actual manager that I was talking to.  I heard some noises and talking in the background.  He didn't seem to know what he was doing or talking about and certainly was not paying attention to what I was asking him.  I heard him say that the food is right there and then he was asking another girl that I could hear in the background if she was there to pick up the food for Kelly.  She said yes and he came back on the phone and told me the driver had just arrived and is leaving with the food now.  When the driver delivered the food, I had asked her if she had just arrived there or if she was waiting around for the food.  She said that she was waiting for the food to get finished.  She said that a female had told her it wasn't ready and would be done shortly.  Then when she asked again the female had told her that it was just getting put together at which point a male that was on the phone with someone else (me) asked if she was there to pick up the food for Kelly.  She said yes.  He got off the phone with the customer (me).  She asked if everything was already in the bag and the manager rudely said yes, paused for a couple seconds, and very rudely said GOODBYE to her and shoved her off (figuratively).  There is no way this manager (whom seemed to be a moron) should be running a store like this.  I know this place just opened up and that things might get a little hectic in a store like this but that is no way to treat customers or grubhub drivers.  On a side note the food was pretty good.  It was much better than last time.  My wife and son think the food is good but we may not order from them again if that's how they treat customers and those are the type of people they hire to manage the store.  I would give service 0/5 stars because it didn't just seem like a little mistake.  It was incompetence.  The food gets a 3-4/5 stars.

The food is actually good, IF you are able to order anything.  We have been several times and only once were they not out of everything but brisket.  

We also tried the drive thru twice only to have ordered and paid, and then be told they were out of what we ordered... so then we had to wait in the line while they did a refund on our cards.  Why would you charge someone for something you didn't even have to sell?

Every said their food was legendary. It took 25 minutes to be seated. Many people coming and going at the hostess stand but only 1 young lady seating people and answering the phone on a Saturday night. Once we were seated we saw 10 empty tables in our section while there was a line outside waiting.

My oysters tasted like the grease they were fried in was old and my husband's shrimp tasted and looked like they came from a frozen dinner. We both ordered a Hurricane to drink and it tasted like a juice drink - no rum detected.

The waitress was pleasant and very friendly.

Not impressed with this restaurant attached to the Hilton

The service was terrible here and I would not recommend it. The girl at the register threw out food on the counter. I found a piece of hair in my philly cheesesteak and never even received an apology. The little cup of ranch is 30 cents and the girl did not want to give change back. We had to ask for it. Food was mall food...nothing to brag about. If they want to stay in business I suggest wearing hair nets and better customer service.

We had dinner here on a busy Saturday night...be sure to have a reservation as this is a very small packed restaurant. Food was okay and Service was not very attentive. We each had a special of the evening but were not Wow'd by anything.  Maybe we visited on an off night but I'm in no hurry to return with so many other choices in Philly.

if you want to have a really unpleasant stay in santa barbara, then rent from santa barbara vacation rentals. the owner, brooke meek gilmartin, first gave us the cell phone number of her maintenance person, Bob. who couldnt have been nicer, and then got angry when we called him without going through the office. she said she wanted nothing to do with us because we were rude and treated her and her staff badly. 
this was not the first time we rented from her but it is definitely the last.
Placed  a big order for our dealership on Saturday . . Didnt even receive napkins or forks.. my sweet tea was unsweet and my mudpie shake was horrible.

We originally wanted to go to El Camino, but with a 105 minute wait we went across the street to check out urban village since there were empty tables. We were seated within 5 minutes. Red flag #1- every other restaurant on second street had a long wait. Why didn't this?

We waited 15 minutes for water and our server. 8 1/2 months pregnant on a 90 degree day. I wanted water, damnit! Red flag #2.

After receiving our water, the server took our drink orders and we waited about 10 minutes. When she returned with our drinks, she ran off before we could order food. Again, 8 1/2 months pregnant and I was hangry and annoyed. We were ready to order and she just ran away.

After flagging down 3 other bussers and servers begging for our waitress to come around, she finally came to take our food orders. Our food came in about 20 minutes which was reasonable. The Rita pizza was pretty tasty. Now here's where it really goes to sh1t.

She never came back to check on us once. It would have been nice for a refill of seltzer, or more water. It would have been nice for a box. We waited 45 minutes, flagged down 5 other bussers/servers, and then finally a busser comes over laughing saying she got locked in the bathroom. She finally comes over to apologize and LEAVES without letting us ask for a box or the check. At this point we were ridiculously annoyed with both her and management. If there was an issue like that, management should have explained the situation and apologized.  We finally received our check and left a 15% tip which was honestly 15% more than she deserved. I worked in the service industry for 6 years as a bartender and server and if I was locked in the bathroom (I get it, sh1t happens) I would have immediately come out, addressed all tables and apologized, and had management assist in handling the situation. I probably would have comped a drink or two as well.
Completely unacceptable experience and I am never returning. You pissed off an angry pregnant woman.

Completely messed up our bill. Charged us combo prices and the shakes. Went we pointed it out they said "oh sorry". I'm pretty sure they knew about the mistake but thought we wouldn't notice our bill almost doubled. Then it took forever to get the food and about five people to do the refund. I wouldn't go back. I wouldn't even recommend my enemies go there. It's a trash place with horrible service trying to scam customers. Place was empty when I got there which says a lot. Don't go there. Learn from my mistake way better places in south Tampa.

I couldn't justify giving them one star only because the location is clean, and our fries were fresh. 

I haven't lived in Tucson for two years and rarely get to have Eegee's so this is a bummer of an experience. 

The reason why it is getting two stars though is that we waited 21 minutes for a sandwich and two orders of fries. I sat here as I watch people who ordered after me, get there food. The associate at the counter didn't keep track of his orders so he didn't realize we were still waiting. We were sitting in the table right in front of his register. It wasn't until I spoke up (15 minutes in) that they even realized we were missed. 

Another 5 minutes went by and then we got our food. When I opened my sandwich it was not what I ordered. So, I had to wait another few minutes for a new sandwich to be made. 

I probably won't be back to this location but let's be real, I love Eegee's and will still stop in somewhere else when I'm in town. 

In other news: Prickly Pear is pretty tasty.

If I was able to rate Bricco solely on their food, I would give them 5 stars. Unfortunately, due to their poor service they are only receiving two. (Threw them a bone for their food.) If you like waiting for a very long time to be seated with nowhere to sit or stand and being rushed through your dining experience than this place is for you. I can understand the long wait because the food is good, but I do wish that they took reservations so people could plan their nights without wasting a huge portion from waiting. The thing that I cannot accept is the rushing. When we come out to eat, we are hoping for an enjoyable, relaxing experience, especially after a long work week. We have spent good money at this establishment and always feel like they are trying to push us out of there to seat the next party. Sad. I wish I could say that this only happened to us one time, but we gave them several chances since their pizza was so tasty. We liked their food and the fact that they were BYOB but we will not be going back. We will be going back to Treno or other comparable places with better dining experiences.

I am giving this place 1 star based purely on the unimpressive dishes we ordered. Last night was my first visit to this place. We ordered shrimp plates and a seafood platter. The food came out fairly quick, the shrimp plates had about 10 shrimp and a load of fries. The seafood platter looked much better at first glance.

The shrimps breading came off by grabbing it to dip in the sauce. The taste was extremely bland, was not crispy in anyway. My mother wasn't impressed by the soggy nature of the fried seafood on her platter. She did not want cause commotion over it.

The service we got however was top notch. Our waitress, Kaycie I believe her name was, was on point.  Refills were happening fast, did not ever have to ask. The place was popping with people, was impressed with her. 

Perhaps this would be a better review if we had got different dishes. Seafood platter and the shrimp plates we had weren't very good. Perhaps the cooks had an off night.

Be very concerned if you buy a mattress at mattress firm. This is our second mattress. We are now into our mattress about $2000. We have sent letters to corporate we have sent photos and videos. To date we have not heard from anyone. This is how they treat people over 55 years old. We're supposed to lay down and let them walk all over us. Thanks mattress firm.

Had a terrible experience here and the follow up call from a district manager which promised follow up from the store never occurred. Save your money and spend it with a place that appreciates your business!  They don't cate about customers here!

Tried giving this location another chance and after being repeatedly overcharged at this location and the Bellerive location.
Same thing occurred last week and after reaching out to the District Manager of these two locations and providing a picture from the register, I was told that employees are simply confused.  Seems like a poor leadership excuse for constantly taking money from your customers that isn't consistent with the amount on your menu.  Too bad because the food is pretty good, the abuse of customers is enough that people should avoid these locations.
Food sucked was nothing like the pic service sucked  never go bck again worst place ever

Loved the atmosphere. Drinks were great but server was very rude. Also added $30 for gratuity and one of the glasses broke while my friend was drinking it, they forgot our round of shots, waited 10 minutes and had to order them again so including $30 is a little much for that service.

My family of four adults stopped in for lunch and were told to seat ourselves. We did. After about five minutes a waitress brought us menus and took our drink orders. We waited another few minutes for our drinks. Waitress did NOT take our order then but left us with our menus, and we waited ANOTHER  5-6 minutes and two other waitresses passed our table and did not even acknowledge us! Needless to say, we got up and left and not ONE waitress or manager tried to stop us from leaving !!! AVOID THIS PLACE unless you have LOTS of TIME and PATIENCE!

First time visiting here. The owner with the dreads was nice, he rung me up & gave the punch card then left. Whoever he has in the back making the food, the two young men..i don't think they know what they're doing. I ordered 3 tacos and waited 41 minutes! I know because I have the Chase app which tells me each time i make a transaction. When i finally got the food it wasn't what I was expecting. I'll probably come back again when the owner makes my food but that's horrible that I have to come on certain days. A lady before be also returned her food saying it didn't taste like usual.

Hate to say this but I made a yelp account just so that maybe the owner can get a glimpse of how awful my experience was today. I came in without an appointment my barber not only made me feel uncomfortable because he kept talking shit and yelling at another barber despite them asking him not to.. he then proceeded to antagonize her by filming as he's harassing her saying "she's not going to have a job here for much longer?" To top it off he then goes to film me trying to get me to say that she's bothering me...I'm sorry in what universe is this okay? Especially in a work environment? The fact that the owner/s even let someone so rude who has a complete disregard for customer service and coworkers alike is beyond baffling. I don't think I will  be back at this establishment. Don't bother coming here unless you enjoy feeling completely awkward. Not a very good approach to conduct a business in my opinion but what do i know?

Hate to be that unlucky person to have had nothing but bad experiences here. The first time, they overcharged me for a full leg, when all I got done was my lower legs. It was my first time so I just thought it was really expensive..I went ahead and paid(and the cashier/receptionist was eating sandwiches at the counter)....when I discovered that it was indeed an overcharge, I called to ask for an adjustment and the front desk receptionist Amanda treated me like I was a thief or a scammer, and was very rude + short with me.  After I finally got that all straightened out, my legs were not even smooth, but stubbly like I shaved two days ago. I was told this can happen and it would be better the next time. Fast forward to the second time, the waxer spent all of 10 or 15 minutes on me, missed several spots to be discovered when I arrived home..and again, my legs felt stubbly and not smooth...after consulting with a friend, apparently this happens when the service is not performed correctly and breaking the hairs off instead of pulling them out.  I came back a third time to return some products that I decided not to use, and apparently only a manager can perform a simple 30$ return? On top of that, was told she is busy and in interviews all day... nevermind there is a PAYING customer who needs help in the front.  I will never go to EWC again,  I don't think anyone should pay to have stubbly legs, make an appointment to do a return, or deal with the rude young woman at the front desk.  Thank you for your time, may you have a better experience than I did.

Very disappointing.  I ordered the Scallops special and was served a huge portion of Quinoa in the middle and 6 tiny pieces of Scallops.  The staff said the Scallops were "bay" scallops but it looked on the plate like they had cut up 1 or 2 scallops and made them look like Bay Scallops.  I will definitely avoid Harvest from now on.  My client was also surprised at the food presentation, extremely hard bread and the lack of customer satisfaction and appreciation.

Thumbs down.
I was under the impression that if a place served food, smoking was NOT allowed. WRONG!  Walked in the door and had to leave because the smell of smoke was so bad.

Went here for dim sum with the family. Food was average. Salt and Pepper squid was pretty much fried squid rings cut in half with barely of the seasoning on it. Har Gow and shui mai were decent. Chun fun or rice noodle rolls weren't that great. The rice noodle wrapping didn't have a good texture and it was thick and mushy. The Shanghai style dumplings were terrible. It was just mushy dumplings.

Service was downright terrible. The person wheeling the dim sum cart hauled ass within 5 seconds not even trying to get people interested to look at what they're offering. Waiters were good at clearing plates, not good at changing out empty tea pots. You have to wave one over to change out the empty tea pot, and ask for a specific dim sum dish which they weren't offering on the cart, and trying to wave for one waiter to give you the bill.

The prices aren't bad for dim sum but the service really does need improvement.

They have a special, 2 sandwiches for $8. So I took my family of 6 and got 6 sandwiches. On our bill, there was a $3 "share" charge. When I asked what it was for, she said the special is meant for 1 person. That's not cool. Add to that the fact that one of our cheeseburgers had a moldy bun, and the waitress didn't offer to comp or discount anything. Food was decent at best. Overheard another customer complaining about there being no carbonation in the soda, and that they charged her for extra sauce, but then didn't even fill up the condiment cup. Places like this need to learn that trying to skimp and cut costs like this really just doesn't do much for the customer's experience. As for us, we won't be back.

Food cold. Service horrible. They have you put the tip on prior to getting the service and now I know why. Pathetic in every way. Servers uninterested in doing a good job. The place was a pigsty. Get your act together.

The server with short black hair working on Friday Apr 13 was extremely rude with our group. She acted like she didn't even want to be here and everything was an inconvenience for her. One of my friend's order was completely forgotten about (even when he ordered the same thing as me) until 40 minutes later. I usually love the food here but the service this time around really left a bad taste in my mouth.

Was greeted and seated immediately!

The piña colada was amazing, however the Guinness was not poured properly. Ordered items and upon receiving them sent the old, stale and crunchy dynamite rolls back immediately.  Ordered the mushroom burger instead which took 25 minutes to receive . . . which was not worth the wait. 

Food items:

Dynamite Rolls: DO NOT ORDER - they were very stale, crunchy and old. Mushroom Swiss Burger: flavourless and you were able to count the mushrooms (3.5) placed on top of the patty. Fettuccine Alfredo was good along with the Canadian Hunter burger (only thanks to the chipotle sauce). The fries that went with the burgers were OVERLY SALTED and contained a mixture of 3 different types (is this on purpose?) that due to different cooking times left some soggy or tough. Our server Katie was great - we know the food issues are not her fault. Waiting 25 minutes though to get a burger and then receiving it when everyone else is done their meal was disappointing.

TVs are placed awkwardly around the bar which makes for a difficult viewing experience (and the lighting fixtures do not help by adding glare), however the acoustics in the bathroom from the hockey game were excellent.
Lunch buffet....forget it. Lousy selection. No fresh pizza after 1 pm. $1 extra for ranch dressing?!

My wife and I went to Miss Saigon the other day to try their pho.  Situated in the old Mongolian Express location just across from the Strathcona Save-On, it retains the look and much of the feel of the previous tenants.

Though we printed the coupon from the Valpak website which clearly stated we should have been able to use, they turned it down, insisting that they only accepted the coupon from their delivered flyer.  What's the purpose of having your restaurant coupon available on-line if you can't use it?  Luckily we did also have the flyer coupon which we were going to save for another occasion.

My wife had the #2 Rare Beef Noodle soup and I the #5 Vietnamese Spicy Soup.

Both came with the usual bean sprouts, slice of lime, basil leaves and a chili.

Though my soup was reasonably spicy, it didn't have that nice pho broth flavour of the better pho places even though the #2 soup did.  Disappointingly, I was told it was a different broth, and mine came with spaghetti noodles rather than the standard rice noodles that the # 2 did.

Overall, it was okay, but for a much more flavourful experience, you can do better.  I'd drive a few minutes down Whyte Ave to have the wonderful broth on 100th Street.
The food is sometimes undercooked (chicken mostly) the waiting staff is ignorant and rude really wish this was an old country buffet again...

I was eating dinner with a group of friends and we were discussing our political opinions. Our waitress walked up and not only contradicted what we were saying but she just wouldn't stop. She went on and on about what she believed. I'm not going to include which side who was for because it is irrelevant- it was entirely unprofessional to blather on about her political stance to our table. I regret leaving the 20 % tip that I did.

Bad service every time, cashier lady has zero costumer service. She doesn't listen to your order and if you have any special requests she is very likely to ignore them and get your food order wrong.
Food is Okay.
Burrito sizes keep getting smaller and prices keeps increasing.
Might as well go to Taco Bell across the street.!

COCKROACHES!!

Huge palmetto bugs in the apartment. All the leasing ofc does is call exterminator that doesn't help at all.

They have some insider deal with a towing company and will tow your car even with the resident parking decal.

The entire complex smells like piss. Do yourself a favor and find  another place to call home.

We rarely come here. This place needs some renovations or a deep cleaning. The vinyl on the booths is torn there is food and gunk at the sides of the booth. 

We ordered and everything was ok. We were just talking then I realized it was taking forever and it wasn't even busy. The guy by us ordered 6 tender but they only gave him 4 and they kept apologizing and saying the other 2 were coming. It took about 10-15 min to bring them to him. They did only charge him for the 4. We got our food it was hot and fresh. 

For $35 not sure this is where I would come again for 3 people. I really don't know what the wait was for food.
Refused to cook cheesy tots. Charged me for a soda when I asked for a water cup. Became belligerent and whined about "corporate" when I asked for my money back. Stay the heck away.

Came in for the March madness sweet 16 game. No CO2 meant no soda or beer. So I asked for a Thai Tea. They ran out of that too. Very disappointed that I am stuck with a water or hard liquor to drink. Restaurants should have CO2 at all times and never run out.

I just tried for ten seconds to find a way to give this place 0 stars. Our bad experience started on arrival. There's a window you have to use outside. It was cold. Additionally, there was a $50 fee we weren't aware of so we ended up paying way more than we should have.

The room was advertised as having a "private balcony", but the door to the outside of our room had a sign up that said "emergency exit only".

The beds were incredibly hard and very uncomfortable. Also we were given three pillows rather than 4. We had to plug the TV in by ourselves because there was no connection. In the shower, the shower head leaked so much that the water pressure left more than a little to be desired. 

I will never go back. I'll sleep on the Courtney Campbell in my car before I set foot in there again.

Every time I come here there's like a 5-10 min wait with only 1-2 cars ahead of me. If the car ahead has a large order, it seems like they are not asked to pull forward. By the time I get my food its cold or the fries are soggy.

So much for "fast" food. Sat in the drive thru for 30mins. It was the same issue a few months back, which was the last time i patronized this KFC. I don't come here often, for obvious reasons, but when i have a hankering for KFC or Taco Bell i suck it up but geesh, this location really needs to get it together. I don't understand the problem, are customers ordering at the window or something? Or are customers changing their orders?? I have never seen anything like this before. New Orleans East deserves better.

4 stars for the food but the service where do I get started. As a non Caucasian tampa native rarely do I experience waiting a long time for service. However went there for a brew bus ride all day event. Started at this location, basically had to wait over 15 mins to even be acknowledged. But again food was yum but prob will not be recommending this location & defiantly won't be suggestion for any corporate events because no matter what you look like or sound like, we never make people feel different than others!!

My fiance and I visited Kobe with a couple of friends. The chef was over dramatic and grating to be around. The worst was that we were seated at the end of the table on the side he would always serve last. Because of this and because he was flirting with the only single gal at the table, the two of us always ended up getting very small portions of the food which would sometimes be barely anything. My poor fiance, who was the very last person to be served every time, would get single pieces of chopped meat and veggies and I would maybe get two pieces. Even the friends we came with noticed the lack of food on our plates. If I pay for a meal, I expect to be served the same amount of food as everyone else. I don't come to dine at a restaurant to be deprived of food that I paid for. We came very hungry and left hungry and the food itself was just mediocre. We definitely won't be going back.

While visiting AZ on business I was told this place was a must and that they had good food in a recreated Western town and I needed wear a tie so they could cut it. Hmmm...

So we went for dinner one night and I wasn't impressed at all. The Western feel was really cool and we enjoyed going to the old time shops after dinner. They were having the gun show but we didn't have the time to experience it. 

The food was two thumbs down. Out of six people, only one person enjoyed their meal. Steaks, ribs, brisket...no one really ate it. For sides we had the Mac and cheese, beaked beans, corn and I think green beans. Everything tasted like it came straight out of a can. One of my co-workers did like her chicken. Can't forget about the white bread. One out of six, you need a mean poker face for that kind of hand. 

I wish I could say the drinks were better, but no one liked those either. One co-worker referred to hers as dish water. I had the beer cocktail which just tasted like watered down flat beer. I wish I could say something better but it wasn't a pleasant dining experience at all. The tie cutting and watching the fire in the kitchen were the highlights.

My wife and I haven't eaten here for several years. This morning, we were in the area, and thought we'd give it a shot. Food wasn't anything special, comparable to IHOP, Denny's, perhaps a little worse than Bob Evens. Why just the two stars? DAYYUM! The PRICES!!! With tip, two breakfasts, one coffee and one tea, for $32. These were average breakfasts. I can get a better meal at Denny's, with my AARP discount, for just over half this. No thanks.

Currently on minute 25 of waiting in line at this place. This has to be the worst Starbucks in the history of the world. 

We finally made it to the window and one of our drinks is wrong and they're out of lemon cake, blueberry scones and basically everything on the menu. Only come here if you want to make yourself late for something.

Good service but horrible food. Jack's new food truck series has to be the worst sandwiches I have ever eaten from Jack in the box. Taste OK but for $5 a sandwich, better load it up. I've tried two out of the three and it's horrible. The pork "belly" in the BLT is so thin, they should be illegal to classify it as belly. Thick bacon is a better term and two pieces that can't fill the sandwich is a rip off. Then the Primerib Steak sandwich didn't even fill 3/4 of the sandwich. Once again failure. Last but not least... They called the bread a baguette but it's really just cheap sub bread. Overall, I'd be ashamed to even market these sandwich as such. I don't blame Martha for not trying them. #JackvsMartha

So there I was just before 6am Sunday waiting in a long line that took over 10 minutes to get to the register (For high priced airport refreshment). 

Based on the family reputation and awesome Churros at the Columbia restaurant I was really happy to see them on their signboard. 

Also I saw Cafe Con Leche and a Signature drink with exactly the same description but one additional ingredient. Oddly the CCL was over $5 but the other with more ingredients was under $5. I asked the cashier and she could not explain except "that's the way they made the sign"

I declined the coffee since it was a bit overpriced either way. But ordered the churros! Then the cashier told me those are not available until the afternoon. ??? It did NOT say that on the sign board!I pointed out that I waited in line over 10 minutes because of that. 

Truly a waste of my time. Poor information, slow service. Largely disappointed. Lesson learned. Lots of other good places get my future business. The Greek place has a dense muffin, glad I tried it.

I was so excited to go to kraftologee after hearing so much about it, but I was disappointed. They advertise a kids area for 2-12. The big kid room wasn't open today, and the room was way too young for the 11 year olds I brought. My 5 year old enjoyed himself though. The 11 year olds did enjoy the board games they found. We had cheese nachos with cheese half melted (seemed like they were microwaved), Kraft Mac n cheese (reheated in a microwave?) And waffles (again, reheated in a microwave?). The latte was very average. 

Great concept! But have a lot of opportunity to make better food.

I'm still kicking myself for paying for this breakfast. This was by far the worst food-- and service-- I received while visiting Nola for the week. Four stars on yelp? I just can't..

Pros: the cafe itself is the cutest place I've seen in a really long time. With its adorable two person tables, paint colors, tile work, and fireplace in the corner, it's stepping inside from a busy, exhausted city life to a scene straight out of Midnight In Paris. My latte was perfectly adequate-- nothing too fancy and nothing to complain about. 

Cons: the service. Im sure the night after Halloween is especially rough for both the service industry employees and their patrons, however it was two in the afternoon and there was only one other couple having breakfast so I believe the service should have been far greater. Firstly, our server didn't greet us-- she just sort of glared, waiting for us to announce our intentions-- dining in or getting coffee etc. No smile throughout the duration of our meal. We had to ask repeatedly for refills of water (their water glasses are small). After ordering two crepes for myself and my companion ordering one for himself and a salmon bagel, our food came out. I had no idea each order comes with two crepes-- something our server could have mentioned. When the food came out, which took a lengthy amount of time, the salmon for the bagel was missing and the other items were on the side so it turned out to be a build-your-one bagel kind of thing-- expensive and time consuming. 

The food. I ordered the Nutella/banana crepe and added strawberries and the chicken crepe. Companion ordered the chicken crepe and salmon bagel. He said once he received the salmon and built the bagel, it was tasty. The crepes-- which are why we were so excited to be there-- were terrible. The pancake was like rubber, chewy and enormous, just flopping around everywhere. It was hardly edible. The interior of the crepe was literally just a glob of ingredients in the middle of the cake and wrapped up, leaving a tremendous amount of unused, wasted crepe. The chicken tasted like it was from the can as did the strawberries. Too much Nutella blobbed in the middle to try to mask to underwhelm of the meal. 

The end cost? Over $60 for the worst breakfast I've had in years. Don't waste your time or money unless you're only going for coffee.

I hate to disparage any business, especially one where I've had a good time, but their management really blew it on this one. On Friday I booked a party of 18 for Saturday and paid ahead of time in full ($755). Unfortunately one of our party got sick and had to bail, so when we arrived I asked the front desk if I could be refunded his $42. "That's fine, we'll take care of that," the staff member said. Ok, great, thanks.

As of today (Monday) I didn't see a refund on my account, so I politely called to follow up and was completely stonewalled by two different managers. The staff member must've been misinformed, they said, and when I (still politely) protested they recited the company lines of "Well as it says on your email receipt, we need 24 hours notice" (impossible since I'd booked 24 hours prior), and then "Once it's in the computer nothing can be done." Uh huh. What a weak, dumb way to handle a large group that tipped well and would've happily gone back regularly. Never had this problem at Urban Axes, so we'll take our business there instead.

Horrid service.  Our server FORGOT our wine order and 5 minutes into our entree came over to confirm we DIDN'T really want that bottle after all.  He proceeded to wiff the table next to ours order - serving the wrong dishes and failing to bring their check upon request.  He was watching the Cleveland playoff game at the bar. 

Great Chef and food driven to a new low by yet another server who simply doesn't give a damn.  

5 star food with -5 star service.

So to start out on a positive note...my fiance got my engagement ring from here and it is absolutely gorgeous... He ordered online and it shipped very quickly. I couldn't be happier with it. However , when it came time to look for wedding bands we decided it just made sense to go back to Shane Co. Unfortunately the experience was not a good one... The gentleman that offered to help us when we walked in the door seemed almost annoyed that he had to help someone.. but I tried to give him the benefit of the doubt. Maybe he was nearing the end of his shift and just tired. However , we told him we were there to look for wedding bands and I was very excited. He didn't share the excitement ... Didn't ask when the big day was, no interest in us personally . I told him I wanted something Rose gold to match my ring and he started pulling some rings. I noticed the ones he was pulling were much more than we were hoping to spend, so I politely asked him if maybe we could look at something more in the $500-$600 range. I didn't think that was unreasonable based on some styles I had seen online during my research. He immediately said, "well I can tell you that you aren't going to get a ring with any sort of stone in it in that price range..."... Okay... So I ended up finding something at the top of that price range that had some small diamonds in it and felt like that was really my only option if I didn't want a plain metal band. He made it obvious he was tired of showing me rings and I felt like I needed to make a decision so next thing I knew I had purchased this ring that I probably wouldn't have originally even picked out. So fast forward a month or so and it was still bothering me that I wasn't completely happy with my ring and felt liked I had been rushed into a decision. So I decided to look elsewhere.  I ended up going to Jared Galleria of Jewelry, and what a stark difference from my experience at Shane. I was greeted immediately by a very bubbly kind woman who was more than happy to show me several options of rings in my price range that were gorgeous. She took her time with me and I felt like she would have spent however long I needed to find the perfect ring . I found a ring I really loved there and was set to buy it but I wanted to give Shane co. one last chance. I went in as soon as they opened today and was greeted by a young woman. I explained to her that I wanted to return a ring I had purchased because I really wasn't sure I liked it but that I was interested in looking at a couple of rings I had seen online. She asked me why I didn't like my ring and I just was honest and explained the prior situation and how I felt rushed into buying something that I wasn't crazy about. She didn't give an apology but jumped at the chance to show me more rings. She looked at my receipt from the original ring and said "okay I see what your budget is based on this". She then pulled out a ring and showed it to me. I tried it on and it was really pretty so I took a picture and said I wanted to show my fiance and discuss with him before making the purchase. However I then looked at the price tag and the ring was $1695! Wayyyyyy out of my budget. : ( Plus the ring looked very similar to the one I had found at Jared , but was nearly 3X the cost! I was polite and just told her I think I would just return my other ring today and think about the other ring purchase after discussing with my fiance. She then seemed irritated and lead me to the back to get my refund. Before she left me she said "sorry about that !" And then walked off. When I left the store after my return she did not acknowledge me at all... I was very shocked and displeased with both of my experiences ... Especially after hearing all of the commercials that boast about the excellent customer service and great prices from "cutting out the middle man". I will be returning to have my engagement ring checked regularly so I don't void my warranty but I don't think I would want to go through the process of looking for jewelry there in the future...
Terrible customer service.   They do not do a good job at communicating with customers and waste your time.

Just stopped in for a bathroom break and to get a drink and a large fri 
Very rude service my husband and I stood there for 3 mins while the 2 ladies had there back to us and was talking . As I said can I place a order in a nice voice I was ignored so I said it again and then she turned around and was like yes!!!!!! And was pissed because I interpreted her . 
Rude and the fires are old
They overcharged me then didn't update my bill. Their beers are just ok and overpriced. Not been here in awhile and won't be going back

They only hire Drug dealers and drug users , sales associate like pourjami know as pj drug user prosecuted in Ca. Using meth and Cocain and buying it from associate in dealership this place gets 0 star

NEVER EVER EVER USE THIS GROOMER ESPECIALLY MARTIKA!!! ive taken my dog for her regular grooming since she was a puppy and have had okay experiences. today, I will never go back. we brought our 18 month old dog in for her appointment and the staff, especially Martika were incredibly rude, impatient and rough with my dog. the tech came over to put a leash on her, backed her into a corner and tried to thrust it on her without greeting macaroni or even giving us a warning that's what she was doing. Dog Etiquette 101: NEVER approach a dog abruptly over the head without getting on her level and letting her sniff first. naturally, my pup yelped and jumped into the corner. Martika immediately said she wouldn't allow her to be groomed because she was too scared. Isn't it part of your JOB to be patient and calm my pup down?! Macaroni has been groomed dozens of times with no issues until Martika got involved. I highly recommend going elsewhere. Our dogs deserve love, attention and most importantly patience. macaroni is a little scared, but never aggressive and just needed some patience and kindness. instead she was refused service and treated like a rat. I will never EVER go back.

I'm really pissed. I eat at firehouse all the time, just usually not this location. I used 8,000 of my points to get my sandwich and the bread was not toasted and they put sooooo much ranch that it was dripping all over me and my plate. The side of the sandwich was completely covered in ranch. The restaurant was trashed as well, a majority of the tables were dirty. I totally wasted my free sandwich because I threw half of it away. Do not come to this location!!!

The worst experience across the board! Between the hostess telling patrons to "just go somewhere else" because of the wait (72 minutes) and the waiter completely forgetting he was working while sitting at another table talking to guests for 20 minutes at a time! You name it, and it went wrong. The appetizers came out with the main course because someone took our order to another table. And then the food came out under seasoned and under temperature. They need to hire a more professional staff because this was just unacceptable!
Food tasted 100% frozen and the portion sizes were no where near worth the price. Dont waste your money please

Came here for the first time with my boyfriend because he use to rave about how good the wings are. I ordered honey hot and he ordered mild and both were kind of a disappointment. I ended up getting bbq instead honey hot. Also the ranch had a hint of banana?? Maybe it was just us but will not be coming back to this location

Great good but terrible parking!  If you don't want your car dinged then don't go here.  They purposely made the spots the absolute smallest possible at your expense.  Perhaps management will see this and reconsider their greedy parking.  I recommend only coming here on a tri-cycle, motorcycle or moped only.

I can't say I gave Misconduct a fair shake, but I decided to leave after waiting 20 minutes to give my order. I let another server know that I hadn't been helped and that I was going to head out. It was nice of her to offer to get someone to speak with me, but there are too many other (better) options in the immediate area for lunch that it wasn't worth the time.

This place was mediocre all three times I got my nails done there.  But aside from that I learned a valuable lesson from this place...just because they say they can wax everything...and have a little board with waxing and prices...does NOT mean you should allow them to wax just anything.  Maybe they can handle eyebrows...but NOTHING else.  I wake up with nightmares about that experience. I feel like I've been gnawed by a dog.

In logging in here to write a review, I am not at all shocked that this westshore has a sorry rating of 1 and 1/2 stars. I don't even want to give them one but you have to give something.

I have had a number of issues with this location over the last couple of years and finally I am done. There was a time it was good, but that was a LONG LONG time ago. 

Today my experience was to first try and order online. The website kept giving me errors and this is nothing new. I then called, man answered please hold, left me on hold for 10 minutes, then comes on, asks pick up or delivery. I tell him delivery and he says 90 minutes. Short and not friendly. I say well I guess after holding 10 minutes I find out I'm ordering from somewhere else. He then says sorry I just put in a large order ahead of you of pies very rudely, I then start to reply and as I do he hangs up on me! 

Westshore, I don't care if other locations are better or not. I am done with all of them now! News flash, there are a lot of other joints in town to choose from and you "stuff" isn't all that!

If I could give it 0 stars, I would. The rooms are dirty and the property is dangerous. One room near ours had police caution tape over the door! The only good thing about the experience is that they let us end our 2-day reservation early without an extra fee. DO NOT BOOK HERE!!

I have given this branch multiple opportunities to get their act together - they work hard to make sure they fail. I used to have 3 properties under contract with them. It was frustrating because they could not keep a time even within their window of time. I always asked them to ask the tech to give me a call before he came - rarely happened. 
I canceled 2 contracts, and kept one: there are times when a tech would come and not have enough bait, frequently late, not show up and keep me waiting at a property in Philly for 2 hours, etc. The kicker was the last one:
a) for the tech to get into the Apt he'll either have to call or ring the doorbell. On this occasion he did neither and wrote on the Report 'sprayed perimeter...' because no one answered. The tenant was actually outside the porch and no one had come; I didn't receive a call either!
b) so I called the Office and they offered to reschedule. I requested the 1st appt, which they gave. On the day of the appt, I wait 2 hrs without hearing anything about a delay so I call the Main Office # and they tell me that they are getting in touch with the tech 'and he will contact me shortly'. Guess what? You're right! It didn't happen. When people lie, they should be a little smarter: I was later told "after his first appt, his truck died ... he's trying to get it fixed and he'll come as soon as that is done!"  The lie? Mine was the 1st appt!
There are other honorable outfits who do a better job, are people of integrity, and do not scam like this Branch does.

Worst And conniving fraudulent bar on beach Drive the employees are Scammers do not leave any open tabs or anything Valuable out like  your iPhone this bar has a convict Mindset and employees are known for credit card Fraud  Iong story short I was drinking with some friends a little tispy but still able to comprehend as I was heading towards the bar exit i remember I left one of my cell phones at the bar the Purple headed girl and 3 others that are employed at tryst were around the whole time so as I came back to ask where is my phone the employees said they didn't see a phone my iPhone after I threatened and stood my ground they finally gave me back my iPhone it was perfectly hidin under the lemon case at the bar which was retrieved by the manager which he knew about..Do not go to Tryst the canopy Birchwood is a safer environment cassis or the champagne bar next door to tryst Do not I repeat open any tabs or leave out anything expensive it will get stolen last time I checked I thought I was on Beach drive not Harlem!! Saint Petersburg City Commissioner was contacted!!!

This place is ridiculous. You can't substitute pasta for a salad. When not everyone want to eat starch or gluten. There's limited options, there's only one size for soup. Wouldn't recommend if you're looking for a new place to frequent

One star for cleanliness and one star for a wonderful staff.  Unfortunately that's all I can give. I usually go to the Lumsden location but have came here the last week for convenience.   Today marks my third time back within a week and I am as disappointed with my food as I was the last two times. I come for breakfast early hours around 7:30.  So assuming it should be fresh. Today I came on a Monday hoping I wouldn't run into the same problem... wrong. The food I purchased is not coming out hot, and it's definitely not fresh. They're over preparing way too much for the biscuits to taste old and soft, my chicken is barley warm and for the hash browns to taste and even look as if they've sat in a heat lamp for too long.    Myself and family visit chick fil a multiple times a week but unfortunately this one needs to step up the quality of preparation because it's not worth the money you pay for "fresh" food.

Riley and Sons movers came to my house directly and quoted me 1800 dollars for my move from South Jersey to Manayunk. I needed to store my belongings with them for two weeks which was supposed to be an additional 400 dollars. Two weeks later after my stuff was delivered, I was given an additional 1800 dollar bill. I was then told the 1800 dollar quote was per load and unload of the truck. Essentially they charged me for an additional move because of the two weeks my belongings were in storage. This was never explained to me prior. I was charged for two full price moves. Completely taken by surprise. Total RIP OFF!! The movers themselves were cool, but this company really screwed me. Don't make the mistake I made. Go with someone else. Wish I give them zero stars.

Towel service is promised, but not reliable. The mold on the swimming pool coping........the grimey body oils in the hot tub....how'd they get that 110 VAC outlet 5 feet from the hot tub past electrical code?.....bathrooms and lockers not so clean.....areas for stretch and calisthenics roped off for 'private lesson' use only....huge staff turnover....no backstroke flags for the pool.....poor design as there is no way to move from the parking garage to the gym during monsoon season without getting drenched.  And there's always an excuse why a lower advertised rate does not apply to your particular membership.
Poor service. Poorly managed. Not real clean. Food was cooked fine. No hostess.Place needs some serious training. Under staffed for minimal amount of tables.

We ordered drinks and an appetizer. 35 minutes later. Still no appetizer. Our server ignored us for 10 more minutes when we were trying to get our check. She finally brings us our check and tried to charge us for the appetizer we never got. 

The actual restaurant is beautiful, but they failed at delivering the EASIEST order ever. There was never acknowledgement of the mistake. Do better.

Very cheap, I will give them that and if that is your biggest qualification in making a choice on what to eat... you are all set. I was not sold on the food though. It was average at best. I think I could have made better pizza at home with a frozen shell.

The food honestly was pretty sad. Especially all the oily items (samosa, puff, chole bature) almost tasted like the oils been used and reused multiple times. The only reason I give it two stars is because the place is clean, spacious and the samosa chaat was moderately alright. So was the falooda.

Pizza is good-it's different. Plenty of other reviews cover that. I want to talk about their service. Getting delivery is not too bad. Sometimes over an hour wait. It's not dominoes, just need to be mindful of that. My biggest issue is when you want to pick up. My husband had to run some errands so he called to order then made a few stops and was at penny's 40 minutes later. He paid for the pizza and continued to wait. Well over an hour later he's still waiting. There are 6 other people there waiting for orders they called in that should be ready by now. I know this because my husband is texting me the play-by-play while he waits. 
This is not the first time this has happened to him. They keep the pizzas for delivery cranking out but don't make pizzas for those who are standing in the shop! Penny's is worried about their delivery ratings for apps like Eat24 but have no consideration for the people who have paid who are standing in front of them.
Penny's, get it together. Stop taking delivery orders if you can't fulfill pickups as well.

Worst company I ever dealt with! They kept trying to make me take MORE AND MORE CASH!! I've never felt more pressure to lock my loan! They told me "I would be doing you a disservice if I didn't ask you if you wanted more cash" IM IN DEBT, I don't need ti borrow more cash IDIOTS

Stopped in here for a quick bite. The clam chowder and calamari were great. But after that it went downhill. The po'boy was the worst I've had, no flavor and not toasted properly. My husband got the cod and fried whole neck clams. While the cod was good, he ended up with food poisoning. We couldn't tell if the clams were actually clams or oysters, and those were probably to blame for how sick he got. 

The service was good to start. Our waitress was very friendly. But once (who I assume) was the Manager day at the bar next to us, our waitress was frantically trying to fulfill orders while the manager and other served sat talking (sometimes about things I didn't find appropriate to be loudly discussed next to patrons) and watching a football game. I frankly found it unprofessional for a manager to care more about a football game than her job, especially when one server is very obviously swamped. It ruined our experience of what otherwise seemed like a nice local place. We won't be returning.

More hype than food. Location is good and accessible though.
A little more effort in food than in interior would make it a high end Indian restaurant around here

Traveled here for work and wanted a manicure. I waited 40 minutes to be called; and, waited another 20-30 minutes after to dry my nail polish. The lady that did my nails said I was 'okay' to go. I left, minutes later my polish came off. I called and asked to have it fixed. Came back and was given the worst service. The owner was very unprofessional.

The gumbo was not completely authentic. The chicken looked pre cooked and the sausage was just ok. The rue was really thick but tasty but i didn't eat it all because it didn't taste or look completely authentic. My friend had the oysters and said they weren't that tasty. 

The food gets 2 stars But it does have a great ambiance and nice feels. And good drinks!
You'd have to really try hard to underperform Comcast customer service. Run arounds, double-speak, missed appointments and upsetting -- that's my experience. I'm leaving.

tl;dr: Sandy legitimately tried her hardest to make it right. I mean, like, she plead with me like your drunk boyfriend you're trying to leave. Her heart was in it, people. But somehow, just like your drunk boyfriend, she made it worse.

Disclaimer: This is my experience and yours may be completely different. 

Without further ado: 

I am writing this with a heavy heart. I don't want to be the person writing this review about someone's business. I have friends who are small business owners. I understand how grave this is. I even talked it over with some of those friends before proceeding. 

The thing is If I think "Someone should do something" and no one is doing anything, then I have a responsibility to be that person. And someone should do something so that you don't end up with crappy aesthetic results or complications that arise from receiving Botox injections from someone who lacks the knowledge, experience and skill required. So here I am.  

This is an update of what happened after I posted by initial review. 

After additional interactions with staff of Revenge MD, I decided to accept their refund because while it won't make my face look any better, maybe spending that money on a spa day will help slough all the icky feelings of this experience:

After receiving the offer of a refund on Wednesday December 5th and declining it on Thursday, I received a voicemail message from Sandy in business development. She said she was accustomed to everyone loving what they do, that she doesn't like people not being happy with their work, that it kind of hurts, that she did not feel good about taking my money. She said one way or the other, she would like to refund my money. Friday, I returned her call and left a message. 

I got no response. So I sent a text because I know everyone receives those. 

At this point, I'm imagining that what will happen is I will be treated with kindness and dignity. I will receive an actual apology and an acknowledgement of my complaint.

That is not what happened, people. Not at all. Sandy called me back almost immediately exasperated, explaining she'd had a family emergency.  She seemed quite upset, which I understand. She again told me how much everyone likes their service. She gave me bizarre explanations for the other negative Yelp reviews that I did not even mention. No actual apology, just a weird diatribe about how everyone else likes them. She asked me to update my review to include that she has tried to make it right. Then she offered other services, despite the fact that I'd already said I wasn't comfortable with their office treating me any further. I repeatedly told her no, reiterating I wasn't comfortable with her office providing any more services. She kept insisting, repeating my name in every single sentence, like we were old pals. I asked her to respect my answer. She continued insisting. Finally, I went full bore, telling her that as a woman, I'm not sure why she didn't understand the concept that it's my body and my answer is no. I actually said to her, "No means no."I told her if she did this one more time, I would most certainly update my review to include this fact. And since you're reading this, you can guess: She continued. 

In fact, so did other staff when I went to pick up the refund.   The injector I saw came out and handed me an envelope with a check. She again asked repeatedly to provide other services or a touch up. I repeated my consent speech. She ignored me, asked what she could do to make it right. She wanted to smooth things over with me. She wanted me to do something about my Yelp review. I finally disentangled myself. But I felt awful.

Even after openly telling the injector that all I wanted was to be acknowledged, to receive an actual apology, she repeated the gaslighting rhetoric about how she thought my eyes looked better. Personally, I liked my face better when you could see my lower eyelid. Half the reason I get botox is for the lift. It was maddening. 

Seriously. It felt exactly like arguing with a drunk boyfriend. I just wanted it to end, you know? I don't want to sit here and admit I wanted cheaper Botox. I don't want to admit I got bad Botox as a result. I don't want to admit that you can't see my lower eyelid anymore. I don't want to admit how wildly insecure I feel as a result of that. All I wanted to do was get the fuck out of this situation and never talk to these people again. I didn't even want to write this. I wanted to forget it and move on. But you know what I want more? For you not to end up this unhappy just because I didn't feel comfortable speaking up. I hope you find it helpful.

RACISM AT ITS' FINEST. 

Incredibly RACIST establishment. Don't bother going if you're not white. They went out of their way to try and kick us off their "sand property" and even once we moved they went to the establishment next door and had them try to kick us out. Then they called the COPS (again) to try to have us removed from the beach completely. When they complained, cops had a good laugh at how ridiculous and blantantly racist this beach bar owner was. Don't recommend ever.

A video to sum up the experience:
https://www.facebook.com/OfficialHolyZeus/videos/10155411993413040/

Disappointed in lack of follow-up received from this company. Once the problem was diagnosed I was told that someone would be contacting me to schedule the repair. Weeks later after not receiving a call, I followed up with the office. No one knew what my issue was or who was supposed to be contacting me - they asked if they could call me back. Two days later I called again and left a message with the answering service. I received a call back the next morning with someone asking what I was calling about. Again, explained what I needed and the individual said that should would forward my request but had no idea what was going on. Cancelled my service with this company.

If I could give 0 stars, I would. I went to this location around 7:30 pm tonight and as I was pulling through the drive thru, from an empty parking lot I head a worker yelling "aye I'm out of chicken. If you want chicken you'll have to go somewhere else". I find this to be extremely professional. Screaming at a customer though the parking lot to go somewhere else, as opposed to just simply letting them know when they come through the drive thru that you're out of chicken but have plenty of other things to offer on the menu. Also, as a fast food chicken restaurant running out of chicken seems a bit odd. Finally, if the employees are going to sit in the parking lot 4 hours before the store closes to tell people to go elsewhere since you're out of chicken, just close the store for the night. 
New to this area and really disappointed in my experience tonight.

There is a lot of potential at Pearl Diver. The interior is gorgeous and well-themed and the outdoor space makes you feel that you are transported to an island. Plus I love the cabanas and the overall vibe is really cool and interesting. 
However, there were some pretty significant issues. First, you have to order at the bar or window connected to the outdoor space. I definitely had more luck at the bar, but just come here planning to wait to order. That alone isn't a dealbreaker though. I'm fine to wait if I'm getting some interesting drinks and delicious food. Unfortunately Pearl Diver didn't deliver there either. While the port to port cocktail was delicious, it only tasted like fruit juice and was very weak. If I'm paying $12 I want it to taste like an adult beverage. I tried the Paloma later and it was better but also very weak and mostly ice. I was excited about the food but bummed when the mushroom and shishito peppers came out with a laughable amount. There were seriously 5 of them on a skewer and the mushrooms were a huge let down and not worth $9 for these items. Luckily the dumplings and dipping sauce were good so it wasn't a total waste. 
At the end of our night we enjoyed talking to the bartender and sampled a shot of the daiquiri which was delicious and what I should have ordered instead of the other fruit heavy beverages I sampled. The bottom line is that I paid $50 leaving hungry and completely sober which makes me grumpy. Luckily I was hanging out with an awesome group of ladies so it wasn't a total loss but I'm not rushing back, especially since it's the new place to be and super popular. Maybe they know something I don't?

Dr Beisman is very nice and an excellent doctor.  However, I have left his office because his staff is so rude, mainly his front office staff and one person in particular.  She is the one who checks you out.  Upon arrival, the front desk staff is rude as well.   I like Dr Beisman, but his staff gives the air that I should be grateful to be a patient.  That works both ways....they should be grateful that I patronize this practice and help pay their salaries.  I have found someone who does work as well as Dr Beisman and my business is actually appreciated.  Lose the attitude front desk staff!!!

I always eat at this place every time my wife and I go to philly, but this tradition has been put to rest. We went there today and it was horrible from the food to the service. Let's start by saying it took 20 mins to 8 pretzel bits and 45 mins to get our ICE COLD philly steak hero's. The best thing about this place was their potato soup which they no longer serve. New owners, new menu horrible place. As you can guess I will never go there again.

This was a bad experience. I paid the full price, no coupon, for a full set of lash extensions with an upper-level person applying them and I should have just paid for the cheapest person to do it. There was a bald spot on one eye. I called, came in, they had the same woman "repair" it and afterward, the same issue was there plus they were falling out like crazy immediately. I called, related the problem again, asked if I could switch to a different lash tech to get it fixed & said I'd even pay more money to just get someone different to work on my lashes (!!) and this place refused. They absolutely refused to do anything except have the same inept woman work on my lashes a 3rd time. So I thought better of my time and took my business elsewhere, have been going to the other place for about 4 months and am extremely pleased even though it's a bit of a commute. I'd rather drive 25 minutes than deal with this place with their sloppy standards and terrible business ethics.
TL;DR
Sloppy job on lashes
Bad business ethics and service
2 other people told me this place sucks. 
I got no satisfaction at all
Don't go here for lashes

Never ever go here they are a nightmare.

Chopped all of my hair off and said that is what the notes say,. no short on sides long on top,. now I look like I'm going into boot camp.

I will ever go there again.

Dora should be ashamed of herself and the manger should try to act like an adult instead of a five year old.

Go at your ow risk...you have been warned

So I would've given them a higher rating because the pizza was great- I had the fajita pizza. BUT, also ordered chips and salsa as a side and lo and behold, I got Doritos and marinara. I recommend their pizza, but any place that "runs out of their chips and salsa" and thinks "oh better get the stunt double- Doritos and marinara" deserves a poor rating and to PLEASE learn from their mistake. I mean come on guys, what is this logic? But thanks for the chips and salsa credit for my next order, I guess?

Bad experience due to our server, Don. Rude from start to finish. For some crazy reason, he charged us an additional $80.00 on our chef's choice menu ( party of 4) because one guest requested "no scallops". The owner removed the charge, but it was embarrassing to have to argue over something so ridiculous. It's a shame because the food was very good, but there are so many opportunities to dine where you feel you are appreciated.

Not the best India food I have eaten, service was not that great eighter, I say is like eating a burger from Burger kings, crappy meat and expense with is no bueno.  I had a high expectation of this restaurant after one of my friends told me it was the best India food that he has eaten in Philly.

The offer a buffet as most the Indian restaurant I have been before, they also have a selection of India dishes, for me, I went for the garlic naan and went I order it, the server gives me some attitude I don't know why... and India shrimp biryani medium. 
For my surprise the biryani was not at all good and not spicy, I normally order my Indian food Medium because I like to feel it a bit spicy on it. But this one didn't have any spicy, the shrimp was not that much and rice dint had any taste at all. 

 My friends had some food from the buffet that with the look, was better, but I cannot confirm or deny this because I didn't eat it.

I am so sad that I have to write a negative review on Salon L.  I came here for the first time several months ago, after moving to the area from Fishtown.  I saw Mandi.  She was wonderful.  She gave me a great haircut and I couldn't wait to come back.  I scheduled an appointment over a week in advance for 9/24 with Lauren because Mandi was not in on that Monday.  I rearranged my work schedule to accommodate this haircut.  I wanted something "new" so I explained to the receptionist what I needed done.  She was confident Lauren could do it.  I received a call at 11am on the date of the appointment that Lauren was sick and could not come in.  Things happen so I rescheduled for Friday 9/28 with Mandi.  Again, I rearranged my day to accommodate the appointment.  My appointment was at 10am.  I received a call at 9am on the date of the appointment that Mandi had a migraine and would not be coming in and that they couldn't accommodate me until 10/11!!!!!!!  WHAT?  2 weeks later.  I was willing to see someone who could do a good cut for my hair type and provided evening and day time availability.  I had explained to the receptionist what had happened with both appointments and she simply said - "Oh sorry, we just don't have anything." Needless to say, I was so excited when I thought I found a salon near my home that was quality and gorgeous.  Sadly, despite being unable to control something like an illness, this has left a very bad taste in my mouth and I cannot continue to rearrange my schedule to then have it disrupted.  I now have to find a new salon.

I've been dealing on and off with H&P for years and have had nothing but frustrating experiences.  It is impossible to reach anyone by phone, which makes scheduling problems challenging, they force you to keep a credit card on file and have overcharged me in the past.  The therapist I went to was sub par and the psychiatrists are just glorified drug dealers.  They spend 10 minutes with you, give you a script and you're out the door.  They are not at all flexible with financial difficulties and quick to drop clients.  I was very unhappy with the services I've received through them.  Totally inaccessible to anyone who isn't rich and mentally healthy.

Consistently dirty but close to where I volunteer so it's where me and my wife would come for a quick coffee. 

Then one day a very rude man stared down my wife (I wasn't there at the moment otherwise you'd be seeing a news story not a yelp review) and when she asked from across the room "do you need something?" He just nods his head and mumbles "uh huh".  No break of eye contact and no remorse. 

So as she gets up to leave he literally assaults her by grabbing her arm and she has to yank it away and ask him to quit touching her. 

When I heard about it I came back to see if the man was still there and he was not. 

Needless to say I'm just about fed up with these types of folk who frequent these establishments. 

I don't place all blame on Starbucks as how could they know this would happen but I do feel like there could be some better people management of who loiters there. 

After hearing about the new policies going into affect it makes me wonder if this won't get much much worse. 

And if I even tried to be specific or upset I'm sure I'd be labeled as the bad guy. So who knows. I guess just have to take "buyer beware" to consideration.

For above $300 per night it was bad. Kitchen smelled like bug repellent. Pull out sofa was extremely uncomfortable. We waited till 4pm to check in, even though we arrived at noon asked to accommodate if possible, check out was 11, small hotel, or MOTEL is a better word, could do better..old furniture, rugs, bathroom we ordered must have a tub, but had shower instead.  
They emailed me a survey, but with 2 star rating it wouldn't post!!

Have you ever seen so many one-star reviews! I've just added mine to the list. The service has been astonishingly mind-bogglingly awful. If I ever actually get my supplies (it's only been two months), I will immediately start looking for a replacement.

Bought a new home in Belleair Florida . Since the original owners used Pinch a penny, I continued to use them myself. I decided to switch to a salt system and had them install it. Since they usually come when im at work, I never saw how little they actually do. When I saw they continued to put choline in the pool basket, I called them and complained. my maid was present one day and told me they were probably working on the pool no less than 3 minuets before leaving. I decided to switch pool services who told me the pool scrubber needed to be replaced.When I decided to do it myself I noticed there was no vacuum . I went over to the pool filter, pulled the cover and saw it had never , ever been cleaned. Thousands of dollars spent and nobody ever cleaned the filter. Called Pinch a penny and they told me this was not part of maintenance and came under repairs. You pay these guys for maintenance , they neglect it till it needs to be repaired? Ill spend the money if Im getting something for it but this is redicoulous.

Well damn, I hope you're not in a rush. Saturday at 11 a.m. and there are TWO, read it, TWO cashiers open. I came back the following week and to no surprise, I was in the same situation. The thing that really got me was they opened a new register and instead of getting the person next in line, they pulled someone who was just walking up. Yup, that really grinds my gears. 

If you want Starbucks, you'll have to wait for that too. Guess how many baristas work there on a Saturday morning? ONE. Yep, just one. 

Saturday morning and you think the dollar spot bins were organized the night before? Nope. They weren't. 

The rest...

The rest of the store was as organized as any Target. There is a manager with white hair who was my hero one day (complicated return). And, hey, it's Target so I'll be back.

I had high hopes for this restaurant! I love Latin food. The service was very slow and the server was clearly not interested in being cordial, let alone friendly. The guacamole was not well mixed. The mango in my salad was not ripe, and the beans were clearly from a can. The drinks were too strong and therefore unpleasant. It wasn't even a busy night---we went on a Tuesday. I would not recommend this place.

Horrified. Staff was completely unprofessional, food wasn't anything great. People were smoking weed on the second level and it stunk even though it was outside. Ship is spacious and has incredible potential but my experience was gross. It was dirty, dusty and I felt uneasy the whole time. I thought a dinner cruise sounded amazing and I went the perfect time of the year. The captain was polite and greeted us as well as said goodbye for our departure. Besides that my experience was horrible. I will never ever ever ever ever go back until I hear the ships interior has been updated and the staff has some class.

The space is very cool. The night I was there, there was a funk band playing in the club downstairs, and it was a fun vibe. Upstairs, the huge screen playing classic music videos also set a retro feel that matched well with the classic 60's era building. 

The service was great. Very friendly, engaging, and helpful. I would give five stars for the space and the service staff.

Unfortunately, the food, on our visit, didn't live up to the promise. 

The biscuits and corn bread that came out first were one of the best parts of the meal. I heard from my table mates that the cocktails were also spot on. 

The appetizer were of marginal quality. Pickled shrimp were fine, but the first plate came out without the piri piri sauce, and the next plate did have it. Taste was good, but presentation inconsistent. 

The lamb meatballs were inedible in my opinion. To me, they were clearly underdone in the center, and the flavor was unpleasant.

The entrees suffered form the same inconsistency. The gumbo was inedible due to a pronounced burned flavor...it has been on a low burner too long between stirrings and had scorched.

The salmon was a good portion and cooked well but with mediocre flavor. The succotash it rested on was scant and no lima beans were to be found. 

The Blue Ribbon salads were topped with over fried plantain strips, measly portions of chicken, but otherwise not bad. Not great, but not bad.

The short ribs my table mate had were also lackluster. He said "It was basically pot roast". Not bad, not great. Consider the price tag of the entrees is significant.

So the kitchen was having a rough night when we were there. They were out of the vegetarian special and also the chicken breast. How does a restaurant run out of chicken breast?

Anyway, cool vibe, not very good food.

Been there a few times, even though I live in Tampa, it's been one of my favs...Today, well I can hardly believe what happened. Stopped by on a Saturday afternoon about 2....Told host we just wanted a drink and would like to sit outside. There were quite a few empty tables and even one that seated just two. He proceeded to tell me that we couldn't drink outside and the bar was full service. I had to remind him that we really didn't plan to eat and that I had drinks outside other times. He then proceeded to trip over his tongue-really! LOL if it wasn't so full of c - - - and back pedal while he told me he had been mistaken...no one had informed him of this BTW. We left-won't be back with all of the other proprietors downtown St. Pete.

After using the services of Crescent Smoke Shop on Tanque Verde for
