many months to purchase incense and lighters, I am advising that you, DO NOT SHOP THERE!  I had THREE defective lighters that I took back to them and they would not replace so I had to buy a new one each time.  The last one I took in leaked butane and the lighter itself caught on fire multiple times.  I tried to take it back a month ago and explained it was leaking as well as the other issues it had.  They would not refund nor exchange. They just said it had air in it.  So once again, a month later on Oct 24th I took the same lighter back and told them I would like an exchange as this had been the THIRD time I had received a defective lighter from them.  The owner proceed to call me a b---h, accuse me of ripping him off, taunted every remark I made, and told me to get out.  He then  followed me out of the store accusing me of using the lighter for crack and meth an told me I was a bad customer. I told him I would never shop at his store again, as well as tell everyone I knew not to shop at his store, and that this was the worse example of customer service I have ever saw. He continued to make remarks and as I was walking away from the store.  I called the police and the better business bureau as he accosted me verbally, slandered me, misrepresents and does not stand behind his products.  I am not a psychiatrist but I believe he is mentally unstable and most likely needs medication.  I am warning you, do not shop at this store.
When calling to make an appointment, there is an automated prompt to leave a voicemail. I've left 2 messages at different times of day and week. No response yet...

We used DE Moving & Storage to store house contents.  We used a COW and 2 storage bins.  When our storage containers were delivered, we had mice in our boxes along with mice nests, droppings and urine.   It was disgusting.

We had to toss a lot of clothing, linens and blankets.  We also had to catch a mouse running across our floor and dispose of 8 babies that were born in a beautifully painted bench.  Lastly, we had to wash tons of clothes and clean up furniture that had mice mess on it which is the last thing you want to do when you are unpacking and tired.

I called and spoke to Sandy.  She promised me a callback in 2 days.   Instead, i received a form letter in the mail that stated since I waived the insurance, DE Moving and Storage was not liable.

Sadly, we didn't receive an apology or a follow up call from DE Moving & Storage.  

I would not recommend using this mover.

Not terribly impressed after staying at the Marriott, TownePlace Suites, and JW (all 3 on Canal street waking distance from here). Would recommend any of those 3 over this place. 

Tiny tiny bathroom and odd room layout in general. 

Loud doors and hallway banging but since we face a wall with our window at least there isn't street noise. 

Location is perfect but heat index was 107° today so not doing much outdoors anyways.

I don't know what is going on here but this used to be my fav thrift store and lately things have changed so much I find myself walking in and straight back out. Prices on the "boutique" items are absolutely laughable they are so overpriced and it drives me crazy that they use permanent marker to write the price on them. If the tag is missing they write directly on the clothing. Maybe not a big deal to some but if I find a Lululemon piece that's in EUC I don't want permanent marker on it ANYWHERE. Not sure if they're under new management but things are just very disorganized there lately. The books up at the front now are all over the place and untidy. I rarely go here anymore either (same as VV in mayfield). Not paying $40 for brand name items that are often better off put in the garbage

I entered the store in a good mood, and walked out in fustrated state. I walked up to the cashier when I was finished shopping ,I was in a cordial mood and yet was `greeted`by the cashier (Sharon) without a hello nor eye contact , I had to hand her my Safeway card as she never asked for it & I had to hand her my money as she never stated the total . I never received a thank you as I left. 


Meanwhile a guy with glasses `Im assuming a manager, comes up behind in the customer aisle Im in with a hand dolly of sorts . He squeezes by me without even acknowledging me let alone showing any courtesy .He is preoccupied bantering with another cashier. Both he and the cashier and the manager are in a blatant discussion about the duration of her break that should`ve been discussed away from the customers .Very unprofessional stuff that should`ve been discussed away from customers. Between the cashier (Sharon ) and this manager , I felt as if I totally ignored and unappreciated as a customer and unless I hear an apology from store manager Brent Schlosser or am offered a discount on a potential return visit , I will take my business elsewhere.


   My only guess is that that Tanque Verde store is on its way to going out of business the way things were operation that evening

The wedding I went to there was great, with pretty much no thanks to the venue. The "light show" during dancing was awkward at best. The two men's room toilets had no door and no walls, respectively. One lady's room stall had a view into the kitchen. 

Most glaring, the in-house DJ was awful. Right after the first dance, he decided, without permission or even awareness from the newlyweds, to play some sort of elaborate military tribute. It colored the whole rest of the night, and not in a positive way. During the night, he just looked so upset to be there. At the end of the night, he chimed in to warn drivers away from a certain neighborhood in the area, claiming it was the "Ferguson of South County", a pretty clearly racist statement.

If you rent this space, make sure the bathrooms are fixed first, and definitely bring your own DJ.

I've given this place so many chances, but the times I leave unsatisfied outweigh the times I leave happy. Every time I get my drink it seems to be made incorrectly or stingy on the amount. I went a few days ago and ordered a grande Starbucks double shot on ice. Didn't pay attention when I left. Turns it out was less than half way full. The majority was foam. I realize this is the case with those drinks but it's hard when you pay for a grande and I got less than a tall. Thought I would try this place one more time this morning. Ordered a venti double shot on ice today. Same thing, too much foam and made incorrectly. The drink usually comes with classic syrup to sweeten it up. No classic syrup and barely any skim milk. I love the staff,very friendly, but drinks are awful quality. We all know Starbucks is pricey and when you pay that much for a drink and it's made wrong or has half the amount in it, it's frustrating. I did have a few sips of the drink below, but it did fit in to my grande Starbucks mug. First bad review I've given. DRIVE THRU IS AWFUL. At 5:30 in the morning I shouldn't wait 18 minutes
For a drink. Do not go here if you think you'll be in and out quickly. I could have ordered a dinner at restaurant and got my food quicker than I got my drink at the drive thru. And I was the second car in line.

Absolute nightmare to deal with - DO NOT USE!

Negative 5 stars. I was covered for 6 months while living abroad. I started to experience inexplicable back pain and contacted them to see if chiropractic visits could be submitted for reimbursement. They said yes and provided no other details. So I saw a chiropractor twice for $150, which resolved the problem, and submitted my claims by March 8, 2018. It is now June 28, 2018 and I had yet to hear a word from them despite sending follow up emails asking for confirmation that they'd received my claims. So I called just now and they said they were processed yesterday. YESTERDAY. They have no explanation of why it was processed months after submission and weeks after my coverage ran out. They are now saying I would have needed proof of a prescription for the chiropractor from a GP for them to reimburse. I WOULD HAVE LIKED TO KNOWN THAT WHEN I FIRST ASKED. It's far, far too late now to do anything about my claim but I wasted a ton of money on my coverage and sought out care I couldn't afford because they assured me I would be eligible for reimbursement. There is nowhere on the paperwork I have that states I needed a prescription prior to my consultation to be eligible for reimbursement. Could not be less pleased with how any of it was handled or the customer service. Zero communication, extremely late in processing claims, secret clauses that aren't made known to the customer until the claim is denied. Complete waste of money, effort, and time. NEVER USE IMG! DO NOT TRUST! Practically a scam.

My family likes to come here but lately this place just isn't up to par. The food is not worth it!!! My ribs were cooked to death and for baby backs they are not good. The fries taste like old fries thrown back in the hot oil and warmed and we all know how reheated fries taste! My grand daughter had the build your own burger and all she wanted was bacon bacon and bacon. Well it came with two slices of bacon. Yep that's it. The waiter did go get her more bacon. He also got her more fries that were supposed to get fresh but the came out in a minute and taste the same as the first batch. I guess we are finally done with this place!
Not all that great, it was hyped up more than necessary.  Food and service were ok, I wouldn't say good, just ok.

Wow, Surf Shacks really slipping. Have been there a few times over the years and it's just steadily got worse. Tried their taco Thursday and while the price was great, you do in fact get what you pay for. Ordered three tacos, and could only get through half of one. Meat not fully cooked, chicken not fully cooked, and fish looked as if it was fried in the same oil as onion rings. I should have sent it back but i was pressed for time and chalked it up to a cheap loss. Some times you just got to write it off. You can feel the slow march of steady decline. Maybe time for a refresh, reboot, and new idea for this location. Better yet, bring in a Rubios!

If I would give a zero stars I would, I went to the bar and got no service, I actually had to flag someone down and when I asked for water to drink the clueless bartender just stared at me like I was a ghost . when I finally did get service I told them my order to speed the process, and this was already 15-20 minutes in at least . I then after waiting what seemed another 30-40 I gave up cause I had little time to wait any longer .

The sad part ? It wasn't even busy . I saw plenty open tables . I'll take my money elsewhere if you're going to make me wait this long on a single order .

Been going their for years until the other day,gave me a toasted bagel with mold
Very disgusted

What happened here?! We've been eating at Jazmine weekly since it opened, but yesterday was as if we walked into the wrong restaurant. We were seated upfront, as usual, and then nothing happened...for 15 minutes. My husband finally got up to track anyone down who appeared to work there, then we waited again. The hostess finally came and tossed some waters on the table and we ordered drinks, and were promptly told they no longer have a bartender and only serve soft drinks, beer and wine, huh. When our number came up, we were finally allowed to order, all food from soup, appetizer and entrees came out within 30 seconds of one another. The food was still pretty good, but twice the veggies and half the meat, major money saving tactics have obviously put into practice here. What a shame. Now Jazmine has the feel of just another cheap Asian food restaurant.

Annnnnnnd, 3rd time was last night and I think I've given it plenty of chances. I literally didn't touch my food, still paid for it, and decided I would never come here again. My 16 year old (who is like Pac man and loves food) didn't touch her favorite food (tacos) either after the 1st bite. That's when I knew. The meat was dry, the tacos were hard as a rock, and the rice tasted boxed *think Chef Boyardee*. The queso started out sooooo good but we threw half of it away when we got to the entire bottom that was burnt onto the pan. Waitress was nice but when you see no one ate their meals...that should cue you, right? It's too bad bc this place has such potential!

Ok so I write review saying service is super slow. Year later I forgot about it and went again. We waited for 1.5 hours to get food. Lol
Thought about leaving a couple times but we thought will come soon, etc. I was wrong. 
Waitress were super nice but it was way too long wait. Also food is not bad. But I cannot wait that long to get food. If it's nice dining and course meal, I don't mind but it was ridiculous.

Impressed by the reviews, I stopped here for lunch about 1:00 pm on a Thursday.
The room was still full (lunch crowd) and very noisy. It seems recent restaurant/bar owners have not gotten the concept that patrons may like to communicate verbally rather than text.

I elected to sit at the bar. The service, initially, was quite prompt. Chips & Salsa arrived immediately. The bartender took my request for a specifically made Margarita. She made that quickly and to my request. However, she did not inquire as to what size I wanted or if "on the rocks" or "with salt". But I instructed her on that.

She quickly took my food order (burrito deluxe, flour tortilla with shredded
beef topped with lettuce, tomatoes sour cream and shredded cheese and served with rice and beans).

The food arrived VERY quickly and I ordered a second Margarita, specifying the size. Also arrived quickly.
Both the food and the Margaritas were exceptional.

Upon completion of my lunch, I moved the plate aside for clean up. I noticed that the other bar patrons' plates had not been cleared. Unusually, but do to the hour, I wasn't concerned.

I looked for the bartender, who was not to be found. There were 2 employees at the far end of the bar chatting, but seemed unconcerned with my needs. Completing my drink, I used the bath room and returned to my seat. Still no bartender.

I left what I considered sufficient payment in cash and walk out. No one seemed concerned. On my way out, I noticed who I thought was my bartender, sitting in a booth chatting with 2 other ladies. Really?!!

I would NOT patronize this restaurant again and certainly WILL NOT recommend it.

I come here everyday and today I realized that they endorse sexist behavior.  My coworker and I were standing in line while she was waiting for me to order when someone cut in front of us. All of a sudden the man behind us told us to "Move the fuck out of the way" I was a little surprised but responded "Excuse me? You could always say excuse me" the man then started to yell in my face commanding that I "don't talk back to him" and "Stay in a lady's place"  I let him know that my sex had nothing to do with his manners and moved out of the way to wait for my coworkers order. The man came and stood right next to us and continued to belittle us in front of the entire deli. I didn't intend to keep entertaining his ridiculous behavior but he couldn't seem to get over the fact that an "Excuse me" would have sufficed.  The owner, instead of asking what was happening started yelling "Spread love" and seemed to side with the man who had instigated this entire ordeal.  After I had the opportunity to explain what had happened the owner offered to buy me a meal which I respectfully declined.

Be kind to each other people don't act like misogynistic asshole simply because your mother never taught you to say "EXCUSE ME" 


Needless to say- I will not be returning to this deli.

Three Strikes... You're Out!
We had really been looking forward to an afternoon with our mother as it was to be a mother, daughter, daughter- granddaughter tea luncheon.
I came from CT, my mother from Maine and my sister and her daughter live here. My sister had been here twice before and although she had not had a stellar experience, she wanted all of us girls to do something special.
This was not to be.
When we walked into a lovely but empty dining room around lunch time, we were introduced to the delicious looking menu and lovely tea cups... and this is where we should have left.
Best part: A delicious cup of tea 
Worst Parts: Tea sandwiches that were all bread, no filling, bland soup, skimpy salad, tasteless dressing, strange tasting desserts and lack of "tea bread" that was supposed to be included, yet didn't make it to the table.
All of this could have been mostly overlooked if the service had been more accommodating and friendly.
From the get go, it felt uncomfortable. When we asked to take home our lemon curd, jam and clotted cream, we were told we could not because ( of a BS excuse that was not clear to us). Instead we would have preferred to make that judgement call. Finally, when I had slipped away to pay the bill, I wanted to be discreet about doing so and the staff could not, would not assist with my simple request. All I wanted to do was give her my card and sign it out of view of the dining room, however, this seemed to be much too much for the waitress.
I have never left a review before, today was mandatory.
Sadly Disappointed.

It takes 30-40 mins to get your food (NOT LUNCH HOURS) that should take tops 10min for a fast food place. There is  NO SUPERVISION for the staff and are allowed to run-a-monk. I am not the only one who complains about this location and these morons want more money for a job they can't even complete in a timely manner. Please do not feel the need apologize for my experience because this sloppy work ethic and lack accountability of the employees if a reflection of the company Taco Bell that it has become.

Since they have changed their menu I really haven't cared much for Chilis but I decided to try them again because it's close to where I live. After almost 10 minutes waiting for a server to acknowledge us and take our drink order we decided to leave. Once again, what has happened to customer service? I mean it's not that hard to acknowledge someone and just let them know you will be with them momentarily. Is that too much to ask for?

Decent selection of items but the people working there usually have an attitude. 
I hate being asked by 50 different people if I need help and them watching me because I have a COACH backpack purse. 
Sorry for disappointing but I don't have to steal shit.

Stupid design choices make the room uncomfortable.
Decor is dark, lighting is pinpoint, so hard to light the room- like to read.

The Shower controls are complicated to the point where the instructions are on the wall, there is a hole in the glass to reach in ( leaning over the toilet) to adjust the controls before getting in the shower- this same hole allows water all over the floor.

The tap/basin design sprays water onto you as it splashes up- the toilet roll holder is sharp & will spear your leg if you stand centered at the sink.

For cuteness painted on the wall in the entry is:

"DRIVERS TRAVELING
 FROM LOS ANGELES TO RENO ARE
 ACTUALLY DRIVING WEST"

Which is stupid and wrong.

Reno 119 81 West
LA 118 14 West


The valet/bellman combine get in the way of easy guest pickup and drop off by drivers whether friends, taxi or shared ride.

No interest in a return booking

My review may be biased by the occasion we were celebrating . The food, simple pasta traditionals ,were ok. It is the atmosphere that was  so oppressive ; it seemed joyless and perfunctory. It was a Saturday night, the place should have been crowded; it wasn't. Something is going there. Maybe it's hiring family.

Ordered lunch from here. Delivery was really fast, so good work by the driver. 
Everything else was pretty lacking. Got my cookie order wrong (ordered choc. chip, got oatmeal raisin). 
The tortellini was dry and hard in places, indicative of sitting in a steamer tray for too long. Portions were really quite stingy for twenty bucks' worth of food. Everything was pretty bland considering how much salt is in it. 
It's a chain restaurant, so my expectations were set accordingly. Even then, I give it a "D".

A Complete an Utter Shithole Avoid at All Cost. Honestly you can find a 4 Star Hotel at a Rate as Competitive as this Dump. First let me Stress the majority of these rooms have Showers Only. Next on the List was Stained Carpet in Room 630 as well as the Half Assed Vacuumed Carpet. Main Lobby was Pretty Dirty which says Alot about the Staff at this Establishment which are Worthless Complaining Cry Babies that didn't accommodate me with an Upgrade to a Bathtub which should be Mandatory in every Hotel Room. My Rate on Priceline was $240.00 a Night which is a Joke when you can go Stay at a Comfort Inn Suites or a Best Western for $125.00 a Night throughout the Country. 

Never Again Hyatt !!!

I was sitting here for 10 minutes before I ordered then after I ordered at least another 25 minutes. I would recommend every single employee that was on staff from 2330-0020 July 14th-15th be fired and sued for loss of revenue because they are the worst employees ever. I hope they act faster when their children ask for food because in reality if they responded in the speed they responded with in my experience their kids would starve and I would be forced to called child protective services on their children. I hope they're happy with their sad lives being the worst possible employees they could be.

Absolute worst car-buying experience EVER. Kirk Popwell and his manager don't know their left from their right because of how many lies they tell. I was heading to the airport to fly to the Tampa area to pick up the car, when all of a sudden Kirk remembers a very important detail without which I can't pick up the car. It was too late to fix before the flight.  Complete and total lack of respect for customers!  I lost the money for the flight and there wasn't so much as a sorry! AutoNation didn't even have the decency to respond to my many calls to tell them what happened. I also pointed out the 200+ mile discrepancy between the vehicle's advertised mileage and the actual mileage and they continued to advertise with the wrong mileage! FALSE ADVERTISING!!! Steer clear of this dealership!

I was so excited at first, very clean very nice. Well over 2 hours later and having to ask for the final coat on my dip and having to ask to pay I thought the nails looked pretty good. Then less then 11 hours a corner breaks off. Next day I lost another nail. I knew they were not dipped 2x and even said I was concerned. Concentrate on the job you are doing instead of trying to sell me your water filtration system.  Never had a problem with dip before

WOMEN BEWARE!! I've heard along the grapevine that this Retro re-hired an employee (personal trainer Dan Smith) who was fired from this same gym for sexual harassment of a fellow employee (who still works there) and also a paying client (who is still a client!) The management was apparently well aware of the situation and decided that the good of the business was more important than the good of the female clients and staff. Please seek gym membership elsewhere, especially if you're a woman looking for personal training. The allegations should have been taken more seriously and someone with that kind of history shouldn't have been rehired.

I'm writing this based on the professionalism.   The 2 men that worked on my mother's sink smell straight like an ashtray.  The whole house smelled like cigarette smoke by the time they were done.  One of the workers used the bathroom and left the toilet seat up.  Going out to your truck to get supplies shouldn't be used as a smoke break when you're on the clock.  My mom has cancer and doesn't need the 3rd hand smoke in her house.  The work they did was good, but please be considerate of your cigarette habit when you're at someone else's home.

Don't bother! 
It's not downtown. It's by the underpass where many homeless people live.  
I realize the newness of the hotel is an issue for some of the staff not knowing the hotel policies, but I'm sure the hotel does not condone lying and handing us off to the next person to disappoint us.  
It was not a good experience. Excuses for lying, excuses for not making up the room, excuses for poor service.  Excuses only go so far.
Small store for American  pickers few t shirts .overall keep watching the program and don't  waste your day going to nashville .

Well that just ruined my Sunday !! 
Managed should just tell employees to be nice and have a nice welcoming face even is 8pm at night 
And don't make an argument about why they should be serving food 30 minuets before they close ! I will never come back there

First of all the owner (Vivian) is lying on my grown daughter that paid for this.  She would never tell them to take my tool box that belongs to me back or keep it. That is a boldface lie.  So they stole it, yes I want it back.  I have two credible witnesses that was there the whole time (both nurses with masters degrees) which ended up helping them moved a lot of items in another vehicle.  Then you say you compensated and took money off.  We ended up paying $845 for this horrible experience.  That means you were going to charge us even more for your mess up, damages and delays. Now we find out my grandson's TV (Christmas Present)  is cracked.  I repeat, if I could give your unprofessional behavior and screw ups a lower rating, I would.  You don't have to lie about our experience, somewhere down the line, you will be rewarded for your lack of good service, (MARK MY WORDS)

If I could rate it a 0 on the customer service I received whole dining her I would!
Our "server/waitress" Tanesha service was TRASH! 
Advice: Eat before or after arriving here!

Service was good. Overall experience not so good loud not relaxing. My bill is $53.41 for three beers and a pizza with very little toppings on it. Had egg and mushrooms nearest maybe eight mushrooms on the whole pizza very stingy on the cheese to.Not impressed

DO NOT use this company, aka Integrity Appliance, which James the owner completely lacks in.  Worse.Service.Ever!  Most of the so-called reviews here are FAKE!   Check with your insurance company and make sure this man will NOT be servicing your major appliance!

I was hoping for great prime rib because of a recommendation from a friend but I was very disappointed.  The meat was a cheap cut, tough and I could barely cut through it with a steak knife, it was also overcooked. It had no flavor until I dipped it into the au jus which was great.  Not sure if it was an off night or they are cheaping out and buying low grade meat.  The service is excellent though.  For the price I expected better.  I will give them one more chance but I will be ordering something different.

Walked in on a Thursday and said it would be a 30-45 min wait. Waited for over an hour and we finally decided to leave. When we handed in our buzzer the gentleman at the counter said "we buzzed you multiple times but the buzzer is on silent". Mmmmmmmk. Cool. Meanwhile the games ate our quarters. Bad business.
Sushi that looks like plastic. Overpriced. Bad wine. Also very dirty bar. Had to ask to clean it off cause soy was everywhere.

Desserts are overly sweet and old. Most of the deserts taste store bought from Sam's or Costco. Customer service is just as bad as whatever they're serving. Slow service even when there's no one else in the cafe. Save your money and just buy cakes or dessert from Sam's or Rouses.
This place is DOA ... for so many reasons.  Go to a real tiki bar around the corner that deserves to survive  Tiki Tolteca

Place used to be good.  It's gone downhill over the last couple of years.  Which is a shame.  There are very few good Chinese restaurants around here.  The worst part however are their bathrooms.  I will never understand how an otherwise decent restaurant can think that a nasty bathroom is okay.  It is a poor reflection on them.  The plumbing has always been an issue but it really just needs a good makeover.

Tried a 3time with family daughter and myself got good food. However wife became ill and was diagnosed at the hospital for food poisoning. They put it in writing, I took report to chapote they read it and then I saw the manager throw the report in the trash.  That's my last visit, I sent a copy to county health they said that's one of several they received during last 30 days and it was on schedule to be rei-inspection this week.

We visited Ole Red for supper tonight. I really wanted to like it, but the menu didn't have a lot to choose from. The atmosphere was enjoyable, good music, and we had the sweetest server that was very attentive, that being said the food took longer than I would have expected as it was not very busy. I had the Nashville Hot Chicken and Biscuit with fries. The biscuits were nothing special and the chicken was not very hot (spicy) but it appeared to be made with dark meat and it seemed like every bite had one of those tendons in it that made it hard to eat, I couldn't even finish it. My daughter had the Redneck Nachos, they were just okay, not near enough toppings for the amount of chips they give you. Ole Red does not appear to be a traditional Honky Tonk so I would have expected more out of it as a Restaurant - more to choose from and better quality for the price. I probably will not return.

The coffee, tea and food are really good here. It is really a shame that I live right around the corner and never go because some of the men that work there are total assholes and make snotty comments.

It tastes as if these donuts are fried in the same oil as the savory foods. I could not escape the confusing distraction of black pepper on my palate, and even perhaps sage or poultry spice. If I wanted a basket of chicken fingers I wouldn't order a dozen glazed donuts, but there doesn't appear to be much difference between the two when you order at this Federal Donuts (a franchise). Admittedly, it has been years since my experience here, so the practices - even the management - could be completely different today. In case they're not, though, be sure to order a side of barbecue or honey mustard with your pastries.

Some cool stuff but boy are they unfriendly. Stopped in this morning for the first time and never mind a friendly hello, NONE of the several people working there could be bothered to make eye contact. We'll shop local at other places, thanks.

On a Saturday night, do NOT even put this place in your plan to eat here. They do not take reservations & I was told a 70-90 min wait at 4:20pm & at 6:50 was not seated after 3 attempts to even be seated with my party. Management is terrible & no one is accommodating no matter how long we waited. I am in absolute disgust with how we were treated.

I never wanted to give a 1 star review on this site (my family runs a small business and I know firsthand that they're not fun) but it feels wrong not to put in a word for folks considering giving this place a try. 

My partner made reservations for Passover dinner, calling ahead of time to make sure they could accommodate a vegetarian. Person on the phone says "sure, you can order the vegetarian options off the regular menu." We come in, tell the waitress that we had a reservation for two. She stares at us for a second and abruptly tells us "no", and there was a moment where we all stood around awkwardly, kind of taken aback by her attitude. She probably realizes this and quickly adds "oh but don't worry, I gotcha!" (Apparently our name was on the bottom of the list and a little faded? The whole tone of the exchange was surreal.) 

As we were seated, my partner wanted to doublecheck about her options as a vegetarian. Waitress tells her no, the person she spoke to on the phone was wrong, she can only get the vegetable platter, before heading off. At this point we're thinking maybe we should go somewhere else for Passover and hope for the best, at which point the waitress becomes suddenly extremely attentive, slapping down a bowl of pickles and matzo and asking for our drink orders. Neither of us are particularly confrontational, and we both hate wasting food, though I realize this is the point where we should've walked out and not looked back. It just seems kind of sleazy to try and corner/pressure people into staying at the first sign of reluctance, though ultimately it's on us for sticking around. 

The matzo ball soup was pretty good, but everything else was about dinner... disappointing, to put it mildly. (Especially the weirdly mushy short rib -- I was kicking myself for taking my chances on it.) I didn't bother with my leftovers. Partner got to pick at a plate of bland steamed vegetables while we stewed in regret. The cookies and baked goods they gave us at the end were technically the best part of the night, except for the part where my partner almost choked on a toothpick in her brownie. 

I've been going back and forth on writing about this experience for a few weeks now because like I said, I hate the idea of leaving 1-star reviews as a matter of principle, but this was a uniquely terrible experience. We both seriously regret giving the place a chance.

I totally agree with Edward D. My kids and I wanted to try this place since we love pizzas. Well first off, when we came in none of the staffs greeted us. We had to ask another customer if we are to seat ourselves. Then after sitting at the table for 10mins. A guy at the bar table signals for the brunette waitress to come to our table. She comes over, no apology, no smiles and unfriendly demeanor. After we've ordered, it took a long while before getting our pizza. Also we were presented with dirty plates. Again no apology from the waitress. When I went up to pay the bill. I presented the mobile coupon, the careless waitress redeemed both coupons! Exceeding our bill total. Since our experience was bad, I didn't want to return. I decided to used the other coupon that they've said they'll honor on my next visit. Well guess what! The young man who took my order for the pizza to go, said it'll just be a little bit for my order to be ready. So my kids and I sat down to wait. 15 mins later another person comes up and asked what was our order. Because the person before didn't put in the order correctly! At this point I was near tears from this horrible experience. No, we will never return!

If I could give no stars I would. Just visted this location for lunch. As soon as you walk in, the hostess wasn't that friendly. When asked if we could have a booth she begins to tell me they can't put highchairs at a booth. The way she said it was rude. Once seated our waitress, Destiny came over right away...she took 15mins to bring our drinks out..nothing difficult (tea, pepsi, lemonade) we also order wings as an appetizer. After finally bringing our drinks out the wings were still not out. We ordered our meals and after about 30 mins we got our meals and the wings came out at the same time! We ate, food ok. Wings were dry not enough sauce. Waitress never came to check on us. She disappeared and no where in sight for 20mins! Then She walked past us 4-5 times not once looking at us, asking if we needed anythung or how anything was. Never brought refills either. We cleaned up table and sat waiting and waiting..finally after 15 mins she comes and we ask for checks. We pay. She never told us to have a good day or thank you or anything she just put checks on table and walked away. Really??? HORRIBLE SERVICE!!! Not to mention when we were leaving the manager who was on duty was too busy setting up a display table to even ask us how anythimg was and did not even thank us for coming..never said a damn word! You mind as well thought we were invisible!!!

Nothing antique about this place. Looks like a bunch of stuff from your parents basement in the 70s. Kitschy and junky. Not all of it, but a lot. A glass with Stella Artois logo for sale. How is this anything antique? More like a messy flea market. Which is fine, maybe change the name though. As you enter, they request anyone with a backpack to hand it in, as stated on the door. Not a very welcoming impression and I think it would be sufficient to ask customers to carry it in the hand instead of on the back.
Overpriced and not worth the hype. The food is okay, but nothing I couldn't cook at home. I don't enjoy spending 15 dollars on a meal if I don't leave full and I'm not wowed by it.

My family and I arrived in the area earlier tonight for St Louis' 4th of July celebration. Decided on Trainwreck because it looked promising. The place barely had any customers in it but we had to wait a good 5 min for our drink order to be taken. It was a whole hour before we were served our entrees. My wife's order of St Louis Ribs full rack was ice cold. My Bison Gouda Bacon burger for $15 was also ice cold and medium rare, which was not how I ordered it. It was also very small, like a McD's burger. Not worth the $15. The whole dining was truly a Trainwreck.

Absolute worst Dunkin Donuts location I have ever been to. It's the only one remotely close that I pass on my way to work in the morning and every single time I stop here it is the worst customer service. No sense of urgency, 0 accountability, my iced carmel macchiato is incorrectly made 70% of the time. Horrific. The line is backed up majority of the time as the employees here are oblivious and incapable of providing service efficiently or orders correctly. Not to mention, the employee at the drive thru window has argued with me the last two times my drink hasn't been made properly. Spend less time arguing and more time doing your job. I would highly recommend you go elsewhere for your coffee & donut needs.

I have not been to this restaurant in years and I will never be back!  This place needs a serious deep cleaning and updating.  It is completely run down.  

The salsa lacks flavor and so do the margaritas.  There is absolutely nothing special about any of the food here.
Long lines every time I come in. Obviously have no idea how to schedule for peak times. I've abandoned my cart several times out of frustration.

Stopped in Thursday night with a friend for a beer and maybe a bite to eat. They had karaoke going on which is usually pleasant or way funny none the less entertaining. Unfortunately the vocal were so obnoxiously loud I couldn't hear my buddy who was sitting next to me at the bar without screaming or invading personal space. The bartender was pleasant and tentative to her customers at the bar. Greeted us pretty much as soon as we sat down. She had to lean over the  bar to take our order due to the people doing karaoke being so loud which made it hard to have a personable experience. I asked her why it was so loud she also complained and agreed with me about it being overwhelming. I assumed she would possibly speak with the host of the karaoke but nothing changed so we left after one beer with a headache and an empty stomach. Were planning on staying out awhile but I guess on the positive side i did save money the bar would most definitely had gotten with just very little effort.

Went here for dinner on a recommendation from staff member at our hotel, Bourbon Orleans (across street). We sat at the bar and had dinner, we were served by Elle (I believe?) 
We asked for two glasses of rose and she said do you want a bottle? I replied no we are looking for by the glass, and she said would you like a taste? Which I replied, yes please. We are given a taste, then she brings us the bottle (sigh).  We ordered the arugula salad and bbq shrimp and grits.  The salad must have sat in the window for 15 minutes.  Elle had disappeared for 15-20 minutes and all the staff was too busy watching the football game to bring the salad. We finally received our food, which tasted ok, the only good part of the meal.
At the end of our meal, Elle told us she had just come back from vacation and was very tired and not moving very fast today. It was strange, we will not be going back here.

Nothing against these post offices we walk into. My problem just occurred this way: 
I sent an overnight package (they can't guarantee anything else). $27 guarantees it gets there by 3 pm or my money back. It got there a day late. Went to get my money back. Online doesn't work. Called phone number. Long hassle. I go through it. Then, "wait for next available agent. Your wait time is between an hour 40 minutes & an hour 50 minutes!! This is at 10:15 on a typical Thursday. 
I have always been a big fan of the Post Office. But who can stay on hold that long. That's absurd. And I tried calling customer service but you can only respond to what they offer you to respond to.

Always understaffed.   I waited 17 min for a breakfast sandwich today.  One person serving everyone.   Just not cool how this place is miss managed.   Every mornin it's like this. Not enough people working for a quick in and out
The people are really nice, but the food was pretty bland. I wouldn't go back again. I ordered the pad kee maw and spring roles...traditional dishes,  yet epic fails

Super racist and the bartender, I'm pretty sure his name is mike  made a joke about roofies......very uncomfortable considering it's a bar. When the guy serving you drinks is talking about drugging  people??? What's going on here?  Comments were also made about a black girl being intelligent for her race. Not returning. Also older blonde woman waitress is an absolute cunt totally rude
Meeeeeeh, it was alright. My wife and I came for lunch... it was okay but definitely not a memorable eating experience.

The Man behind the counter made reservations for Us but forgot to mention they were at another KOA 30 miles away.
This KOA is on a busy Freeway
5 feet between Sites

Decided to give Bru Burger another shot.  Absolutely never coming back.  I've never had such a terrible evening.  The wait for a table is absolutely ridiculous, ended up having to hangout in the hallways of the building connecting because this place is so overcrowded.  They don't take reservations (which is ridiculous to start with and could ease up on the congestion) and their rules on half of your party being there BEFORE you put your name on the 2 hour long wait list is beyond the worst.

Food-cold and bland. Two people at our table ordered the same burger and both were sick within an hour after dinner.  Nobody else was sick.

Between the rude hostess, the wait, the food, and the experience I'm officially done.

Waited a very long time to be seated even though they said 20 minutes. Then after taking our order we waited another 45 minutes for our food. My $14.75 salad came with mostly a mound of lettuce! Terrible wait time and food not worth the cost!

Note: I visited very close to when the location first opened around Feb 2018. I hope that the place will have changed and its possible that they have improved. I hate to give them a low score just at the open but this is just what I think.

This review is for the center city location. I came in with high expectations but did not like the food at all. I got the tonkotsu ramen. Presentation was poor, and the ramen came in a plain white paper bowl kind of like an instant ramen bowl. There was no water - they gave a tiny water bottle and disposable utensils. The veggies did not look too crispy or fresh but quite limp and pale.

The broth was very thin and not silky. It was bland and not salty or savory enough. The pork was not cooked in a pot roast style but instead fired with a torch, which gave am unusual burnt and chewy texture rather than something soft and buttery like normal tonkotsu pork dishes. The noodles were no better. They were a little too chewy.

Overall the ingredients were poorly integrated and bland. Try nom nom ramen a few blocks away or terakawa for better ramen.

We had a very disappointing meal here  the hummus was flavorless and overly thick. The lemon soup was overpowered with lemon flavor. Gyro meat was dry, and the pita bread is not homemade. Finally the tabouleh was made of large pieces of tomato and cucumber. It was lazy preparation. Lastly, the meal is far from moderately priced.

I was so excited to have lunch here due to the rich history of the building, but honestly I was disappointed. My brisket sandwich was not hot and was dry. I had to drizzle hot sauce all on it just so that it'd have some flavor. The sweet potato fries weren't bad though. They were sweet and crunchy, but just needed to be be hotter. (My food had obviously been left out, just sitting there for too long after being cooked). But the worst part of the meal was the coleslaw. It was absolutely disgusting. I might've gone at a bad time and heard their breakfast is better. I will try again. Hopefully with a better experience.

I had an issue about a month ago and I thought that it was resolved by the sending of a hundred dollar DIGITAL gift card, note how it says DIGITAL. Somehow since I don't own a printer or a computer I am being made to go out of my way again to use this gift card that in this day and age I can use a scan bar for a coupon on my phone in a 711 but I can't use it for a repay for on of the worst experienced dinners at a so called fine restaurant I'm at my breaking point with this place and will go out of my way to not return there and use this gift card at the Sparks location. I would really recommend to anyone out there to avoid a bad experience and just enjoy the Sparks location as will I!

*Minor Update -- I filled out a survey from Landrys corporate expressing my concerns and have received ZERO response. 

The thing saving this review from the dreaded, but not often awarded, "1 star" was that the food was very good.  That being said...

We showed up on a Saturday night.  The place was more than half empty, but there was a wait due to short staffing...  Well, o.k.  We were lucky to be seated pretty quickly and ordered because we were hungry.  

We waited 90 minutes for our entrees.  The tables around us that were seated after us were all eating, or done eating.  When we finally got a manager--after about 70 minutes--he said he would check and then we never saw him again until the food came.  I'm assuming our order was lost and not actually put in until we inquired after more than an hour.  Some kind of update would have been nice rather than leaving us hanging.

This stuff happens.  I get it.  I didn't care for the manager's approach. He apologized for the delay and for our "short wait" while making a bunch of excuses about being busy and short staffed.  As we continued to stare at him blankly he offered to comp our dinner salads...  Which seemed like the very, very least he could do.  I mean really, the very least.  He actually called 90 minutes a "short wait" several times.  You can keep saying it -- but that doesn't make it true.  And it makes us feel like you are downplaying the problem rather than owning it.

I hate hearing excuses.  Especially when the problem is of your own making anyway.  Why can't a manager just admit that the service was unacceptable and not the way we intend to treat customers?  Maybe a decent discount or even some coupon for a free entrée if we come back (to get us to come back).  The whole reaction to a pretty big screw-up was -- "sorry about your short wait."  It's not enough to make me want to go back, even though the food was all very good.  Food is good in lots of places, you know?

Life is like a box of chocolates.  You never know what you are going to get.  But at a restaurant that's about $30-$50 per person, you do expect to actually get your dinner in a timely fashion.

***Review for Rooftop Bar Movie Night Only***

I am a NOLA local and saw they were playing The Ring at Catahoula Hotel Rooftop. My cousin is in town and, oddly enough, had never seen the movie so we decided to give it a try in spirit of Halloween. 

Let me preface by saying the rooftop bar was very inviting, atmosphere was great and it had a very cool laid back vibe. The bartender was extremely friendly, we ordered a refreshing bottle of white wine to enjoy with the movie. She also informed us they do movies up there every Wednesday, how cool! 

Something was wrong with the sound of the movie on the digital copy or the wiring of the speakers and the entire movie skipped and sound turned off intermittently. No one ever tried to come and fix it even though multiple people complained. I did hear the bartender say she had alerted her manager to the problem. We decided rather than be upset about it to sit any enjoy our $30 bottle of wine and laugh it up with a nearby couple watching the movie. I did however feel bad it was my cousins first time seeing the movie and she had to kind of just guess what was going on with the sound skipping and cutting in and out. 

The bartender had mentioned they were playing Hocus Pocus on Saturday. We were excited to possibly come back and enjoy that Halloween favorite but after that poor display of a movie night we will save the $30 and watch it at home on Netflix.

For an apartment community that is over 25 years old (maybe 30), it's a decent place. There are some downfalls when living here. For one, they failed to address the soundproofing between units when remodeling. The noises are intrusive and after countless times (months) of reporting the issue noise, the problem is not resolved. 
The trash and recycling areas are not ideal, not because the containers are too small but the recycling container needs more openings. Residents are just dumping right at the openings when there is much more room in the container which leads to overflow of trash and recycling out into the parking lot. Also some residents need overview of what is trash and what is recyclable. It would also be helpful to add two more trash and recycle areas in the corners of the community.
They need a better way to of ensuring the entrance codes will work. Sometimes after the third try, you cannot get in unless you use the key, but that's ok the residents keep unlocking the doors so anyone can walk in and out as they please. And people keep complaining that some items or packages get stolen...."I wonder why?"

The main reasons why I am leaving at the end of the year is because of the entrance doors are always unlocked which is a real security risk and the noise between units. You get no real peace with children running and yelling in the hallways and neighbors banging or slamming doors.

But if you want convenience, living here is ideal. Plenty of retail establishments in walking distance. Public transportation is ideal and you are close to major highways.

Absolute worst experience ever!!!! Service was horrible and food took forever. Even after waiting the food was incorrect. Management is aweful and not customer friendly. We will take our $$$ elsewhere!

I've been to this location 5 times, but only had my hair cut here once.  Every time I'd walk in I'm told "we don't have any more appointments for the day" though the app and website say there is a zero minute wait.  They're also pretty curt when telling me they don't have time to deal with a walk in.  Funny thing is there is usually just one person cutting and two or three others milling about with no one waiting. This SuperCuts doesn't seem to have good staffing or customer service skills.  Not once did they even try to schedule me on another day.  I finally went down the road to the Goodland Barber Shop.  It was PACKED yet I waited less than 15 minutes and they did an amazing job. I wont be back to this Supercuts in the future.

free guac my ass.... you have to order this online to take advantage of the free quac for avocado day..  whats the difference between ordering it online vs going to the damn store to get it.... what a joke.  Qdoba is better

Ekta has some really awesome food, however today is my first delivery experience with them and it has been absolutely terrible. Ordered for delivery 3 hours ago through their website and update: food still has yet to arrive. I called and the person answering the phone has been extremely short and rude and is not explaining the situation at all. I understand that it can be busy but waiting 3 hours for delivery is absurd and the attitude that I have received over the phone is disappointing. I do love this place but this experience right now has been very disheartening.

The fried wontons were falling apart, and the spicy shrimp  had about 10 -15 small shrimp and about a full quart of not spicy at all  red sugar sauce. Don't waste your money.  See the photo for how much trash is left after the  shrimp were fished out.

Yes. I am aware this is a low score, but I have to stay true to my opinion. That's what reviews are. 
I was overly excited for the opening of Gin. Everyone can agree the NOLA area needed a new Korean bbq spot. I told myself I would wait to give the business some time to get their feet off the ground and get things right before I would try it. I should have listened to myself. 
A party of 2, we got the Combo #2 for 4 people. We chose the Marinated Pork Belly, prime short rib, beef bulgogi, and the thin brisket. It came with two bowls of rice, a salad, and a plate of lettuce with zucchini on top. The sauce plate came out with soy bean paste, siracha, and whole garlic and jalapeños. There were only four banchan dishes and none of them wowed me. It was all too similar. The combo did not include tofu soup, but that's okay, they're still working on the menu. All of this for 49.99. Not bad. The meats that came out were good quality. The ones marinated were flavorful as well. 
We also ordered the dumplings. Standard, crispy, but the ponzu sauce was good! 

Now to the point of the low rating of 2 stars. The service! TERRIBLE....honestly, it ruined what could have been a great experience. The server only talked to us once : to ask what we wanted to drink and order. After that plates just kept coming and that was that. I was never asked if I needed something by our server, I had to eagerly look around to see if he'd pass back so I could ask him something. Another server caught me looking for my server and sweetly asked if I needed help. That was nice. but honestly overall, the service was horrendous. The grill had burnt and we had to wait for someone to change it out, eventually had to ask. I never got more napkins that i needed; kbbq can get messy. I asked for more lettuce - traditionally, most places give you a basket of lettuce. I got a measly two pieces. I like to make lettuce wraps with the kbbq, so I asked for lettuce. Wanna know how much that cost me? 1.99 every time!!!! I paid $6 FOR LETTUCE. Did my server ever notify me of the cost? NO. Does it say it in the menu? What kind of establishment charges for lettuce??? It's kbbq! I could totally understand if you charge for rice...but lettuce? Come on. Do better. 
If I based this on food alone, they'd get 4 stars. I've eaten kbbq in Atlanta, New York, and Dallas. I know not to hold Nola to that standard, but at least have good service. Good service can easily uplift any business.

I just received my first delivery from this Pizza Hut. Usually I get pizza from a local independent shop.  I was sucked in by a 50% off pizza deal. My order was delivered 40 minutes later than the time that I was first told. When the order finally arrived, I received a 12" pizza. I had ordered a large. I called the shop and the manager, Albert told me that I ordered a medium before I even told him my name and address. I had paid by credit card in advance. This was very disappointing as was the quality of the pizza. I asked him how many inches wide is a large box to see what size I got. He said that he didn't know. How could a manager not know something this basic? At that point, I realized that I was not going to get any satisfaction. I had waited really long and been overcharged. I won't make this mistake again. 

The only good thing was that the delivery man was really nice. I tipped him well because I figured he must get blamed a lot for the deficiencies of this establishment.

Fairly friendly staff. Pretty clean. However, food was underwhelming and overpriced. Truffle fries were just okay. The oil was probably due for a change, it gave the fries an off taste. Despite that, they were the better part of our meal. My husband said the chicken on his salad was dry and mediocre, he ate it, but didn't enjoy it. The crab and avocado on my salad were disappointing. They were tart and salty. I was expecting something more sweet and buttery. I don't know how you ruin crab and avocado. The only reason I might be tempted to return is to try their Bloody Mary Flight. Don't see that very often. I probably won't though.

Overrated. LaScala's Fire seems to be the new obsession of high school girls and middle-aged women, much like Panera.

Overpriced for acceptable food.

I'm a little bummed about my experience. While we had a great time because I was with great people, the service was incredibly slow. Yes, it was a Sunday morning and we were there for brunch, but it was unbearably slow. There was foil in the champagne poured by the server. She noticed it, audibly acknowledged it, and then just handed it to us without fixing the issue. She also took a bottle of champagne off the table that still had a full glass left. We had to chase down the lukewarm coffee regularly. The food was pretty good, but overall fairly mediocre. The draw here is their $17 bottles of champagne on Sunday. However, there are better deals with better food and service in the area.

I have been eating at this restaurant for years.  Each time I visit NOLA, I go there.  I always order the gumbo.  This weekend, the extremely rude host was the first issue.  We are met by the elderly host and asked for a table on the balcony, she said, "no", just simply "no".  Then I asked for a seat for two, she again said, "no".  I asked how long of a wait and she said, "no, I have two more reservations and I can not seat you, go to the bar if you want".  Wow.  Then we sat at the bar and ordered the gumbo.  What a disappointment.  The gumbo had no flavor and no seafood.  I always loved the gumbo there.  It was as if they ran out of gumbo and quickly whipped something up to serve.  I know that Memorial Weekend was very busy, but that is no excuse for the ignorant, rude host and serving horrible gumbo.  I truly hope this was just a one time thing.  I always recommended this restaurant to anyone that was going to NOLA.  What a disappointment.  I don't know if the host is an owner, but either way, they should not allow her to host anymore.  She is a bad first impression.

Went there shortly after it opened. Roof leaks caused us to be moved twice. Food took quite a while and then the order came out wrong. No accommodation or recompense was offered. Just not worth trying again.

After skimming the stellar reviews for this place, I wanted to try their food, and I was craving a banh mi, so I ordered a shrimp banh mi and shrimp summer rolls. I'm not exaggerating when I tell you this was the worst banh mi I've ever had. Like, it was a complete horror show.

First off, I was disgusted to find that, upon taking the first bite, the shrimps still had their shells and tails on. Yuck. The bread was soft and laden with mayonnaise and soy sauce, along with copious amounts of black pepper. The soy sauce was a huge problem and reduced the roll to a soggy mess. There were way too many pickled vegetables on there, too, which added even more wetness and overpowering flavor. I don't know how, but everything that could be wrong with this sandwich, was. Nothing was right about it.

This order came to me from UberEats, but let's be clear: all of the issues described were the establishment's fault. Naturally, UE refused my refund, despite the photographic evidence and strong case made for terrible food unfit for consumption. They "shared my concerns with the business," but that accomplished jack shit, as Pho Don never attempted to contact me to rectify the situation.

I will say that the shrimp summer rolls were fresh, tasty, and overall excellent, hence the upgrade from one star to two.

I'd be back to try some pho, albeit reluctantly, but I'm putting a personal ban on their banh mis for the rest of my natural life.

I paid $250 to rent the Still Works for a party in January.  I booked the event 3 months in advance, the event coordinator never responded to any of my calls and was never available when I visited.  I dealt directly with the manager.  The week before the event, a new events coordinator got in touch with me to introduce himself and finalize our arrangements.  We met and he assured me that he would be on hand an hour before the event so that he could assist with the setup.  He showed up just before our guest of honor arrived.  The room was so cold that our guests had to wear their winter coats during the party.  Eventually the bar tender turned the heat up.  The music from the bar was so loud that we had to shout to hear one another.  About an hour into our event, they started a tour of the distillery, which they never informed us would be occurring.  The tour guide was yelling so that he could be be heard over our party.  He moved the tour into our reserved area and start yelling even louder to sell tee shirts, all the while screaming over the guest of honor as she opened gifts.  This was a horrible venue, I suggest party hosts look to book elsewhere.

I've been here twice this week and both times disappointing for the high price we pay.  I purchased the wrong tickets the first time and it was a huge hassle for them to help me.  On a busy holiday night, there was only one person in ticket area.  She kept telling me she would help me when her line was gone.  It was never ending since she was the only one!  Then I asked to speak with manager and she said she was in the back office.  What?   Why wasn't he/she helping all these people!   Another employee kept raising up his hands saying he couldn't help anyone because he was currently off the clock.  

The second time we came there was only one person working concessions.  She was so slow.  The people started getting upset in the line because there was another employee at the soda machine turning them all off while there was a line of people who wanted their over priced drinks!   Then after I got to the machine, the thing was completely empty of everything but water!

Now we are waiting for our 10:50 movie to start and it's 11:05.  A customer is now going to desk to ask them to turn it on for us. 

Who is running this place?   Larry? Moe? Or Curly?

Movie coming on at 11:10pm.  15 minutes late with no explanation!

The worst hair salon experience i have ever had in my life!!! I had just moved to Nashville and was looking for a total change for my new city.  I wanted my long hair cut short, my color deepened and richer.  What I came out with was a total hack job!  My hair was so messed up I had to wait 5 months for my hair to grow out just so someone else could fix this butcher job!!! The color was so mat it looked like cardboard.  I called and said I want my money back and, it wasn't cheap that was for sure, and they wouldn't give it to me.  The salon thought it would be great to come back and have them fix it. I will never ever set foot in that salon. When I finally trusted another salon to fix my hair it took 9 hours.

SCAM ALERT! I normally would never give a one star review, but this situation is up scene. I went on a Saturday, which is five dollar euro pita day. While waiting for my order, I looked over my receipt amazed at how much I had just spent on 2 pitas and fries. That's when I noticed the discrepancy between the posted prices and what I paid. As you can see by my receipt I was barged a dollar extra per item, including the "$5 pita". 

I brought this up to the girl at the register and her response lacked any empathy. She said the owner just hadn't gotten around to changing the posted menu. SHAME on you, Little Greek. A simple sign, or Post-it notes with adjusted pricing would've easily sufficed. You're stealing from your customers! I will not be back.

update: the owner responded to my original post, sounds like part of this was employee error (or poor training) considering I just asked for a side of fries with the order. What he failed address is the fact that I was charged more for the lamb pita than the posted price. His employee was apparently aware of that disparity as she seemed unphased when I pointed it out. Sure this 50 cents isn't a substantial difference, but on principle I stand by my original post. The food is simply not good enough to get scammed.

Not authentic. The food was bland. The kung pao chicken tasted old. The walnut shrimp was all soggy. The fried rice had nothing in it. And was over cooked. Chow mein tasted like plain noodles with absolutely no flavor. I don't even think they were chow mein noodles lol. The only reason I ordered from here was due to delivery which was nice but 45 dollars later.. the food was so bad my boyfriend didn't even touch it. Wish I could get my money back..

The açaí bowls here are HORRIBLE. If you feel like having berry flavored molasses then go here. I don't think they even put real fruit in the smoothie part. Not only is the consistency bad, but it tastes terrible too. Also, getting in and out is a NIGHTMARE. So if you like waiting to pull out onto the street for hours then go here. I DO NOT recommend this restaurant. It is HORRIBLE

The worst Fairfield I've ever stayed in.   The place is WAY overdue for renovation.  Rooms smell and not well maintained.  Very noisy being right off I-75.  No insulation from noise.  Heard people in next room like they were sitting next to me.  Service at breakfast was terrible.

Message to owners :
Worst restaurant experience ever ! The owners or owners family had atleast 4 kids running all over the restaurant screaming their heads off continuously. You would think they would have controlled the situation considering they had customers , but nope they didn't do anything until I said I want the food to go and that's when they left . They never apologized or nothing so disrespectful! What a way to show new customers that you appreciate them ! The place is lame but the food is okay not bad at all. I suggest taking the food Togo, because the ambiance is depressing.

Horrible experience! Manager taking shots at the bar and making jokes about the other customers. Our server and the cook were the only two people working. The manager kept grabbing one of his coworkers that made me uncomfortable! When I asked our server if that was her manager she said yes, and then apologized for his behavior. What a joke! The food was decent, but they were out of chips and fries (i could understand this if we were there right before closing, but we weren't) everything is over priced and when you pay to have your burrito fried and it's not, doesn't make for a happy customer. Steer clear, better restaurants out there. Props to our server though!!

I left my dog for the 1st time in champs house last weekend for grooming. As part of Grooming, they supposed to cut nails and clean ears. But did not cut nails or clean ears. When i called the center for explanination on that, they said ofcourse we would have missed it. You can bring back the dog for free cut. I was not expecting that from them. I was going to Petsmart all the time, never had any issues. But this time i thought of trying for new place. I am not happy with grooming also. It is not even some places.

Entered the store today and was immediately pounced upon by a sales person. Told her I just need to look around a bit.  Continued to follow me through the store asking questions. Told her numerous times I just needed some space to look around. Sales person was relentless.  After ditching the first salesperson I got the same routine from another salesperson. Got so fed up I left without making a purchase.  Made me want to take my business elsewhere.

They have a great menu but sitting at our table for over 30 minutes without anyone acknowledging us (except for the hostess who seated us who did not even speak to us other then to motion for us to follow her) There was only about 15 people on the outside deck and countless waitresses and waiters walking by us and didn't even acknowledge us. Then I see the manager come out and he says something to the hostess who turned and looked directly to the table we were sitting at. So since all the tables around us were empty I thought we would then be taken care of. Nope. We sat there for over 30 minutes and finally I walked up to the hostess and I assume an assistant manager and I stated to them that I wanted to let them know I was leaving because I sat over at our table for over 30 minutes with out anyone trying to serve us or even saying I'll be with you in a minute. So I stated  I don't understand what the issue was because of all the waiters and waitresses that were all standing around the bar with nothing to do and the response I got was OK and nothing else. No apology no can I get my manager. OK is all I got for a response. Needless to say as much as I love the food there I will never eat at one of these establishments again

We ordered Dan Dan Crispy Tofu, Taiwanese Oyster Pancake, Scallion Pancake, Fried Chicken, and Shanghai Pork Soup Dumplings. Besides the dumplings tasting satisfactory, everything else was too oily and too salty for our taste. Our palates are all different. Not my cup of tea! We ended up here accidentally since my mom thought this was Another restaurant. We won't be returning to this restaurant again.

This restaurant is pretty bad honestly. I ordered the Chicken with Orange Peel and General Tso. I expected to receive chicken morsels covered in sauce, however I received actual chicken strips with some sauce on it. Pretty unfortunate honestly. 1/10 recommendation

My husband and I went through a short but intense cycling phase and didn't enjoy our experience at Soho. Firstly, they separated our bikes after they told us we'd be riding together. That didn't start our experience well at all. Then we went to the extremely small locker area with one flimsy bench for everyone cycling (i.e., dozens of people) to use. It was so cramped and obviously didn't smell pleasant with so many bodies crushed together changing shoes.

The classroom is large, but there are one or two load-bearing poles that make some bikes less desirable than others. The floor is so slippery with the cycling shoes on. I almost witnessed a pregnant woman slip and fall face-first. Thankfully, she caught herself on another bike. 

There were technical issues throughout the class, with music not playing for various reasons. The instructor had to go to the back several times, which killed the energy every time.

We had been to CycleBar a lot before trying Soho, so we naturally compared everything (as is the nature of Yelp) and concluded that Soho didn't have any positives over CycleBar, which has a large locker area with multiple restrooms, carpet throughout the studio to negate slipping, stadium seating in the studio (so you're not staring at someone's butt crack the whole time), snacks, cold and tepid water dispensers, zero technical malfunctions in the many times we've gone, much more parking, and the list goes on.

After the Soho class ended, we headed to the locker area and discovered children playing with tablets and toys on the one available bench. Again, we maneuvered through dozens of people to get our stuff together and return our shoes. Just not a comfortable experience. A staff member asked us how class went. When I said it had been "okay," he didn't inquire further, which indicated to me that nobody there really cares to improve the customer experience.

I'm giving two stars instead of one, because the instructor and workout were fine. It was a decent workout, and we left sweaty. It was the first and last time we'll go to Soho. I definitely recommend CycleBar instead.
Our waiter was lethargic, queso was cold. Entrees were decent but wasn't impressed.  Also, didn't expect to pay broadway beer prices thus far off of broadway.

I try to find the best in every restaurant, some are just harder that others. To be fair, I went to Margaritaville on a Saturday night, after 11:00 p.m.,  after a show. I felt like our waiter just gave up. Everything was so slow. I ordered the Cheeseburger in Paradise and apparently the chefs gave up too. Zero seasoning. Now, for the good part: the French fries. They were on point. Look, if you like watching drunk bridesmaids dance to mediocre 90's country songs, have at it. If you want decent food and service after 11:00 pm, you may want to try Waffle House.

Sad to say I won't be coming back. This is for the II hair salon on Washington Ave. I was told I'd need to bleach my hair twice for a color they couldn't seem to match with a Swatch when I showed them a picture (my hair is black and dye-naive). The guy, whose name I never got, told me he'd take more time to slowly bleach it...I expect some tingling during the bleaching process, but I saw red patches tinting my hair after the first bleach. Hair was washed, no conditioner used...then the second bleaching turned into a pure burn, to the point where when they added more bleach to cover spots, I felt the pain in my stomach and my whole body tingled (I normally have a decent pain tolerance). Feeling like I was about to pass out, they told me it was normal and to wait another 20 minutes...finally told them I couldn't take it and they washed it off, no conditioner for my hair. They didn't cut much hair off - even when I kept requesting it to be cut shorter. They added a grey color, which honestly looked better when it was in dye form, not finished product. They agreed to honor the coupon for 20 percent off, but somehow tacked a last-minute $20 for something, then asked for cash tip - the cash part I get, the random 20, not so much. 
I dislike the grey they told me would "look so good" so much I brush my hair to hide it. My scalp that night hurt so much I had to put lotion to soothe the burn! 
And they ruined the collar of the shirt I was wearing that day...so I spent 8 hours for a painful bleach, minimal hair cut, a ruined shirt, and mysterious pricing... I'd go for the main salon next time.

I was looking forward to eat at KFC after two years out of the country. If the server was friendly, the food was plain awful. Small pieces of chicken, dried up from too much cooking, mashed potatoes, dried up in the plate from sitting under heat, the corn was also dried up and plain awful.
To top it all off, the temperature was very cold in that place. They will never see me again.

I guess I'm just a glutton for punishment at this point.  I'm not going to write a detailed review here, just make some bullet points.

Food took over 40 minutes. (Probably about 5 tables have people)
My daughters food was room temperature.
My steak was well done when I ordered it as rare as possible.

We keep coming here because our kids like the food, they don't even want to come back now. 

Avoid this place at all costs.

I base my reviews on 3 things Cleanliness, Friendliness, and food. 

     The waitress took our order and I mentioned "I would like to "Try" the smoked bologna". It stated on the menu a "Try" is a 1.50 charge. This is so you would not have to waste money or food if you didn't like it. Unfortunately she brought the "Whole" appetizer. It didn't look a pealing, it was a thick slice of bologna with american cheese and BBQ sauce on-top served with crackers. We managed to eat one piece of it each. It was cold and did not taste of smoke. Underwhelming. 
     I wanted to go to the restroom to wash my hands and turned the light on the wall. It was very sticky and the bathroom was not very clean and opens into the dining room. 
     I returned to the table and the server came with our food. We ordered two, two meat dinners. The chicken was dry under seasoned, sausage had no flavor and was cool, ribs were warm but under seasoned, and the brisket was dry and had no flavor. The sides- the garlic potatoes did not taste anything like garlic potatoes they tasted of Margarine and temp was cool. The Cole slaw was good (Vinegar slaw) and the beans were Good. (Not to sweet). 

     I used to go here all the time for the BBQ, Brady and his mom worked hard as did the rest of the staff to see the place was clean and the food was fresh and hot. I am not sure who is working the place now. I have looked at all the reviews and there are a mixture of very bad and very good, so I am sure he and mom are still there some days. 

    
     The waitress was kind and accommodating, very nice person. Generally its the food and the staff which keep you coming back to a place. I wish my experience was a better on but, I appreciate how hard the waitress worked to make us happy. 

We paid our tab gladly and left a 20% tip on our purchase. I would never take my experience out on the people working there.

We waited over 90 minutes for the worst meal we've ever had. Steak was dry, cold and over cooked. Braised short rib hash was over cooked. Our son had the French toast that was soggy and under cooked. 

I've never seen an entire meal this botched before.

They were not willing to do a quote for a custom door! The only way they would even consider helping would be if I paid to have it installed as well as paid to have a steel frame removed from the concrete foundation and a new one installed. Way to upsell customers.

This will be my second time at this restaurant and both times we got stuck with the same rude waiter. The food is great, but this waiter is awful. He's obnoxious, was writing in his order note pad while we were tying to ask him questions about the menu (and he wasn't writing our order down), wouldn't check-in on our table, slammed down our margaritas at the end of the table, and was visibly annoyed by us being here. I will stress again that the food was good.

I will start by saying upgrade levels because the first level massage you can tell the therapists are new. When I scheduled I just asked for a massage and did not know there were levels. 

The massage was ok. Nothing special. I would of rather upgraded for a better massage. It felt she was afraid to use lotion and was all over the place with the massage. 

The voyage location is not good. Avoid this location.  The room is super hot. It seemed cooler outside in the 107 weather. Then I was offered warm water at the end. 

Disappointed for the price paid.

First of all, the hotel is great. Quiet, comfy & the rooms are nice. Pool is clean & the location is top notch. One of the night staff named Patrick is probably the nicest hotel desk workers I've ever met. Now the bad.... My family & I had a room for several days over the new year. (Not cheap) On our second morning we bought all our groceries ($80) & left them in the room while we went to Clearwater Beach for the day. I had bought groceries, mugs, plastic plates, silverware,toiletries, snacks, bread, coffee, milk etc. I put the cold stuff in the fridge. I removed the DND because I wanted the towels changed etc. When we returned in the evening our room had been made but they had completely reset it and removed all my stuff - every last thing, even the stuff in the fridge. I went straight to the desk & the young man ( not Patrick this time) told me that the housekeeper would not have done this and insisted I did not have groceries! He then said he would require my original receipt from the store (Publix)to prove it.
