Well, young man, I have my receipt right here in my hand but here's a little lesson: I won't and don't need to show you my receipt. You, Sir, need to speak to your housekeeper. Customer service is apparently absent at this hotel.

I was so excited when I heard that TGI Friday's was adding the Beyond Meat Burger to their menu! I love those burgers but they are still hard to find in a restaurant, never mind a restaurant with a bar (which I prefer since I normally dine alone). 

However I was incredibly disappointed to learn that they serve this burger oozing with animal products, including cow pus and who knows what else. I knew that it came with white cheddar but I naturally assumed that it would be vegan. Well it's not, and neither is the Friday's sauce that comes with it! I mean, really? Wtf!!!!!! What kind of ass hat thought it would be a good idea to smother a perfectly good vegan burger with disgusting animal products? If I had wanted that I could have ordered a dead animal sandwich!

Anyway I ordered it with no cheese or sauce. It came on a suspiciously unhealthy bun (whole wheat apparently is not "green-style" to these people). It was still a Beyond Burger so it still tasted good but I spent the time wondering if the bread was really edible. A close reading of the menu called the bun "buttery" and it certainly felt greasy enough to have butter. It literally ruined my burger. The only other bun is gluten free and I don't have celiac disease so I avoided that disaster at least.

I even checked their website but the nutritional information there is utterly useless. They don't list ingredients, they don't warn you which ingredients have animal products, and their entire nutrition web page is predicated on the assumption that you will only order each item exactly as it is described on the menu (which you would hopefully never do because most of their food is disgusting).

Meanwhile the Harvest Seasonal Grill in Newtown serves the Impossible Burger with vegan cheese and it's to die for. I gave up my night there to try something new and now I regret it.

Also their beer selection sucks. Hello? This is 1980, can we please have our beer list back?!?!? 

This is one chain that is well overdue to fade into obscurity. So disappointed.... I would definitely give zero stars if I could. They didn't earn a star.
I don't even know what I even ate there, left with my taste buds all confused. I honestly don't think I'd ever be back!

DONT EAT HERE!!!! We came on Jan 28th for breakfast and the owner/ manager was picking up toast off the floor as we walked in  and put it to his nose and smelled it and then put it on the plate and and went to go serve it. The host watched and allowed it too! I said "don't serve that! You just dropped it on the ground. "He then proceeded to serve the other bread and asked us "How many people?" I said I am not eating here! You dropped food on the floor in front of me and then tried to serve it!"

At early bird special, and the restaurant is no where near busy.  The manager is too busy socializing with his friends at a high top In the bar to realize that service is lacking.  So, if you enjoy slow service, mediocre food, higher prices, and a surly staff, then by all means go to Bonefish at Tyrone Mall.  My rare ahi tuna bowl came out well done and the plate was so hot neither my husband nor I could touch it.  His meal was ok, with the exception of the broccoli which had so much dirt  in it, it was inedible, however the staff thought it was comical.  We have never had this poor food or service at a Bonefish.  Blatant disregard for customer service.  And to think this is the "slow" season.  Snowbirds beware!

If only zero stars were an option... this location is slow & disorganized compared to others. I just gave them another chance and i got stuck in the drive thru...don't know what happened, but one car was at the window for 8 mins, it was 20 mins before i got to window and my orange freeze had been sitting there waiting for me because it was totally melted. Unfortunately i had already paid...because i handed it back and told them it was melted and they argued with me. They told me it was "fine" and they would drink it like that. I asked for the manager and they sent for another, but it was ridiculous up to that point. I'll skip this location from now on when I'm in this area!

Trying to get my battery replaced. I am given only one option for an appointment and it is next Tuesday? I'm not able to come in at that time and there are no other appointment choices. NONE. This is ridiculous. I'm having a hard time believing that the Genius Bar is booked solid for an entire week. Even if it is, I should be offered more than one choice.

Very few antiques. (Well, quite a few larger pieces marked NFS...not for sale.) Mostly branded merchandise like shirts and mugs representing the TV show. Basically a tourist trap. Disappointing. It really is a bad representation of the show.

Terrible service and terrible food! A friend and I visited this location tonight and I will not go again! The table was dirty. The waitress never asked us if we wanted refills on our drinks. The food took forever to come to the table. My salad was all lettuce, no chicken. My friend wasn't happy with her food. Her chicken tenders looked old and her mushrooms looked old. The manager brought our food to the table and my friend let him know that she wasn't happy with the presentation. He didn't try to fix the situation. He just said "you don't want it"? And left the table. I won't go back.

The rating would be higher if the staff can get it together. They are very unorganized. Almost every time we come here for takeout our order is always messed up. Today they forgot our 12 empanadas. We live close by so once my husband got home with our order and noticed, he called right away. They told him to come back down, he then had to wait 20 mins and was given attitude like it was his fault the woman messed up. She even asked for the receipt to prove he ordered empanadas in the first place. Sorry, but when the place is dead I don't think it's that difficult to remember a phone order. He happily showed her and it was only then she went to the kitchen to have the order started. Ridiculous, so now he has to wait for them to fix their  mistake, meanwhile the rest of the order at home is getting cold. They did not even apologize.

Poor service, overpriced,  uncomfortable waiting area. Cart of dirty dishes and wasted food passed by our table multiple times from the bussing service. Food was overly greasy and did not look appetizing but tasted good.  Server asked for order and then started talking to other staff instead of listening to response.

Very bad experience tonight.  Service was bad.  Never saw our server's face because she sat in a booth behind us to take our order.  Another server dropped a tray of drinks and used the f word serveralbtimes very loud across the restaurant.
Will not go back did rush job disappoint. Thus is the 2 salon went to that the girls just want to rush. So desoponted.

We came here for restaurant week and unfortunately I was not impressed with it at all. 

I love the ambiance of the place with the dim lighting and candles. Makes it great for date night. However, the space inside is a bit smaller and tables are pretty close together. 

The drinks are really good. I had the White Whiskey Lemonade which was strong and refreshing. I am not a Gin drinker but everyone else in my group loved the Market St. Wino and the Evil Genius was super strong for those looking for more of a punch. 

Moving along to the food. I was actually very disappointed. I ordered the crab bisque which was the favorite part of my meal, so I recommend that. The Cheesesteak Spring Rolls were a bit greasy and lacking flavor. The Calamari was horrible, the batter was not crispy at all. The ribeye which I ordered lacked flavor and was cooked a little more done than what I ordered for a medium steak. 

I left a little disappointed which was unfortunate. I would probably stop by for drinks again but I'm not sure about the food.

Coming from Union Station headed to NYC the bus is always always behind schedule. The bus drivers make multiple stops at times that aren't in the itinerary. If I take the bus at 3pm to NYC a 4hr ride how do I arrive at 30mins to 10pm . Everyone on the bus was annoyed this time around.

The service was excellent but the food was disappointing. My eggs were undercooked and the spinach quiche was hardly a quiche. It was layers of whole spinach leaves topped with gobs of melted cheese, barely any egg. The taste was straight cooked spinach and I had to return it after a single bite (something I hardly ever do!). Staff was very helpful however. We've eaten here before and loved it-was very surprised by this experience.

Please. Please. Please. Do Not Stay Here!!!!! Literally the worst experience I've ever had with a hotel. They charged my card 4 separate times!!!! 4!! All of the transactions were different amounts! When I called to talk to someone they claimed it was a deposit fee or a preauthoruzation fee which I didn't know anything about, and I was not informed about when booking or checking in! Not to mention the money has not been returned 5 days after the incident. Every time someone tries to fix it, they add on another charge! I've been charged $821 plus some change for a 2 night stay! 

The rooms are small. The showers are moldy and they smell. The pool is outside and even though the pool was supposed to close at 10, there were people in the pool until 12 am. Unfortunately, my room was right next to the pool and I couldn't sleep. 

Save your money and go some place else. I should've slept in my car.

STAY AWAY!!!
How on earth this place got 3 stars is totally beyond comprehension. On a whim (without checking Yelp reviews first) we stopped here on Saturday for lunch. Upon entering we were asked if we had a reservation (there was only one other group at a table), we said no and were asked to follow the hostess when we were ready and she moved on, I guess we were ready!
We were seated and waited and waited - no server. Eventually the hostess came back and asked for drinks, water was fine but unfortunately my wife asked for coffee. The water came and then the coffee. My wife added some cream from the personal jug. It curdled but she tasted the coffee - it wasn't just luke warm, it was stone cold!
Still no sign of our server. Eventually someone came back to refill the water upon which I mentioned the coffee was cold, telling me she'd get more, I told her not to bother. We eventually ordered through the hostess, Chicken & Waffles is apparently a piece of chicken and A waffle. My wife's Eggs Benedict sat under the warming lamp for some time, she measured 9 minutes, thanks to the open kitchen and there not being too many other customers. The potato side was drowned in salt and luke warm. My 'Remedy" I think it was called was OK except for the luke warm potato side. After this was served our server finally showed up and asked if everything was OK, at which point we just wanted to leave. After finishing what we could stomach and waiting and waiting and waiting for a modicum of attention I stood up to put my jacket on, hoping someone would see me and come over with the check - no luck. Our server was chatting in the bar area, I interrupted her for the check.
This place is absolutely pathetic, we observed the staff just hanging around chatting and laughing. Our server and a cook went out back to smoke and filled the inside with their leftovers.
Again, STAY AWAY, the myriad of food carts provide better food and service.

Never pay with a debit or credit card here!!! 3 times in a year my card has been used fraudulently after visiting this location. After the 1st 2 I narrowed it down to this place so after my new card on a totally new Acct arrived I ONLY used it here well I now have the proof as the card was just used elsewhere. Again I've ONLY used the card at this Taco Bell. Waiting at TPD now for them to take a report. I have all the documentation. Save yourself a headaches and NEVER PAY with a card here. Total thieves.

I think the food is great however the service was non existent.  I ordered my food 15 minutes before I got to the location, once I got to the location I waited another 30 minutes before my food arrived.  Not one simple apology for taking forever on the food when I ordered it to go. I watched someone walk in order there food and sit down and practically eat there meal while I waited. Oh did I mention that the place was empty. Yep they were not busy.

I ordered via GrubHub from this restaurant. I requested a special accommodation due to a food allergy. Instead of canceling or calling to inform me that they could not accommodate my request they made the order the normal way. When I called to let them know my order was incorrect they stated they could not make my order the way I requested so they made it the normal way otherwise they "couldn't have made me anything". $46 later they've charged me for food I can't eat. I called them at 8:43, they stated I should call GrubHub and that they would refund me through GrubHub. GrubHub called them at 8:46 and they refused to do anything because they were closed... they close at 9pm.

Just came back from brunch and unfortunately the experience was not great. For context, it is Mother's Day so it is one of the biggest brunch holidays of the year, but the overall experience could still have been better. 

When we arrived at our suggested arrival time (according to the No Wait app) there were still over 20 parties ahead of us. Trying to check in was chaotic, with the hosts simultaneously clearing tables, checking people in and trying to get food out to the tables. Over the 1.5 hour wait for a table, I observed that there did not seem to be any flow of service or well-oiled process. At least 2-3 tables were unoccupied at any given point despite the long wait, and it was not unusual that any any given moment the majority of tables did not have food on them. This was interesting to me since there seemed to be a large number of dishes waiting to be delivered to tables consistently throughout the waiting period/meal. When our party of three was finally seated at the bar, several of the dishes were already out of stock. The food was good, but nothing to write home about, especially at the price. The staff seemed stressed and all over the place. I would guess that it was understaffed for the volume, for which responsibility resides squarely on management's shoulders.

I've decided after this experience I will never come back for a Sunday brunch. If at all.

Worst service on the beach -totally ignored for 30 minutes -wait staff outnumbered customers and we had to call the restaurant number to finally get a waiter/ 45 minutes to get served -beautiful setting -obviously bad management
Don't use the valet parking service.   They're horrible!   See their page, as well.  They are disrespectful of our property and absolutely rude.  HORRIBLE.

Don't even think about eating here.  They messed up three of our orders (group of five).  Tripped and THREW on of our meals at us, staining clothing and the manager didn't seem to think it was a big deal.  When they delivered something we didn't order as a COURTESY they removed it from our bill.  We didn't order it!  

Walk away. Walk far

Thanks, but no, thanks, Lisa.  We're going to pass.  NOLA has so many great restaurants, we don't need to come back.

I was really wanted to like this since it was the first place we tried for crawfish,but wonk wonk, so disappointed. We ordered raw oysters, crawfish, bbq shrimp. The oysters were OK, the crawfish had a mix of small and medium sizes, but they were salty, the bbq shrimp was borderline inedible due to saltiness.

I went to this nail spa for the first time and didn't have a great experience. My nails did not look like I had a manicure done at all. There were bubbles in my nails, they didn't look the same color. they were so busy it's like they were trying to get you in and out.

Bold prediction: Pearl Diver won't last a year

...unless they make some swift adjustments. This island-themed, supposed retreat recently opened to much hype and anticipation. But based on my first visit and after reading other reviews, the post-launch buzz isn't looking good.

First, the location is a bit of a challenge. It's on Gallatin Road, about halfway between Five Points and Fox Club/Mickey's/Walden. It's sort of on its own. And parking is very limited.

Second, and certainly most memorably for me, the entry/waiting list/line (whatever it is) situation is just an absolutely confusing disaster of a poorly thought out procedure. We walked in to find a waiting room(?) with what appeared to be a line. We gathered that there was a bit of a wait to get in (which is not a foreign concept, so no beef there), but we didn't see a host stand or anyone who appeared to be managing entry. So, initially confusing. After a few minutes, we realized that the woman wearing the hip dark green romper was in charge of letting people in. After explaining that there was a bit of a wait because they want to make sure that everyone has a comfortable experience inside, she proceeded to let three people skip the line and enter because they were friends of the owner. So whatever make-believe, good-vibes policy they're touting was just killed for me right there. Eventually, three of us got inside and grabbed a big booth in the front room. 

Soon after, we noticed that two of our friends had arrived and were waiting in the waiting-for-the-sake-of-waiting line, and I walked up to let the host/bouncer/romper person know that the two guys we were joining us in our booth and asked if they could join us rather than having to wait and stare at us from the waiting room. As expected, the answer was no and that everyone has to wait until there's enough room inside -- even though the room wasn't that crowded and our friends were just going to be sitting down in the booth with us.

At this point, romper bouncer started to get a little mouthy and patronizing, to which I (*ahem* the customer) took exception. She explained that the policy wasn't pretentious and that it's designed to keep people happy. As an added bonus, she also explained that she's the least pretentious person because she lives in an airstream trailer (note: basically the most pretentious thing I've ever heard). After engaging in a bit of a back-and-forth, frustrated, I eventually walked back to the booth, and our friends were eventually allowed to join us. And I say it that way, because apparently as soon as I walked away from the door, bouncer romper told my friends that 1.) it'd be a bad idea for me to come back to the door again, and 2.) she'd still let them in despite my actions.

Alright. We're all inside, and eventually, we calm down after debriefing the door fiasco. I'll try to keep it brief from here on out, but I've got a lot of notes left. Besides, we're on island time and in no hurry. Maybe a list will help:

1. Two of the three drinks I tried were horrible and overpriced, also noting that they charge $10 for a michelada (yep, beer and spiced tomato juice).

2. It was 85 degrees out and humid AF having just rained, yet all the garage doors were open. The climate of this "oasis" was disgusting.

3. Two one-seater bathrooms are not enough for a place of this size. Additionally, the blue lights on one of the unisex bathroom doors and pink lights on the other are confusing. Perhaps this is intended to be a clever social experiment to see if men use the blue light door and women use the pink light door, but the restroom line would run more efficiently if both were clearly indicated as unisex rather than suggesting gender-specific rooms. Just another detail that wasn't well considered.

4. Two weeks in, and the paper menus were already falling apart, which just resonated with me as cheap.

5. One bartender took my order by standing about three feet behind the bar, arms folded behind his back with very erect posture, and then raising one finger to his ear to indicate that he was ready for my order. How arrogant!

The decor and lightning are beautiful, and I've been reading about what the owners are trying to pull off. But relaxed, island retreat is definitely not what I experienced. If they can be bothered to listen to their customers, my recommendations are:

1. Figure out your door situation -- what is your procedure and policy, and how are you going to clearly convey this to potential customers in a way that is straightforward to understand? This is the first impression. Keep it simple, and get it right.

2. Based on my experience and others', it's already time for an all-staff lineup about providing customer service. Set clear expectations, and cut the fat if your employees aren't getting it done. This is incredibly basic and fundamental to your industry. Arrogant, patronizing service won't cut it.

I'll take the host's advice and will skip coming back to the door.

Worst experience by far. We walked in on Mother's Day for lunch. Not a single person was dining in (makes sense now). The waitress had no knowledge of the menu and when asked a question became very frustrated. Later I asked if we can speak to someone that had the answers to my questions (menu isn't clear) and the waitress then went to go get someone else to assist us , few minutes later she came back and says "the owner is next door he said you can walk over and come ask him whatever questions you have" at that point we got up and left the restaurant. Extremely un professional and showed ignorance. Won't ever come back here. Save you're selves a trip and try the many other places that have some decency on how to treat their customers or just people in general.

The only reason I'm giving two stars is because the service wasn't terrible. The food here was honestly really bad. Eggs were all cooked wrong (even after we sent it back), my grits and sausage were cold not to mention how gritty and inedible they also were. We got all our food out separately (there were 5 of us). The last thing we received was silverware and an extremely over cooked burger. None of my food was good and it was probably the most unsatisfying meal I have had in a while. When I asked to speak to a manager I was told I had to walk upstairs and that he/she was in a meeting at 1:30 on a Sunday. I left hoping I'd never have to suffer through a meal like that again.

Good food, horrible service. We dined in on May 10 for dinner. The hostess was so rude. No kind of greeting at all, not even a smile. Just asked how many and showed us to a small table that had chairs on one side and a shared booth on the other. We were there for a special occasion and the restaurant was about 25% full.. was about 7:30ish, so we asked politely if we could have one of the many open booths. She rolled her eyes and said they were all reserved, and we can sit on the "booth side" of the table, which made no sense since only 2 people could fit on that side. I knew that could not be true given that it was a weeknight and almost 8pm so I pointed to one of the smaller booths and said even that one was reserved? Another eye roll, then she said "I mean...." like we were being difficult by asking and said "fine, whatever". Clearly had a lot of attitude and was just all around rude. Once we sat our server was friendly, food came out quickly and was tasty. After that we didn't see her much and no refills on water, took forever to order dessert and get the check. I never did get my water refilled. The family next to us had to get the manager because they were sitting down so long and hadn't even been greeted. The manager was nice and was able to help them, but that shouldn't have been necessary, that serve only had 3 tables, one bring ours and by that point she wasn't even stopping by. No complaints on the food, but not worth coming in for the rude hostess and slow service. So many other options in cool springs now.

Way better options here in SB. This joint is for tourists only. Food is not good and overpriced! I had a chicken salad  ick!!! The patio is an afterthought and you have to get on a wait list. Will not go back.

If you want to feel like Julia Roberts in Pretty Woman when she goes shopping on Rodeo Drive, then this is the place for you!  Yes...the interior is beautiful but the food was honestly just okay.  I've had the same level of food at my favorite 24 hour diner back home.  The waiters, managers, and hostess made my husband and I feel like our money wasn't good enough for them.  We paid $125 dollars to get treated like less than and eat mediocre food.  I would recommend saving your dollars (especially if it all looks like you're not rollin in the dough) and go somewhere with equally as tasty food for 1/4 of the price.  My husband went back the next day to complain about the service, and they gave him a business card with a number on it to call and offered no apology.  All I can say is, big mistake, big, HUGE!

Horrible Horrible!!! Don't do it! We ordered at 7:15, delivery not until 9:40... zero remorse or apology from staff/management other than we are a bit busy!! Food was cold, chicken was like rubber, meat sandwiches were cold, hard even a bit under cooked. Some fries were cold--- some soggy and some still frozen. No aus jus, salad was wilted and avocado was already dark.  Poor management, customer service. Nothing was offered for a possible second chance. We kept telling delivery driver it wasn't his fault but he didn't even say sorry, but agreed that our delivery time was over 1:30 late and had no remorse other than for us to sign the bill.  We are going tomorrow and disputing the charge. Will never order from here again!  We have been so happy with other local vendors! Will continue to support them- NOT Tazza!  Very unfortunate and horrible experience!

When you walk in you'll think it's a nice place with good decor and probably AT LEAST half decent food. At the front counter there is a basket full of plastic containers filled with fruit loops and Cheerios. So I took one. I got to my seat after waiting about 10 minutes and ate the Fruit loops and they were stale. Not a big deal I thought it's probably just some old cereal. I got my food, I ordered scrambled eggs, pork roll and sausage. The first round of pork roll was ok so I order more and it was bad. To burnt and way to greasy. I started to eat my sausage, finished them and ate the potatoes it came with. Half way through the potatoes, I found hair. I took it off my plate and on the floor. I FOUND ANOTHER PIECE OF HAIR. That's absurd. I shouldn't have to worry about hair in my food. It was a good place until I good my food. I highly doubt I will return to The Turning Point.

Food was really good. The service however was not great. We had gone in for dinner and drinks, maybe only 5 other people were in there. We got our drinks and it had been 30 minutes and the waitress had never came back over for a food order. We ended up going up to the bar to close out the tab and go get food elsewhere when the waitress said she would be right over for the food over. She did end up coming over after, the food was really good but the service was not friendly/warm or attentive. Probably would not be back unless sitting at the bar.

I went here today hoping to enjoy a half and half poboy. Any New Orleanian knows what that is, but for those who don't, it's a half shrimp and half oyster poboy. 

Let me start by saying this...

When you get dressed you put your clothes ON, not next to you, not in the other room!

Traditionally poboys are "DRESSED" with mayo, lettuce, tomato & pickles. The menu indicated that their poboys were "DRESSED" and I was expecting it would be. NO!!! According to the staff "some people don't like mayo so the kitchen doesn't put it." Then the sandwich comes out on non-traditional French bread and "DRESSED"??? Hardly..!! The lettuce, tomatoes & pickles were piled on the side of the sandwich which was half the size of the average poboy. 

TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED!!! 

Sticking to the neighborhood dives!

This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had, at 6:30 ever morning I got woken up by chair moving on the floor where they served breakfast. On the last night of my trip they started doing construction in the lobby directly below my room, I had to leave the room the noise was so loud when they were doing demo. I called the front desk and they said there was nothing they could do the construction was scheduled. Their rates did not reflect a discount for construction. You will do better at a motel 6, don't waste your money here.

Terrible location and staff. I used to work at chipotle and I can tell you for a fact many of the rules aren't being followed. 
The person on the line called me a b***h just for saying I wanted a little bit of beans. 
So unprofessional
Nothing more depressing then getting to your hotel, after a long day working in the heat and eating 20 chicken nuggets with no sauce. Even more irritating I PAID for extra. F this location.

Bad Chinese. Fried rice was not good. Mushy and pasty. 
Kung pao was okay but sauce was runny and thin. Hot and sour soup lacked flavor. Don't bother.

The restaurant is on a small street and you have to ring the doorbell to get in. The decor is really cool and cozy with dark lighting and rug-lined walls. Everything was great at first, the staff was nice and our first waiter explained everything we needed to know about the 7-course meal. After that moment, everything went downhill. 

I think our second waiter was new so he got our first course mixed up with the hand washing part. He didn't seem to really care that he made a mistake and was very nonchalant about it as well.

After we washed our hands, the first three courses were served together with stale pita bread. There was one delicious eggplant dish and two underwhelming salads, one being what tasted like boiled carrots and a simple cucumber and tomato with vinegar dressing. 

After the waiter took that away, he brought us a pastry looking pie that was over dusted with powdered sugar. The filling tasted vaguely like bland rubbery egg whites and maybe tofu? I don't know, it was all very confusing. 

When this plate was taken away, we waited a whole hour and a half before the next dish came out. During this time no one came to ask us if we needed anything. We had no water, no help, and definitely no explanation as to why we had to wait so long for the next course. 

When someone finally asked us if we needed water, to which we responded yes, it never actually came. That happened twice within the two hours we were there.

Finally, the chicken dish came out and it looked like an over boiled baby chicken with a lemon slice on top. I feel like it probably doesn't take an hour to make this under seasoned chicken so I'm not sure what happened there but we had to wait another half hour (2 hours total now) before we decided we could no longer wait for the rest of the meal. So we asked for everything else to-go and to get the check. At this time, the waiter finally explained to us that the oven was broken but it was too late. 

Of course the check took another 30 minutes to come. By the time we left I couldn't tell if I was more mad about waiting 2.5 hours for nothing or about paying $160 (with gratuity already having been included in the bill for you) for five people to wait 2.5 hours. 

I got home and tried the kabob. It was dry, over-cooked and super bland. All in all, I'm probably never going back. The food was not good and the service could've been so much better.

So they're drive through is drawn out by a idiot. You have to loop around the entire restaurant. But we decided to dine in. Upon walking in, it stunk. We turned back around and walked out. We're thinking do we really want to eat here? If the place stinks it's probably dirty and I don't want to catch a case of food poisoning. 

We went across the parking lot to White Castle, their place didn't stink when we walked in.

Horrible service, girl at register extremely rude.  Cheesesteak totally came out wrong, as to the way I asked for it.  Moreover, they forgot my fries. I had to go up and ask for them multiple times.  Non the less, I still payed $14 for all this. 

What a waste of time and money.  I will never go there again, and I DO NOT recommend this place!

Did takeout of Viet Bun and Prawn Mee soup.  Stressed no cucumbers please to the person taking the order and of course, it had cucumbers.  Couldn't eat it and had to throw away but definitely noticed that the meat looked like charcoal.  The Prawn Mee was so gross I had one spoonful and threw it away as well. It tasted like Miso soup that had gone bad.  Hawkers, you owe me 18.73 - ended up eating canned soup for dinner.

My neighbor recommended this place and finally my pregnancy cravings came in for some delicious chicken enchiladas. I'm sad to say this pregnant lady is so disappointed. The chicken does not taste fresh, it's really dry and had a really weird after taste, the enchiladas weren't rolled like enchiladas normally are, they were like chicken tacos with enchilada sauce, there wasn't even very much sauce on them at all. Rice and beans were decent. At this point, I'm forcing myself to eat my food because I did just pay $10 for it all. Tried a new place, and now I know.. I'll pass on coming back. I think I'll stick to my usual spot that has never disappointed; Nico's.

I want slices to succeed because its a local business but its the worst pizza in town and wveeyone else i've talked to agrees. Just go to franks or apollos or founded or golden crust pizza  They are also local and each so good in their own ways.

Yes, the Sonoran dog is good. 

The fries were soggy, the fondue was rather tasteless even with the chorizo. And everything came out at once instead of app then main course. We thought the salsa was all pretty bland too. Maybe the other location is better. ‍

Our waiter was friendly, but slow. Another table beside us waited for a very long time to even get anyone to come take their drink order.

OHMYGOODNESS!!! I have never been so dissappointed in a Sonic Restaurant ( or any other restaurant,for that matter) in my life! Placing the order was like pulling rotten teeth! Fragmented and painful! Bridgette was not only rude but completely uncaring. Our order came out wrong all around. No napkins, no condiments, no hellos or smiles! The drinks tasted spoiled! This Sonic was sooooo bad it makes me give all other Sonics a second guess. 
Exit 195 in Bellevue, TN. 
A big fat 0 stars-minus 5 stars!

I have purchased my 2nd new car from this dealership, the first experience was horrible under the ownership of someone other than the current owner but I thought I would give the current owner a chance as he is known by personal friends of mine...but the experience seems to be much the same. Yes, there is a woman in the service dept. parades around as the service manager who is extremely rude, condescending and purposely tries to upset you with her arrogance so she can go on a power trip and try withholding your car key they did not return after the service.

PLEASE BEWARE OF THE LIFETIME FREE OIL CHANGE PROGRAM being offered with new car purchases as this is only going to be honored IF you pay for all those major services regardless if they are already done by another company or simply are not necessary. I just found out today that because I get free tire rotation with FOUNTAIN TIRE (excellent company who stands behind their agreements without playing games) whom I purchased the tires from (in which they will inspect my brakes for wear and tear etc) I refused to pay the unnecessary $340 plus tax (service #3) fee that my free lifetime oil changes will NOT be honored!!! I asked if I was expected to read the pages of fine print to confirm the salesman wasn't lying about "no hidden catches" to this free oil change deal being offered - really it was built into the cost of the car but lets let them think they are doing us a real favor as stupid consumers!! - I was told "yes" so lesson learned today: West Edmonton Hyundai admitted the salespeople will lie to get the sale then will tell you that you should have read every word of the entire contract before buying the car to make sure the truth was being told! Lesson #2: this company is very unethical!

Worst place ever. I would say the old bait and switch deal going on here. Advertise it and they are out of stock right away. It took almost a week to get my order. It came frozen. The only thing that lived were some fiddler crabs. Everything else dead. Also When I did the count I couldnt even find more then four of the shrimp. They have the worst packaging ever and the poorest excuse of an insulated box I have ever seen. I want my order replaced or my money back. What ever the case. after doing some checking it looks like you burned one more customer. Worst place ever. Thanks for the frozen trash.

When these folks look at my dogs they don't see animals, they see dollars.  They are more interested in making a buck than they are in me or my pets.  Very judgemental, office staff is rude.  Boarded my dogs there and one got bit and the wound infected. They did take care of this for free but the first vet that looked at the dog did not prescribe any antibiotics and did nothing for the dog just sent her home with my daughter. the dog had been bitten on the paw and the puncture had gone all the way through the animals paw. It seems to me that any reasonable vet  would have prescribed antibiotics but no. the final straw for me though was when I found out that Yelp would not even allow these people to buy an advertisement on Yelp because their score was so low. Yelp cares more about me as a consumer than these people do and I have never given a dime to Yelp I have spent thousands of dollars at Mount Airy Animal Clinic

I just wanted to follow up on my original review.  I wanted to thank the owner for writing me back and being honest.  

My issue here isn't that you didn't want the furniture.   It's of course up to you to choose what you sell.  My issue was that being told you would take it I ended up wasting an entire Saturday morning to bring them over.  

After it was determined that you had said you would accept the furniture the right thing to do would of been to take it.  Instead I was told it was a waste of his time and to leave.

I have increased the rating since I respect that the company contacted me.

Um, never again. Came to visit a friend & decided to come to Applebees. Wasn't too hungry & decided to get my goto food when im not too hungry which is a house salad. Actually was enjoyed it till I saw a piece of black hair in my food. Now i have long red hair & the people i w/ dont have short black hair, so whos hair was it? Instill don't kno...

We were there for (hopefully) a  special birthday celebration. 
I had called ahead and made a reservation. 
We hoped to have a wonderful meal, but it wasn't going to happen.
After we were seated, the waiter (who seemed scattered) didn't come over to our table for ten minutes. 
When we ordered our drinks, he brought me a drink but not the beer sample  requested by my boyfriend. After another ten minutes the beer sample was brought. At that point, my boyfriend chose to order  a different beer. After  yet another ten minutes, the waiter returned to tell us that the second beer requested was not available.
Thus, after a 35-minute wait with only one drink served and no offer of food to be ordered, we left. 
It was a major disappointment.

I will never step foot in this place again. From the time we walked in, until 30 minuets later when we walked out(because of being ignored by staff when we wanted to ask a question) it was obvious that the management and employees here could not care less about their customers. When I notified a staff member about their lack of service, and the reason why we left the restaurant, no care was shown at all. No apology..nothing. Horrible people and I hope they read this. (Not like they would care) In particular I am referring to staff members working reception and taking names for tables. 

In a city with so many great restaurants , you are better off passing up this place. Total DUMP

After the experience I had today, I'll be taking my business to Crate and Barrel.  The store refused to exchange an item I purchased yesterday (for something more expensive) because the item ended in .99.  Considering half my home is from West Elm, I'm shocked at the poor customer experience and lack of understanding from the staff.  I won't be back and have complained to the corporate offices about the lack of consideration given my moderate request.  This is the same location that once told me they don't make full beds or bedding when I own a West Elm full bed and bedding.  Incompetent.

Absolutely horrible service. This was our worst experience in Nashville by far. The wait staff was terrible. Our drinks sat empty for over 40 minutes, we had to ask three different staff to ask him to stop by our table, and waited altogether over an hour and a half to get drinks, have our orders taken, get our food, drinks refilled. When food was brought out, they brought out wrong dishes, COLD food, and forgot an entire entree. When we asked to get things remade and brought out to us, the MANAGER, was horrendous. ("Sorry" was not said once)

"Our cheese just solidifies like that."

"Well I don't know what to tell you, we literally just made it sooo." 

"I guess we could remake that." 

"Here are those fries you were complaining about."

When checks were brought out, it was a MESS. Everyone's checks were wrong. Not a single check was correct, with food orders and drinks mismatched, charges incorrect, just a plethora of issues. 

Management here is horrible, the staff is rude and dismissive, the food was cold, undercooked and overpriced for what it was, and this was just a bad experience. This place REALLY put a damper on our last day in Nashville.

I had my worst experience shopping for a car. 
Sadly I don't remember the guy name. 
I'm looking for a new car. Being new to US I don't have all the paperwork with me and obviously I am not ready to buy before 2 weeks. 
Once he understood I was there for a primary contact (took 1 minute cause I told him upfront) he started to be rude and basically telling me to go...out...
I'm a long time customer in Europe but obviously it will not be the case in US. 
For new expats I have visited better places

Wow. We have problems with this location every time, but tonight was the last straw. Our pizza arrived lukewarm at best, and both pizzas were made with the same toppings instead of the two different pizzas we ordered. After a ten minute phone call, they finally said they would replace the pizza but we would be put at the back of the line and it would be another hour or so to arrive. We asked if we could come to the store and exchange the pizza and were told it would still be an hour to replace. We elected just for a refund as it was already after 7pm and we were hungry. In order to receive a refund, we were told we had to drive the pizza back ourselves. That's the last time we order from this location. It used to be a great store, but current management seems to have no concept of customer service.

Another big disappointment with this place!  Just had the worst pizza ever!  Ordered the highly over-priced "extra most bestest" pepp with stuffed crust.
First off, I called in the order and was told it would be 5 munutes.  When I arrived they told me the order didn't get placed, so I waited 15i munutes for my order to be done.
Once I got the pizza home I found it to have very little of everything except sauce, which it was flooded in!  The crust was stuffed, but it was so thin at the bottom that you couldn't puck it up without it tearing and making a big mess!
Honestly, I don't know why I keep coming back to Little Caesars. With as many people as they have working there, you would think they could get orders done right, and on time. It looks like a Chinese fire drill with everyone running around in circles but not getting anything done.

Edible Arrangements is a racket. After calling the unresponsive branches over two days, called corporate, who tell me they've opened a case and I need to wait 48hrs to hear from the branches (because apparently I ordered from one but it was fulfilled from another). After almost 48 hours I call back and can't get through to either branch again, and corporate tells me the branch tried to contact me (not true) and are waiting for me to contact them back. I call both branches back and get busy signals and literal 1990's shrill internet connection noises and never reach a person. I'm done with this company absolutely forever. Disputed the charge with my bank, have been reimbursed through them.

Very disappointed! We went there last night for Saturday Steak & Seafood dinner. I was looking forward to the bacon wrapped filet and grilled ribeye. Just to find out after paying $38 a person, they were all out!! Had to settle for prime rib, which they always have on menu. 

Went to salad bar, guy was huffing and puffing and slamming utensils down, like he didn't want to be making a salad. I only ordered from the salad list, no substitutions. 

On top of that they were out of strawberries, so no chocolate strawberries for dessert.  

We have gone several times before for Sunday brunch. Everyone in my group didn't feel satisfied with what we got for what we paid. I kept apologizing cause it was my choice. Never again!
so difficult to work with these people. sadly this is the only company whirpool partners with for high rise buildings in philadelphia.

Don't do it when you call the background is so noisy sounds like people fighting in background ordered wings and pizza took a hour and a half they sent wrong wings pizza looked like one cooked yesterday called Pizza Hut told us to bring it in and they will check it,told them the reason I selected delivery was because my car was in the shop she told me too bad and hung up.They forgot to include my soda and again they told me to come get it.Dominos is much better nearby!Don't waste your time with this location even Frozen pizza from the grocery is better than this location and the inside if you go in is filthy.
Terrible customer service and the automated washed left streaks. Also did not clean wheels properly. Won't be going back

Absolutely horrible, went in for a oil change and tire rotation. Went across the street for lunch, came back expecting my car to be done. The guy said they could not do tire rotation due to they couldn't get back wheels off. WTH I just put these tires on like 8 months ago. So I left disappointed went back to work, parked car.... When I came out to go home my car wouldn't start. The battery was dead due to them leaving a dome light on. Why they had my dome light on. Idk!

This is just bad quality chinese food. I don't know what it is but it just taste weird. The fried rice is a bit dry and the sesame chicken just had a weird taste. It was necessarily bad just different.

The review is based on the business hour. 

I came here and it was closed, even though it was not a holiday.

I tried a Jazzy bowl a few weeks ago and was not impressed. The ribs are great and the only thing I really liked. I did not like the sides I received because the collard greens were overcooked and the mac and cheese was extra salty.

We've given this place 4+ attempts to win us over and every time they let us down. Multiple times they've messed up our order, or under delivered on quality. Most recently we ordered for the NFC Championship game and they were very busy. Their staff was continuously apologizing for messed up orders on pickups while we waited for our food. We ordered wings and two sandwiches for pick up. Wings came out very slimey and disgusting, we threw most of them away. Chicken and regular cheesesteaks were very dry. We usually get extra cheese, but decided not to this time, wow what a mistake. They hardly put any cheese on either sandwich at all. Came out very dry and we ended up throwing half a cheese steak away because it was so disgusting. Extra cheese at Nick's is regular cheese anywhere else. 

Very disappointing here as other locations such as Clayton have always been great. We will never order from here again.

The Worker Bee gets a Worker F! "Rude" employee!  Walked in and walked out after being berated by the employee cleaning the table that we chose to sit at! Apparently customers aren't that important at this establishment!

I honestly cannot tell you what's worse how filthy and horrible the place smells of trash or how horrible and dishonest the staff are ?? 

Numerous times I have had ridiculous experiences from their not accepting their own coupons ( was accused of printing them myself!) to being accused credit card was stolen, to being overcharged for several items and being told that I had switched the prices ! 

Yes folks these people are truly the disease carrying bacteria that stick to your shoes when you walk into the most filthy of public urine and feces covered restroom floors!  You just want to bath in bleach and disinfectant when dealing with these sleazy dirt bags!

After 27 years of being a member I gave up my membership and will never ever rejoin!

Not going back, we ate there about 6 months ago it was OK, I had the overpriced Pork Chop it was just OK. Must say the ambient is very nice. Tonight we visited thinking we would enjoy a great meal. The service was GREAT but the food was just plain BAD. Sausage meat balls and spaghetti the menu made sound like it would almost being like eating in Italy. The spaghetti was over cooked and the meatballs tasted like they were BOILED and were VERY BLAND just crap. My wife had the steak and Brusselsprout..she won't complain but when she left almost an entire steak there and DID NOT want to any home I knew there was something wrong. This  place has BAD over priced nasty stuff coming out of the kitchen. Last visit for us. There are better places to eat at Wiregrass YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

My family of 6 came in and wanted to go bowling. There were over 15 available free lanes. They refused to let us have 2 lanes because we weren't a party of 7. They said if we would have called and reserved they could've given us two lanes, but they couldn't since we were in person. I could understand if they were really full or busy, but there was plenty of availability. There were six free lanes around the one we eventually bowled at. It was clean, but the decor was out of date and fairly worn. All of the shoes were somewhat "sticky" and my mom nearly fell. We were there at 5 pm and there was also no option to order food or drinks. Would not recommend. Poor service.

Not the best Panda Express I've been to.  The food wasn't very warm, which increases the risk for food poisoning.  You could tell it had been sitting for awhile.  A lot of young people running the place.  Very disorganized.  They didn't seem like they knew how to prioritize.

I walked in on Valentine's Day around 8PM, and it  was we pretty empty .  I was surprised that maybe 8 people in the back dining section and the hostess said it would be a quick service.  I ordered a salad and burger.  I waited over an hour to get my food.  I was so hungry.  Little did I know that it would take an hour and 45 minutes to eat here.  I would not return, especially if I was in a hurry.  I would have left after 30 minutes after ordering, but I didn't want to be rude.  Very disappointed!
Got the almond and it was okay.  Like the park place one better than this place. People were friendly and the place is super cute. Crappy parking

We used to eat there a lot but it had been several months since we had made it to town. We were so excited. Today we tried to eat there and everything was different. The catfish wasn't catfish anymore and it was squishy. The mushrooms weren't whole anymore, they were stems and pieces that tasted like chemicals.  The sesame chicken was squishy and tasteless and the orange chicken tasted anything but orange. Those were the only things that I liked there to begin with and now they taste weird and uncooked.  After 10 minutes we went to pay and leave and the manager or owner or whoever the guy was asked us what was different and when we told him, he said they never served catfish, they never served whole mushrooms and they have always had the same cook.  He laughed and made us pay the full price, even for the un-carbonated sodas. If you want to get treated poorly and leave hungry, eat here.
Very disappointing, had a hard time finding anything on menu that was interesting and my veal chop was chewy, tough & tasteless. My daughter's chicken was bland . Not worth the effort or money.

Just got off the "Paradise" 6 days 5 nights to Cozumel and Grand Cayman. Perfect weather! Crew very hospitable. Jamie, cruise director had great sense of humor. Ship a little dated. (19 years old)  Lots of red hues. Rooms comfortable but needed a shampoo on our,  what else, red rug and a thorough dust/wipe down on top of TV, on top of clothes closet etc. We breath that air for 5 days. No windows
in room. Not too much to ask.   
Food extremely disappointing. Breakfast good though. Boiled eggs were boiled. Bacon cooked. Not many choices for dinner (one assigned dining room) and a lot of recycling of menu items. When I see a short rib or a lamb shank on the menu,  I am expecting meat attached to a bone. Shrimp cocktail is micro size. Drink/ Alcohol plans are great if you are a lush and want to pay flat rate $60 per day, (including port days). Otherwise you pay as you go, ie  $12 for pre-made LI ice teas w tax/and 15% tip.  Entertainment was pedestrian at best, ie a "rock show" with no rock band. Nothing even close to off off broadway. The "theature" where you sit had virtually no seat backs, very uncomfortable....an invitation to leave.  Don't get internet package because $88 gets you a frustratingly bad wifi connection.  Why do you get  wifi included on Jet Blue at 35,000 feet and bad wifi from Carnival Cruise for $88 at sea level? Just asking. Oh yea, we lost all water on board for 3 hours in the middle of my shower. Not too confidence inspiring to have no water in the middle of the Gulf of Mexico.  Anyway, Carnival Paradise is been there done that.  Time to move on. It seems as if Carnival has stopped trying.

We had really bad service- We went on a rainy Tuesday where it looked like we were the only customers.  When we finally got some one to help us he kept getting interrupted by phone  calls.  We finally left after about  45 minuets and took our business elsewhere(Avalon)

I ordered a burger, fries, and quesadilla from Renzis on a Monday around noon. I waited about an hour for the delivery driver before I called back. Upon calling, I was informed the driver was here and I did not answer the door or my phone. I informed the lady on the phone that no one called and no one came by my house. They took down the right number & address this time. All in all, this place is always messing things up. I've been ordering here for a couple months because I do like the food, but it's just not worth the trouble. High prices & extremely bad service. Thanks but no thanks. No one took fault, no discount, and no customer loyalty. There just so many places that appreciate my business. I'll be going else where from now on.

I only tried hummous and pita, hummous was ok, pita: they gave me a lot of but they were prepackaged plain and a bit dry/old.

The pictures on the menu did not look that appetizing and service was a bit frigid and took awhile to get me the hummous to go.

This review is solely based on the king of prussia store experience. The products are great. Expensive but definitely worth the quality in my opinion. The store however is a nightmare. I went 12/30 and there was literally no stock of men's underwear. Unless you wanted a 4XL in bright red you were out of luck. Same story with the undershirts. I understand it was right after Christmas but there was almost a week after the holiday. It's unacceptable for a retail store to be in this situation. Especially when you're paying $25 for underwear and undershirt. On top of all of this, when I got home, the undershirt that was in the box was the wrong one. Shirt was a v neck and box said classic tee.

We moved an 1100 sqft house with a shop and it completely filled the big truck. It took 3 guys 6 hours. 

Two of the guys were fast and careful with items. One guy was slow and careless, often moving fragile things on his head or upside down. There were too many instances were I grabbed things off the truck with him standing there. Our dresser was badly damaged and other of our furniture arrived missing wheels or required parts.

We are still missing several items: screws to assemble our couch, a 5 ft tall floor lamp, and small pins to assemble our bed.

I've called Fox for weeks about our missing items and I always get the same run around. They collect my name and number and say they'll call back tomorrow. I've never talked to the same person twice, and as you might expect, never received a call back.

I'd love for Fox to get their customer service in order, but at this time I'm recommending people stay away from Fox Moving.

This restaurant is 100% VEGAN.   It's not called out in their descriptor.   The menu also uses the words "beef" and "chicken" and it's not -- it's beef and chicken alternatives.    I privately messaged the restaurant asking them to correctly describe their restaurant and was offered a refund.

Strange.

It might be good if you're a vegan.   The patron should know where they are going when choose a restaurant.

Yikes.

I've gone twice and will not go back. First time around wasn't good (not good food), but decided to give it another chance nearly a year later. Even worse. Our order was taken and didn't see the server again. After a half hour, we asked some other server what was going on, and she said she will go check on it. Never saw her again either. Another half hour we asked someone else and he said it would be a minute. Eventually brought our food out. Cold. We got our check and said we were not going to pay for the food we barely touched because it took an hour to get it. They took off the food on the bill, but didn't even apologize. Normally I would think a place would have the courtesy of removing even the beers as a "sorry for screwing you over", but they didn't even recognize they messed up. Also, the servers standing by the counter in the front had to use their phones to see. When you put on a little light in a dark room, you'll see shadows moving across the screen. And that we did.
At least I got to see the movie; I sat behind the handicapped section and because of the way it was set up, a handicapped viewer had no where to sit. (He was on crutches - hey ignorant employees, not every disability requires a wheelchair.) So I would especially not recommend this place if you have a disability.

These guys used to be on my five star list but the other day the guy purposely gave me the wrong items I don't appreciate that I called them up and complain and he still gave me a hard time and he knew what he did guys an asshole

They do get 1 star extra for the delicious salad and the melon martini but the rest of my meal was not great.

I got their infamous brandy burger and my husband the Cobb BLT. His sandwich was very yummy, I loved the addition of hard boiled eggs. My burger unfortunately was a mess. First off I ordered it medium, which should be pink inside, what I got was well done. At well done that delicious meat is no longer juicy it is dry and flavorless. Our server took forever to come check on us, and we were 1 of maybe 5 tables! When he finally came back I told him my burger was over cooked and he offered to make another, we had already waited so long at this point I was hesitant but he persisted and offered to box it up to go. 10 more minutes later we get our check and my burger to go and he "kindly" gave us $4 off our bill. So I get home and cut my burger and once more it's not cooked properly, very inconsistent sear on the meat- if a chef can't cook a burger properly we have a problem! Overall I might return for a salad but that burger was horrible, no flavor, no juicy-ness, the "brandy"sauce was non existent and the bun far to big and dry. I'll stick to The Parish where the chef knows how to properly cook and dress a burger.

The food is pretty gross. I ordered lasagne and it was really dry, cold and had a weird after taste. It looked like they pre made it days ago and just warmed it in a micro wave. The same goes for my other friends meals.

I purchased a used Nissan from tis dealership Spring 2017. My initial sales experience was generally positive and I declined to review the service area at that time. After going here for service and warranty work for the past 9 months I feel I can say with confidence that this is the worst Nissan Dealership for service in the STL area. They are sloppy in their work and generally not very trust worthy either due to a lack of dedication or cost savings. They have been promising a new building for the past year but I'm seeing much going on there and the service waiting area is a lot like a bus terminal waiting room. I could get into the particulars but I think its best to say that there are way better nissan service dealers close by. I do know the service staff has turned over in the past year so perhaps there is the possibility for improvement, but I have this one car I paid a lot for that I can not afford to have serviced poorly.

**Please note that I would have given 0 stars if I could have, and that this review is a reflection of the online system and store staff since I never got my food**

Really disappointed to write this review -- have heard so many great things about Tiffin and today was the day that I was finally going to try them out. The menu looked great and the prices were reasonable, as advertised on the website! What was not as advertised, however, was the ability to "online order and delivery". 

What's ironic is that the website provides a very nice order tracker. What's not nice is that I've been able to see that my meal has been ready for an hour and it's still not here. Does not really make the meal feel appetizing.

After speaking with the delivery person, who was admittedly very friendly and apologetic, I reached out to the store to understand how this could have happened, given I placed my order at 5:40 and we're now tracking 2 hours of waiting, I expected a reasonable understanding of my disappointment and was greeted with what started as friendly service and ended with her hanging up on me. Really not the right way to approach a hopeful repeat customer. I thought I had found my indian restaurant of choice here, and I see I will have to continue searching.
We try it for first time. The frappes were good but the service really poor. Wait an hour for 4 "empanadillas"

Kanella Grill and Kanella South used to be my two favorite restaurants in the city - so much so that we arranged to have our wedding reception at Kanella South through a brunch buyout of the entire restaurant, to be held in May 2018, after months of searching for the perfect space as we are not typical "wedding people."  We placed a deposit of $1,200 in October to reserve the date.  In January following the holidays we made reservations to eat dinner there and to get in the mood for the final lead up to the wedding.  I received a hasty voicemail only hours before our reservation stating that they couldn't honor our reservation because the restaurant is temporarily closed, and, as an aside, as they reopen we would be the first phone call they make regarding our buyout.  Naturally with the wedding only a few months away, we began to investigate alternatives and requested our deposit back.  That voicemail was the last I heard from them despite several emails and attempts to get my deposit back.  The space is up for rent - and still no communication or apology from Kanella.  It was only through filing a dispute with my credit card company that I finally received my deposit back.  They never even offered to transfer our buyout to their other location.  (That wouldn't have worked for our guest count, but they had an opportunity to try to keep their money.)  I have seen from Open Table that other guests have shown up for reservations that were made after the restaurant closed.  I firmly believe that had we not had the buyout arranged we would not have even received the aforementioned phone call.  Needless to say, we will never patronize Kanella again, and I would especially caution anyone considering doing a larger group event there (we've seen a number of rehearsal dinners and other special occasions).

Customer service is horrible after 1pm. The morning crew  keeps the place going, After 1pm it's like a zombie crew comes in and has no clue how to run the place. Sitting at the speaker of the drive thru for 20mins without getting your order is unacceptable. Get it together Dunkin!

If I could rate it 0 starts I would.  I made reservations for Sunday Brunch for 11am the time they open.  We arrived on time and the place looked closed and the door was locked.  About 2 minutes later  a man came and told us to wait and we would get in a couple of minutes.  After watching him on the phone for the next 10 minutes and not caring how long we waited we went across to the Vous and had a great brunch.  Very rude and disrespectful

This is the closest ShopRite from my home so I shop here by default only... the one front-end manager is a miserable woman. She is not only dismissive and rude to customers but she is extremely rude and nasty with the cashiers. My husband doesn't like to shop with me anymore because we had two awful interactions with this woman. He asked to speak to her manager the last time and he was no better... he actually defended her behavior and I am sure it wasn't followed up afterwards because her demeanor has not changed. Other than dealing with the front end, the rest of the staff is usually pleasant and willing to help out.

The sushi was pretty good but the service was atrocious. We were sat at the bar for what should have been 1 hour but turned into 3. We waited ages for our check even after asking for it. When we waved over an employee we were ignored. When we finally received our check it was wrong. They then took it back after us sitting there for more time and got it wrong again. The third time it was fairly wrong but at this point we just wanted to leave. Will not be coming back to the establishment. Over all the restaurant experience was terrible. A time waister for sure. We were late to our movie because of this. Lost my business.

Just stayed 3 nights here. 4 years ago left a review of how it was back then. Still same problems... dealers scolding the players...barking about using Cell phones at the tables....food was not great... service was good at check in but shocked at all the nickel and diming with room rate, tax, resort fee, resort tax etc.... rented a mobile scooter and the thing would only stay charged for 90 minutes! May not stay here again.

The Sail is a great example of a place that looks great and disappoints. The service is slow and unsteady. The food is unusually poor. The servers appear to be uninterested in their jobs. I have been to the Sail 20 times. I was at the Sail on August 8, 2018 at about 7 pm and the service was slow slow slow. One of the male employees was serially groping the waitresses and this delayed their service somewhat. Are there any managers at the Sail? I have no idea.

This place needs to be bought, destroyed and rebuilt.

This place was fine but wow the customer service? I booked on Expedia and wanted a room with 2 beds for me and my mom. And we get there and we open the door to the room and there was ONE bed. So I go down to the front desk to complain and they're like "sorry but when you book on those sites, you get what you get," and then proceeded to tell me that basically if you want a GOOD room that meets your needs, you have to book through them. So I went like 2 days kicking myself and wishing I wouldn't have used Expedia UNTIL...a wedding party showed up and a million people were spending the night plus we went to the nearby Cheesecake Factory and that waitress confirmed our suspicions-they overbooked. And instead of fucking over the wedding guests, they fucked US over. And instead of giving me a night for free or something, they brought a COT up to our room. My mom tried it out but said it was too uncomfortable so we had to SHARE. THE BED. Thankfully the bed was a king so it wasn't too uncomfortable to share but it was just ridiculous. What kind of customer service is that? They should've put on Expedia that they were full (like they had done a previous weekend I tried to book and found they were full) and they DEFINITELY should've given me a free night or free nights for a next visit or just SOMETHING. And they did nothing. The one woman at the front desk gave me lowkey attitude about it too. All the other staff other than that one woman was very nice, I will say that. I think if I wanna come back and stay in that area I'll book at the next door hotel, the Hyatt House though because I'm not taking the chance that I'm not gonna have my room accommodations met again

The staff is SO RUDE with anyone that comes in. You could be dying an the girl at the front desk will still give you attitude instead of her helping you and welcome you with a nice greeting.. no she will tell you everything with attitude and a face like she is smelling dirty dipper. Then it takes them forever to walk you in and then the nurses inside are not very nice either. I would not recommend this place at all I've been to the mes center on upper state
Street and that one is million times better. Don't waste your time with this people.

We called the cab at 6pm, by 7:45 it had still not arrived. Would NOT recommend this cab company to anyone. They are are unreliable and awful. Luckily a lyft picked us up but we would've been stranded in the Bayou if not for them.

I would give ZERO stars. Horrible Customer Service. Agents will gladly book a shipment then forget about it. It took a month to get my motor shipped. I should have driven it there myself and saved both time and money! Also you will get Billed Extra after it arrives! Horrible Company and you are not saving money...it is much cheaper to call Roadrunner, Saia, or R&L  yourself for a rate. Lesson learned the hard way!
Just walk out and don't bother. The staff was rude and literally told us "read the sign". We dont know what the food tastes like because the Jerky staff literally left a bad taste in our mouths.

My worst dining experience in more than 10 years. My Open Table reservation said I needed to eat dairy free. I asked the waitress to confirm with the chef that what I was ordering was dairy free. She said it was no problem. When they brought out my food, it had mashed potatoes and a butter sauce. The waitress said oh, okay, I will bring you the menu so you can order something else. The manager came over to the table and proceeded to loudly berate me for raising my voice. He said they can't get every order right, and these things happen and I shouldn't be so upset. He then went on to say that he would not let me speak unless I lowered my voice. The noise level in the restaurant was so high that I had to raise my voice to be heard. He then continued talking, and talked over me when I tried to speak. He kept yelling at me to calm down (even though I wasn't saying anything because he wouldn't let me). He eventually brought me a different meal (grilled chicken and steamed broccoli) and they charged us full price for it.

This restaurant made my birthday celebration a disaster. The manager was so rude to me my friends couldn't believe it. The noise level was exorbitant, the spaces so narrow you had to ask people to move so you could get down the steps to the bathroom. The waitress eventually came over and apologized, claiming it was a miscommunication between her and the chef.

Do not go here unless you like rude service and people who obviously do not and cannot listen to a word you are saying. They only have about six tables, but that was obviously too many for them.

To begin with, came at 5:45, dinner time and there was one waitress/bartender. One person to run both?? Service was terrible due to poor management of scheduling obviously. We ordered water never got it, we order a second round of drinks never got it. Are food was all cold. Appetizers and main courses cold. The worst part, THERE WAS HAIR IN THE MAC AND CHEESE. The sangria was gross. This has been my worst yelp review but I highly suggest avoiding this place. I've lived in New Orleans and Slidell. They missed the mark by far.

Aside from parking challenges facility was ok. But when my wife cancelled, they told her my membership was cancelled and i didn't find out until a trainer telemarketed me, then did not get response from manager for a week; deceptive practices, unresponsive management.

Came all the way from nyc to eat some pho and was quite disappointed. The pho broth was very bland and the summer roll was just ok. Nothing special. The only good thing is that it was well air conditioned on this hot day

We've never dined in here, only carry out and delivery so I can't speak for their service skills. However we've had dinner from here 3 times and each time it wasn't anything flavorful that I would brag about. We didn't complain because each of those times we paid with food vouchers they kindly provided to my job around Christmas time.   I figured it was petty to complain about free food.    

We tried them again some months later and got break fast deliver thru Postmates. It was DELICIOUS! We were so satisfied!!! So we thought maybe they are better with breakfast , another few weeks pass and we decided we're going to order the exact same thing because it was so delicious last time.  This time we were less than pleased . I was upset honestly.    I ordered hash browns with my eggs SUNNY SIDE UP.   The whole purpose is to mix the egg yolk with my hash browns... but when I got my food my yolk was cooked all the way through.  I had to sit my eggs to the side because I can't eat it cooked like that.   I asked to have onion and chz added to my hashbrowns.. they upcharged me 5$ dollars for ONION & CHZ. Which ended up being a big mistake anyways. They gave me damn near a whole onion! Disgusting ! It ruined what was left of my meal.   And the cheese the did add they didn't even put on the hash browns , they put them on the side of the box so I had a bunch of melted cheese stuck on aluminum foil. So I had to pick out 75% of the whole onion they cut and added, and if I wanted to eat any of the cheese I paid 5$ for then I'd have to eat foil shreds as well.  


Very very displeased.    Out of 5 or 6 meals from this joint I only loved one of them.

Not a bad gym as far as being kept up..Maybe 2 personal trainers there that look like they fit the description no offense just call it how i see it..My major issue is i like 2 work out at night and it seems like kids run the place at night,It feels like the parents left the kids home alone when u walk up 2 the front desk there are kids huddled around making protein shakes for each other socializing I may have waited a minute just waiting on someone 2 acknowledge and scan me in,Not professional at all..Day time is crowded unless it is around 2-3 it is hard 2 find a happy medium thinking about finding another gym around town...

Disappointing. Service is non-existent. Made to feel like an inconvenience. Dirty wine glasses. Just all around a pretty terrible experience. Food was good but with this lack of care for its patrons, the food doesn't matter.

I recently ordered delivery from this location. My order came to $40 and change and I left a $6 tip. Upon checking my account, I discovered that a $10 tip had been applied. When I called and explained that while I normally wouldn't complain about $4, I needed it to not overdraft my account, the man I spoke with offered to give me a full refund. He said that I would have to come in the next day to collect it. The woman I spoke with the next day made me feel horrible. She said that the man I spoke with the previous night now had to pay for my pizza out of his pocket, and that I should've just came in and asked for my $4. I never asked for a refund, I was offered one. I was also told that it would take 5 days for the money to be refunded to my account. It's been 9 days and I still haven't received it. Like everyone else, I work hard for my money and things are tight. I decided to treat my family with what little I had, and if I decide to do it again, I won't be doing it here.

Cool ambiance and excellent food. And that's where my compliments end, sadly. It took a very long time to out to put our order in and then for the food to arrive. I'm a typically patient person, but this was pushing it. Mine was basic, two eggs and a biscuit. Got it wrong, so had to wait longer. Also, another order from our table was delayed because it was forgotten/wrong.
After the meal, the checks were wrong and just a frustrating experience. And another ling wait. Happily, we are a patient group, but this was ridiculous. 
Typically, a discount of sone kind would be offered. None. 
Again, the infrastructure not functioning ruined our Sunday brunch experience. 
Hopefully,  it's just today for them. However,  we are Nashville guests,  so they won't have the opportunity to redeem themselves.

Horrible company! They came to fix my dishwasher through my warranty company. It worked for about a month then broke again. They came again and I was told a part had to be ordered. It took over three months of follow ups to just to find out the part wasn't made any more. Luckily, I was able to get a new dishwasher through my warranty company.
My refrigerator went out. The same company was assigned to come out to repair it. The repair man came and "fixed" it. However, the temperature in the fridge and the freezer kept fluctuating. I called the warranty company and they sent them back out. The repair man told me the door wasn't closed all the way. Huh?? An annoying alarm goes off anytime the door is ajar! Temperature still fluctuating after that "repair" and then it finally goes again. So I'm forced to toss all the food in the fridge AGAIN. I called the warranty company again and they assigned this company again. I kindly requested for the warranty company to send a different company because this company SUCKS!

Just spent over an hour there for lunch. The restaurant was maybe half full. You seat yourself, so I grabbed a booth. My wife was right behind me. As I was sitting down a server came by and said she would bring another menu. There was only one menu on the table. More than 10 minutes later another server came by and asked if we had been helped. We never got the other menu, but we ordered. I ordered unsweet iced tea with lemon. She brought the tea, no lemon, no artificial sweetener. My wife ordered tacos, so prior to getting our food I asked for some extra napkins, and a refill on the iced tea. We never got the napkins.
