Long after we had our food another server came by and refilled my tea. My steak sandwich was terrible. Tough as nails, and the bread was dried out with no taste. I never got a chance to tell our server that it was subpar because it was a long time before we ever saw her again. She brought our check, and another 10 minutes goes by, we are needing to leave, so I took the check and money to an inept bartender. She had not had a single customer since we'd gotten there, but she acted like I was bothering her. She asked the name of our server. I told her I wouldn't know that, because she never introduced herself. She leaves, finds our server towards the back. Our server proceeds to glare at me and is talking to the bartender. The bartender comes back, has a hard time figuring out that on a $31 check she owes me $9 change. Finally, she entered it on a calculator, and gave me back 9 one dollar bills. It was a tossup to go to this place, or back to ML Rose. Wish to gosh we had done the latter. Wow! What an awful experience.

i am about to transfer all of my scripts!!!!!!
for over a week i have been trying to refill a script after a week without meds i went directly in only to find out they were reaching out to a number over 6 years not in service. i reach out they next monday to see if they were able to reach out to my doctor and they informed me "my doctor failed to authorize my refill) 
thats funny because i just called my doctors office an hour earlier and they have no problem calling in my refill
so......what is the problem cvs
once this is filled i will be transferring all of my scripts
i have been with cvs for years
signed
one less customer

I'm giving two stars. One for a pretty atmosphere and for not getting food poisoning. One for a really nice server named Caleb that tried to fix the situation (can't unspill milk and disappointing sushi). But that is being generous. I walked in and asked if the bar was open seating. The hostess said yes so I went to the bar. It's a big U shape around the bar and sushi chef's. I sat and sat...for 15 minutes. I walked there so didn't just want to jump up to leave. The sushi Chef's were three feet from my face and acted so akwardly. Like I was weird for looking at them. Never even a hello. The bartenders kept serving other people to both my left and my right but wouldn't even acknowledge my presence. It was so AWKWARD!!! I felt embarrassed and annoyed. A server named Caleb said that I sat at the Sushi bar technically, one seat off of the actual bar. There was no marker or distinction at all. Nobody wanted to help me because they had not been told that they had been seated and I was one stool off from the bar so the bartenders didn't want to help me because I was not theirs. Total BS!!! It wasn't even busy in there. The three sushi Chef's were younger guys snivveling about hooking up with some girl from "da club" and the sports on TV. The rice in the sushi was not fully done, not sticky enough and my tiny quarter round value roll fell apart on each piece. They had no idea what GOBO is and again engaged with me in a way like I had worms crawling out of my ears for asking a question. I asked about the Ramen and I was told nobody had tried it and it was a newer fad to the area. Doea anyone here actually know anything about Japanese food  or service? They  didn't on this night clearly. I honestly came here for the Ramen as that's a staple for me. My serving dishe was being removed as I was still eating. I had to grab my plate back!!! Could this possibility get any more awkard? The people on each side of me were given complimentary edamame and I just sat there watching them enjoy. So the manager comes out to talk to me.....here I am a female alone at the bar embarrassed yet AGAIN and the person to my right said it must be embarrassing, and it was. I went on a Thursday alone because it was advertised as ladies night and thought I would be less uncomfortable going alone. I'm a travel nurse and have to find comfortable places to go alone often. Cannot recommend this to fellow travelers or females flying solo. The manager gave me a $9 ladies night discount an hour early of ladies night pricing that started at 9pm. I still was only a few dollars short of $50 even still for eating alone (with sake) on a Thursday when. I went home still hungry and super unsatisfied. I still tipped Caleb 20% for effort though he needs to get more comfortable with their new menu and not take a plate away from a guest still eating. He was the only part worth gratuity. I was going to withhold this review and try again, but I feel ripped off for what I got, how I felt and what I paid. There are too many other places to go here.

When this place first opened and the owners were there cooking and taking care of things,this place was the buisness haha!!! Meaning delicious!!! Now they have other people working in there and it suck real bad. Use to go twice a week. Now won't step foot in there. To bad cause it was soo sooooo good.

Went there for diner last night.  Very cold inside the place!!  Wings were great!!  Ordered family style salad a bit boring/disappointing.  Ordered two different pizzas. (1 for each couple). Ours was served quickly the other arrived when my date and I were done ours.  The server 'forgot' to put a complete order in I believe .  Initially she blamed the cooks then something else and then she admitted that she didn't put the order in.  No problem people make mistakes .  The other couple was still eating and she cleared the table.  Going so far as to box their pizza.  Asking if we wanted dessert which we declined.  Received the check immediately.  We were never so rushed at dinner anywhere .  No comp for the server forgetfulness and no apology but the worst was being rushed.  Don't plan on returning !!  Btw pizza ok but not the best !!!!

Mediocre at best. Pinto beans were decent. Grilled pork was the best meat. Chicken, steak tacos were okay. Rice was not flavorful. Queso was decent. Looked authentic but did not taste authentic. Try lolis tacos instead

This place has such potential! 
Service is touch and go, drinks take forever "it will be 40 mins until we can get you your next round". The servers hate it and can't make money let alone the wrath of angry customers. The management literally has no idea what they're doing and what a wasted opportunity they have. Ugh...

The restaurant was clean, the service friendly....pretty much all that was positive.
The grilled cheese was disgusting - there was some odd white substance on the grilled cheese.  My family thought originally it was maybe another type of cheese.  My husband's cheeseburger was flavorless - all mustard, pickles and cheese.  The onion rings were run of the mill, slightly over cooked, and flavorless, aside from tasting like fried grease.  The seasoned fries were very much overpowering after the first couple of bites.  Redeeming foods were the chicken strips & the regular french fries, but neither were the best we've ever had.
Where are the napkins?  We could have used a few more each - so. much. grease!  
We all left wishing we'd just stayed in our vehicle, and ordered the fries and onion rings to go in the drive thru.

I've been to this location twice. The first time WAS TERRIBLE. The nurse called me by the wrong name multiple times and accused me of faking. It ended up I was having a seizure - so the nurse was obviously I was not faking. I called and complained and never heard back on what happened. The 2nd time, the nurse was fabulous and everything was great until I went to pay my bill and someone else's name was on my account. They claimed I told them I had a lawyer and gave them this name. It still makes my blood boil. Do not come to this ER if you can help it.

The food was mediocre and the service was terrible.  After seeing several people who placed orders after I did receive their drink orders first I had to ask about my drink- they didn't even have a ticket for it.

When the food finally came, only 2 of the 3 items arrived.  One was an order of waffles that was supposed to be the sweet waffles with vegan strawberry butter, maple syrup and powdered sugar.  Instead they gave us chicken and waffles.  When we asked to correct the order, they brought back the same waffle... parsley and all, with three strawberries on top.  The third time the waffle came out it was just a waffle with the same three strawberries... no powdered sugar, no vegan strawberry butter.

After 40 minutes we had to again ask about the third meal we ordered. After having seen many other patrons come and go, having ordered, eaten, and left in the time it was taking for us to get our food.

Overall, the place was pure chaos and the food wasn't worth the hassle.

Ordered the neapolitan pizzas. Received nice tasting pizzas, if you can get over the super toasty burned crust. Didn't take a picture of the pizza itself, but I did take a picture of the aftermath. You might as well eat a couple of charcoals to be frank.

Go with the metro pizzas since they're thicker and shouldn't burn as easily.

If you insist on getting neapolitan pizzas, drown it in parmesan and red pepper flakes to get the bitter taste out of your mouth.

Our server, Stephanie, was very nice. The food took about 45 minutes and we were there for the lunch special so I really didn't expect that. I got the thin crust sausage pizza and a side of the garlic Parmesan fries. Honestly, the food wasn't good. My friend got deep dish pizza and seemed to like it. The dough was horrible although the cheese was good. The garlic Parmesan fries were basically cold and the ranch on the side was some of the worst ranch I've ever had. I don't think I'll be back. 2 stars are for the server keeping our drinks full and acknowledging the food was taking a while. Oh well

We were excited to try this vegan restuarant.  The reviews said that they were worth a 4 star rating. To be honest the hospitality and friendliness was one of the things that made it harder to continue our night out and try the food. The glasses were filthy. The asapargus and mushrooms had no seasoning.  Dont get the charlie sliders....i repeat, do not get the charlie sliders.  They redeemed themselves with the cauliflower steak and the zucchini crab cakes, and the cocktail names penicillin. By the end of the meal, we barely got checked on and our server seemed upset. We were not impressed.

As nice as the server is, if you're looking for a friendly person to greet you...this ain't it. This place must make so much money they don't need more business. I've never seen people be pissed off about more guests showing up to eat. "I know the table next to you is empty and all your plates won't fit on the table...but you showed up late so screw you." Never be back here. Server really is great and it's only his second day. HE is the reason we are staying to eat.

Horrible! I have gotten the cheap wash here before for $15.99.... this time we went all out, got the most expensive wash- paid extra for vacuuming the floor and between the seats. We waited 45 minutes.... got in the car and need to get a new car wash... literally HORRIBLE. I asked them for a rag to let me clean up and thy said no... then do your job. This is a car wash... if I wanted to just vacuum my car and go through the automatic wash I would have paid 10 dollars elsewhere. Won't be coming here again.

Worst experience I have had buying a vehicle. It's been 2 months since purchase and I still don't have a copy of the bill of sale or a detailed final package. I'd rant and rave about the business practices of this dealership but to save typing and time just now the customer is not important only his money and signature. The sales manager won't even return our calls and I'm having no end to the headache I took up when I bought here. Please do yourselves a favor and avoid like the plague.

I get it, you don't like your job but the three guys working should put a little more effort into providing decent customer service. Also, this is supposed to be a family friendly place to get ice cream right ? Well I don't appreciate my child having to listen to "I got what you want but you just want to smoke my weed" being played on the speakers.  Ice cream was cool but never again.
People working there are as cold as their ice creams! We didn't feel welcome... No going back here anytime soon!

We were very excited about trying this place after driving by for such a long time. We were looking for something fresh and new (an after Church hobby of ours) and this popped up on a search for a brunch spot on Gulf Blvd. It all started off well with a call to see that they were open and not flooded with Mother's Day business. The lady on the phone sounded so welcoming and friendly we were anxious to give this a try. It's a great space, cool atmosphere and amazing location it checks a lot of boxes for regular place to visit. They had a special menu today and it was a bit pricey for us($18 per person for brunch is a hundred bucks with drinks and tip). They did have a few items A-La-Carte and that's what we ordered from. They had great live music but for a concrete floor, open floor plan, small space it was way too loud. Folks were yelling at one another to have a conversation over the music. It was good music and seemed to be a talented young girl but wow, was it overwhelming how loud it was when she was belting out some notes. 
Then there are the employees talking about the customers. Some of us are messy, esp the folks that left the table next to us with the kids. Some of us are stupid apparently according to the employees that were talking over the music loud enough for us to hear. I guess the line to the order counter should wrap around the counter and not be a straight line from what the employees were saying to one another. I hope we didn't do anything to upset them while we were there....... the food was good. My chicken salad was very fresh and tasty the steak sand was delicious that my oldest started and I finished, haha! Overall, a nice place, decent food and cool atmosphere but fighting to talk over brunch and worrying that you'll be judged by the staff is not something we'll come back for. Go North just a bit and you'll find a "Sweet" spot that has yet to disappoint. Although I'm sure they have clients that aren't perfect also, they must discuss it out of ear shot of the customers.

DO NOT BUY A GIFT CARD OR VISIT THIS SPA.  

First, this place is over-priced.  I have been to other spa establishments that have better facials/massage than the place here for much more reasonable price tag.  I would not recommend the service.

Second, I wanted to cancel a gift card that I bought less than 24 hours ago, and the person said there is no cancellation allowed even though the purchase was by accident.  

They must really need the money because their spa sucks and that's why they cannot afford to refund gift certificates that were made less than 24 hours ago.

Went here for a full eyelash extension and while it did the job initially for the first few days and no matter how much I took care of them exactly as told they would fall out constantly. I even purchased the recommended items to care for my faux eyelashes. During our conversation there she seemed to not believe what I had to say about myself she was asking me questions like I was being interrogated. The lady doing my eyelashes left an eyelash glued incorrectly making it going into my eye. I had walked out the door just to turn around and my eye was seriously injured. She acted to not care and made it seem I was making a bigger deal than it was and needed to get over it. All I said is one eyelash seems to be out of place and it's hurting my eye and I can't seem to fix it on my own.
The worst part of my experience was when all the false eyelashes fell out I realized the worker lady from Uptown Charm cut off all my natural eyelashes. I did notice she was using scissors but I just thought she was cutting the false eyelashes. It has taken me almost a year for my eyelashes to grow back to a decent size.
Small wings like micro dwarf sized wings that they charge over a dollar each for them lol. Yeah they taste fine but completely not worth it at all. Sad

We booked this through Hotwire.  Extremeley cheap, however think of that when booking on the strip amongst $300 a night places.  they have two buildings on the proeprty and when you park on the south side, it'll take you about 5-10 minutes to find the lobby to check in (hint its not on either the front or back). The beds were absolutely horrible  you'll sink into them like Fester on the Addams family movie.  I can deal with old run down rooms, however the glazing on the bath tub was peeling away, there used to be an exhaust fan in the bathroom which appears to have burnt out and covered up with a generic light.  The room we were in was adjoining to the next.  The walls were so thin that we would hear the people talking next door.  They were a bit loud a times but even their dull talking felt like they were sitting in our room.  Towels, there weren't enough towels or washcloths for the 4 of us.  The only icemaker in the one building was broke-you had to walk to the second building to get ice.  

Overall, Ive learned my lesson.  I'll pay a bit of extra money next time.  We will NOT stay here again.  It needs a major update.

I must admit that my latte was good and ask that you not avoid this place because of my review, just avoid this horrible excuse for a Reuben sandwich. Admittedly, it is a generous portion of wet sauerkraut to soak your marble rye accompanied by ONE remarkably and impressively thin slice of turkey pastrami. Really??? I can't complain since I offered it to the other five people at my table who all took one look and declined my offer, so I disposed of my drenched sauerkraut sandwich.

My God I have never experienced such a poorly managed hotel in my life. We waited 5 hours to check into our room. 5 hours. 5. 

First it wasn't ready. We waited 1.5 hours for them to text us that the room was ready and we never heard anything. Go back wait in line 20 mins, get keys to a room, walk a mile to it, only to find another family occupying it. Walk a mile back, wait 30 mins in line, get new keys. Walk a tad further than before, get to the room and the room is a single bed when I requested a double. Call customer service, wait on hold for 40 mins, I'm told they have a room for me, I need to walk back down and get keys. Walk down get keys, talk to manager. Manager assures me the room is any upgrade as we have been trying to get to our room for 4 hours at this point.  Get to the new room, which is further away, with the manager in tow, new room is occupied too! At this point I want to cry. I'm exhausted from walking and dragging 3 kids and luggage through this massive place. We wait another 30 mins in the hallway for new room. Finally get a room at 9. All of the hoilday events we wanted to do were over. We missed everything I planned to do. 5 hours after we tired to check in, we were finally able to sit down and not fight the crowds here. 

You would think that was enough right? Nope. Wake up to find that I've been involuntarily checked out of the room at 930 am. I was supposedly given late check out of 4pm.They fix it. I leave and come back to shower and there is no hot water. I called the front desk to inquire and I'm informed that I was checked out again! Involuntarily. Now I'm told that it will be 2 hours before I can get new keys delivered. It only took 30 mins, so that's a plus, I guess. 

This was a complete waste of my money and more importantly, my time. I spent more time searching for a room or talking about the issues than I did enjoy the "resort". They gave me points on my rewards account, but at this rate, I don't think I would ever stay at this place ever again. Ever. It was a terrible experience for me and my kids.

If you honestly love your pet do not bring them here. My dog went in for a simple UTI and after all the medication they gave her, caused her whole body to shut down. She then died three weeks later. So bringing my dog here shortened her life span and cost me $3000. Please look for a vet that cares about your animal not money.

FUCK THIS PLACE!!! If I could give it 0 stars, I would. Dark haired dancer named Izzy literally smacked my friend in her face with her high heel. Required stitches and was bleeding ALL over the club. The bar, the manager, and the dancer, they all did NOTHING!! They were pissed and yelling at us that there was blood EVERYWHERE!!! SO UNPROFESSIONAL!! Absolutely horrific experience. Please please do not go here!!!!!!!!

We had a very bad feeling about this place the moment we pulled in...

Sun City Stables made a big deal about booking a reservation, so we did a day in advance and arrived 5-10 minutes before our scheduled time to ride so we could get the paperwork done and pay. When we arrived, there were no signs for an office or any indication as to where we should go to sign the waivers and pay. There was no one out in the fields, so we walked around and looked at the animals, waiting for someone to appear. So I'm not really sure why I needed a reservation - I guess so we could just be ignored and not have any employee out to greet us on time? As we walked around we saw the goats, and other small animals in their "petting zoo"...  they look like they aren't taken care of. (Dirty water dishes, no protection from the sun).

After about 10minutes of looking at the animals some guy yelled something inaudible at us from across the field... so we walked over to him and he said he had the waivers for us. We took the waivers and said we would fill it out while we walked around and checked out the horses. We were filling out the forms and looking at the available horses to ride... some looked okay but the others didn't look like they were in good shape... some actually looked really sick and un happy. On top of this they didn't even have any horses ready (weren't brushed - had burrs in their mane, and there were no saddles out) - by this time it was about 20 minutes past our reservation. 

We were still on the fence about riding, but filled out the waiver and started walking back over to the only employee that seemed to be there that day (Friday Feb 23rd). In the meantime two more women showed up and were talking to the employee. We handed him our forms, and he continued to talk to the new people that showed up while we stood there waiting.... we stood there for another 5 minutes while he talked to these new people and continued to essentially ignore us (at this point in time it was 10:50, we had been there for 30 minutes already and still hadn't paid yet, and didn't have any idea which horses we were going to ride). We were so fed up with the poor customer service and so sad to see how a lot of the animals were not taken care of - we just walked away. 

Just a terrible establishment all around.

Seriously too expensive. $43 for food that taste like it's 2 days old. Customer service at the buffet place is horrible. I just don't recommend unless you really have to eat here. Get a nice meat for $40 somewhere else.

My experience here was on the border between okay and disappointing.  First, I like to be greeted immediately upon walking into a restaurant, and the delayed greeting came just the second before I was about to turn and find another place.  There are posters all over advertising blended juices that are fresh made daily; when we asked for one, we were told that the juicing had not been done yet.  At 10:30 in the morning, at a breakfast restaurant, and they had not started any juice?  The server did not offer to make any, or say yes but there is a 20 minute wait, or any other suggestions that ended with me getting juice.  She seemed pretty disengaged the entire meal.  I had to ask for a water refill, and I should not have to ask when my glass is clearly empty.  The restaurant was not busy.  Everything about this just made me feel complainy.  My eggs benedict was enjoyable; the english muffins were a bit blackened on the edges but the ham, eggs, and hollandaise were decent.  The pumpkin waffles were great.  However, you'll see in the photo that there is a giant scoop of cinnamon butter on the waffle, which tasted great but was cold and the waffle was not hot enough to melt it even a little bit.  We ended up slicing it into pieces to eat with the waffle bites.  My dining partner got one of the egg skillets and said it was meh just okay but pretty boring flavor-wise.  Our server dropped off the check and did not mention whether we were supposed to pay her or go up front, which typically is a good thing to tell customers.  (pay up front is the answer).  Overall this is a very generic breakfast restaurant that could easily be swapped out for any other, and there is no particular reason to choose this one.  The juice could have brought it that extra step up.  If you're going to advertise a differentiator, it is important to actually have it ready for customers, or it becomes a bigger disappointment than not having advertised it at all.

Honestly, I've never been to a Starbucks with such awful staff. I just moved to the state, 5 days ago. I've lived in NYC, Boston, Pittsburgh, Ann Arbor. Never, have I ever.. and I mean ever...had to deal with such disrespectful people in my life. I was extremely excited to have a Starbucks location  so close to my new home, not anymore. What a waste for the company. Such a prime location but they have filled their store with employees that should be no where near the public.

Five of us seniors had lunch there recently. The hostess was very nice but our server was somewhat confused. I asked about the QUESADILLA BURGER if it really looked like the one on the menu, as I had second thoughts if I can actually get my jaws around it as it looked to be 1-1/2" thick. She said yes, and that it was a very good choice. 
Well, it arrived and was only about 1/2" thick and a mess to eat. 
Blatant, false advertising. I also asked for well done, crispy fries and it was ignored.
The beer selection was unknown as noone there could produce a beer list of their 7-10 taps. There were only 4 beers listed on the menu and I had to wait for the bartender who spent 10-15 minutes pouring me a draft. Only 4 people were at the bar.
When it came time to pay, I was the only one who got a senior discount and she couldn't explain why, nor was she willing to correct the oversight for the others. 
I now know recall why I haven't been back to this chain in 20 years.

Was first customer today. Ham and cheese omelette was lukewarm and I could barely see any cheese. Hash browns burnt to a crisp. Coffee was hot. Waitress was indifferent. Probably won't 

I was here five months ago and it was crap. I thought I would try again was no better. Waitress was horrible. Not friendly at all  she acted like she didn't want to be there. Food was a little better. Only had one visit to my table by my waitress in 90 minutes. 
Doubt I will ever be back.

Ok so my nephew ended finding a hair on his food they didn't charge us for his plate . He got the sea food pasta and waitress was very helpful but I honestly felt that the food and appetizer were very mediocre and pricey at that . I am sure you can find another location with the same kind of food and better prices . I wouldn't come here again . It's 5 in my book

I purchased a full bedroom & living room set from Badcock on Jan. 15th in cash.  Because I did not finance, I must go through a song & dance every time I call in (which is now about 20+ times).  It is now March 8th & they have not rectified the issues as of yet.  Although folks in the store location were helpful, the corporate Mulberry FL location is absolutely horrible.  Not 1, 2 or a few pieces of furniture showed up damaged.  Every single piece had an issue found once the dust was removed from everything (yes, covered in layers of dust).  I'm not a picky person & furniture will get normal wear & tear but not on first delivery. Upon the second delivery, I was told by the delivery driver "you will want to keep what you have because what is on the truck is worse."  He was referring to the 2 chairs at the cost of $399 each, a smashed bedside rail, 2 scratched nightstands & a damaged dresser.  

The company apparently only has a single person that can make authorized decisions on what is to be done in situations such as this (now after looking at reviews, mine is not unique).  I finally received a call from this person after submitting a general inquiry on their website for a "contact us" & not one of the many conversations or voicemails I had to leave.  I was offered multiple discounts if I were to keep the furniture & a tech would be out to correct any of the issues.  Mistakenly, I agreed to this & I have not received any refunds nor any calls to schedule a technician.  I came home from work Monday to a "Sorry We Missed You" note from Badcock...odd as no one has spoken to me or scheduled. 

Friendly store personnel, mediocre quality furniture with ill craftsmanship & terrible customer service, follow-up & ensuring wrongs done by Badcock are made right.

If no stars was possible that's what they would get....this Starbucks has the most incompetent staff in town.  I consistently get the worst drinks from them as they can not follow directions.  Not once have they gotten my drink order correct.  I have even ordered simple drinks they should not mess up like a green tea latte and they do not add enough of the mixture and I end up with a milk drink essentially.  So incompetent!

HORRIBLE... HORRIFIED.....HORRIBLE... I am so embarrassed to say that this Mercedes service center is one of the worst in the Nation.  I have been to 9 Mercedes dealers from  PA, Sugarland TX, Austin TX to mission beach California. And this is the worst one yet, try Princeton or even Flemington Mercedes Benz dealer. I'm sorry guys but Susan in service will ruin your total experience in your wonderful world of the Mercedes experience! I love my Mercedes and all the service that usually comes with having this vehicle.  
Don't take your van or car there, you have been WARNED!

On 11/29/17 I came to the dealership for an oil change on my 2015 K900.
Several salesmen approached my husband and I about leasing a new car.  In the end we got a 2017 Cadenza. We were told that we would receive a check in the amount of the payoff and we were to send it to KIA Finance for payment to close account. First off when does the customer make the payoff for a dealership? We received a check and sent to KIA Finance only to find out that it was not the correct amount and we still owed a months payment.  When speaking with KIA we were told that they had never received a call for the payoff on our account. They also advised that dealerships used a third party company to obtain payoff information and that their figures were always a month short.  We were told by the salesman not to make December's payment as it was not due until the 17th and the payoff would be done prior to that date.  We made advance payment for Cadenza with the next payment due on the first of January.  Now we are supposed to pay another months payment to KIA as the payoff was not correct. At this time I am unable to make this payment. Fuccillo is refusing to reimburse us the months payment they shorted us. We also had problems when dealing for our K900, and as I have seen in other reviews it was a switch and bait situation. The General Manager did call us and corrected the problem.
I have enjoyed the two vehicles but will not deal with this dealership again. Be very careful when trying to make a deal. If we do not receive the payment owed us we will take the next step of contacting the Better Business Bureau and filling a compliant.

Location: Along 21st, no parking..panera/starbucks next door have towing signs posted everywhere

Atmosphere: ordering sheet given to counter, name called out; overall a very homely atmosphere. 

Cleanliness: tables with crumbs and overall college dorm bathroom.

Food: this will meet your expectations if you're expecting middle school cafeteria Taco Tuesday, the late lunch/study hall menu. 
Tacos have craft shredded cheese, limp shredded lettuce and the meat, oh the meat. I had the 'ground beef' which may bring back memories for those who've eaten in a cafeteria: it tastes like it's about 75% low grade ground beef and 25% textured vegetable protein, the oily/red juices dripping down should forewarn your toilet. The chicken was a tribute to dry tasteless lovers everywhere.
Guacamole: It is as though a can of sherwin-williams dark green and brown paint were mixed to create a patina of flavorlessness, with the taste to match
Salsa- two big tubs of mushy tomatoes by the counter, I was too timid to risk my esophagus on
Queso dip- Velvetta on the beach, with the same tasteless, grainy qualities of pre-fab cheese

I don't know service wasn't knowledgeable on allergies. If you have allergies or dietary restrictions don't eat here because staff is not very well educated on contaminants or even full ingredients. The amount of food was commendable. Quality was just ok. I asked for a veganized bento box and it still had a lot of fish and eggs so that was very disappointing.

I went today to this Mucho location. JUST HORRIBLE, I am a huge fan of this franchise, I go to all the different locations throughout the city, it is a custom at this location to offer POOR SERVICE, the workers and perhaps the owner is East Indian, and they DO NOT KNOW how to treat their customers, I was here today and ordered a Mucho Burrito, and was short changed with the toppings, the guy who prepared it was ridiculously cheap and rude. This is not the first time this happens to me, I have come here before and it's always the same people, always the same thing. I was planning to email the franchise, but I don't think they can do anything for me, these people will still be in business with their horrible customer service and their lack of respect for their customers. I pay almost $12.50 today, I also go to Freshii who has way better customer service and way better staff, I don't recommend anyone go to this place until they change owners or staff. We are in Canada, not India, we deserve better customer service!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Very disappointed with their bait-and switch tactics. Went there to check it out and got their prices. I told them the prices were cheaper on the internet and they agreed--they suggested I should sign up on their website. I signed up on their website but when I got to the facility they said deal I signed up for was not available. I ended up renting a smaller unit for lessor money but for more money than advertised on their website!

They seem to have no real connection with their national website and all employees seem well aware of this--it seems to be kind of an inside joke with them that the customers get scammed this way. I don't blame the employees at Goleta so much as the company itself which allows this practice to flourish.

Sad... What happened to this place? My daughter was so excited to go to Cat Therapy with me yesterday.  When we arrived, there were way too many people in the small space and too few cats.  It smelled very bad.  The receptionist was not friendly.  We decided to do something else instead. Too bad!
Came here with knee pain. They told me to take 2 tylenols. Seriously? I will not be back. $110 for a 2 tylenol diagnosis.

I've had local taco before via uber eats and always enjoyed it. However, going there in person was another story. Waited 4 minutes to be sat, even though multiple employees walked by, and then sat for 18 minutes without being asked for drinks or anything. This was after a server came up, asked to wipe our table off, then said he'd be back. He proceeded to clean a large table off while another server waited 2 tables ON EITHER SIDE OF US!!! We ended up walking out.
Female pharmacist on staff ridiculously rude on the phone. Pharm techs uneducated on how to apply coupons.

To find out there was a children's museum in Santa Barbara was exciting.  I waited until recently to attend.  Unfortunately, it was underwhelming.  I took 3 children, a couple second graders and a pre-k student.  We spent only about an hour in the 3 stories of the museum.  Honestly, as a parent and an educator, I was hoping there was going to be signs explaining the science of what was going on so that adults could interact with their children.  There wasn't any of that. Just "Touch Here" "Move this" "build a car" etc.  It was more like a distraction than any sort of science.  I was very disappointed, but the views were wonderful!

I was hoping to find a great acupuncturist in Philly with an intuitive approach. I regularly go to receive acupuncture when I was living on the West Coast for chronic migraines, regular maintenance and general preventative care. I've been receiving acupuncture since I was a kid, introduced to Eastern type of treatments for over three decades. So, I'm quite familiar with the process and nothing is lost in translation. I'm shocked that my experience could even be the same place as the great reviews I've read on Yelp. I've never written a poor review, but really felt this experience was unacceptable. 

Upon calling, the receptionist was pleasant and seemed accommodating, setting my acupuncture, plus a 60 min massage for Sunday. Quoted first time, $60 for the acupuncture session and $60 for the 60 minute massage. But after suffering the start of a migraine a day earlier, I called to find out if I could move one day earlier. They said no problem and to get there earlier in the day.

When I got there I was led to the the doctor's office and waited while he played an iPad game. I sat in his office and waited and watched him. I briefly got to sharing about my migraine, tried to explain about my other issues - usually giving more details helps with the overall prognosis, but all he took note was migraines and allergies. He never asked my age, diet, menstrual cycle, or checked my vitals i.e. pulse, tongue, or eyes.

So below is the run-down of the top things that irked the experience the most.

1. Quoted one price, but was charged 1/3rd more. They explained there are additional charges for needling your front and back body, but the doctor gave me a discount.
2. When asked for advice on how to prevent migraines and maintaining over health through tips of diet, sleep, exercise, etc? He didn't ask what my current diet was, but advised me to eat protein and really emphasizing eating soy, which is completely counterintuitive to what I've been informed. 
3. I asked a few questions about what to avoid and letting him know I had taken migraine meds before getting there. His response was "Western medications aren't good to take for migraines, it'd be better to take natural herbs." When asked which ones...no response.
4. His assessment/recommendation for acupuncture was to come every week for allergies (which I've had cured seasonally in one session for over 10 years) and dismissively said it's not necessary to come regularly for the migraines, unless I have them. No mention of any of the other issues I tried to communicate. 
5. At the end of the session, he quickly removed the needles, told me I was done and walked out. It was only later when I looked in the mirror did I realize my new mole in the hairline was actually a blob of dried blood.
6. Lastly, the kicker was the massage appointment I initially booked never happened. They argued about who they could call and then informed me it can't happen today. I'm not fluent in Mandarin, but I could  understand they called multiple people that refused to come in.

Now after over 24 hours later, still with a nagging mild migraine and post writing the review. I realized that under my skin a blood spot has developed.  In over 30+ years I have never had this happen. I religiously care and remove every mole & freckle...and now I have a new one from yesterday's session. 

Sadly, I had high hopes seeing as the Yelp reviews are/were quite good. Maybe it was just a really off day. I didn't manage to catch the Dr. name. I hope this review helps others that are looking for someone long-term care, this was a completely disappointing, daunting and ineffective experience. So, safe to say, I'm still "shopping".

Would not recommend.  We had a quote given to us by Kurt, the estimate was 155.00 for 1 hour and 240.00 for 2 hours including labor and materials.  The workers did not leave a bill, they were here approximately 1.5 hours. We contacted Family Air the next day to insure that we weren't misinformed, the office stated not to worry that they would mail a bill.  A week went by and still no bill, so we called again, the office person stated that the worker had not yet submitted the paperwork, but not to worry that they would not apply late charges to my bill???  Fast forward a month, and we finally receive our bill that has now gone to 375.91.  I immediately contacted the company, leaving a voicemail.  No one returned my call so I called and requested to speak to the supervisor, manager or someone in charge.  I was routed to the CS manager who stated that she would bring the bill down to 265.91 but would not honor Kurt's quote of 240.00 max.  I am paying the bill, but would definitely not ever recommend this company to anyone.

It is sad to write this about a Pediatricians office but for new parents thinking about using this office it is worth providing some insight.

Full disclosure. I attempted to reach out to discuss this matter the CC prior to posting on Social Media but they are non responsive. 

-They are great at taking new patients but that is about it.
-If you are do not schedule an appointment in the office or they have to reschedule due to the office hours changing it is nearly impossible to reach the scheduling POC. My wife played phone tag with the scheduler for nearly a week.
-The office is NOT interested in sick visits for kids. Our kids go to daycare and as such from time-to-time they are exposed to disease. Our oldest son (16 months old) has needed to see the Pediatrician 4 times due to illness. Each time we attempted to schedule a sick visit we were essentially told there was no availability. Beyond the actual mechanics of attempting to see a provider for a sick visit, the on-call nurse seems to be grossly overworked and is not responsive. Call back time is at least four hours later. (Side note, last time we contacted the office for a sick visit, the on-call nurse advised us that there was nothing to worry about (eye puss) and that daycare should not have any issue taking him back. The next day, daycare called and asked him to leave. We contacted CC Pediatrics for a sick visit and again, they were not accommodating. Ultimately we ended up taking our 16-month to an urgent care. At the urgent care, the Doctor was so concerned about his vision being harmed they asked if he could identify colors yet. Regrettably, he cannot so at present we are hoping that this eye issue has no long term impact on his vision).

Long-story short, in my opinion, a Pediatricians is supposed to be one of the most stable and important relationships in a child's life. CC Pediatrics seems completely disinterested in acting as an important part of my children's life. They primarily seem interested in collecting revenue from well visits and not actually engaging when medical attention/advice is truly needed.

Used to be our favorite pizza place. Will begin the search for a new place. Mostly based on service. 2nd "bad" visit.  
If you come at the beginning of dinner 5-5:30, sign says seat yourself but then no waitress will claim your table. (Both times)
Last visit pizza was obviously forgot/missed by kitchen as we had to ask what happen before it occured to waitress she hadn't served it. Would have been more acceptable if she had at least kept up on the beer.  
This time when asked for a waitress after waiting 10 min, was told she would be on the clock "soon". Really??? How about you take the order and hand off the table if the end of your shift. Waiting with hope in my tummy for at least good pizza.

HAHAHAHA THIS IS FOR THE MANAGER/DAY TIME BARTENDER BECAUSE HE TOLD ME TO AND IT'S LOOONG OVERDUE: 

So about 8 months ago I got "flagged" and a tab slammed on the bar in front of me at about 4 pm on a monday in July because the daytime bartender decided me and my friend (who were 2 out of 3 sitting at the bar) were WAAAY too much to handle. I payed the tab and did not tip from feeling disrespected and left without saying a word. Granted, I DID leave a drunk Facebook review, I did not return for almost 8 months. I literally went there one night during a snow storm to get food. Somehow THE ASSHOLE DAYTIME BARTENDER (RON) remembers me 8 months later, and says I am not welcome there (even to get food) and tells
Me I should go write another review on yelp!!! WELL HERE's YOUR BELATED REVIEW!!! POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE! I hear from plenty of places in the surrounding area that you are the "employee of the month" for kicking local's out for dumb reasons!!! HERE'S YOUR BELATED YELP REVIEW!!

I'd give you 0 starts if I could. I had a bill for $0.44 cents after I closed my account. I tried to pay it online multiple times, but it never allowed me to because it was less than the minimum. I tried to pay it over the phone, but got the same message. I started getting threatening voicemails and letters in the mail saying that they were going to send the bill to collections agency and ding my credit... all over a ridiculous bill for less than a dollar. I finally got a credit specialist on the phone who told me I had to pay about $8 just to settle the bill. Infuriating. I've been a loyal customer for years and got treated like a subhuman. This company is the absolute worst. Avoid getting service from them at all costs.

Was excited to finally try this place out. Upon arriving I felt the prices were pretty extreme but since we were already there thought my family would try it out. I first asked the lady to explain to me what it was all about which was only told you go 14laps I would have expected a more elaborate explanation beings that I was paying over $100 for my children and to go around the track one time. We proceeded to wait until we heard our names called after 40 min of watching other people I decided to go ask when it would be our turn. A rude employee told me it would be about another 50 min. I felt like they should have told me it would be around a 2 hr wait to even ride from the get go. I chose to just get a refund due to the horrible customer service and extreme prices. Will not be returning.

Food took forever and not good.    They made us wait so long my guest threaten to walk out .    Other people were served before us , 30 mins after we ordered.  I got the feeling Lisa doesn't  served my kind, racism is live and well in Florida.  People of any color avoid this place.  Sad my vacation has been tarnished by obvious racism.  But I want to thank the other restaurant guest who stood up for us and also noticed the same thing
Only like 3 flavors. Everything looked stale and old. Settled on the donut holes. The blueberry ones were decent but honestly you can get better/fresher ones from Dunkin' Donuts for cheaper

My niece wanted to go here for her graduation so we took her my family and I are from Texas so we wanted to try it the food took forever and I a ordered a pesto pasta it was not what I was expecting I went to my hotel room and woke up sick my mother got the pasta with the same noodels as I did her Alfredo sauce was broke from being heated up to hot  she had the same angel hair pasta I did and was also sick this morning  I am a chef and been a chef for 20 plus years so I asked if the sauces were made fresh daily I was told yes. And a amateur chef could tell you that sauce taste like it came out of a bag

Called this place to ask what approximate wait times would be like if I headed over there and whoever answered was extremely dismissive and wouldn't give me any type of answer. Looking for a new barber in the area and they clearly aren't getting my business. Customer service skills need some work.

Went here with two friends looking for some spicy food.

We got the "special appetizer," which was a sampler with a samosa and some kebabs. It was great, the meat was seasoned wonderfully.

One of my friends got the goat vindaloo, "as hot as you can possibly make it," I got the paneer makhari, medium, and my friend got the goat bhuna, also medium.
Our food came out reasonably quickly, not particularly short or long. My dish was a beautiful red color, really impressive to look at, and the flavors were very nice. No perceptible heat, though, which was surprising since I ordered a medium.
My friend's goat vindaloo had a bit of heat, but I would class it as solidly mild. Tasty, just not spicy.

I read other reviews that talk about this place having VERY spicy food, and I'm honestly just confused. Did we use the wrong words when ordering? I can't see how "as spicy as you can possibly make it" could be interpreted as mild. Does my group have a higher standard of "spicy"? I don't personally think I do, I often order medium spice at restaurants and find my mouth pleasantly ablaze. Maybe they were just having an off night, and if we went there again, things would be spicier? But there's no shortage of other restaurants in St Pete, and second chances don't come easily.

The food was tasty, the service was good, I was never at a loss for water, but as a man who likes spicy food, there are plenty of other options.

This is my third time staying here and every time I stay here I give it a bad review... Why do I continue to stay here you ask? Because they give a low state employee rate when I travel for business.   After pulling into the parking lot with hardly any cars and then I asked to be upgraded because it seems as though the hotel is pretty empty they try to charge me $10 to do that rather than just giving me a little bit better of a room.  I just lather myself in sunscreen and went down to the front desk to look for a towel they told me the pool is closed.  Not sure why I continue to stay here and any negative comment left on yelp has not ever been returned by a member of management... It's like they don't care

I really want to love this place, but after giving it a second chance I just can't. We ordered the ham and Brie omelet and the special: biscuits and gravy with egg and bacon and a carafe of blood orange mimosa. The breakfast came before the mimosas and we had to go to the bar and track it down, they bring it and it's just oj not blood orange but it took so long to get we decided it was fine. The food is just sub par especially for the price my omelette was really just a scramble folded in half with no gooey Brie in the middle like I was expecting. The gravy is not a traditional sausage gravy at all it's a weird floury gravy. No amount of ketchup or hot sauce could redeem my meal. So disappointed I mean with a name like Bacon my expectation was so much higher...

I decided to pay however I will not return. The pedicure experience was great. I got the milk and honey pedicure ($45). The young lady asked me how did i want my eyebrows, even waxed the top of one and asked was it ok. I replied yes. My eyebrows now have no shape. Even asking her to fix them. My toenail polish is peeling not smudged. Some polish was on my skin as well so as normal once dry i lightly pulled and off came some of the polish. The people were nice but no thank you.

This is hands down the worst customer service experience I have ever had. I got my vision checked there for glasses and contacts. I elected for a photo instead of getting dilated by drops and never received an email with the photo record, this after asking on three separate occasions. I choose and purchased the glasses I wanted and that was that. I went to the store a few months later to order contacts. I had the rudest person wait on me. There was one other customer in the store so it was not busy, one employee was working with the other customer and the other one is free. She seems to be in the middle of paper work so she says I'll be with you in a moment. No problem, my friend and I proceeded to look at sunglasses frames. When she is ready for me she motions for me to sit down, I do so and ask to order contacts. She looks up my information and in the nastiest tone for no reason at all tells me I have to buy two different boxes because your eyes are different. I know I reply, and she rudely retorts " well I'm just telling you." I didn't deserve this attitude and I had half the mind to walk out the store and just buy them online, oh how I wish I had. Look I have terrible vision, and have for 27yrs of my life. I know even with insurance this is going to be costly. My glasses were close to $300 and just a 3 month supply for contacts was $180. I elected to pay more for a picture of my eye because I value my eye health. So the least thing you might expect out of a store you bring eye insurance to and have spent over $500 on-top off insurance is that the store will at least be open during the posted hours of business and treat you with common customer service and decency. I arrived at 5:28pm to pickup the contacts, surprise... door locked. I knew I was in trouble when I saw that same rude employee walking down the street a few blocks before I got to the store. There were still employees inside and they just looked at me like I was crazy when I pulled the door to try to open it. Believe the other reviewers, don't waste your time here. There are so many other choices in places to buy glasses and contacts and they certainly don't care about their customers.

I have only had bad experiences here. I have another nail salon I like but this one is across from my apt so every now and again if I'm in a rush I will go here ... and it never fails to disappoint. The woman Monica was rude and rushing, I have been getting my nails done for 15 years I don't need someone to tell me how to position my hand and fingers after a long day. A nail experience is supposed to be relaxing after all we are paying for it.
I asked her to cut them down, she cuts them only a little. Cuticles barely pushed back. And when I got home I had a hang nail which I've never had in my life. A waste of $40!

I would like to rate them -10 but that option is not available, i have take visitor insurance for my Parent who visited me in US byt paying such a high premium but when I files just around 595 USD claim for my mother, its pending with them from last 2 months with no progress and when I have called the customer care, representative who have attended the call was not at all apologetic for the same, instead he was very very rude and asked for more time.

When I have asked how much time you need more , representative of IMG didn't gave me any answer and was so rude.

Imagining this is just 600 USD claim but in case if the claim was more I am just thinking how this company will work and process.

I am very disappointed with their service and will never ever use them again and also will never ever recommend.

This hotel is one of the worst I've ever stayed in.  The room had stained carpet, dirty walls and stained sheets.  It just felt very dirty.  The hallways were old and dirty as well.  The hallway carpets were also stained.  The only onsite parking is valet for $50 a night. Self park is across the street in a public parking garage.  $7 if you leave by 9 am.  I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

From entering the building through paying the bill this was a 2 star experience. Unpleasant ladies at the front counter, no attention at the wine bar, server was a "no" person, food was extremely average/poorly prepared.  I love the Jacksonville store.. 5 star.

This place sucked.  15 min til the server came to the table, another 10 min to take the order, solid 20 min waiting for the food.  It's BBQ, it's not made to order.  They smoke it the night before.  What the hell took so long?  It was cold as hell when it got to the table.  Only redeeming quality was the brisket chili, the meat and sides sucked.  Blue Oak is like 5 blocks away, just go there.

First time buying a  NEW Jeep from Dayton Andrews. Purchased a 2017 Jeep unlimited. It now has just over 4K miles and needs all new brakes and rotors. The service manager said it's not covered due to external influences (salt air, they are guessing).  I asked how long it was on their lot before I purchased it. They wouldn't tell me. I called Jeep corporate and they said they called the service manager and stand behind his opinion. Jeep wouldn't tell me how long it was on their lot. Maybe it's from the dealer having their cars on the lot so close to the beach.   Just cost me $900 to get it fixed.   This is not what I expected a Year after buying a car from them.  Buyer beware.

Worst carnita taco's I ever had. Corn tortilla was served soggy and not grilled, meat is far from fresh. The food is definitely not authentic Mexican. It's a glorified Taco Bell. They do not even know what salsa verde is when you ask. They responded with a "huh?"
El burrito in town is soooooo much better and more reasonable!

I ordered a Jimmy Johns lettuce wrap and couldn't be more disappointed. First it took almost an hour for delivery when I was told 15 minutes. Then when I opened it, it had none of the add ons that I requested ( no pickles, peppers or cucumbers) yet it was on my receipt. Complete waste of money for something that resulted in basically  eating a single piece of meat and cheese.

There were 4 ciders on the menu, and 1 of them was alright. I would take an Angry Orchard or Redds over all of them. I also tried one of the IPA beers on tap, which unfortunately tasted pretty bland. But the biggest issue which is the driver of my poor review (and the main reason I am taking the time to write it) was that the white tile wall was covered in what appeared to be mold, contributing to the musty smell. I would suggest this place does a thorough cleaning, especially if they're going to be a brewery which is a business that relies on cleanliness.

We went to Milk and Honey for dinner on a Sunday evening. The place was not crowded so there was no excuse for poor service.  Three of the entrees we wanted were not available. So we ordered what was available.  We ordered a wine...thirty minutes later the manager returned and said they were out of that wine.  So we ordered another wine. The meals and appetizers all came at the same time twenty five minutes before our bottle of wine ever showed up. We were  almost done with our meal when the wine finally  arrived.  We had to remind the waiter to refill our water glasses.  We were not given an apology or any compensation for the poor servExtremely disappointing

After milk and Honey management read my review they were quick to respond and make it right.  Definitely worth another chance!

My husband was parking the car and I went in to secure a table. One of the hostesses asked if I had a reservation and I said that I didn't. She was very snooty in tone and talked down to me . I am of Malaysian descent and have a Master's degree. I didn't appreciate being talked down to. She said I could sit outside, at the bar or at the high top. I agreed to the high top. When my husband came in, he observed that patrons who were casually dressed were seated in my section. Less than a quarter of the tables in the other section were occupied - he went to the restroom to wash his hands and saw this. My husband ordered a Sushi plate while I ordered the Singapore Grouper. His sushi was fine, but he didn't want wasabi on his plate and there was wasabi on his plate. He was annoyed. My Singapore grouper was disgusting - naming it a Singapore food is embarrassing. It was served with a sweet sauce and had absolutely no flavor. This is not sweet sour fish. The menu didn't describe that dish having a sauce- so deceptive. The server was ok. However, I asked for a spicy sauce and he recommended sriracha, but brought a horrible spicy sauce which he said was served with edamame. My husband then asked for the sriracha again and he brought it. What a totally disappointing dinner!! No more Wild Ginger for me.

...the museum itself is fantastic. Lots of older prop planes from WW 2. They even have a B-36 which I only have seen in an old Jimmy Stewart movie. Take the tour because it's worth it. My gripe is that I also wanted to tour the boneyard at Davis-Monthan AFB which the museum also "handles". You need at least a 10 business day advance registration; which I did. After checking on it I found that I was not on the list and NOBODY at the museum could give me an answer as to why. This was on my bucket list and I seriously doubt that I will ever be in the area again. Here's an e-mail of the person that sent me the "too bad but rules are rules" letter: pcollins@pimaair.org...
Truly terrible drunken noodles. My sister's pad thai was much better, but not amazing. The thai ice tea was pre-made and not that good either.

I have been going here for about 5 years.  The servers use to be nice and smile and upbeat.  Now they all look like they just got out of prison and had a bad love experience while locked up.  The food was good and now just so-so they reduced the menu and took lots of favorites of customers off citing the it was too hard for the kitchen to make.  Seems dubious since they made it and sold it for years.  The beer is VERY GOOD.  Place generally looks dirty with think dust behind the bar.  Many many better places to go in Dunedin. This place was great need new management it has potential but appears to be at an all time low!

Do not go there! Owner, Rick, was very rude and doesn't know how to run a business. He charged me $23 plus tax in advance to replace the clip on the strap of my fossil purse. He said it would be ready in 1 week. When I went to pick it up, he wasn't there and his workers couldn't find it. When I finally found it, nothing had been done to fix it and workers had no idea if part was ordered or what the status was. They said they couldn't refund my money and said to come back in a week. They handed me the owners card and told me to call him. Owner claimed the clip was in a drawer and he would either refund my money or fix it. When I got there, he was gone but came back since he left his phone. He refused to refund my money, showed me some crappy clips that he had in the drawer that did not match and yelled at me that I was being to picky. They replaced clips with ones that did not match and Gave me a $20 credit for future repairs, which is worthless to me since I would never go there again.

If there was an option for no stars, this restaurant would receive a zero rating. I'm not surprised though, the last time we were here, the food was bad then too. I must say that over the many years dining at this particular restaurant, the food has gone downhill. I ordered mamas trio and the food came out cold! Not just sitting in the window warmed ready to be taken the table, but cold out of the frig. I had our server touch the fettuccini with his finger to verify and he concurred that the noodles were refrigerator cold. He then took my plate and must have placed it in he oven and yes it came back hot, but the bottom of the lasagne was burnt and stuck to the plate, I couldn't scrape it off to eat it. Not to mention that he price of $19 was way too much for the small portions without a salad. We were one of only four tables in the restaurant and not once did my tea get refilled. My husbands tea sat empty at the edge of the table for quite some time and was refilled as we were paying our bill. My husband had the chicken scallopini--the exact same item he has had for years and obviously the recipe has changed...for the worse. There was no sear in the chicken, it tasted boiled. The cheeses for the first time tasted like velveeta, not the original butter and cream recipe.  The kids each had spaghetti and meatballs and no thank you, we don't want to mix those leftovers to take home. And just like last time, the bread was dry and tasted like it was old, not fresh out of the oven like we used to get.  Not once did our server come back and ask us how we were doing or if we needed anything. Sad to say, but you lost our business.

I came here and ordered 6 burritos for the family. Driving home my son started freaking out and we looked down and there was grease leaking out of the bag down his legs. When we got home we opened up the burritos and they were so soggy because they were soaked in grease. Before going here look at this picture. We threw away $40.00 in burritos due to all the grease. I do not recommend Los Betos unless you want a gut bomb!!
Probably one of the worst places I have been service was crap food was even worse, the only reason I gave 2 stars was because the milkshakes are so amazing.

On 19 February 2018 I entered into a contract with ASC Moving to move the belongings in my home from Newark, DE to Wilmington, DE, a total of approximately 12 Miles. The contract called for ASC Moving to pack said belongings on Tuesday, 2/27/18 and move them on Wednesday, 2/28/18. I was quoted an estimate and I paid a deposit.

Even though I paid for packing, I found that many things had still not been packed. The ASC staff completed their "shift" at 4:00pm and left, even though the job was not completed. I had to pack many things myself.

Because of the amount of content to be moved, the move would take place using two trucks, and four men. ASC Charges per hour per man, plus a truck fee. Because they don't have big 53' trucks, they would send 2 trucks, but I'd only pay for 1. 

Move day (2/28/18): 3 movers arrived at the Newark home with one small truck. They said the driver of the larger truck had an accident and was hospitalized. I'm sorry that happened, but don't they have a backup? They also said that, because they have only the small truck, the move would be completed in two trips. WTF?

I immediately phoned the ASC office and, after conversation expressing my frustration, received affirmation from Andres Santa, the owner, that the "clock would stop" once the truck was unloaded at the Wilmington home the first time. This really should have been the point at which I canceled the move with ASC and rescheduled with a different company, in spite of the expenses that I would have to incur. 

Surprisingly, they damaged only one piece of furniture (a bookshelf). The shelf was so badly damaged it made no sense to have it moved. Some of the "kitchen" boxes did not have appropriate padding and it was amazing that some of the glass items (mason jars, in particular) did not break.

The first load took 8 hours and 15 minutes from start to finish

During the round two packing, one of the crew members asked if the clothes in the closet were going (yes, he really did ask me that question), he told me that they had no garment boxes and wanted to know if I had some garbage bags through which they could stick the hangers and move the clothes that way. I supplied the garbage bags. 
I wondered why they didn't have (or use) a dolly or why they didn't have a ramp to move heavier items up the steps - all the things I have seen happen in the many, many moves I have experienced before (but all with national moving companies). Then they realized they would still need a third trip, and that would happen on 3/1/18. I had no choice; items couldn't fit on the truck.

Highlights of the move include:
- the dining room table top was moved, but the base wasn't moved at the same time.
- They didn't bring my clothes, shoes, etc in the 1st or 2nd round, so I had no clean clothes until next day
- All the paintings and mirrors and those types of fragile items were not properly wrapped. I had to be explicit about how to care for these items.
- Some bookcases were moved to the new home but the shelves for the cases were not moved in the same run, so made unpacking difficult.
- They left trash (plastic bags from clothes and also from mattress cover in the new home; I guess I have to trash them
- When I emailed the owner about the damage to my property, he said it could be fixed with some wood glue
- Owner, Andres Santa, offered no compensation for my having to pay another month's rent at my old place because they had to complete the move on 3/1, when I needed to be out of the old house on 2/28.

I know this is a long message. And it only begins to capture the unprofessionalism and what I would also characterize as incompetence of this moving company, ASC Moving. This company was referred to me by a trusted colleague. I can say with certainty that no-one will get a referral to ASC from me.

I went to get an advertised oil change and tire rotation, after 20 min i
was asked to look at my car, they had taken apart my front brake and
tried to tell me they needed to be replaced at a cost of $350-$400. I at no time asked to look at my break pads I told them NO! I do not want them replaced. I paid them for the oil change, got home and realized they had not rotated my tires. NEVER again will I go there.
This Taco Bell just needs to close down. Whoever owns this franchise needs to come back from their six month sabbatical.

Horrible service and subpar food.  Came here with a few friends to celebrate a birthday and couldn't be more disappointed. I think they genuinely didn't care for us which is upsetting since we paid almost 400 bucks for our meal. Took FORVER to get our food. Apps came out quick but entrees took over 45 minutes to come out. Same with dessert. I felt incredibly disrespected they should retrain their staff on etiquette. Manager came over and comped two desserts but It wasn't enough to make me wanna come back ever. They place blows 

Apps:
Philly nachos - the only thing that was good. Good sauce, meat was cooked well, nachos were different but good 

Lobster mac n cheese - average. Greasy 

Steak tataki - terrible. Too salty 

Creamy spinach - decent. Probably good with a steak 

Dinner:
Veal shank - 4 small pieces of veal and a weird crunchy croquet of sorts. Veal was good but expect more portion for 35 bucks. 

Filet and short rib - looked ok. Didn't taste but friend said it was average 

Salmon - buddy said this was actually good 

Dessert:
Warm Vanilla cake - awful. No gooey center. Lacked flavor 

Philly special - an embarrassment to Philadelphia. Remove or redo this dessert. This is a city of champions and if you're going to pay homage to the Super Bowl you better come correct. 

Tacky interior, view is not what you'd expect. If you wanna come for happy hour might be worth it to see what the hype is about but that's about it. 

Epic fail

Pulled up to select a wash and a guy told me I could not have my jack in the bed of my truck so I told him I can take it out and another guy proceeded to come over and tell me that I had too much dirt on my truck and I would have to rinse it off myself first before I went through the wash. Didn't know there was a limit of dirt to have on your vehicle smh what's the point of a carwash !?!!!

The food was awful. They gave us stale chips, and when the food came it was nothing but Colby jack cheese. Also half of my plate was taken up by a deep fried pepper completely deprived of flavor, like a crunchy tomato. This restaurant has been so thoroughly Americanized it is worse than Taco Bell.

Horrible service cleaning lady stole my friends clothes, paper thin walls, my boss toilet didn't work spent his time going downstairs to use the restroom, my room trash can was emptied but the room wasn't touched! Staff is ok but not into taking care of the issues .... breakfast is continental so basic

Table of 8..Pizza was SOGGY and took a long time to be served, half the table ate their food before the other half got served. Had to chase down the waitress for beverages refills multiple times. Mom had to eat dessert with all the dirty dishes on the table, very disappointing. Poor service and mediocre food.

I was getting my battery tested. From the start the man at the counter was trying to sell me a new battery - even prior to the completion of the diagnostic. I did in fact need a new battery and was given a quote. I said that I wanted to consult with my boyfriend before making a purchase. He asked why I couldn't just buy it and then said, "You said it was your boyfriend - not your husband or your daddy! That's not a healthy relationship." After this I asked for my vehicle and left. Another gentleman, came to apologize for this interaction, but the damage is done. I will NEVER return to this location and will spread the word.

I used the Cleaning Authority for 3 years.  Although they were not perfect and did not pay attention to detail, it was way better than I would have cleaned.  The price was good and I was happy, although they always seemed to leave some cleaning tool or supply behind..  However, over Christmas break I noticed all my gold jewelry gone.  The only people who had been in my house over Christmas was the Cleaning Authority.  We contacted them and although they did give us the names of addresses of the ladies who had cleaned that day, that was it. No apology, no reimbursement.  I immediately cancelled the service and filed a police report.  I am devastated as all my gold jewelry came from my late mother and grandmother.  They even took my high school ring and daughter's baptism necklace.  I still tear up as I think about my mother's ring that I wore everyday but just happen to take it off over Christmas to wear a new ring my husband had given me.   The family jewelry is gone and no amount of money from our insurance company will ever replace it.  Please do not hire this company.  Find a private person that you really know and trust.

My family and I have eaten at Mr. Ans many times, This past fathers day was not good at all. I didn't day anything when we were there so as not to cause a disturbance in the restaurant. When I got home I called to speak with Mr. An and he wasn't there.
I talked to the manager and old him what happened and figured I would get a call from the owner but no one ever called. The waitress kept forgetting things. She charged us for a split plate for a 1 year and a 2 year old who didn't eat anything. She said she was going to bring food for them but never did. She also said if she didn't charge that for the kids she would get in trouble.They just charged us for it anyway. The cook was slinging spices at the children. What was that for? We had filet and it was just small chunks filled with grissel and fat. The shrimp were very tough.
They also charged us 18% tip. We always leave at least 20% but would not have done that that night.
There were only 5 adults eating. Not supposed to charge a pre-determined tip unless there are at least 6 or more. That is what the manager told me unless there is 6 or more people eating. There were 2 little ones that did not eat. The bill was just a little under $300 with a $48 dollar tip.
We have eaten there 3 or 4 times a year for several years but that was the last time. We will never go back there again.

It takes one bad experience for a customer to completely change their feelings towards a restaurant/business.  That happened to me today while picking up my order.  

Regardless of the issue, employees and business owners should try their best to make every customer happy.  Words were mumbled and dissatisfactory body language and looks were given.  I felt awkward and unappreciated walking out after this minor/petty occurrence. 

I work right around the corner at one of the city's largest employers.  I am also in the neighborhood and regularly have conversations with neighbors and community about restaurants and food options.

I will no longer support this business nor will I promote or advertise for them as I've done so since before they even opened their doors.

Went for dim sum today. This is not the same as lulu on olive. I was hoping they had cats on Sunday but no. Ordered hot and sour soup with a few dim sum items too. Waited about 10 minutes then asked the waiter of he got my soup that I ordered, he said yes. About 10 minutes later the soup came out with all the dim sum. Not a good order of service since the soup should usually come out in a minute or two. Some it the dim sum wasn't really hot, almost cool so the sauce was already congealed. The lotus sticky rice had no interesting flavor, tasted like regular rice just rolled up in a leaf. It wasn't bad, just okay. Not the place to go for Sunday dim sum.

The itsy-bitsy spider climbed up the water spout. Down came the rain and washed the spider RIGHT INTO MY freaking CHIPOTLE BURGER. The spider literally crawled across the top. The server was a doll and apologized and took it back and they made me a new one. It was all a funny joke until ANOTHER spider crawled across the table. We assumed they would at least pay for the spider infested burger considering I didn't get my new burger until all my friends were almost done with theirs. But NOPE. The server told us the manager (Mr. Petty looking for a pretty penny) said he would send us some free mediocre cake (wasn't even good.)

Hopefully the money I spent on my burger will go to an exterminator or at least some Raid. ‍

A week or so ago, I went threw the drive threw and ordered the shrimp tackle box. The girl on the intercom asked for my order, I give her my order and a asked for a side of cole slaw. Then I didn't hear anything else. I said, hello! She came back on and she asked again what was my order. Told it again! I then drive around to the window. The lady was very nice, asked for my money and I noticed it was not more than the $5 tackle box, I asked if she had added the cole slaw. She saw that it was not. She added it and then said it would be a few minutes the shrimp will be fresh. She gave me my order and I drove home. I opened the box, no French fries and the shrimp was over cooked!!! Very disappointed! Don't if I will ever go back!!!!

I would give the food 3 Stars & the service 0, we had not been to Kitchen Bar in months, it use to be our after work Happy Hour Spot but we stopped going because the service was always slow, guess what nothing has changed. We went last Friday and despite bar area being empty it took 15 minutes to get a waiter, I asked for lemon for my drink and my husband ordered a Corona with lemon. The waiter brought the Corona with a lime (no biggie people do it all of the time), & brought me 3 lemons on a red napkin. When I reminded him that my husband asked for a lemon with his Corona and he should bring the next round with lemon he pointed to the napkin & said you have 3 lemons there. I should have left them but we had already ordered, the Cheesesteak EggRolls & Nachos never disappoint but we barely saw our waiter & my daughter who was drinking lemon drops couldn't find our waiter & had to ask another waitress to get him, 5 minutes later he appeared took her drink order that was delivered 20 minutes later, when I complained to the manager he replied it is not even busy. My point exactly, he spoke to waiter who came over to deliver the bill no apology, explanation, nothing. Nope won't be back you I'll spend my money elsewhere.
The food here is pretty good but we've been there twice now where they closed over an hour earlier than their posted hours.
