We went to the dealership on Friday night and instantly felt like we were in a meat market. Huge as seen on the commercials is a true statement. It's a huge misleading bate and switch game all the way through. We were told we had an appointment by a young lady. When we were arrived we were switched to a different sales person by the sales manager. We were told on the phone that we were approved for 13 percent of our income. When we sat down at a table we were told that they needed to run credit. Again it was a bait and switch. We looked at cars and found one we liked. We were then told that a new one was the best option due to rebates. Again a bait and switch. We were looking at Kia sol with a budget of $13k to $17k. The new Kia had a sticker of $18k. When we sat down at the table again they played games with a $3000 add on package including pin stripes, nitrogen in the tires, etc. Every used Kia in the world has these features on it. Again a bait and switch as we requested a car without the upgrade package and out of the hundred of cars they could not produce a single car with out it. Then came dealer fees and many more charges. The basic 2018 Kia with cloth seats and no frills was now over $25000.00 dollars. Again a bait and switch on the price....but it came with a cruise. Do they really think we want a vacation when we are there to buy a car? Talk about a conflict of interest. Think how much the cruise costs financed in with the car over the next 4 or 5 or 6 years.  When you walk in the door and see all those red shirts and closing tables...run. We were there for almost 5 hours before we completely realized that the whole place was a box full of snakes. We simply walked away and an hour later the sales person sent a text saying he would meet us at the table as he was away from the table for long periods of time and did not realize we had left.  Please, please, please go somewhere else or you may end up in a car payment for the rest of your life because the car will not be worth what you paid for it.

There have been several reviews on how good and authentic the Bun Bo Hue is here.  Unfortunately, I disagree as it is been tamed (whitewashed) for the Reno palate

Reno residents may call themselves gourmands but have no true understanding about Asian food.  It's said to see that when residents in Reno eat at a Vietnamese restaurant, they order more off of the chinese menu which has really nothing in common with the cuisine of this country other than the influence of China on the cuisine many centuries ago.

I've tried the Bun Bo Hue here and it's not even up to the standards of Bun Bo Hue I've had in the past.  When I asked the restaurant where is the following standard ingredients of this soup from Hue Vietnam

- Boiled Pork blood cubes (Huyet)
- Vietnamese shrimp patties (Cha Hue)
- Vietnamese ham (Cha Lua)
- Pork Trotters
- MInced Banana Blossum, Rau Ra (Vietnamese Mint), and regular Mint as additional garnishes to the shredded Cabbage, Bean Sprouts

They said that not enough people order the Bun Bo Hue and all of the above are to strange for the palates in Reno.

Why sell a Bun Bo Hue, if you can't make it authentic.

If you want Bun Bo Hue that's close, but not as authentic as you would in the Bay Area or Garden Grove (Orange County), eat at Pho 777, Asian Noodle or SK Noodle

Literally sitting in my car crying right now. Ugliest nails I have ever gotten in my entire life. This place is OK if you have natural and short nails or just want a color. Not for stiletto nails, gel nails, long nails, or acrylics. DO NOT COME HERE FOR TRENDY NAILS!!!!!!!! I love getting my nails done, I've been getting them done for the past few years. It's something that is really important to me... right now I feel like somebody shaved my head bald. I am going home and taking off these nails as soon as possible. On top of that, I start a new job on Wednesday and wanted to make a good impression.... now I will either have to come up with another $55 or show up to my orientation with bare, ugly nails.  

I waited over 30 minutes after being told I would only wait 10. He said he couldn't get the shape I wanted, that it was "impossible". When obviously I know it's not impossible, I've been getting my nails this shape and length for years. Saying that I would "poke my eye out" ... I asked if I could just do the coffin shape instead, then he told me he would have to charge me extra for that. So you can't do the shape I want, so you're going to charge me extra to make up for your lack of skill? next they were out of the color I wanted to use, next to the color I picked wasn't dark enough to cover the sparkle gel I had underneath. So I went with my third choice, the nail polish went on extra thick and ugly. He knew that my nails looked ugly, because he made me pay before he painted. No one else had to do that while I was there. He was trying to tell me about how he couldn't make the sparkle gel go away, when I know that's also not true because I go between using sparkle gel and regular gel for my manicures all the time. So basically they are money hungry liars who suck at their job. I cannot emphasize enough that I have never received nails this ugly. Plus he was rushing, he completed my fill in under 30 minutes... Usually it takes my nail tech over an hour. WORST PLACE EVER !!!!!!! I wasn't even able to get a refund, instead I got a gift certificate. I don't want a gift certificate, you can trust me I am never coming back.
Got a hoagie from here and it was sour tasting , have not been here for a while and when i do this is what happen a bad sandwich never coming back  to this place.

I went to this nail salon every other week and loved it. This week I went back and got the same thing I always get, a full set with gel polish. It's always $26. I go today and they say $36. I was shocked and confused as to why it went up and Nikki the owner said it's always been that price. Then why have they been charging me $26????? Then she continues to be rude and petty to me because I was asking why it went up. Don't go here unless you want to be lied to about the prices.

I've actually heard a lot about this place. I was anticipating trying it...

To be completely honest... This was the furthest mark from an enchilada I have ever had in my life. I eat a lot of enchiladas from a lot of authentic places. This one, just wasn't good to me. It lacked seasoning all around. Hot sauce didn't even save it.

The atmosphere was ok. I didn't go to the bar, I think that may be why people frequent this property. If i ever go back it will be just to drink.

This drink was really gross and it had a bad after taste. The boba was salty and you couldn't digest it at all. I had high hopes because I thought I found a boba place in Santa Barbara but it was disgusting.

Sam Levitz Furniture will never see another dollar from my household. This store has successfully dropped the ball with my family not once, not twice, but no less than three times in the past week. Multiple missed delivery windows, failure to communicate and deliver on purchase expectations, missed opportunities to win back a dissatisfied customer. The last piece of furniture bought at this location remains in the box and will be returned tomorrow night.

I can deal with a lot of things, but poor customer service that results in my wife being disappointed is beyond what I am willing to endure.

I just purchased an appliance from Lowe's online web site.  I made the purchase but nowhere on that page did it ask if I wanted installation.  It only assumes pick-up.  I then went to the installations page, filled out the questionnaire (for a call back).  When someone called me back I was informed I have to go into the store to purchase the installation (could not be done online)!  I did that.  I got the call from the installation vendor and scheduled my install.  The day of my install the vendor went to pick it up but there was an issue.  I got a call from Lowe's Installation dept. saying they needed my credit card again.  WHAT? They had cancelled my original online order (because it was "online") it was not the correct "process". They rentered my original sale. I rescheduled with the vendor and did get my installation. The reason I ordered online was the day I was in the store ready to purchase there was only 1 associate there and about 8 customers in the area, I waited an hour, left, then ordered online. This review is to let you know if you plan to purchase an appliance for installation, do not order online.  The whole process took about 1 month from the day I purchased to installation day.

I got an aloha bowl and asked to sub almond butter for peanut butter and was charged extra ?? The bowl and the allergy shot I got were yummy but because of the already expensive prices plus up charge I felt a little cheated  back home in FL similar food options cost much cheaper.

Ordered Red Curry and it was disgusting. We asked not to add pineapple to our entree and they still added. What's more ridiculous is there was literally NO Salt in our food and it tasted very bad. We spoke about our food with manager and he had very bad attitude and no willingness to help nor replace the entree. Instead he blamed me by saying i have a high salt intake which is ridiculous! First, they shouldn't be commenting on guest's food preference without even knowing the facts. Second, learn to accept your mistake and be willing to talk nicely to guest if not replace the food. Bad experience!

Wow where did all these great reviews come from? They must be friends or relatives because our visit was incredibly unsatisfying. 
Service was so bad, like inadequate. 
We went on a Sunday afternoon and several large parties were finishing up and leaving. Perhaps that had something to do with it?
If it wasn't for the bus boy I don't think we ever would've been taken care of. 
Food was very overpriced for what it was, and I had a bite of my husbands rice, loobia polo (sautéed green beans, mushrooms and peas with tomato sauce) and the bite I had to spit out!  It tasted spoiled! Like sour and not from the seasoning. 
I had a veggie kebab 14.95 that consisted of two old (as in leftovers ) sad, cold potatoes on the end. The marinade - seasoning was slathered on thickly, so much so that it didn't melt or cook into the veggies which were mostly onions with a tomato, a few pieces of zucchini, a quartered mushroom and a slice of red bell pepper.  My rice, adas polo, (raisins, lentils, dates and saffron in basmati) was good though.  But not $45 good! 
We shared an interesting appetizer called tah dig which was a crispy rice cake served with a vegetable mixture over it for 11.95. The menu made it sound so good and intriguing but it was very disappointing. Just kinda bland and not fresh. 
The helpful bus boy brought us the house made bread ( also good) with a plate that had cilantro leaves, wrapped cold butter pats  and a hunk of onion on it. (?) I love cilantro so I ate it but it was weird. 
Do not recommend.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would.  I walked in and the lady behind the counter looked at me and my friend with a death stare.  She did not greet us or say hello.  Then I heard a bunch of yelling and arguing at the end of the aisle---a customer and an employee were arguing with one another about the employee following the customer around--I guess the customer felt as though she was keeping an eye on her to make sure she would not shoplift?  Then when the customer left, all of the employees started getting fired up about it.  The one employee yelled "I was just trying to eat my chips!"  It was so uncomfortable.  Then as I was looking at lipsticks an employee yelled over to me that I was not allowed to try any of them out.  Then as I was about to make a return for a product and had my receipt (which by the way you can only receive store credit for returns--which okay fine) but said they could not return it because it looked used (it wasn't).  The prices arent good either.  Better off going to Ulta folks.  You wont get yelled at and you can make returns :)

First time this has ever happened to me where I stay at a place infected with bed bugs and other forms of insects. Woke up in the morning to find a bed bug on my pillow. And other bugs crawling around the room. We packed up everything and immediately went down to the front desk and asked for a full refund. We were suppose to check out the next morning but did not feel comfortable enough to stay one more night. It's was disgusting! Front desk was very understanding and gave us the full refund with no questions asked. After I showed the pictures to the front desk he mentioned that the rooms were just recently inspected; which made me feel even more disgusted. I wouldn't recommend staying here on a budget or not.

The owners drunk girlfriend fell on my wife



We had been sitting at the bar having dinner and a drink. The owner and his very drunk girlfriend who was way over-served by him were sitting at the bar. They were leaving and his girlfriend fell on my wife, slamming her into the bar. The owner only said "she's drunk, I'm taking her home". Meanwhile my wife is hurting from being slammed into the bar. Pretty sad behavior from the owner of this place. We like coming here, but will not return.


https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g34606-d7209098-r560746095-Boulevard_Burgers_and_Tap_House-St_Pete_Beach_Florida.html#
Was not authentic, meat was cold and their pork made me sick. I'm sure I had been there a while, it was a slow day.

The service was great and the view is amazing as it's right on the Boise river. However I think it's overpriced considering the quality of food. I'm hard to impress when it comes to sea food because I'm used to eating sea foods mostly off the coast but to me the food was very bland and wasn't appealing. I had high hopes for it considering their advertisement but I was really disappointed in the food.

Bad experience.  Have been here twice and the customer service is horrible.  No one asks if you need help.  It almost feels like you're bothering the employees here.  To the employees who work there,  if you don't want to work, I would recommend you stay home or get another job that has nothing to do with customer service.

Very frustrating. Have tried to call this dealership for over one year to make appointment for my Range Rover airbag recall. Find myself on hold every-time. One time I did get a service person and was told i'd get a call back. That never happened. For the record, today was 5th attempt.

I normally don't write reviews so I'll make it short and brief....
It started with my order which they got wrong, but I still over looked it. The General Tso was  poorly cooked and just thrown together, with no real blending of the flavors. 
I call back to let them know and what I get in response was an attitude, and again I over looked. When I go to eat an egg roll it was greasy and super soggy as well as the other 3. And they tasted as if they were fried in along with my General Tso. So, when I call to let them know the issue the owner sighs and catches an attitude as if I had the nerves to call and complain. Unless, you have no real knowledge of good Chinese food and your standards for flavoring is low then this will be your place. Everyone, please be advised!
#customerservice101

For lack of better words, this place is a complete shit show. I have never dined at the restaurant, but the bar/ nightclub is the most disorganized, poorly managed cluster fuck that I've ever seen. My friend and I were looking forward to a fun ladies night out -- not so much. There was a line about a mile long to get in to the club, but we waited patiently. After almost 30 minutes in line, one of the staff members told a large group of us at the back of the line to follow him to another entrance outside. We did so, and we weren't even halfway there when a tall, African American bouncer started yelling at us to go to the back of the line. When myself and several others told him we were just there, he said he didn't care, and he forced us to the back of the line. On the way back, we ran into the employee who told us to follow him, and I explained that we were sent back. He apologized and told us to we could go ahead in the door. At that point, another bouncer yelled at him and at all of us customers, and forced us to the back of the line yet again. At this point, my friend and I were ready to leave. We were appalled by the way the staff were yelling at each other, and yelling at us, the customers, even though we were just doing as we were told. At this point, I decided I wanted to speak with a manager, simply to report what was happening outside of the club. A few minutes later the same, tall African American bouncer who had just yelled at all of us to go back to the end of the line, approaches me and says he's a manager. I questioned him about being a manager since he had so rudely just yelled at a huge group of us to go back to the end of the line. Then this bouncer told me that he was not only a manager, but he was the owner. Um, no I don't think so. This man looked like he was the leader of a gang, and he was shaky and fired up with adrenaline like he had been using cocaine. A quick Google search later revealed that the owners of American Social are Rick Mijares and Paul Greenberg. I attempted to explain to him the situation at hand and the chaos that was happening around us with people screaming, cursing and pushing one another. But how do you explain that to someone who is a part of the problem and is lying about being both a manager and an owner of the establishment? This is the case of someone on a power trip, and most likely high on drugs, who thinks that he has the right to say and do anything he wants. I kept trying to talk to him, but he couldn't even stand still for 2 seconds to listen to me. He kept cutting me off and saying that I needed to hurry up and that he didn't have time to talk to me and that he needed to go. I asked him politely to please slow down and let me speak. He continued to interrupt me, he wasn't listening to me, and he never maintained eye contact. I realized that there was no talking to this man who couldn't even stand still. At that point, I said forget it. I believe my words were, "This place is a shit show, and I won't be back." This bouncer claimed later to the police that I touched him? I am a petite Caucasian woman who is only 5'1" and I have NEVER been in physical fight in my entire life. If I did "touch him," it must have been very fast and in an expression of anger and frustration, because I said I was leaving and walked out the door. The bouncer then grabbed me by both of my wrists and would not let me go. No one has ever grabbed me like that in my entire life. He squeezed my wrists so hard that I couldn't move at all. Today I have swelling, bruises, redness and marks on both my forearms and wrists from where he was holding me. He then marched me outside of the club and paraded me around to the crowd like I was a prize. I screamed for him to stop, but he wouldn't. I kept screaming, "please let go of me, you're hurting me," but he wouldn't let go. I was scared like I've never been scared in my entire life. I didn't know what to do. At this point I went into "fight or flight" mode and my wrists were burning like fire. I could barely move my body because he had me pinned so hard, but I tried to kick him in the legs and in the nuts so that he would loosen his grip from me." Let's not forget that I was 100% sober and had not even set foot in the club. He then paraded me around back inside and called the cops over. The cops had to tell him multiple times to let me go. I knew then and there that I had been assaulted. I gave my statement to 2 policemen, but they did not fill out any type of incident report. They also took a statement from the bouncer. I was shaking and crying and my wrists were on fire. The cops said that it was his word against mine and they didn't even offer to look at the security footage. The police told me that the witnesses both inside and outside of the venue did not matter. They also said that my friend who was with me was not a witness. I was then told that if I ever stepped foot in American Social again that I would be arrested.
I've visited the restaurant with my husband and my three kids, and none of us liked it. The food is expensive and very bland.

We ate there Saturday September 30. The ambiance is ok and the seats and table were comfortable. The service is bad and the food is mediocre. There were too few servers working and the server we had took 20 minutes to do return with drinks (which were screwed up) and then 20 more minutes to run our credit card. I am surprised St. Elmo's would associate their name with this place.

DO NOT STAY HERE! Their Valet failed to give us a "RED" slip and when we returned to get our car we were treated like criminals. Really! Threatened with security, called liars and they not only searched our car illegally claiming they suspected we were crooks but even took a picture of my drivers license with a personal cell phone.

I told the manager to look at his cameras. We will NEVER return to this place even if it were free!

We purchased a puppy March 2017. We took our puppy to the Vet within three days. We took Our puppy for the necessary shots and follow up appointment. They took a stool sample and they said he had Giardia. We were upset because we had no clue he had this diagnosis. Our puppy had to be on medication three different times and probiotics for two months. We believed he was cured but took him back again just to check again-and he still has it. Now he is back on meds again. I am unsure how to move forward because our pet insurance may consider this pre existing. I found out that a friend also bought a dog at puppies plus and her dog has Giardia. I l
am so upset. We love our dog but feel as if we got robbed. Our dog was not cheap. Puppies Plus I believe you owe us.

Unfortunately we have gone to this restaurant for several years but it has gone downhill. Tonight we waited over an hour for our meal and when we questioned the waitress she was unapologetic and actually told us that we don't need to rush. I agree we don't need to rush but an hour of waiting for our food is too long. It seems to me they need to get more help in the kitchen and on the floor (waitresses) to accommodate the amount of people who are starting to come in. The food is good but it's not worth the wait and the rudeness of the staff.

I really want to like this place. I gave it another shot hoping things were different after bad experiences...nope.
The set up to order and pay is very disorganized. The staff has never been warm or friendly to me. It feels like you are bothering them. 
My last trip 2 people who came in and ordered after me received their food first. Mind you this was on a weekday morning on a non busy time as well. 
The only reason 2 stars instead of just 1 is because I do like the food. I hope this review is received by the owner(s) / managers as constructive criticism to make the place better. 
My overall advice: there are other businesses in Broad Ripple that will give you better service.

I had a really bad experience. When the worker came he quoted how much it was, which turned out being a much higher amount than the quote my partner had received. At the end I checked with my partner and found this out. They talked on the phone about it and the worker said he had shown me pictures of the inside of the ducts and explained the price. None of that had happened. We were forced to pay because it was his word against mine and I was not going to argue with two men in my house by myself. They blatantly scammed us, and definitely felt they could do that because of me being a woman. Would not recommend especially if you are female presenting.

I was really looking forward to some good wings after reading the reviews. I'm starting not to trust you guys. I ordered 20 wings, Veggie Fried rice, Chicken Philly, and Fries. My and my partner's wings were overcooked to the point that we could not eat them. They were hard and the meat was dry, it also had no seasoning. The rice was very good and fresh as well as the fries. The chicken Philly was decent but nothing set it apart, I've had a better Philly at Jersey Mike's. I was most disappointed with the wings, you don't serve what you wouldn't eat.

Waitress cussed my friend and said it was "a fucking slap in the face" we didn't tip her more than we did (together it was at least $15-20) also said "if i knew y'all wouldn't tip more i wouldn't have even served y'all i would've paid attention to the people at the bar. Now let's run back the facts, girl stopped at our table possibly 4 times including getting our order and bringing the checks. We waited over an hour for hard tough cold food repeatedly claiming our food wasn't done, although it came cold? Words of advice hunny - better service equals better tips. Do your job thanks. Very petite blonde girl I'd avoid at all costs. Her comments made me very happy that i didn't leave a bigger tip myself.

Worst service I've ever had our waiter was very rude saying we came in late when we came in an hour before closing he gave us an attitude the whole time we were there also messed up a few orders. These people discriminate against college students and it's horribly sick. We then responded to his service in his tip which he would have expected because of how rude he was. I highly discourage anyone thinking about going here unless you want to be harassed by the service.

We've been eating here since it opened. A while back we were told @ the counter that they no longer offer custom made salad/build your own. Once again, my husband went in yesterday, with the sign still posted about the custom/build your own salad, that it is no longer offered. He was given a bowl of spinach with a handful of nuts and some dressing! We've been to PIEOLOGY in another city & custom/build your own salad was offered! 
EITHER BRING IT BACK OR TAKE DOWN THE DAMN SIGN!

It's just below middle of the road Chineese food. Whatever you do, please don't order the General Tso's Chicken. I don't know what it was made of but it wasn't Chicken. Something bred-y, and tasteless. Maybe they gave me the Veggie General?! Either way, it was disgusting. The Chicken Lo Mein we had was ok. Just ok. It's not a place to avoid...it's just not very good.

Worst nail salon ever. Went to get my eyebrows done and the girl was in a rush to get done that she did the worst job I've ever seen. I came in with thick eyebrows and left with uneven and barely anything left. She was aggressive with my head and I could have done it better with my eyes closed. She then ran out the door to be done with her shift. I will not be going back and I would NOT recommend this place.

Don't come in at 8:30pm they start putting stuff away, young Service pope tel you what to do! Management is not handling his workers! Not professional!  Rude! Only person who was awesome was the waitress Tina ! She was sweet!
They close at 9:00pm but this says they close st 10:00pm!

Ok, I guess my go to place was having a bad night with their service staff. Upon arrival, 7:20pm on a Friday night, we were presented two options: 1st - to sit in the dining room, without reservations, $20 or 2nd - be seated on the rooftop for $10. Basically, the main dining room had UGO and the rooftop was having a Caribbean affair. Due the lack of space we opted for the rooftop, WRONG. After climbing the stairs, we were greeted by a young woman who said that there was a $15 cover. Forget going back and forth about the stated $10 cover.  A server came by, took our drink/food orders and left. That was almost the last time we saw her. Someone else brought the food and drinks. The Caribbean affair tuned out to be large overwhelming speakers.  We couldn't hear ourselves talk. No one was dancing so it's not clear why the volume was so high. After eating, we waited for about 25 minutes before just going to the bar, where our server was multitasking, and asking for a check. No one returned to check to see if we needed anything and for napkins, we grabbed someone else walking by.

I'm disappointed but if I can convince my SO, we'll go back. This was a first and like I said, they could have been having a bad night.

Pretty disappointed after choosing Bourbon & Branch for brunch during my latest visit to Philly in Sept. I was upset with the lack of flavor the meals had. I chose this place for it's good reviews but I was not at all impressed. I ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich and fries. Not sure if it was the meals we ordered but I could have done without.

Saw all the great reviews, plus tucsonfoodie kudos ... students are on break, so let's try it ...
From the overpowering smell of Clorox inside the teacups, to the cold steamed pork buns to the shrimp & pork dumplings without even the essence of shrimp and a strange, almost menthol scent of the dipping sauce, to the insipid broth ala Campbell's vegetable beef from a can ... the one star came came from the hot & delicious tea- brewed eggs ... Really, spectacularly bad, and this from someone who can eat at roadside stands without a qualm. Not sure this is something I could get past to try again. 1 star is a first for me, and I was so ready to be pleased.
I decided to get a loyalty card after my purchase and the manager would not "retroactively" put my $10.00 order on it. Goodbye Panera..terrible customer service

The absolute worse experience we have ever had in a hotel! My in-laws and our family booked 2rooms from Thursday to Tuesday for a basketball tournament. After checking in we were told they're sorry for the inconvenience but we had to be moved from one tower to the other on the last night because they're would be a power outage. That was fine things happen and you have to adjust every once in a while. But Monday morning when we went to check in to the new room they tried to charge us all these fees we had already paid for again. Finally we talked to a manager and around 12:30 he sorted out the mistake then we had to wait for our rooms to be cleaned! Ok! We came back in 2hrs rooms still not ready we came back at 8pm and we still had no rooms!! 8:30pm we get keys. Just to find out there was already someone else assigned to that room and sleeping in that bed! Never again!!!

DO NOT GO with large group. We had a reservation for 10 and called to let them know we were running 15 mins late, they said it's fine, the table was ready for us. When we got there the table was not "ready" it was missing four chairs and it was wet from them just wiping it off when we sat down. We were starving and ordered soup as soon as we sat down to anticipate wait, the soup took 45 mins. We didn't receive silverware and napkins until after the soup was served. The dinner took another hour. We had to repeatedly ask for drinks we ordered and of course the waitress blamed it on the bar. The place is called salsa but they don't serve salsa, they do however serve hummus and pita. I'm part Puerto Rican so I was confused with the menu. There was one waitress for the whole restaurant. Bathrooms were gross. Do your self a favor and just go elsewhere, trust.
Jason Richardson is unprofessional and condescending when speaking with him about a vehicle. Needs better management training

I visited Nashville over the weekend and decided to get my nailsdone on Friday and the chrome polish is ALREADY chipping. It was $20 more to get chrome over my SNS powder and didn't even last. Definitely not worth it at this location. On top of that they were short staffed and my friend and I were in there for 4 hours. My friend asked for marble accent nails and they didn't do anything close to it.

The staff at this Walgreens are consistently useless. They have misplaced or claimed to not receive prescription orders at least five times when every time I have placed the orders via the automated system and followed up with a phone call in the following days to check the status. I've used them for years and am going to take my business elsewhere immediately.

Made an appointment at this pet clinic about 6 months ago and the day of the appointment they called to tell me they had "an emergency surgery" come up. So I had to reschedule my appointment. Made another appointment in the last week and again half an hour before my appointment they called to cancel due to "an emergency surgery". This place was not honest about the cancellations and it was all due to them being scared of my dogs. I had gone to the measures of sedating my dogs prior to the appointment and they did not care. They are not the only ones with the busy schedule. Would never return to this place due to their dishonesty and unprofessionalism.

We last ate at Duling-Kurtz 30 years ago.  It was our special occasion place to go.  We then moved out of the area.  We now have returned . This past week we had another special occasion and decided to eat at Duling-Kurtz.  We were very disappointed.  The meal was mediocre to say the least.  The French onion soup was very good, dinner rolls w/lemon curd very good.  The meal went downhill from there.   The salad was nondescript.  No shaved cheese or anchovy filet  in the presentation .  We had the house specialty lobster crepe.  The crepe and the lobster filling was dry and the vegetables were over cooked.  We did not have dessert.  Regarding the atmosphere in the room that we ate, the interior needed a do over and seemed to not have been painted since we were last there 30 yrs ago.  We were not rushed through the meal but the waitress that we had was inattentive.  Finally, the meal was extremely expensive.  I don't mind paying for an extraordinary meal, but this meal was one step above diner food.  This will be the last time that we dine there.  So disappointed.

don't know how this place is even open honestly...unless they're having some biker night- the place is a ghost land- even then they complain about the shitty service- waiter is beyond rude, the female one(doubt they can afford two waiters as the place is barren all the damn time- definitely not a place to party). Everything was overpriced and watered down...probably because no one goes there.....honestly- DONT GO HERE EVER!!!!  Many bars in Tucson, been to them all- even the crappy ones- but this was the WORST EVER!!!  Seriously, go someplace else---

You may be asking why I am wasting my time writing a review for a Dunkin Donuts. You also may not be, but here it is anyway... 

The food/coffee here is average and what you would expect from any DD location. The problem here is the service, as well as the employees. Not only are they all miserable, they are incredibly rude. They are also impatient. Yesterday I went into the store and placed my order. For some reason I was logged out of my DD app and needed to log back in. There were two people behind me in line, but they had another register. The cashier cancelled my order and made me stand off to the side while she and another cashier took the orders of the two men on both registers. I then had to reorder everything  she said she remembered the order, typed it in and I paid. Of course the order was completely wrong when I received it. When I told the people who made the order that it was wrong the owner came over and confirmed what I wanted, then remade it. It was still wrong when we got in the car! 

The owner of this location has been rude to either me or other customers every time I've been in this store. He's also horrible to his employees and talks down to them every chance he gets. Needless to say, I will not be going back into this store. You should avoid it too.

Ordered the Bacon Cheddar "Artisan Burger." Tiny, DRY, and the "crispy bacon" wasn't crispy and was almost ALL fat. The small pieces of meat I did find, we tough and rubbery!!! The "special sauce" was spicy (not in the description) and not tasty. The meat was so dry, I didn't finish it.

For over 15 years, I have dealt with Discount Tire stores, Traders Point, Castleton, and the new store on North Keystome.  All my tires come from them due to their customer service and the courtesy they have always offered me.  Specially the one on North Keystone. 

Today I was on the west side and needed a few pounds of air in one of my front tires. I pulled up at this store. Almost 6 feet from their air station and hose. I asked the man at the overhead door to please add a few pounds of air to my right front time. It was at 27 PSI and wanted it to be 30. The man said to park my car and they will get to me later. I said sir it just takes 30 seconds to add a few pounds of air to the tire in front of you. Help me out. 

He said he has to get the manager. The manager, Ryan comes over for quite a few minutes explaining to me that  I need park my car then they get to because there are six people ahead of me. I told him that I finding it frustrating that you are spending a few minutes taking to me instead of reaching to the air hose snd spend 30 seconds to get me going. 

Poor judgement on his side I felt.

Just ordered an extremely expensive small pizza to be delivered. After waiting over an hour to receive it, I am paying $22 for a small pizza with a side of Ranch dressing and the driver told me he did not have the ranch (even though we paid for it).  I feel like it's not that complicated of a transaction. Small pizza side of ranch.   So we called the store to ask if they could bring us the ranch dressing that we paid for and they said "yes, we will send it right over" and it never arrived.   Oh, and the pizza is only average at best.  We only call Rusty because they deliver.  Next time, calling Postmate, Reataurant Connection or DoorDash and getting a better pizza with better service.  Sorry Rusty's, after Ordering your below average pizza just because he delivered has come to an end. Technology and the new delivery service's will allow me to get a better product, with better service, at a better price.

They changed the menu and increased the prices quite a bit. It used to be one of my favorite places. They had these camarones in little tostone cups that were BOMB! Now they have some night club next door. The food is expensive for the basic everyday food. A roach crawled up then wall next to me. I cried and someone killed it for me.

Agreed that the only good thing about this hotel was location right across the street from the beach, otherwise we were very disappointed with this hotel for the money they charge. Extremely old but you could deal with that if the room was at least clean which it was NOT. Upon entering the room we noticed the small table in the kitchenette area had not been wiped down then there was gum stuck to the carpet which was pretty freshly there as it was still sticky once settled in we showered and when I grabbed a clean towel to dry off I noticed stains on the towel. We didn't say anything at first the next day after being out at the beach went back to room around 4pm to notice room still hadn't been cleaned yet and we had no fresh towels to shower with. We went to the phone in the room to call down to front desk to ask when room would be cleaned and could not get a dial tone pulled the little night stand out to see why (well first there was old food behind the nightstand never cleaned) and then noticed the phone wire had been cut and there was no way to contact the front desk. We then went down to tell them at the front desk how room is not cleaned yet and we had no phone service cause wire was cut and there was food behind the night stand and was told they would have maintenance come fix it which never happened  they did finally come to clean the room and once again never wiped down the table or counter tops that were dirty and sticky. Would not return recommend there seemed to be way nicer places for your money

What a rip off tourist trap. This place is underwhelming to say the least and run horribly!

Once you get inside you're immediately caught off guard by the arcade in the front. This place is tiny and cramped as ever! My family and I prepaid for our passes but still had to wait on a long line before the water section entry for wrist bans. 

Once you get inside the water entry, it's pure chaos. You have no choice but to put your stuff in lockers that cost $10-$15 each! We had 7 people with us so we had to buy two. Staff here is horrible! There was no one telling us where to even buy the wristbands for the lockers. Turns out you need a special bracelet just for that. The locker area was ridiculous! Super cramped, people pushing and shoving trying to get through, it was just a nightmare. 

Once you get your locker be prepared to wait again in a small crowded space for a changing room. These rooms were dirty and unkept, I was not impressed. 

The place itself is super tiny, I honestly expected a much larger facility based on the website and Youtube vids I saw. They have about 6 attractions in total, I am not kidding. The best attractions were the lazy river and the big tube slides. Everything else even for the kids was just meh. 

The fact that adults can drink here bothers me. I don't think alcohol, adults and kids should mix but apparently it's whatever goes at Sahara Sams. The overall experience of an indoor water park was cool but I would not return. This place is a rip off completely. And good thing we didnt buy food here like our friend did, she spent $74 on 4 items!! Save your money and go elsewhere.

This Wedys is the absolute worst fast food business, I have ever been in. They were out of chicken tonight. Last week, no baked potatoes & the place is empty.
There are at least 5 people "working", yet there is no food ready.
There were 2 cars ahead of me in the drive thru. The first car tried 3 variations of orders before 1 was acceptable. The man in front of me wanted a salad, that one I understand, no one has romaine. Then he ordered chicken fingers & they had to cook them & it would take 8 minutes.
There were no customers. in the store & 2 people in the vehicle ahead of me. The girl on the intercom left me sitting for 10 minutes & forgot I was there.
I finally pulled up to place my order & there was no chicken cooked & I'd have to wait 6-8 minutes. This chick went ballistic on me! I was the rudest customer & it did not stop. She went on the entire time I waited griping & complaining about me. The guy at the checkout gave me a soda for my wait. I addressessed my displeasure with the verbal bashing I was having to listen to.
I called corporate while waiting & spoke to someone who genuinely seemed concerned.
What's a girl to do? I did not eat my food, I was afraid of what may have been done to it & I will never return to any Wendy's again.
Their door says open at 8:30. Nope. 9:15 right now and they are still not open. 2nd time this has happened. GTFO.

I'm in town for work and wanted to check out the new food hall to see what options I had for lunch. I saw this poke spot and figured I'd give it a try since I had a hankering for poke. 

I haven't written a review in a while, but I felt compelled to warn people about this spot. The food itself was mediocre, a solid 3/5 stars. Nothing special about this poke spot whatsoever. What knocks the score down 1 more star is that it is so expensive!! You're going to spend a minimum of $11 unless you just want rice, greens, and toppings without any proteins-which would still put you out $7 for a small. They put a ton of rice to make it seem full, and skimp on the salad.

Another important thing to note is that they don't allow any substitutions in their signature bowls. I was totally fine with that since I wanted the Spicy Salmon bowl. As they started working on my food, they told me "Oops! We ran out of salmon" so I asked them if they could give me the same bowl but just substitute the fish for the tuna. They informed me I would have to change it into a "make it your own" style bowl then because no substitutions allowed, remember? I asked if it would turn out to be the same price because, after all, it was not my fault they ran out of salmon. She assured me it would be the same price so I proceeded with my order. At checkout I ended up paying $2 more than the Spicy Salmon bowl price, and with a protein that I didn't even want to begin with.

I regretted choosing this place for lunch today and won't be returning. If you do give this spot a try, just be forewarned that they will not budge on their "policies" even if they run out of an ingredient. And know that you're overpaying for a mediocre product.

The wait time is ridiculous. I tried to make an appointment online and it said the next one available was over a week from today. I came in the store and it was over 1.5 hour wait. There's always so many workers there. Need to hire more technical people and less selling people!

Terrible place! If you are looking for a bar on Whyte to eat or drink, please, don't come and waste your money in this ghetto dump! Avoid! 

To give some background, the current management previously owned a Chinese restaurant called Chinese Dumpling House. It earned a terrible reputation among Chinese customers, so the owner changed locations to its current location and opened H2O Lounge as well, two establishments sharing one space.
 
We decided to try the Dumpling House, wanting to see if the food got better after switching locations. First thing we noticed when we entered was the appalling hygiene, none of the tables were wiped, and there was even leftover food on them! The food we ordered was frozen, seemingly made a long time ago. Had very little meat in the dishes and a LOT of msg in it. Very disappointing.

terrible, I ordered a salad which was over $11, it was supposed to come with the goat chease on it but they forgot ti put it on.  I couldn't get the waitresses attention, when she finally came to the table she did offer to get me some but at that point it was too late. We ordered a salted caramel cookie, which would have been good if it wasn't microwaved. To make matters worse they turned on the game and it was so loud we had to leave immediately.
Styrofoam plates. $10 beers. Very limited menu. Slow service. It's not awful but you can do better at about four other places in this hallway alone. Pass.

Do not get your mechanical work done here! The worst customer service I have ever encountered. I took my Jeep in for a checking sound and ended up keeping it for a month. Matt, the mechanic representative, was not on top of anything. I had to call for updates and call Chrysler to escalate the long delays in getting my car out of the shop. When I went to pick up my car it was filthy and they didn't put things back together.

We were in Tampa on vacation. We found this restaurant on yelp. I called to make sure they could take us. They said there was no wait. We got there moments later and they said they couldn't take us for hours. I asked why she didn't say that when I called. The hostess looked directly at my 2 year old and said she didn't know. It all worked out because we ended up at the most amazing restaurant closer to we were were staying.

This outfit STINKS. I would give a negative star if I could. They take your money and run. I ordered two tubes of collagen filler, on 8/21/18, but never received the order. I first called on 9/12 & their Customer Service said I would get disposition on the order by the end of business that day. Called as she indicated to FU - she was rude and then they just sent me a standard email with a link to the supposed USPS tracking.  That tracking said only that a shipping label to me had been created, but no product had been received from HOB (ie that it was only a pre-ship order). I called HOB twice more and sent an email requesting a credit to my credit card, since the USPS still did not have the product from them.  Got more run-around and rude phone behavior.  Finally on 9/20, called to ask where item was (told inaccurately that the shipping manager looked into it and that the postal service had the item but hadn't shipped it - patently false-- USPS tracking label still showed no item received from HOB). Cust. Service would not let me talk to a manager, claimed a refund 'would be pending'; but when I expressed impatience at all of this, wanting still to speak to a manager, the woman hung up.  DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS NIGHTMARE PLACE.  I filed a complaint with the Federal Trade Commission (told the rep I was going to do this...she said 'go ahead') regarding shady online consumer retailers.  My order was small, but I hate to think of those who might have a heftier order.  Avoid this hassle altogether - DO NOT ORDER FROM HOUSE OF BEAUTY.

Went to the Polish Cottage Wednesday (04/25). It was me and my fiancé's anniversary and we were hoping for a nice meal out. Prior to arriving I checked the restaurants hours twice, which stated open till 8pm. When we arrived at 7:20pm we were told it was take out only. So BE AWARE to anyone who hopes to get dinner an hour before closing, they might turn you away. We left and went downtown because we wanted to have a nice sit down dinner. I double checked the hours that are listed outside they're door, which stated 8pm. Nothing about take out only.

Place is overrun with aggressive homeless ppl. Management needs to run them off. Have compassion for homeless, but don't want to be aggressively panhandled while I'm trying to eat. I'm a gold card carrying Starbucks hard core customer whose Been to many locations across the country and the staff at this location Is really rude. Second visit here they were all talking in front of me, turned their backs to me when I approached the counter and kept taking, and then all walked away and did not take my order. Finally one of them who was taking came back and helped me. Guy who got my food and drink was rude. Won't come back here if in the area.

And this may be very generous!!!  They changed our door keys daily, so after a full day of touring,the last thing we wanted to do after going to our room, was go back to the desk and get our keys newly keyed and get attitude from the front desk. 

The housekeeping did not leave towels in our room and the beds were made, but that's it!!!

The "happy hour" is from 5-7, but they have a choice of one wine and 1 "drink". It was like the gusts hadn't eaten a meal in days and were waiting in line for the food. By 5:15, there was not any food left. 

Do NOT stay here!!!

I reeeeeallllllyyyyy wanted to like this place. The food was so good and the interior design is so cute! I met a friend and he was at the bar for a little while before I got there and when we sat, he told me the service he received at the bar was pretty bad but we didn't get into it and wanted to be optimistic. Our server bought us out really warm water which is ok I guess, but took literally forever when we asked for ice and our water glasses stayed empty pretty much the whole night. As a server myself, I understand being busy but it's just like all the other servers around us didn't bother to work outside of their section even a little bit to make sure everyone was ok, not just their own tables. Our server was very friendly, but I think he had a little too much on his plate that night. The person who ran us our food was very rude to us, but our food came out quickly and was so good. It sucks that I didn't see a manager the whole night, and I probably won't be going back.

I went for takeout of wings.  I ordered the "Award winning garlic roasted" wings.   Not sure why they are award winning.  They were kinda tasteless for garlic, but would be good otherwise.  Maybe i got the wrong order since i placed my order about 10:15pm and disnt receive them un ltil 11:05pm.  The bartender came over and asked where my wings were as i had yet to receive them.  While they were good, they didt have a garlic taste.  Oh, and they charge  $0.25 for a to go order.  Not about the price, but the principal.  I ordered 16 wings amd received what would be considered 14 wings.  See the pics. Disappointing to say the least.
They wouldn't let me in because I was late..didn't realize the recorded movie would mind.
Dirty place food is yuck too many spices on foods. Good luck ppl do not spend ur time over there and money dosent worth it.

I've been to 2 of these in philly and 1 in NYC, and this is by far the worst.
The food was mediocre at best, with sugar overloaded into everything - including their sacred dan dan noodles.  (I ordered the dan dan noodles, the cold cucumber, dry pot fish, cumin lamb, and eggplant).

This place is supposed to be able to do more authentic spicy stuff but this branch can't do either, even the chilli oil is not hot. 

The wait staff is woefully untrained... They wear random clothing so you can't tell who they are, they're super slow...  I thought they'd hired highschool students with no previous experience, but they looked a bit older. One time when I came to this location for lunch I had to go up to the counter and ask them to take my order, and then again for water, and then again for the check. Nice people, But they've never been trained. 

The table management was pretty terrible, they have large tables to begin with, which are too big for 2 people but not an ideal shape for 3 or 4...  And half the time they had tables for 4 being given to 2, so the whole place was under-utilised despite having a line to get in. And because the wait staff are slow and bewildered, they don't turn around the tables  so quick. 

The other locations have had way better food, better trained staff, and were an overall better experience.

This company was referred to us by our home warranty provider. They were very unprofessional and I would never recommend them. We asked them to come in fix three issues. We had an issue with the P-trap, problem with our recirculation pump, and an issue with our jacuzzi tub. The owner Rick came in and talked badly about the home warranty company telling us that he did not need this work from them and that he was plenty busy with other work. He came in with no tools.  Instead of fixing the recirculation he just bypassed it and said they were a waste of time. He refused to look at  the tub and admitted he did not know anything about tubs. (When they called me to schedule the appointment I told them the specific problems and the three things we needed to be fixed.  They should have told me at that time that they could not work on the tub.) As for the P-trap, he did nothing but run water in the shower. 

Overall we felt he came in and did not provide any service. I will call our home warranty company to let them know and ask for another company to be sent out.

Oh dear, what a shame and expensive too.  We have just returned from London and where happily surprised to see that an Indian Restaurant had open in Painters Crossing, Rasa Indian Cuisine in the old Ming Restaurant..
We ordered which was well taken on the phone, although a confusing and over long menu, picked up our order and returned home.  
We were surprised by the lack of taste in the Popadoms, the rice had obviously had been warmed up with a hot water (you can tell), not sure what or who knew how to cook Chicken Tikka Masala (the most popular dish in the UK), ours was grey rather than red and huge pieces of chicken (we think), very unappertising.  Finally, only 4# shrimp in the Tandoori Shrimp at $19:95 probably the most expensive shrimps in Chester County at nearly $5 each.  The sauce again grey and unappetizing.
New nachos are terrible they need to go back to the old ones that were awesome. Hopefully they change back before March madness.

They lost 3 of the 4 articles of clothing we brought in to be cleaned! We tried countless times to talk to Carlos the manager and he never spoke to us. We heard countless excuses of 'he's in the bathroom' 'he's unavailable' 'he's in a meeting' 'he left early.' We were asked to give them 2 weeks to find the items and we were sent home with paperwork to fill out. We also tried to reach corporate to no avail. We found an online chat and left our email address and phone number but never heard back. After two rounds of paperwork, multiple visits and calls to the store, and a lot of aggravation, we just received a check reimbursing us for the purchase price of the items (we had to provide receipts). It has been almost 3 months since this ordeal began.  Very disappointing experience all around. It's one thing to lose 75% of our items but to have such poor customer service and no one showing any effort to remedy the situation was extremely aggravating.
Update 2/23: Still have yet to hear anything from Carlos or management.

I am so unhappy with the experience I had at this nail salon. I got dip powder for the first time and chose to go to this nail salon because it got good reviews. The lady who did my nails was extremely rough and made my cuticles bleed. She made the color extremely thick on my nails and it did not look right at all. It looked like I had acrylic nails on shorter length nails. The whole experience felt rushed. I ended up going back to have them try and fix it. Another women who worked there filed down the thickness of the nail polish. it still did not look right after she was done. It's a shame I had to spend 35 dollars on a botched manicure. Would not recommend this nail salon at all.

This used to be my favorite restaurant. However, it's gone continually downhill for years. My wife and I gave it one more chance tonight. Never again. Poor service, marginal food, issues with the bill. Sad to see how far this place has fallen.

Every time I go through the drive-threw I wait at least 15 mins Or more it doesn't matter if I'm the only car in the drive threw  And my order is never bake it's always a sandwich and fries that's it and all I see them doing is messing around in there

It's been a few months since I've been there and I have to say that I wasn't all that pleased. I left feeling worse than I did than when I walked in. To top it off, the girl who was doing my massage injures my foot. My toe is still swollen and my foot is still bruised. Definitely not going back. I should send them my doctors bills.

This is the condition of the quiche Lorraine the Bakery House handed to me yesterday (and I ordered for pick up yesterday over a week ago.  The box was taped; when I got it home and opened it the quiche was a mess.  This is the condition while still wrapped in their plastic wrap.  The crust was not even in the wrapper; 1/2 of it was just gone.  The owner was apologetic and gave me my money back but I'm stuck with this horrid looking quiche to serve my guests this morning.  He admitted that it was pure laziness on the part of his staff.  I ordered this a week in advance of my event.  The woman who took my order was rude but I was willing to let that go.  I should have known then.  This is truly a disappointment.

I was looking at my phone trying to pull up my yelp reward and received an attitude fueled comment from a worker saying "I'm standing right here so you can get off your phone". I would have been fine explaining the misunderstanding but the attitude made refuse service outright. I later found out that this was the owner of the Zen Den. I was with a group of friends and each had a sub par experience.

It's going to be hit or miss because it's a consignment shop. The problem is the lack of customer service provided by the employees and their new rules. If something you've consigned is under $8 or $9 and doesn't sell you won't get it back. The lack of customer service is the bigger problem. Just be friendly and helpful. Most of the employees there seem annoyed to be working and are not friendly. They do have loud conversations with one another. You can shop there but don't expect a great experience.

They charge people different prices depending on who you are. My daughter got charged extra for the same services her friends received on the same day. They didn't realize all three were together. It's a horrible way to conduct business. When my daughter simply pointed out the math was wrong according to their posted prices, they were rude instead of understanding or admitting they made a mistake. I would never recommend this place.
Worst milkshake ever do yourself a favor and don't go there. Taste like a slushy milk with sugar it was truly awful.

I was highly disappointed in my experience here. First off they don't take reservations, we had to "call ahead." We arrived and were seated right away. We ordered our beverages which came at a timely manner. But some of the mugs were dirty. We received new ones. Then we ordered avocado toast as our appetizers (one plain, one with eggs). They were both very delicious and came out after our drinks were served. We asked for side plates so we could share. Every plate was dirty. We asked for new ones because they were all dirty (food residue) and the waitress looked at us like we were insane. We ordered our breakfast and it took almost 45 minutes. Our waiter who was very nice brought out chips and salsa for us. We did not want chips and salsa we wanted our food. We kept wondering why he brought us this. We figured it was because the food was taking so long. Then finally our food arrived. Well here comes another problem. I ordered the lemon blueberry pancakes. They were just blueberry pancakes (which I don't like). It had no lemon and nothing else that the menu described (I would have ordered something else). Then the other orders were completely wrong. One person ordered no mushrooms in their eggs and as it was being placed on the table you could see it was chock full of mushrooms (had to be taken back) and the other asked for no potatoes. There were potatoes on the plate. And she asked for other things to be included and they weren't. Both had to be remade. The manager came over and apologized and took both meals off the check. We were a little worried because one person at the table special ordered her meal and the waiter wasn't writing anything down, so we though he might get it wrong. My biggest problem with this is that people have food allergies and if they eat something they asked to be replaced they could get sick. I wish they would be more careful. They gave us a gift card to come back (I don't live near there so I gave it to a friend). I was very disappointed. I will not be returning or recommending to anyone. I gave 2 stars because the food was good. Everything else gets 1 star.
It's a lousy pizza but I prefer little Cesar pizza with more flavor and very cheesy, and best flavor

We will not be returning after a single wellness visit. We were required to deliver medical records before being able to make an appointment. We complied but found it off putting. We have never experienced such a requirement and would have have been stuck if we needed to get in for a sick visit. During the wellness visit, they offered an optional eye exam (machine) at an additional cost of $79 if insurance did not cover it. We declined and ended up with no eye check. A normal eye exam includes an eye chart, and they did not have any after their upgrade. Federal guidelines for wellness visits include an eye exam, so the fact that it did not come with the co-pay is reason to not return due to their business practices. The office staff was unconcerned with my request for a standard eye exam because we would not be billed and thought school would cover the gap.

My fiance and I dined at the Germantown location this past Monday, at approximately 5:30pm. We were seated immediately, as there was no wait. After 10 minutes, my fiance walked to the bar to ask for some water. No one had been to our table. When a waitress finally came over, she said "sorry I have the whole section". We ordered a side salad, cheese sticks and a deep dish pizza. We dine there frequently so we knew it would be a 45 min wait for the pizza which was why we ordered apps and salad. After 45 minutes, we did not have our apps so we asked about them. About 5-7 minutes later they were finally delivered. An hour after THAT we still did not have our pizza, and we had watched the table beside us turn twice (one family was seated there when we arrived. They finished, paid, left, another family of 5 came in, ordered 3 pizzas, ate and left, and still we had no pizza). We brought this to the waitress's attention. She said "We have a new chef, so he is still learning the ropes" OK, but he managed to get their pizzas to them.... Eventually the manager on duty came over and offered to get a round of drinks. My fiance ordered a beer, but having a headache, I just wanted more water, and to get my food and go home. After almost 2 hrs our pizza came, and the manager (after we asked what she was going to do to fix the situation) gave us a coupon for a pizza for our NEXT visit. As someone who also works in the service industry, I know how it is...but I also know we are taught to make the situation right. While I appreciate the free pizza for our next visit, we were still charged for our entire meal THIS time, which was the time we experienced an issue. I told the manager, 312 is our favorite spot, we come there frequently, and have never had a problem. It would not deter us from coming back, but I left very frustrated that our entire meal THAT NIGHT was not comped. I still do not understand why we had to pay for something we waited 2 hrs for.  I just think a little more of an apology and better customer service by the wait staff would have been good

Rent scene was recommended to me when I couldn't find a place that could manage properties in the temple area. I really thought this would be the place for me after reading the reviews. But they weren't very responsive to my concerns or questions and after a while both Marvis and his partner completely ignored me. You can't jump into business with people blind sided without your questions answered and because I did not get the information I needed I've decided to just stop reaching and took my business else where.

This place is terrible ordered food there today and they only brought a salad then they said they lost our order after waiting another 35 minutes they still left out one of our meals. The food was cold and not at all good.  Terrible will never go back.

Food looked and smelled amazing.  After seeing the pics on Yelp I was dying to come here, so I came here for my birthday.  No liquor license, so no alcohol at all.  After waiting for our food for an hour after we ordered and a half, our waitress asked if we still wanted our food?? What the hell?? I was dying to try that cast iron pig of crab and whatnot....so obviously we said yes, then 2 hours and 45 minutes after ordering our food still was not there, so we walked out. Worst service of all time.
Had a root canal done here in 2012 by Spencer. Turns out it has been infected since! Had to go to eidelson at exclusively endodontics three times for her to fix it.

Normally, we really enjoy eating at Harvest or grabbing something to go.

Unfortunately when trying to call in for a reservation this evening, I was told that there was no possibility of seating for our party of 7 at 6 pm.

At any time. When I asked if there was another time, I was told that there were other large parties from 6 until 8 pm and again, I asked if there was another time (that was not between those hours) that we could get reservations, but I was told that we wouldn't be able to get in at all tonight. 

I understand that places are busy, but calling in for reservations 4+ hours later and then being told that there is no seating at all sort of confounds me. 

I guess we'll have to try another night when this young lady isn't working or answering phones. ‍

The most redeeming quality about this place is the decor. The Panang curry was watery and the pad Thai noodles were over cooked and way too moist. Thai spicy was a good level of spicy. I normally get drunken noodle or pad seyew but looking at the photos other yelpers posted - I knew it wasn't quite right. I wouldn't come back for either of those dishes.

DONT WASTE YOUR TIME THIS COMPANY SUCKS AND THE PERSON WHO RUNS THE PHONE IS VERY DISRESPECTFUL AND HAS A NASTY ATTITUDE AND ON TOP OF THAT THE CAB DRIVER NEVER SHOWED!!!! This company definitely deserves less than 1 star but this will have to do sinces 0 stars wasn't an option. I waited over an hour and a half for a cab and when I called to checked to see what was going on the lady who was running the phones was very rude and short and she never answered my question she just hung up on me. And when I tried to call back nobody answered so I had to walk 7 blocks with a bunch of heavy groceries and two small children. NEVER AGAIN WORST CUSTOMER SERVICES EVER!!!

Negative stars, slow service. Didn't refill my water, and then waited to get our check, took around 20 min. Then the next morning my boyfriend puked from the weird beef that was on his nachos. And the burrito I got was dry, and should of gone to Super Burrito for better quality.

I visited the McDonald's at 1059 Marketplace Blvd. today. I ordered a double cheeseburger, with no onions and no pickles. I also ordered a small fry. There were two others waiting for their order along with me. I waited 15 minutes for my special order and jumped in my car upon receipt. I did not check my food until I was on I-10. Not only were the fries cold and stale, but the double cheeseburger had both pickles and onions on it. I will never go to this location again. Where is the quality control?

What a terrible change. Used to love this place, but their pizza is nothing like it was 3 years ago. Last few times the pizza is burned, not salted, the slices are hard and cheese is no longer chewy and fresh. Unfortunately, won't being ordering there anymore. What a shame.
This is the worse place ever!!! What a waste of my time!!! I would never tell anyone to go here!!!!

Don't bother going.   The NYC locations are 20x better.   Went on a Saturday night thinking it would be crowded and was excited for a good meal.   Ha...Food wasn't good and service was even worse.  For example, the best thing we ordered was my 10yr old kids pasta noodles with butter (not on the menu) for $12.45  NYC pricing in Philly.   Needless to say....I won't be going back there.

I will never step foot in this place again!! My daughter and son in law stopped in for the pork sandwich, and were belittled and mocked by the other patrons at the bar. It was so demeaning they took the food to go. Was the food good? Who the hell cares. I have lived up the block from this establishment for 30 years, and never had a bad thing to say about it. To be honest it wasn't the staff, but the inbred Chichester a#%wipes that hang at the bar. If you liked Deliverance this is the place for you!!

Don't bother trying to find this place. Went to the address. Nothing. Called - no response. Went to Facebook to see if they posted their location, but they haven't posted since 2017. Maybe it's closed???

Sorry, I just wasn't a fan. The soup doesn't is just way too bland. I ordered the spicy beef soup instead of just the regular pho. The only difference was the spice level, the noodle size, and the addition of beef chunks instead of just beef slices. 

I had to add a bunch of salt, fish sauce, sriracha, etc just to make the soup flavorful. It tastes a bit like lemongrass water honestly. The noodles were super thick, chalky but mushy at the same time. 

I had an incident with my food that I won't speak of, considering that I understand things happen at restaurants. However, it caused me to return my bowl of soup when I hadn't even finished a third of it. The owner came out and basically told me in the nicest way possible that it was no big deal and that they could just make me another soup. I lost my appetite and declined politely. 

When they came out with the bill, I saw that they didn't remove the soup that I had barely finished. They didn't offer me another meal. They didn't offer a discount. They just acted as if the issue I brought to their attention was no big deal. In my mind, that's not good service. There's too many Pho places in the Tampa Bay Area to deal with mediocre food and lack of responsibility for mistakes when preparing food.

The two stars are because the soup wasn't terrible once I added all of the seasoning and the decor inside is pretty nice.

We took our daughter here on a Saturday evening around 7pm.  After filling out the paperwork and paying the copay, we were told it would be a two hour wait.  We were the only people in the waiting area!  When we asked the guy at the desk why he didn't tell us that before we spent 20 minutes filling out forms, he said he "forgot".  We left and went to the ER on 19.

I came here with a friend for mani-pedis.  My pedi wasn't bad, but my manicure, done by a different person than the pedi, was one of the worst I've ever had.  I had gels on that needed to be removed.  They used the electric sander pre-soak, then soak, then electric sander again.  My nails were broken, split, and peeling by the time all the gel was off.  The harsh treatment with the sander was completely unnecessary.  The new gel was then applied and it was streaky and didn't look good.  It stayed on for two weeks pretty good, but there were so many splits in my nails I was afraid I couldn't get another gel mani.  Thank goodness my usual girl back in Newbury Park was able to fix everything.  I would never go here for a manicure again.

However, my friend really loved the manicure she got here.  She did the dip powder, and it came out lovely.
Horrible, horrible, HORRIBLE!! Waited no joke over half an hour in the drive trough to find out they only gave us half our order and didn't give us the sauce we requested.

My second visit here was not pleasant what so ever. My friend and I called and made an appointment for the morning (which was no problem) there was only one other lady being helped when we arrived. The staff continued to exclaim how busy it was meanwhile there was no one waiting to be helped. My appointment was interrupted several times because the man talked to his cousin on the phone, kept walking over to the other lady to touch up her nails. He proceeded to keep stopping his work on my nails to help other customers nails as they came in without appointments. I found it extremely unprofessional to dart back and forth between customers. He also was snappy and rude with me and my friend when we had minor requests about touch ups. No tip from me.

The service at this Jack in the box is absolutely awful. It's the closest place to eat from my work so I stop by when I don't feel like making a lunch, several times I've been standing at the counter waiting for someone to take my order, they see me standing there but continue their own personal conversations. Today while waiting in line, 4 other people were ahead of me, they had 1 register open, an employee came up, did something on the second register, looked at all of us in line and just walked away to do anything other than take orders. If this location had better service, I'd give it more stars but I can't bring myself to to give them anything more than 2 stars.

Talk about disappointing. Ordered at 4:15 PM on Sunday as we drove back from Ohio. I told the waitress I was on I-70 but expected to be at the 86th Street location around 5:15 PM. She said that she would wait to put my order in so that it would be ready when I arrived. Got there at 5:10 PM and my order (3 dinners of full slabs of baby back ribs with sides of macaroni/cheese and broccoli with each) was waiting at the bar (that should have been my first clue). Got home, the food was cold (it's about a 10 minute ride from the restaurant) and the meat was tough and dry (Squealers used to be dependable - fall off the bone and tender). The sides are about the size of three forks full - not worth the $24 per meal charged; even gave a tip based on past experience, which was definitely a mistake. Definitely will be looking for a better BBQ restaurant; any suggestions?

We decided to try the new Haddonfield Restaurant with very disappointing results. The food was was subpar and clearly not up to Haddonfield standards... The small portions were poorly executed and my Chicken Cacciatore lacked the usual and promised peppers and mushrooms, while the 'Baked Ziti' consisted of penne pasta in flavorless red sauce with some Riccotta, obviously not baked nor topped with cheese.

While this restaurant was by no means expensive, it wasn't worth the price we did pay.

Update...I received a phone call last week from the owner of the car wash, but unfortunately I was in a meeting when he called. I tried calling him back about a half hour after he called me, but he was busy. He told the receptionist that he would call me back. Since then no call back. I tried 3x but still no call back. I have been in touch with my friends at NBC 10 (trouble shooters) and the Philadelphia Inquirer. They are willing to interview me so I can tell everyone about my experience. I am planning on meeting with both of these news forums this Friday.
I have received well over a hundred replies from my family and friends stating they will no longer give this establishment their business. I hope this does not happen to you.  There are more reputable places out there I have found.

On Saturday, September 22, we took our Golden Retriever to the Veterinary Specialty Center located at 4909 N La Canada Dr. Tucson, AZ. As she had abdominal swelling (Ascitis ) from a possible liver condition,  my veterinarian suggested that fluid be drained to provide some relief from her discomfort.  As this facility was highly respected we were sent there for the procedure along with forwarded charts and information provided prior to our arrival. 

As treatment is provided 24 hours per day in the emergency department an appointment was not required. Upon our arrival the reception had no idea of any prior notification from our veterinarian.  I spoke with a technician who also had no idea of what should be done. After some investigation they learned that yes there were charts that had been forwarded and I was taken to an exam room. The technician said the doctor would like to take a look at my dog to evaluate her. She was returned to me and I was told that the doctor felt she was not in a critical state and could wait until a biopsy was scheduled on her liver. At no time was I able to have direct contact with the doctor.

I scheduled an appointment for the biopsy but upon returning home I had many questions that I needed answered before committing to the surgery. The following morning I called and again spoke to receptionist requesting a quick consultation with the doctor when she could fit me in and that I would wait on the phone. I was told that I would learn all about the procedure on the day of the surgery. I said that was not satisfactory. I wished to speak directly to the doctor now. I was put on hold for 20 minutes or more at which time the receptionist came back on the line and asked me what I needed. I explained that I had been waiting for 20 minutes for a quick minute with the doctor. I was told that she was too busy to speak with me and again told me that my questions would be answered by the doctor the day of the surgery. I then cancelled the surgery appointment and clearly expressed that my dog was too important to me to be treated in an uncaring, impersonal,  unorganized and obviously inadequate facility such as theirs.
