This center is nothing but a money mill for desperate pet lovers and I strongly suggest you consider other options for your family companions. 

Dr. E S Nielsen M.D.
(dbnr)

Jazmine was good for a long time but recently visited the restaurant for dinner and was not impressed! To begin with I was disappointed I ordered the lamb which was very fatty.  On top of that while the menu said it was $14 I was charged $18.  In addition I ordered the pot stickers which were on the menu for $6 but I was charged $8, the explanation was that was the lunch price for the exact same dish!  Quite frankly Jazmine has seen better days, food way over priced and mediocre quality! On top of that they recently ended the happy hour so my friends and I have decided not to frequent Jasmine any longer!

This place is a complete scam.  I went here because my mechanic said it was ok.  It's not and now I am suspect of their judgement.

First, I called to see how much they would charge to put tires on my car.  I got a price.  However, he spent 15 minutes trying to talk me into his house tires (which I'm sure that he gets a large portion of the sale).  Uneasy since he seemed slimy over the phone, I thought "How hard is it to install tires.  I'm sure that's all they do so they'll do a good job."  So, I came in, brought my own tires and asked them to install it.  
Then, he ends up charging me 33% more for tire install/balance than what was quoted on the phone.

They also found something wrong with a tire pressure sensor (although it had been working up until that point).  He said he could replace it for $100, which he proclaimed "I won't charge for labor since we already have the tires off".  I quickly looked up that this part was $50 on the internet.  But I thought... ok, he's there .. and to get this done on its own might cost as much.  So I foolishly agreed.  Then, when the guy gave me the car, the tire-flat sensor was still on!!!  I called my husband and he said that it might need to be reset -- so I didn't pursue it with them.  But how can you fix a sensor and then still give it back to the customer while mumbling "one of the other sensors was giving a weird reading".  P.S. my mechanic says that they replaced the sensor with something different than the others... a rubber sensor that probably isn't compatible or doesn't even work.  So $100 for NOTHING.

The icing on the cake was that my tires started going flat after I got out of there.  A few rides later (after highway driving and with kids in the car), my tire went completely flat on the way home, which could have been very dangerous.  For another tire, my husband can feel air coming out of the stent.  They didn't even install the tires right and they were all going flat!!!  

This is really the worst place ever, with the guy trying to make buck selling you some crappy brand of tires, crappy sensors, marking prices up once you walk in the door, and then to cap it all off, nothing is done right.  I hope that this place goes out of business.

Tru Green sucks! They killed our grass. We called them and they came out gave us an excuse saying that it wasn't them that damaged our lawn. Well then who if they are the only ones spraying it? After a while we called to cancel with them. So we cancelled and they still came out I told them to leave we cancelled with them. The person said well it's on my paper work to come here, I said no to leave. They left and we got billed by them after we cancelled and sent their people away.  Then they came back out really early in the morning today while we slept and did our yard. We have cancelled with them. But they will not take our cancel. Bad company and idiots working. If I could I would give them minus a bunch of stars. They don't deserve even one star.
Lazy workers told me they were closed at 9 when their operating hours sign outside the building clearly said they closed at 10.

Be careful of added costs that get racked on at the end of checking out. We had a new employee at check in so maybe these weren't explained accurately. The room was 200$ 
Added pet fees, parking costs, and bocce fees were added in for an extra 100$

17.00 for a large pizza.  My 95 lbs ten year old finished the whole thing.  And then ate he ate my sandwich.  It cost me 30.00 to feed my ten year old here.

Edit:  in response to the company responding to my review. This type of feedback in unacceptable,  how long have you guys been in business. And this is news to you?

Beware of this apartment complex. It is roach infested. I was moving to Palm Harbor from NY and practically did everything online. After a 28 hour drive I signed the papers half asleep and started unloading the truck. We slept that night on an air mattress because we were too tired to put the bed together.  I woke up to a roach walking on my arm. 
I tried to get out of my contract that morning but it was too late. I already signed (just hours earlier) and if I was to break my contract I would need to pay 3k we did not have.  So we got stuck. Throughout the next 6 months there was a roach guy coming in almost bi-weekly to spray, this did not help. I am allergic to roach dander which might be the reasons my eyes burned and nose dripped constantly. My poor dogs were always sneezing and coughing which made me think that all the roach spray affected them.  It was too small of an apartment for all of these chemicals to be ok. I just couldn't anymore. They knew I had issues. I called them so many times. I even thought about moving to a different apartment in that complex to avoid a fee, but when I looked in closets I found remnants of a dead roaches. 
I was new to the area, homesick and dealing with an apartment. I was even too grossed out to cook in our kitchen, or even sleep peacefully. 
My husband and I decided to just move, it wasn't worth it anymore and honestly the sneezing and burning eyes were getting to me. 
They knew I was dealing with all this roach crap, they knew I wasn't happy, all they can tell me was, "well, that's Florida for you! We have bugs" Every other local I asked told me that was not ok, that their home is free of roaches and that they are bullshitting me. 
I told them we were leaving and if they can give me a break on the "breaking the contract" fee. I begged. I even asked to speak to someone higher but they wouldn't let me. They would not give me a break on the fee even though they knew I have been a mess since I moved in there. 
Fast forward to today, $2800 that I refuse to pay,  is going to collections over a ROACH INFESTED APARTMENT! This is totally unfair. I don't see why I should pay all this money when the apartment was not up to standards. 


Update. I called a few times and left messages. No response. Why bother replying to my review if you are not actually going to do anything about

Used them a few times and it was always good and professional.. 
TODAY (however) I was told a technician comes between 12pm - 5pm. This was all scheduled yesterday. Its now past 5.30pm and still nobody in sight. I've called twice with no decent help. Last call was a complete additional waste of my time. The lady had no information until I finally just asked her after she is being quiet if she'd help or was just listening to me moan. She said she was just listening to me moan.. lol
So now I'm rating a 1 and will never use them again for anything. If they cant schedule right nor help a customer or even pretend to care.. . Why should I hand over money?

Haven't been here in years! Thank God they opened up another sushi place in the Black Horse Pike (now called Shogun).  
Sushi never tasted fresh to me but I used to frequent here during their half price sushi nights so I couldn't be too picky.  Even though I know roaches are everywhere, it's still disturbing to see one crawling on the wall next to my booth. Since then, I've never returned.

Our food server was very gracious, but the food and drinks were less than expected. The calamari was too salty and the PLT bread tasted like it was thrown together without any meaningful tasteful purpose. My dirty martini tasted more like olive juice. On the upside, the salmon entry was tasty. It was simply too expensive for the quality of food.

Long wait. Finally got the food and it was cold. My burger had a dot (literally) of ketchup and mustard. I should have just gone to Mcdonalds. Quality would have been probably the same, but it would've been cheaper and at least quick! Don't waste your time or money here.

I had the worst experience of my life. The workers behind the counter were  inexperienced in their customer service skills. My food was thrown all over. All the food containers was a mess. Manager was not to be found.

Stood in line for more than 30 mins with a child & was told we will have to wait longer for people to leave before we can enter. Way overpopulated.. obviously not big enough to accommodate all residents. I will NOT come again or ever due to these reasons with the heat. I'd rather spend triple at an actual water park big enough for all. You just lost business & I will pass my experience on to everyone I know as well as social media.
Waste of time & gas.

Very poor service it takes forever to get your drink orders, and any food orders. Also they mess up on your order and offer no compensation. Lastly last time I ate there they decided to tell me they were out of what I ordered after the rest of my group already got their food.
They canceled my online order after I had already waited 30 minutes without an explanation and still charged my card. Obviously will pursue a refund but it will take 3-5 business days. What BS.

This was by far the worst experience I have ever had here at this salon. I have been a patron here before with subpar customer service. However the quality of work is I guess able to balance out the unorganized chaos of a system they use. This Saturday before I head back to Florida for school I remembered this salon for its great pedicures even invited my sister. We signed our names in and the wait was already extensive. A sweet lady informed us that she would text us to inform us of when her name was called because she was before us. She did so we arrived and our names had not been marked off so we assumed we were next. Several people later, after asking and picking who was next. Someone still failed to assist us. They were not even referring to the sign in list anymore. Just picking over those who had been waiting.

A place with water is just nothing to shout about. It's not shaded and the water is a quarry of warm nasty water. Plenty of kids there. No place to get drinks or food. It costs only 5 to get in but go to the real beach.

DD use to be my go place for a nice quick breakfast that is to before I moved to Safety Harbor. The location at Enterprise and McMullen Booth is the absolute worst DD I have ever been to and I have been to at least 100 DD restaurants around the country. I have given this location about half a dozen chances but this morning was the last straw. I understand every one has a bad day and needs another chance. This location is absolute slowest. This morning I was in more of a hurry than usual, and I placed my order online ahead of time so it would be ready for pick up when I got there. I pulled in the drive through ready for a hot meal and I was told to pull over, park and they would have it right out. Annoyed, I parked for 5 minutes before I entered the store. I was told they don't start the order until I'm at the location and give them my name. This absolutely defeats the purpose of ordering ahead of time. I finally received my order 25 minutes after I placed my order online. I would be more sympathetic if they were slammed. It was 5:30 am on a Saturday not another customer in the drive through or in the store. Owner of this location should be doing something about this. As you can see there are a string of similar complaints on this site over the last two years. This isn't isolated. I will be contacting corporate.

Horrible customer service and follow through: 
This review is long overdue. I write it now as I still not have received any correspondence from management at Audio Express and I have grave concerns regarding both the integrity of their staff and customer service. 

Last December my husband purchased a remote car start from Audio Express. On the intake, their staff was helpful and excited to sell us this product. It all went downhill from there. Scheduling a time to have the starter installed (between my working schedule and their availability) took three months. 

When my husband did schedule an appointment it took an entire day to install. Upon returning to home, the headlight knob was not attached to my dash and there was some black gum-like substance seeming to be holding it in place. Immediately we called the store and spoke to the manager Chris. Chris told us that the gum was to stabilize while part while the clips were set. Sounded strange. He also told me to just push it in really hard and it would stay. I did and it dropped out again. I requested that they order me a new headlight knob as mine had been broken. Chris said that they could not do this and that their tech needed to look at the car before hand. 

We made another appointment which was more difficult to schedule as I was told that the lead technician was needed to fix this problem. Finally, we were able to get in and my car was fixed, so I thought... I Asked Chris specifically if my car has been glued again (during the end of appointment walkthrough) and he assured me that it had not. He told me again that they used a tack to hold it in place so that they clips would hold. (I do have all of these conversations recorded on my phone). Feeling suspicious but seeing that my knob was in place I thanked him and drove home. 

About 2 months later the knob came loose again and was covered in black glue. I was outraged. I called the store and spoke to Chris who said he had no control of what his technicians did in the back and that he did not know anything about the glue. I asked for the manager and Chris said that he was the manager. I then asked for the owner and was told this was Rob. I called the number given which was a store in Colorado. Immediately the employees on the other end of the line became suspicious of my call and told me that Rob was a very busy man. I told the man (Lex) about my concern and experience and asked how I could relay this to Rob. Lex gave me an email for Rob that was info@audioexpress.com. This upset me as it is an information line and not a personal email or contact.  Lex also gave me the district Manager's name of Jeremy Valdez. I called this number as well and he was also unavailable. 

As one final attempt at resolution I emailed Chris back. I demanded that my car be fixed and that I watch the install to ensure that the part not be glued in place for the third time. Chris asked for my VIN and said that he could get the part and mail it to me. I did receive the part but have yet to install it as I am not sure how and I do not feel comfortable returning to the store. 

I asked for a refund on my car starter as it cost me numerous visits and damaged my car. I was told no, and I still have not heard back from any management. Above all things mentioned, I am concerning this is happening to other customers.

The Bar is near the hotel we were staying in,  so our group of 8 thought we'd give it a go for Friday night dinner. I'd had lunch there in 2016 and the fried spinach appetizer was so good,  I was excited. 

They were able to seat us immediately, which was great for such a large group and the place being pretty busy. We didn't have enough menus,  but that's ok,  I was focused beer first. Good selection of their own beers. It was cold outside, so I settled on their toffee porter. It was good (and warming due to the high abv).

When I got the food menu, it's a typical pub menu with appetizers (no longer had the fried spinach which wad the first disappointment), sandwiches, wraps and burgers, flatbreads, and salads. I wanted something lighter, so ended up with the quesadilla from the app section (on the servers revomendation over a veggie flatbread). My dining companions ordered a variety of sandwiches, salads and wraps. My 'dilla was crispy, but not super hot temperature-wise (the overwhelming amount of fresh jalapenos in the filling did make it hot spice-wise). Overall, it was ok (plenty of other fillings and cheese), once 50% of the jalapeno were removed. The consensus of our table was that all the food was only marginal; overdressed salads, coldish wraps and sandwiches, and overall underweming sides. I snagged a few off the pub chips of a neighbiring plate- they were the stars of the show.

Service was friendly, but slow. Yes, it was a Friday night and most tables were full, but drink turnaround was slow, with few water refills, and the food took longer than standard turnaround time. If the food was piping hot upon arrival,  this timing would not have mattered, but it was not hot at all (warm might be generous). On a St. Louis summer day, this might not be a big deal, but on what seemed like the coldest night of the year, hot food is a must!

Takeaways: I'd come back to sample more of the beer selections (they do taster flights). The beer would have to suffice to keep me warm (the food won't). And, if you see the fried spinach offered again, order this immediately!

Super uncomfortable time, was looking forward to adding this on to my list as had just visited the west.

Went in about twenty minutes before closing to check-out the gift shop before heading out for the night. Upon arriving the security guard was the first to open the door and "welcome" me which was a good sign until she told me they were closing soon and made it clear this was a priority. The guard insisted on checking my purse AND make-up bag. It was a very non-welcoming welcome to an org that has been advertising on social like crazy. No one in the gift shop said hello even though I was one of a just a few people there. Spent less time there then the time it took to park.

very disgusting place i ordered a buttermilk chicken that tasted rotten with a cheese that was literaly like rubber with soggy whitish color in the middle and fries were a little green. had to throw away everything, very nasty. never coming back again.

The only reason the place gets 2 stars is because the leasing agents are nice and the place is convenient to everything. Unfortunately the pool is too small for the number of residents living here, elevators are often out of service, trash backs up, they do not hold many resident events, and the grill area does not have restrooms or enough grills.  It's not a bad place to live but for 3 thousand dollars a month this place falls short.

Horrible service

Came in with a party of 3 and was asked if we would like the bar. We asked for a table and was told there are no open table, there is an open table at the front of the store. We were told that is a table for 6. I've often seen it often seen split into 2 + 4 seating in the past even on busy weekend evenings. This same table was split into 2+4 a few minutes after hostess was scolded by manager(?) and we were still not offered the table

I specifically asked for a table in a non crowded walkway so I can talk with my dining companion in peace in my OpenTable reservation, they put us RIGHT next to the OPEN double-doors to the street, and yes, there were other reasonable tables.  Waiters were walking past us constantly and we could hear street noise including cars revving their engines.  

The rum I ordered seemed watered down, perhaps because they added WAAY too much ice and let it sit before delivery.  The quacamole had almost no taste, even with all the extra ingredients we added.  And the chicken empanadas were tasteless and kinda burnt.

Place has gone downhill significantly since they first opened.  Just to add insult to injury, OpenTable sent me a notice after the fact informing me that that I missed my reservation even though I identified myself by my full name, party of 2 and had a reservation.

I need to preface this review by saying I too have worked in the service industry for YEARS, and I understand the importance of reviews. I would NEVER come out and write a review just to be malicious, and it honestly took me months to even decide to write one. But after the recent uprisings against sexual harassment, I knew I had to. 


I waited such a long time before writing this review because I was so both flabbergasted and angry. I will not go into every explicit detail because I start to shake when I think about it. Ralph Carter is a chauvinist pig that deserves to be fired. I'm a 32 year old woman, and I was treated like a little girl. I was yelled at repeatedly, avoided (I live in Tampa, conveniently Ralph who will tell you he works 24/7/365 but is NEVER there when needed, so he could never meet me at the dealership when I could make it over). I paid for a car IN CASH on a Friday afternoon where no male employee could be found to take my money (naturally Ralph had already taken off for the day, but remember he works 8 days a week), but EVERY SINGLE MALE EMPLOYEE WAS OUTSIDE THE SERVICE GARAGE GAWKING AND STARING WHEN I WAS WALKING TO MY CAR. I sat in my car and watched them for several minutes. I was wearing a tank and jeans, and brought a jacket; this was hardly "get noticed" attire. It was like all of them had just gotten out of prison, and had never seen a woman before. 

The entire process from start to finish was awful, but Ralph told me I was buying from the best, and this car would last forever --

Funny how I go to get a first oil change and they tell me I had BLACK steering fluid and BLACK transmission fluid. 

They wouldn't accept my paperwork the day I purchased car, flat out. They told me that guy was gone for the day (it was 11 am) and not to worry. Three weeks later they are white on rice on me looking for alternative payment. Why wouldn't they have looked over my paperwork the first day? Because there is a clause they don't explain that says if your loan isn't approved you owe $1000 plus .25/miles over 700 in a month, plus whatever little knicks you might put on it after driving off the lot. I put $2500 down. If I couldn't pay for the car in cash, I would have FOR SURE lost that entire deposit. But wait, didn't I ask them to look over everything already?!

STAY AWAY. This is a total scam, and Ralph Carter made it all the more miserable. Ralph Carter and the boys club of Crown Honda. 

He's a bitter sexist... something. I said it. I don't get that he even listened to half of what I ever said, and I think it was because I'm a woman. He tried to shake my hand on a deal when I hadn't even seen the car yet!! Was it that he thought my sister and I were just dumb, or just women in general?!

This is my SEVENTH car, I've done this before. Purchasing a car is supposed to be so fun! And this just hurt my heart after a while. Still does, to be honest. 

I will NEVER go back, and my sister who was with me that day just purchased a brand new suv from a different dealership, told me what an amazing and easy time she had working with different people, right up the street from this circus. So this isn't typical Florida car buying. 

Remember, Ralph Carter is not your guy and this is not your dealership. No one deserves this.

I love their products and the employees are very welcoming. HOWEVER, the music is so loud that I can't stand to be in there any more than necessary. The high level of the music is very distracting and irritating. I went in this past Saturday morning, quickly grabbed the two small gifts I needed and left as quickly as I could.

After multiple calls we were told that there would be one driver to shuffle all of the trailers around which includes picking up 3 trailers and dropping off trailers at two houses only a couple blocks from each other. It is now after noon and the only thing that's happened is two trailers were dropped off at my parents house. One driver for two households. Absolutely unex exceptable!! I will never use U pack again.

I don't know what has happened to Characters, as I (and a co-worker) had good experiences there previously. It has gone from being top-notch (albeit a bit expensive) to mediocre food, absolutely dismal service and being absurdly expensive. Our server was one of the most insulting, rude servers I've ever encounter anywhere - she messed up our orders at in at least five different ways, blamed it all on us and to add insult to insult when we pointed out our disappointment to the Day Manager - she acted like she couldn't possibly care less.

If the near empty room during the height of holiday office group lunch outings is any indication we aren't the only ones to discover Characters is 'off the list'.

We ordered two arrangements and asked for them to look like the picture on the website, but when we picked them up they were miniature! They were beautiful but Very expensive for what you get and the website is deceiving.

Growing up in Tampa, Nicole's donut shop was always a treat to go to. Light airy donuts with chocolate icing was always a favorite. We also like the chocolate iced and white cream filled. Obviously the business has been sold because the donuts are much heavier than they used to be and no more light airy white filling but now with overly sweet buttercream filling, I didn't eat it.  Yuck. Very disappointing.  When you purchase a highly successful doughnut business, why on earth would you change the recipe?!
I don't recommend this place to eat anything. Their bread is stale and the way they make their food is unsanitary. The staff is rude, especially the lady who wears a tone of make up.

2 stars for poor service. 2 stars for food which was bland, needed to get up and seek out a salt shaker since server was not available, didn't know we would need to salt the food when it was delivered. Rice and black beans served cold. Margarita was below average.  5 stars for good wine list and value on bottles, the French Malbec merlot blend was excellent Clos la Coutes. 
5 stars for interior space, 0 stars for choice of Mexico City disco loud music that is totally annoying and because of this we will not return.
Consider flamenco or gypsy kings and lower the volume, your little black book is showing lots of customer complaints.
This was a Tuesday evening, the restaurant was not busy so wasn't sure why it took so long to have our food delivered.

I've heard so many good things about this place but they did not deliver what so ever. We dined in on a Monday night. Ordered our food and drinks. Took a seat and waited more than an hour for our food on a slow night. We saw guests who got their food before us when they ordered after us. Very disappointed. I rather go to JJ's pizza.

Drinks are overpriced. The staff was rude and the manager John took the side of one of his liar bartenders, Nicole Ratty, after she lied to him about us. Oh and YES it's a bar, in fact it's a "Rock bar" but they'll kick you out if you cuss. House of Bards where the customers can't cuss but the bands can...

The food was ok, honestly I was expecting something better; when I was ready to pay I went to the counter and the guy told me the amount without receipt; so at that moment I did not remember the prices for what I order so I paid what they told me to pay plus tip. Then, when we left the restaurant my wife told me that the charged us something extra, I called the restaurant and asked for verify my bill, they said it's not a mistake but I insisted that something was over charged to my bill. To make the long history short; the guy confessed they charged 15% automatically to the bill when is more than $30 plus the tip that I already gave. For me this is totally acceptable and fraudulent.

I'm skippin' the small talk and breakin' this one on down:


FOOD:
This was our first stop on a recent biannual trip to NOLA and was a disappointing first stop. We had a large group that is fond of sharing, so we had the rare opportunity to try a great variety of things off the menu. Of the ten(ish) dishes I tried, only the stuffed mushrooms stood out as worth returning for. The trend here is deep-fried and cream-covered, but lacking depth of flavor. My main dish was the Delta Queen, and for $24, I expected SOMETHING more than what was essentially spaghetti with a fried seafood platter on top.


DRINK:

A solid standard full-bar! Their custom cocktails were nothing special, but the two guys behind the bar were knowledgable, personable, and quick on their toes. The 40-some minutes we spent here while waiting for a table was the best part of the whole evening.

SERVICE (FOOD):
Our table service was great. We were a group of eight, which means a lot going on, but our server did a great job getting everything right. It took a while for food to arrive, but it was a Friday night, and you can't expect magic to happen.


SERVICE (HOST/HOSTESS):
Despite calling ahead, both hostesses were "short" with our group, making it clear that we were a trouble for them. 


ATMOSPHERE:
Nothing special here- just your average NOLA-style casual dining. I DID enjoy sitting upstairs more than down- it was quieter.


PARKING:
None.


Final thoughts: While nothing was bad or wrong (except the unwarranted attitude from the hostess), Katie's offers nothing special enough to bring us back.

Excellent food. Environment was not conducive to conversation or families. We went on a Saturday night at 7:45 pm.  If you want a bar or club with food, this place is for you. If you want a nice, family oriented restaurant, don't stop in. The live singer was so loud we couldn't hear the person next to us. We had to move outside to the patio but then the mosquitos got us. Food taste amazing but this place needs to decide if it's a club or a restaurant... And yes there were people dancing so maybe it's a club and they need to advertise as such or at least wait til later in the night to transition into the club that they clearly want to be.

I pulled in the parking lot a few minutes before my appointment.  As I was grabbing my wallet there was a guy walking around the car thumping on the windows.  These back windows are acrylic, says the tint guru.  Ok, first I've heard of that but if you say so.   We can't tint those.   He checks with his boss who says the heat gun will melt the windows. 

It's a BMW I3, which is electric...meaning the heat of the sun wastes electricity cooling the car in Florida.  In other words, 99% of the I3's sold....get tinted.   Literally thousands of pics on the I3 Facebook group 
...many in this exact 3M Crystalline.  

I posted on the I3 worldwide Facebook group asking if this was just a 3M Crystalline issue.   Many responses, some saying he is wrong about them being acrylic and some posting pics of their cars done in 3M Crystalline saying right or wrong on the acrylic, he is wrong about not being able to tint them.   The one thing they all agree on....find a better tint shop.  I also spoke to BMW, who laughed at MCOR's assurance that these windows are made of some untintable material.  

So, I found a better shop.  Advanced Film Solutions.  Oddly, there were other I3's there with the same story about MCOR.  Advanced installer said the same thing BMW said...not acrylic.  Install looks great, no issues at all.   I would find someone other than MCOR.

Drove by many times, parking was an issue. Finally stopped by on our bicycles. The service was A1 but the hot dog and fries were a bit to be desired. The bun was dry considering it's supposed to be a "steamy". We must have got the bottom of the fryer fries,?hard and crunchy.

Plus over 25 minutes to get a hotdog???? despite quite a few people behind the counter?

The estimate cost was $3500 the final cost $3915.40. They added on shop fee, the taxes and Told me he would give me $100 off my final cost but the price was still above the quoted price. I asked Charlie, who was very rude with me, on explaining the estimate was not really the final cost but all these fees needed to be added. I was driving home and the engine light came on so I had to take it back to their shop. They keep it several more days, and when I picked it up, the car smelled like cigarettes and had been driven over 100 mi. used 1/2 tank of gas. I ask Charlie, who said, we gave it a good test drive. Charlie explained the problem was not his, but the torque converter they installed, it was NOT new as stated on the bill, it was a typo on the bill he said, he wanted my old  statement bill to change it. I left very unhappy with Charlie and AAmco, and after 4 calls have not heard back from customer service.

Glenn H.

Walking in you think WOW! What a cute boutique style hotel...then it's over...front desk was friendly enough but not too helpful with anything else...you get nothing at this hotel ...steep parking fee... no complimentary coffee/tea....no water any where except at $2 a bottle...unlike Hilton's that have both... free, and usually free parking too. 
Then there was our room...not clean and there was an empty plastic GALLON jug kicking around in it...when we left there was no "thank you" "how was everything" "hope to see you again"..just a guy with his head in his phone...
Oh, breakfast was decent if expensive. Rather do the regular brand and avoid the Boutique style until they learn how to pull it off...

Dealing with Comcast is excruciatingly painful.  Cust. Service w/ them is an oxymoron.  I've only received Cust. disservice.  Today I wasted another hour of my life after receiving a bogus bill dealing with 2 Comcast employees.  Comcast executives seem to be oblivious to their current customer desires.  If it wasn't that Comcast is permitted to operate as a virtual Monopoly, it would be bankrupt and like dinosaurs-Extinct.  I only hope that Comcast gets its comeuppance.
We were just served a burnt pizza. Didn't realize until we got home. How was this pizza ok' d by management?
Horrible place, looks like joint, smells horrible and the management is $hit. The hookah is not prepared well, the mixtures and flavored are whack. Don't waste your money.

I scheduled my appointment on a Friday for the upcoming Monday. My appointment was for 11AM Monday. I leave my house morning of which is 45 minutes away in plans to arrive 10 minutes early for the convenience of the business. 15 minutes before my appointment time, when I am 3 minutes away, I get a notification saying my appointment has been rescheduled to 11:30. They had TWO days to notify me this but instead do it 15 minutes before my appointment! I decide to wait in my car. I see someone has an appointment too that they showed up for so I'm not the only one who had this problem. During this time waiting I am paying for parking. 11:30 comes around and still no one is here. This is really inconvenient waste of my time driving, waiting and money on gas, parking. I wish this business had some respect for incoming customers. I wish I was able to comment on their service but didn't even get to receive any! This would've been my first time but I'll take my money and time elsewhere.

Food was decent however we waited 45 minutes for the food. I understand being busy, but the frittata does not take long to cook it should have honestly been pre-made then heated upon ordering. Iced funky monkey was great but I would not return for another long wait

Honestly nothing spectacular just some sandwiches & bagels w standard regular normal sandwiches. No surprised on the menu. Eat at the demise if there roof of your mouth because they bake the bagels too long & dry out the whole thing for an exaggerated unnecessary crunch. Poppy seed bagel was good but my mouth hurts lmao

Where should I start? To say we were rushed through our meal would be an understatement. To put things in perspective I'll provide you with a little timeline.
7:15pm walked from our hotel in Philadelphia 
7:30pm arrived at the restaurant for our reservation
7:40pm served appetizers
7:50pm served dinner
8:15pm dessert
8:30pm check
We literally had elbows and arms flying all over the place, served by like 100 different people, never really had a chance to get comfortable, couldn't have a conversation. Even paying the bill was like a 50 yard dash. Before I could even close the book one of the servers reached over me to grab it asking if I was finished. If you ever want to experience how uncomfortable it is to eat in a lions den come here for dinner.

I bought a 2015 Chevy Malibu from ARMEN dealership in May 2017. The sales person was VERY accommodating. He offered me the PLLATINUM PROTECTION PLAN. I declined. After I declined, the finance rep, STEVE, said that he had been there for years and that he used this plan himself and that the insurance company paid for a new tire immediately over the phone. STEVE assured me that the same courtesies would be extended to me if I were to get the same plan. It seemed too good to be true so I declined again. That was when STEVE became aggressive with me and really pushed the issue. Eventually, I said okay to the PLATNIUM PROTECTION PLAN. Fast forward three weeks and I had a flat tire. I call this "protection plan" and they informed me that they do not pay for flat tires to be fixed at any place of your choice nor do they provide payment over the phone. They must inspect the tire, determine the fault of the flat tire and there is no guarantee that you will get it fixed or a replacement. However, my fee of $1000.00 was guaranteed to ARMEN and it was paid via my credit card. STEVE, the aggressive, pushy finance person lied to gain a sale. He misrepresented the plan and now, I'm out of $1000.00. Also, while STEVE said that the plan offered 24 towing, the tow can only be to an ARMEN service and you have to be close to ARMEN because they only tow within a  specific amount of mileage to the dealership otherwise you pay. 


I tried to cancel my plan because it was useless and a scam... 

Steve from financing  told me to call the PLATINUM PROTECTION PLAN to cancel and PLATINUM PROTECTION PLAN told me to call ARMEN DEALERSHIP. After months of no returned phone calls from STEVE. I went to the dealership. I was belittled, dismissed, disrespected and lied to AGAIN! STEVE informed me that I was the only person in 10 years to want a refund. That was a LIE! The woman who commented before me had an issue as well. 
 

STEVE from financing is a LIAR and he will say anything to get your money. STEVE never apologized. I am disappointed in this business and I will be sure to tell everyone I can DO NOT GO HERE EVER! ....AND DONT TRUST LYING STEVE FROM FINANCING! 


PS: STEVE used the owner as "bait" to close the deal. He said that the owner was hands on and very big on customer service.... THAT WAS A LIE! I never spoke to anyone after the deal was closed.. OWNER, if you read this FIRE STEVE! He does not provide honest customer service.

Strolled in a good two to three hours post opening time and they A) had a 10 minute wait for tea to be made and B) had no boba prepared. Was told it would be at least at 40 minute wait.

Having walked close to a mile to check out the boba at a boba place only to discover that the boba shop had no boba, I was pretty disappointed in this boba shop. Boba. 

Marshmallow drink was fine, hard to drink and not sure how well it matched. Ambiance is cute. But without boba this boba shop kinda sucks.

I gave it a 1-star because no star is not an option. We ordered via drive-thru and asked for mild sauce. Not only did they not give us the sauce but the food was cold and our drinks were given to us in smaller cups with no ice. Worst Taco Bell ever! Shame...

We went for brunch, and I don't think any of us will be back.  We enjoyed the decor, cappuccinos, and disco fries.  Other than that, it fell flat.  We really wanted to like this place.  The egg dishes were overcooked with little flavor and the avocado toast (which was on a roll) was unappetizing.  Colleagues went the week before and got disco fries and burgers which were good.  I hope it improves.

My two item order was served incorrectly and with attitude.  I always ask for my breakfast sandwich on a plate, and it is almost always served in a bag.  Besides being wasteful (and face it, Starbucks is pretty self-righteous about environmental friendliness), it is represents that getting a very simple order correct is unimportant.  I can't imitate in writing the attitude I received when I said the order was to be on a plate, but it was not friendly nor did she offer to make the order correct.
I visit Starbucks less and less, and this one often reminds me of how employee attitude affects workplace atmosphere and customer satisfaction.
I just ate my bacon, gouda, and egg sandwich and it was cold in the middle.

Nice cozy Italian restaurant. Cool lights on the outside shaped like an Italian flag is easy to spot at nighttime. Stopped in on a Saturday night to a full dining room and had to sit on the patio. No worries about that the weather was beautiful. Smoking is allowed on the patio which is a big turnoff while eating. Especially when employees come out and smoke there on there break.

Food is reasonably priced. We started with a salad, French onion soup, and some complimentary bread sticks and marinara. Soup was over the top salty and not good. Salad and bread were above average.

For entrees we chose blackened chicken with fettuccine alfredo, chicken marsala, and manicotti. Chicken marsala was awful. Every one in the party took one bite and agreed. Being a special I would never run it again cause the chef obviously has no clue how to make it. Blackened chicken dish was below average.  Chicken was ok but Alfredo sucked, sauce being pasty and bland. Manicotti was the best dish and can't knock it at all.

Service was good our waitress being very efficient. The pour on a glass of wine was awesome. Food just wasn't very good. 
.
She told me 5 to 15 min, called back 45 min later and told me 5 to 15 more min, they totally screwed us do not call this crappy service

We stopped here for the night after a long long day of driving. We wanted to check out Indianapolis as it was pretty much mid point or a little beyond mid point from where we were coming from.  But luckily we found this place as we stayed out just one night.  When we got here the staff that was attending was saying  that they were pretty much booked up for the night.

We got our keys and headed to our room on the first floor, and when we got to the door I tried to get in... But nope, the door wouldn't open. It felt as if the latch was stuck and the door handle couldn't turn all the way. So I went back to the attending person and he came down and tried to open it. It took him several tries and more force until it finally swung open.

Inside, it was a hotel room. Nothing special, except this room was super old. You know those styling choices you made back in the 90's that aren't really up to date anymore? Yeah. That's what it was like. However, there's new hope for this place. The staff said that they were planning for renovations, which is sorely needed. 

I've definitely been to a better Marriott, but hey it was only for one night and we checked in around midnight. If you stay here they might have started renovating or already renovated so your experience could differ.

Our first time to the movie traven to see Mary Poppins.  The movie started at 2:20. We arrived in theater at 2:15, order taken in about 10 minutes, drinks and appetizers arrived in a very timely manner. Then the movie started. At 3 pm our dessert arrived (warm brownie with ice cream) I told the server we wanted lunch first. I called the waitress twice to see where our food was and she gave us a dismissive answer. 3:45 lunch arrived.  10 minutes later the same dessert was reserved (brownie cold and ice cream melted). This was a very unhappy visit and we will never be back.

Got introduced to this place by the Mrs. and to tell you the truth, was not all that impressive. Food was ok upon eating the order that was placed before arrival. The Mrs. for the most part took care of the order and was familar aith most of the food that was being ordered based on the site. Some of the food was questionable (wraps in light plastic wrap) to decent (chicken with a peanut based sauce).  Needless to say, although I respect alot of cultures and have a wide open palate when it cones to trying carious foods, I came into this dining experience with an open mind but did not have the best experience with the food that they prepared. Very willing to try this place down the line.

I enjoyed the pizzas when management changed. Then one visit I watched a guy enter the building after smoking a cigarette and not wash his hands before working with food. I was very disappointed, especially considering the new manager and/or owner was a few feet away from him when this happened. I question the cleanliness of the establishment and workers.

Ordered spaghetti, short ribs, gnocchi, chicken, duck, fish of the day, and steak. Also got a couple sides.  

We sat outside for dinner.  While nice, the St. Charles streetcar passed by like three times while we ate and it is L. O. U. D. 

A few dishes (spaghetti, chicken, fries) were waaaaaaaaaay too salty.  Food wasn't to my liking. Sauces were a miss for me. Either too salty or too bland (fish of the day). 

We ate at two fine dining joints in NOLA and in terms of service, one placecan can be described as inclusive, Herbsaint as exclusive. 

Food wise, Herbsaint doesn't come close to any Michelin starred joint I've eaten at.  I've eaten at Restaurant Andre in Singapore and dropped $700 by myself, and considered that to be worth it.  Spent $600 at Ryugin. Worth it. $400 at Sukiyabashi Jiro Roppingi Hills.  Worth. Herbsaint?  Definitely not worth the $250 we dropped on it.   Any Joel Robuchon joint murks Herbsaint so bad, it's like the Warriors playing a high school team. 

Don't get me wrong, NOLA knows how to do food right. I love NOLA.  love the people, love the food, love the music, don't care for the fine dining.

My daughter took her Escape to Mister today on Front Street.  Their machines deeply scratched the back windshield.  Of course the management denied they caused it.  It's a new car and it did not have any scratches when she went into the car wash.  I don't appreciate telling my daughter that she was basically lying and the scratches were already there.  Clearly we have better things to do than deal with this and wouldn't be so unhappy if Mister just took responsibility and fixed the damage.  Our family will NEVER go back if they don't make it right and will encourage others to find another car wash as well.

Ordered a cab for a couple who are visiting from another country, was told 15 min wait. The driver called to confirm the trip but NEVER SHOWED UP!! When I called an hour into the wait there was no answer to either phone number!
Will definitely not call this company again!!

Please read the whole thing, you'll be glad you did.
This place was a very interesting experiance to say the least. We couldn't come to terms and to be honest I wasn't happy with the value they were giving me for my trade. 
Who ever is, lol.
Anyways within a few minutes of me leaving the dealership the sales person Tiffany is texting me telling me saying she can get the manager to give me $400 more for my trade and that if I came back she would give me $500.00 to put down as a downpayment....I told her to keep her money because (a). Its against the amvic rules for her to even offer that and (b.) Who in there right mind would make such a offer???
I gave tiffinay my terms and told her I'd be back only if they would accept them. 
She got back to me and and told me she needed a deposit to show her boss I was serrious. I laughed and said sure why not. I gave the $500 via my visa and Tiffany sent me a picture text with the receipt for not only my $500 but another one she says is her $500 to put towards my purchase.....now this seems completely insane to me but whatever right.
Next message from her told me that her manager accepted my offer. Perfect right?
I gave my info to the finance office and
the next day She sends me a image of the bill of sale from the finance office as my wife was aproved.  I picked up right away that they had built $500 into the deal and you guessed it they put
$500.00 in the dealerships favor by lowering the expected payout on my trade by exactly $500......so as I suspected her $500 although not expected and not asked for was nothing more than some sort of numbers game used to trick people into thinking they are getting something they are not. 
I know this sounds crazy and I wouldn't be surprised if you don't believe me, but msg me and I'll send you the texts and a pic of her card  so you can see the phone number and the texts belong to Tiffany at Go Kia South
 Don't deal with people who lie, don't deal with Kia on the south side. I called the dealership back and spoke with a manager, I forwarded the messages and proof of the fraud to him and he seemed disappointed but ultimately never called me back within 24 hours as he promised. Baised on that action I would assume this is normal practice for them and they don't really care, if they cared they would of called back.
I'll be going to AMVIC with this as I think they should be made aware of this fraudulent activity.

I am so surprised this restaurant got 4 stars. If you like home cooking then don't go here unless you don't have a good pallet. They have deteriorated since I went there as a kid. I find them very expensive considering most of the sides are from a box or can( vegetables, mac'n cheese). I've been here about 4 times but was so outdone with the 3 small pieces of catfish which looked like chicken tenders and was so crispy it was dry and Mac 'n cheese which had a cheese powder over the noodles. Yuk -very processed. These 2 items were $8. I wanted something other than fast food- I should have had fast food. I left and went to another restaurant. Will not return.
Had coffee and lunch there. Understaffed. Poor, poor service to get drinks and then to pay bill. May return because it's close to 465, but very unhappy with this location.

I just moved to the area and figured I'd check this out.  I should have known something was off since it was 6 pm on a Friday and not a single person was there.  We went in for the $5 sangria special that was being advertised on their sign out front.  The sangria was awful.  I mean really awful.  It tasted like 80% lime juice with a splash of wine.  The lime, lemon, and apple slices in there were rotten.  My friend (who it doesn't take much to please) didn't even want to finish the drink.  Then we go to pay and the one bartender overcharged us for the drinks.  I said something to her, and I flat out heard the other bartender say "I originally rang their sangrias in as $5, why did you change the price?"  Are you serious???  I will never return again.

So the one on S Meadows Parkway is my jam. This one? Not so much. Placed an online order for pickup at 5:16, got to Jersey Mike's at 5:17, walked in, and told them who I was. After very little acknowledgement and 5 minutes of searching they find my subs and tell me have a good day, no receipt or anything.

Get home, both subs are lukewarm (I live less than 5 minutes away) and the rosemary bread I ordered isn't in either bag, instead just their standard white. Both subs aren't cut, at all, which one down the center would have made sense for a medium.

On the plus side, it tasted good, but man, this location totally dropped the ball.

The total of my food charge was $288 & I tipped $50 as I trusted I would get the portion sizes I've gotten in the past-$338 total!  Look at the pics and tell me if this is $288 worth of food?!!
 I used to really love this place and had ordered fajitas for parties at my house in the past but I totally got ripped off on this last order. I ordered steak and chicken fajitas, like I've done on 2 prior occasions and the portion sizes were pathetic for the amount of money I was charged($100 more than previously). I paid when I placed  the order as I've done on prior occasions. The day of the party I sent my husband to pick up the food.  He didn't know what I ordered so he was just my errand boy, so to speak. When I saw the pitiful trays of half full fajitas, I was mortified!  I called and spoke to Jose, the owner, and told him how displeased I was and asked him what he could do to remedy the problem.  The problem was I paid $288 for portions that were more like $100 worth! He basically told me he couldn't and wouldn't do anything about it and eventually hung up on me!  I'm outraged by his lack of customer service and complete denial that I had been overcharged! I ended up order pizzas and wings from Vincent's to supplement the lack of food I had for my guests. I will never, ever eat or order from Carisma Mexican Restaurant in Skippack and feel that I was completely screwed over!

What a nightmare!! We are in Philadelphia for the NAFSA convention and we booked at the Sheraton Philadelphia Downtown. First off, the guy with the handkerchief in his jacket pocket at the reception had a chip on his shoulder. We flew in from Los Angeles on a redeye flight, got into the hotel at around 7 AM and were super tired. We asked this guy if he would be kind enough to let us check in earlier by giving us a call as we waited in the vicinity. He callously said "okay" without even asking for our telephone number. We knew right then he really was not into helping us.

At $175 per night, we had to pay $15 a day for Internet connection. There was only a tiny bottle of shampoo and a small bar of soap. When we asked for body wash, we were told that's only available to guests on the upper floors. On our second day, we ran out of shampoo and tried to call the reception to ask for another tiny bottle of shampoo. The phone rang for a good 5 minutes with no one answering. This was at around 11:30 PM. We had no choice but to get dressed to go downstairs to the reception to ask for an extra bottle of shampoo. The lady at the reception acted in the same callous manner as the guy with the chip on his shoulder. No apologies whatsoever.

The carpet in our room is warped. The front entrance to the hotel was littered. There were smears and fingerprints on the revolving door. 

I travel extensively and stay at other Sheraton properties in other parts of the world. This has to be the WORST Sheraton hotel I ever stayed at. 

This is my first online review of anything since I'm usually too busy to write. However, this time I couldn't help but to start writing this review because I don't want my fellow travelers to make the same mistake as we did by staying at the Sheraton Philadelphia Downtown.

I hope the corporate office of Sheraton will take note of my and many other negative reviews of this particular property and try to protect their goodwill and namesake by proactively improving their service and make necessary changes.

Late lunch with grown kids - We should have   know when we walked into the large cavernous room that was at best 65 degrees on a 32 degree day that the food would be as chilly as the room.  Waiter was great - high energy and was accommodating in drinks, refills of chips and salsa and easily took our order.  What he couldn't help was the oddness of the food - the black beans were swimming in a salt water mix with a few onions, the fish tacos came with a vat of odd mayo and the refried beans were just...bland.  No taste.  Thankfully the chips and salsa were excellent and we ate with our coats on.   Maybe it's great in the summer with a margarita, but without flavor and some heat... will pass.
The food is good but the restaurant is not clean. It makes it hard to trust the food.

If I had time to read the reviews before hand, I would never have made the mistake of using this company to handle my restoration services.  On December 29, 2018, my condo flooded.  My insurance recommended that I use vendors that they had worked with in the past:  Peerless and Bobby Pages.  We were very distraught with the damage so we called Scott who runs Peerless pick up and delivery service. He came in and surveyed the damage and gave us this schpiel on how much experience his company has and ofcourse how much better they were than Bobby Pages. (whatever).  He gave us a timeline of 3 weeks which was fine.  To his credit there were some work clothes I needed right away and he was able to get them back to me the next day.  For that I will give this review 1 star.  
We got one delivery of a few items like snow boots and blankets with the promise that the remainder would be coming in the following Monday. 
We heard nothing all week.  I had to call him and he tells me he is taking the day off in Tahoe. He blamed the plant for not finding all our bags of clothes and that would call them and call us back.  We got "crickets".It has been a series of excuse after excuse as to why he has not delivered the remaining items.  We have been back in our condo for  a week and a half and we have no drapes to put up on our front windows.  A 3 week delivery window is quickly turning into 4 weeks.Needless to say I will be letting my insurance adjuster know to take this company off their list of vendors and on every avenue of social media warning people to stay away from this incompetent company!!!

Two stars are for the coolness of the servers; all hipsters with tattoos, some fashion hair colors, fun piercing and all! The owner obviously has a fun style and it shows I his/her choice of staff.

Restaurant has a fun atmosphere but there are very few decent seatings. We were once place at the very back of the restaurant at the bar in front of the kitchen, there was so much smoke and noise, we wouldn't have enjoyed our food even if it was excellent which was not the case!

Ok! The food is bad! The menu looks exciting with dishes with intriguing names, but all of the many items (except for one) that I tried were simply bad! Many items are deep fried, over seasoned and very salty. As a personal chef of a vegan person I understand the predicaments of getting good flavors without meats and dairies but adding spices and salt and deep frying is certainly not the answer.   

I liked the presentation of the dishes but other than the dessert beignets (deep fried and unhealthy but delicious) nothing tasted good to me.

Average Mexican fare. The Margaritas are good and the service is decent, EXCEPT for one busy night when we stood at the bar waiting for a table. The bartender completely ignored us while making drinks for others. He looked straight at us, and wouldn't say a word, not even "Be with you in a minute". After 10 minutes, it almost got to be a joke, except it wasn't really funny. There is no excuse for willful ignorance from a waiter or bartender. I now avoid this restaurant unless my friends are going there. One bad experience is enough for me.

jason aldean does not know a damn thing about food, drinks, or hospitality. 

hang out here long enough and you'll start breathing from your mouth like everyone else there.
Rude wait staff.  Food is OK but employees make you feel like you are doing them a favor by being there. It is a shame for the owner.  He should review his hiring criteria.
They sent two estimators and neither one ever went on the roof or sent an estimate. I called twice to find out what was going on and received no help. Unprofessional and unacceptable.

I've been in the store twice. The staff there is less than friendly. I'm a regular consignment store shopper (Epic before they went out of business, Ricochet, Recycled Room, Kidz Again, etc) and I've also consigned items. These other locations everyone is really nice and personable. I've never purchased or consigned with Renewed Expressions but based on the clerks at the store I won't be back.

Not so great tonight. I have eaten here many times. I had the tostadas. Really glorified nachos. The meat carne asada was tasteless. Use a little garlic or spices. I told my waitress and she said sorry. She never refilled drinks. Our quac was so small for 6 people that not everyone got a serving. Not a good experience tonight. My glass still has the tag on it. Not so clean!

Horrible experience..., and am a Diamond member for 7years now and this is the worst Hilts n property I have ever been to.

No care for customers let alone loyal Diamond customers...

I am on the verge of shifting to Marriott!!!

If I could put 0 stars... I would.

Horrible costumer service from everyone at this company! Called to inquire about houses for sale in the area and whomever answered the phone apparently did not have time for me, a customer. She rudely answered the phone, cut me off mid sentence and then put me on hold until I eventually hung up. The "Realtors" act like you are inconveniencing them and barely make eye contact.

Horrible experience, never seen any worse customer service in Santa Barbara! I am sorry, but you have to take care of your customers well. I literally got so heated up that I felt the necessity to open a YELP account to post my first review ever. Being not satisfied with the communication at the cashier my first time, it was the second time I was there and I told them I had to be back at work and that I had limited time. After 25 minutes what I had in return was a return receipt on my hands with not even a proper apology. Not even mentioning their AXXESS card management. Speechless; they treat you like you're taking their money away from them. I've gotten similar feedback from my girlfriend and my business partner within only two weeks. Two bad experiences and a couple negative feedbacks, it's a fail!
Place sucks.... Room smells like cat piss.  Lobby so warm its cooler outside at pool bar 86 degrees out lol... Shithole stay away.... Sleep in your car you'll be better off

This place is a rip off! Last time I was in here I felt like I was overcharged. This time I am positive!  I put a stack of quarters in my left pocket and transferred 1 to my right each time I ordered a drink. They overcharged me $24 and refused to fix it! I will never go back to Georgia's!

Last time my new every two contact expired I went to this store and they said Verizon no longer offers a discount after two years. Then why is it in my Verizon app?! So I waited two years for no discount. Surprise, surprise, whenever I go into this store they say that I am on the old plan. This is a total scam just to get me on a more expensive plan. It's never a cheaper plan. Then when I asked how much the new plan is, just like another reviewer mentioned, it's crickets. The staff always need to check the computer to see how much it will cost even though the do this same routine hundreds of times a day. 
Then they take 15 minutes just pressing multiple buttons on their iPad acting like they don't know what the ballpark cost will be per month. I just walked out and use my iPhone 6 it works just fine. Screw Apple and Verizon! Corporate garbage.

I'm very disappointed; I order over the phone the young lady couldn't understand  my order repeated atleast 4 times.
Once I received my $20 order food was cold,fish was small, bread/hushpuppies hard as bricks, didn't receive any garlic-butter sauce. 
Waste of time and money!!

So many things wrong with this place. I'll start with the worst. The guy rolling my burrito rolled it directly on my tray. When I said something to him about it, he acted like it was no big deal, as if this is normal procedure and he didn't understand that this is not normal. The next thing is the communication barrier, they had multiple people working here and no one really spoke English. The food tasted good, but I couldn't get over the fact that it was rolled on the tray.

Let's start out with the good, our waitress was awesome she was very sweet n attentive to all our needs.
We started with fresh bread killer, homemade whipped butter,so good so far
My girlfriends fried shrimp came very good. Bad was the fries how do you mess up fries in a 5 Star restaurant?????
Now my steak n lobster came out,here we go bad things fixing to come to truth, I ordered the most expensive steak you could order,it was a bone in ribeye 53 bucks with a lobster tail 22 bucks.
The steak came n lobster I ordered medium, steak came out well done ugggggggg. The lobster came out it was cold.   Wtf
So she came and took my dinner back while my girlfriend was eating hers.
Finally the manager came to our table told us he was sorry for the delay.
My 2nd steak came after another 15 more minuets of waiting. What a disaster it came out way under cooked almost tar tar. I called manager over again told him I wasn't happy with this crap. He compt all my drinks and food.  I wouldn't ever think about coming here.  They can't cook a steak right. Geeezz

So, I get the wrong pizza, call the store, they say they'll remake it and send it out. Over an hour later, I call the store back to ask where my pizza is. "Oh the driver forgot it so it's probably cold by now. Do you want us to remake it?" No. No, I don't. "Ok we'll refund you for the pizza." Waiting, waiting... "Ok there's a $20 coupon on your account." No thanks, I want my money back. Guy proceeded to tell me he didn't think they could do that, manager clearly had no desire to speak with me, eventually caved and just gave me my money back. My advice? Spend your Saturday night watching paint dry, it will be more enjoyable than dealing with these nimrods.

Everything here was eh.  Food.  Ambience.  Service.  All mediocre.  We started with a salmon small plate.  It wasn't great. I had the bronzino which was overdone and the presentation was a bit of a hot mess.  Wife's pasta dish was okay.  The drinks were good!  The desert was where it fell apart-  ricotta donuts did not come as advertised.  Was really just a bowl of hot over fried dough.  I'll chalk it up to a bad night.  Probably won't try it again.

Worst food ever. If I could give zero stars I would. They got rid of the only decent thing they had- the rotisserie chicken. Would not even know where to begin with the issues.  Be smart just avoid this place. I wasted $70 on garbage.

This place is a dump. I went because my little sister liked it back in the day and it is TERRIBLE. The food is subpar and the place smells like old mildew or mold. The staff is HORRIBLE, there is some guy that follows you around to clean after you and see what you are eating. VERY uncomfortable. This place needs to close. What a waste of a location and space.

Me and my coworkers have been going to this location for lunch ever since it opened. The service has been fantastic until today. I'm a little upset that my grilled cheese today was moldy and had lots of pickles on it even though the box said no pickles!! The manager was very apologetic and handled it well. My issue is with the kitchen staff who failed to notice the mold. I don't understand how they managed to cook it thinking it was ok to send out like that. Even with this bad experience the staff is friendly and they still have the best grilled cheese around!

We have gone to many escape rooms around the country while on vacations. And always had good times.

We try to find medium difficulty so that our adult son with down syndrome can fully participate when he joins us.  He couldn't  participate  as much as usual here. 

 We chose the pirate plunder and asked them to set for kids level since he was with us. They acknowledged and set it up. When we stopped at an hour I mentioned this was not kid friendly,  they responded  that it was their hardest one. What????

Clues were NOT  clear.  And were a  minute or two after us in a a few cases. In one case my daughter spent 15 minutes  with one lock because they wanted us to read an h as I (sideways). Locks should be clear on whether need 4 or 6 digits or a word. I wasted  time on important lock that needed word not numbers ( the other of same type had 6 digits)

If you must go there,  get their groupons or many coupons  or discounts.  We didn't, but that happens when you are on vacation 

Management,  I suggest that your game master  is key to escape room satisfaction.  Not sure if game master  and hostess communicated well.

Super small restaurant.  We walked in with 5 people and they couldn't seat us together, which was disappointing.  I've been vegetarian for 10 years, and honesty I'm tired of these tiny overpriced veg restaurants.  Being vegan/vegetarian does not mean eating pricey fancy foods in claustrophobic restaurants that can only fit small parties or people going on dates.  Everytime I try these places, I feel ripped off and never want to go back.  I always end up preferring regular restaurants with veg options that don't cost an arm & a leg and can seat your party comfortably.

The food -- I ordered the Spicy Dan Dan Noodles (see picture) and it was blah because it was drenched in sauce so you can barely taste the noodles, and the sauce was drenched in hotness so you can barely taste the other flavors commingled in the sauce.  Lastly, it was Very expensive for such a small dish.  $14!!!

This place hits your wallet and it doesn't feel worth it.

My family and I had Thanksgiving dinner there.  It was such a disappointment.  The service was slow and unfriendly.  Some of the food was good, but my filet was not cooked to order.  Even though we had reservations and are very nice people, we felt unwelcome. Thankfully, we have a wonderful sense of humor and will laugh about this for years to come.  However, we'll never go back to the Ship Inn until there is a change in management.

I was in the area and needed a quick bite.  Why not sugar rush myself before a big meeting,  right? I wanted to get white milk and two donuts.... They have all but white milk.  Sorry,  not a strawberry or chocolate milk fan.  No,  I do not want juice or coffee.  I order three donuts... Maple bacon eclair for a coworker,  sourcream cake and chocolate cream for me. I get the first donut ordered but the waitress taking my order stops and answers the phone before I can't spit out the rest of my order then hand motions the other cashier to finish my order. Note,  no washing and and no gloves between taking cash and getting my food.  My total was $3.36 for 2 donuts.  I have to spend at least $4.50 before they will accept my card.  I have no cash with me.  No sign announcing this.  I have waited in line and while being helped because the counter girl answered the phone during my order.  I keep an emergency $100 folded in the back of my wallet. I pull it out and they do not have enough change. At this point I'm like shove the donuts up your ass and take some customer service lessons. Have no ideas if the donuts are good since I could not pay for them.  Thank you for making me look like a jerk off who can't pay for a few donuts.

So frustrated with this place anymore. I have had the occasional hiccup with service before, I have been overcharged more than once, been unable to find any parking. I Had someone call in and pay for service as a gift, only to not have it applied. 

While getting my lashes done in the end spa, all I could hear was a screaming young child that was in the back with the workers. I let management know and they assured me it wouldn't happen again. The child was still in the back screaming, when I returned 3 weeks later...while I was supposed to be soothed by spa music. This was about more than just paying for a service and being told this wouldn't happen again, a child was in the back with industrial cleaning equipment where no child belongs. I am not sure which bothers me more, that the management doesn't care about their customers or that they are aware of a child in an unsafe environment and did nothing about it. 
If it weren't for my amazing stylist, there would be no reason to ever go back.

Ordered a Italian hoagie and a pizza , when the driver arrived she brought the hoagie and asked us to pay before we got the pizza ( something way out of the normal for us ) we eventually convinced her to give of the pizza and we still paid & tipped & when we got the pizza it was obvious that something happened before we received it . Cheese & toppings were thrown over the crust and what we ordered ( which was I a half & half ground beef & meatlovers pizza became A bunch of pizza toppings just thrown over a pizza & all over the place ....

I'm giving this 1 star only because you can't pick 0. I waited in line for over and hour here last Saturday only to pull in the bay and have them tell me they had just used the last filter that would fit my car! On top of that there was no apologizing or remorse. When I asked if they were kidding me, the guy smirked at me and told me something along the line of, 'That's just how it goes! Have a great day.' After I left and pulled into the the next place I went to get the service checked my tires one was over inflated significantly. This was just minutes after they had inflated it while checking my fluids outside the bay because the lines were so long that day.
Will absolutely never go back and advice anyone to avoid this place. Rapid Lube just down the road took great care of me.

I've never been compelled to write a restaurant review, most seem so petty. From a indifferent waitress, watery drinks, to a chef(cook) to has no clue, Finnegan's Pub ranks as one of my wife's and my dining disasters. Run like the wind to a McDonalds before any expectation of decent food or service is crushed and you are questioning the meaning of life itself. No we did not have a good experience.

For some reason, it seems as though the food businesses along this strip don't seem do very well (from an outside customer's opinion), which is really interesting because the establishments right around the corner on Walnut street seem to thrive (again, an outside customer's opinion). 

Hatch & Coop recently replaced Jake's sandwich board (which I had been meaning to try out), but to be honest, I'm not quite sure how long this place will last. 

The food is really not worth the price. I came during a promotion at opening, and their chicken sandwiches seem to mimic Chik-Fil-A but more costly and less tasty. The portions are tiny; the guys definitely did not consider it a meal. I also wish they served at least tap water, because we were forced to buy bottled water given our thirst. At least the interior seating is nice, and there are two nice large center tables to accommodate groups as well. I personally wouldn't go again, and would probably rather pick up food at the 24/7 Fresh Grocer right across the street, which is saying something.

I tried to give Safari another chance today... despite the fact that their prices are way high and the quality of the wash is medium at best. 

So, I drove over there to get my car washed and arrived at 3:58. Apparently, they close at 4:00. As I was pulling in, the attendant stopped me to put the closed sign up and would not let me through. I asked if she could cut me a break since it was 3:58, and I had driven all the way over there.... nope! And she was not nice about it!

This really is the last straw with Safari. The attendant gets to go home a few minutes early today, but  In return, I will never bring my car there again.

Working with Love, Leon (formerly Krauter photography) was the most stressful part of planning our wedding. We were profoundly disappointed with the lack of client-care, honesty and communication throughout the entire process, even in the delivery of photos.

We hired Lauren + Casey because we liked their style, we wanted a husband/wife duo and we wanted Indy locals (we live in Los Angeles, our wedding was in my hometown of Indianapolis). We were happy to hear that Lauren, like us, felt it was important to meet in-person to talk vision + prep before the wedding. We agreed to meet in the June and July months when I was scheduled to fly home to Indianapolis. After hiring Love, Leon and putting down our 50% deposit, we felt that Lauren's interest in us and our wedding ended.

At the beginning of June, I reached out to Lauren to set + confirm our first in-person meeting. Lauren informed us that she and her husband (2nd shooter) were moving to Germany at the end of the week and she would be unable to meet until the afternoon before my wedding day. As I probed further, she admitted that Casey was no longer available to shoot the wedding and she had already hired a new 2nd shooter. When I searched for this photographer online, I came up blank. There was no Instagram, no website, no reviews and no verifiable online presence of her work. Lauren supplied us with two private links to photos, but asked me to "trust her on this one" even though she had never shot a wedding with this person.

We begged for our deposit back. Because so much had changed, we wanted to go with another photographer and part ways with no hard feelings. She refused to make an exception and informed us that she would be keeping our deposit regardless of our decision. We didn't have the budget to pay another photographer without getting that $1,650 deposit back, so we had to proceed with Lauren and try to make the best of this new situation.

Her demeanor on the day-of was good and she handled herself well with our bridesmaid photos. The only thing that struck me as odd & unprofessional was when she asked the Matron of Honor to buy her an Uber home during the reception. 

After delivering the photo galleries, we noticed that a vast majority of the family and group shots were blurry. The trees behind us were focused, but all of our faces were out-of-focus.  I reached out to Lauren asking for sharper versions that were suitable for printing and using in a photo book. At this point, she admitted that she had made a mistake with her camera during our group photo session and she did not have any in-focus photos of our wedding party, the bride's family, the bride + groom's family or my grandparents. 

I was stunned. I reached out to some professional photographer friends to see if anyone could salvage the images. I received an overwhelming response that this was not a camera setting issue, but rather a fundamental photography-skill issue. A photographer may occasionally slip into back-focus for one or two frames out of a hundred, but anyone who bills themselves as a professional would see this mistake after a shot or two and fix it immediately on-site preventing further blurry photos. 
They were all stunned to find out that she hadn't fixed it on-location, and further than she hadn't owned up to the rookie mistake upon delivery. She waited to see if we would catch it. The whole thing just doesn't sit well with me. 

All this to say - Love, Leon added stress to the wedding process rather than alleviating it. Maybe it was a one-time mistake, but I wouldn't recommend taking that risk on your wedding day. If you're a bride or groom who values communication, transparency and an overall positive experience in wedding planning, I would urge you to explore other photographers in Indy. 

**NOTE: As a courtesy, I let Lauren know in advance that we would be sharing our honest experience on this platform. In response, she offered + provided a 50% refund for the $3,600 contract and apologized as she understands that nothing can replace the fact that these images were not captured. She will "use this as an opportunity to learn and grow."**
