Good initial sales experience.  Very knowledgeable sales person (Dean) but you should still do your own homework.  Very knowledgeable about tow vehicles and the product he was selling.   During the initial sales communication we were impressed by the service available at follow up but that changed as the paperwork was being signed and during my first call for service.  We (my wife and I) were originally told that the first winterization would be complementary and if we did the annual roof inspection "x" amount of roof sealant would be complementary, if needed, during the inspection.  When we asked the finance person about the roof sealant he was unaware of any such service and when I called for the winterization I was told that they do not do that service unless I had a coupon from the sales person (which I didn't).  I left a voicemail for the salesperson at that time and he informed there was no documentation in the sales paperwork of that agreement.  In addition I had emailed the salesperson twice with no response days after the initial sale about a question regarding towing suggestions (he is a very good resource) and received no response.  He was outstanding responding to emails prior to the sale but after that there was no response (possibly his email server was down?).  During our PDI there were a couple concerns (they fixed many quick issues while I waited that night) that we feel needed to be addressed before delivery but the sales person assured us that there will be other concerns that arise over the first year and it's best do rectify them all at that time.  I will provide a follow up after that service.  Overall average sales experience but Dean is a very knowledgeable salesperson, initial impression appears that the service should be good when you schedule well in advance and plan to stay and wait for some service, great location if you live in or close to STL.

Totally unimpressed. Been eating Good, Bad and Ugly Philadelphia cheese steaks for about 45 years - been wanting to try this place since it opened 5 yrs ago. The location is great, the design of the place is decent (nice heated little seating area), and the staff was nice enough, but clueless on how to move a line of 11 people in less than than 20 minutes. (Reminded us of the ridiculous, unnecessary long lines at Tony Luke's.) 
issues:
1- The meat is seasoned with a quick, little sprinkle of salt and pepper - not enough to get the flavor/taste right.
2- We watched our meat being grilled from moment it was a hard frozen block - it didn't get any seasoning, so it was tasteless.
3- Meat doesn't cover the bread. Inch of just bread at each end of roll.
4- French's yellow mustard! Really? It's disgusting...got to at least offer spicy mustard too. 
5- No hot sauce
6- No hot peppers out. Asked for them, guy said they had them but forgot to give them to me.
7- The Aversa bread was a basic Amoroso style squishy/airy steak roll. Nothing to rave about.

My first visit to Naf Naf was to try a chicken rice bowl similar to the one's you can buy on the streets of NY from halal carts.  I ordered the rice with chicken, chopped salad (cucumber and tomato), cabbage, and pickles topped with garlic and the S'khug (green spicy sauce.)

The rice was fine but not that flavorful, the chicken was clearly old, as it was dried out, and didn't taste as if it had been marinated in anything. The other issue was the balance between the garlic sauce and the s'khug.. there was too much s'khug and it was not well distributed.  Net net, I have had better. I think if the ingredients were fresh, and the sauces were on the side the experience would have been better.

The pita is a good pita, but almost superfluous with a rice bowl, and the take out drink (san pellegrino blood orange soda) was good but I would have preferred the option of a well made lemonade or ice tea. 

I will return to try the falafel as they look to be quite good and the toppings remind me of Israeli falafel shops.  However their rice bowls will certainly not be in heavy rotation.

Have been going to Hansen's since early 60's.  Always have been the best snow balls ever.  Cream flavors are the best in N. O. (Chocolate, nectar & ice cream flavors) are our favorites. 

Went last weekend, the niece was not there and four guys that were there were "TEMPS", didn't know much about making snow balls.

But the worst thing about the snow balls was the complete lack of flavor of the syrup, ice was fine as snow, but the flavors were not there, BLAND, BLAND.

Did anyone else have this experience this weekend?

updating my review. i worked for this establishment on and off for four years. i was mistreated and underpaid. and when i decided to quit i was instantly "barred for life". i can't enjoy my old customers. i can't enjoy karaoke (which i love) and i have never been more upset in my life. i have been through physical assault, drug addicted employees, extensive work hours, and unprofessional work conduct. will never return - especially because i'm "not allowed"

Awful Customer Service! Good luck getting any help here, even if you ask.
My sweet elderly mother was redoing her bathrooms and contractor asked her to go and pick out some items.
After walking around and asking about 3 employees for help, she was given the cold shoulder or a simple, "I don't know." You don't know where vanities are? Really?!?
Then when she went to customer service and finally got someone to come to bathroom isle to help her, he was so dismissive and just rude!  She showed him her measurements for vanity and he said it was wrong! She said her contractor gave it to her. His response was for her to send her husband back, since she was confused. How inappropriate! And my mom is a widow, so no husband. What a jerk!
My husband already refuses to do business with Home Depot, so we weren't too surprised.
Go to one of the smaller surplus stores. Better prices and selections. And actual customer service.
There is a great one in Madison, by the Wyndsong Theater (Myatt Dr.) Can't think of the name right now, but that is where she ended up getting everything and they were wonderful!! And he measurements were written down correctly.

I decided to try United Buffet for the first time tonight, overall I was disappointed.  The quality of the service was, at best, mediocre.  The hostess saw me standing waiting to be seated, acknowledged I was there, and walked away, leaving me waiting for 10 minutes before being seated.  

The menu was advertised as Chinese/Japanese buffet, in reality I found a very small amount of Asian style dishes at the buffet, but a broad amount of fried chicken, fries, pizza, seafood, mac and cheese, and more of the like.  I tried the Asian dishes and found the buffet dishes bland and rather stale.  The sushi was limited and poor in quality, much the same as the prepackaged sort one might purchase at a supermarket.  The hibachi and poke grills were fresh and made to order.  

There were signs posted everywhere citing children under 10 years needed to be accompanied to get food, but the staff did nothing to enforce this, there were small/young children running all about who don't hesitate to run into patrons trying to get food.  

The furniture and facility on the whole seemed modern and cleanly.  

If I absolutely had to attend a buffet on the spot and had no other choices I'd patronize United Buffet again, otherwise I'm going to keep on the search for a buffet with better quality food and service elsewhere.

One star is too much for this place. Below is the post from a great friends of mine and the treatment received by a double amputee veteran and his service dog. 

"I have never seen such blatant discrimination as I did from this place last night. As our group began to walk in, the bouncer stopped a friend (who happens to be a double amputee and has a service dog) and would not allow him in with the dog. The bouncer said it was for safety reasons for the rest of the guests. He did offer to let him take the dog to the upstairs bar. "Great" we said "point us to the elevator"...no elevator so we were told "well, you're out of luck". We asked 4 different people to see a manager. After an hour a manager came. She said she would have come sooner but she was far too busy and can't come running for every little thing. While waiting for that hour we also tried to flag down numerous police to explain that it's a federal law that service animals be allowed to accompany their handlers. The reply...It's a civil matter. Finally after talking to the manager we were told we could enter. All we had to do was explain how the dog is of service. I think that's when they finally realized his handler has no legs. We walked in and said "you have a better shot at seeing Elvis than you do of any one of us spending money here" and walked right out. Best part of that hour is that I explained to everyone who was going in what was happening and 99% of them turned around and went elsewhere. Which is what I'll also ask of anyone reading this post. If you go to NOLA spend your money somewhere else!"

My husband and I rarely get a date night anymore, so when we do we usually stick to our tried-and-true faves. But last night we wanted to try something new. We learned our lesson, yet again. Honestly don't know where all the 5* are coming from. Did we eat at the same restaurant?
Love what they've done with the layout and decor, music was a little loud and the tables are awkwardly long so you have to shout... maybe I'm just getting old. Cutesy names cocktails were delicious when they finally arrived halfway through our first appetizer. 
First we got our broccolini and hummus with turnips/onions- no baba ghanoush but it probably takes longer to cook...  broccolini good but nothing special. Hummus was lovely especially with fluffy house made pita. Turkish wine red and white delicious- still no baba ghanoush- we order two more apps as entrees. 
A good 15-20 min after we finish "first course", waiter got snippy with my husband when he inquired about it. Excuse me?! It eventually arrives: a huge portion of an entire large eggplant topped with a mound of raw red onion and a pice if bread half the size of the eggplant. 
A couple minutes later our entire course arrives. Unimpressed to say the least. Husband has lamb kebabs and lettuce like a street cart and my $18 scallops consist of 2 medium sized over cooked over seasoned pieces on top of potato purée way too garlicky (didn't know there was such a thing) and salty green beans. 
Missed the mark by a long shot- food and service.

We love the Swah-rey further west on Central and tried this place for fun last night. The desserts are so delicious. I felt a little confused by the creme brûlée portion though? It was a mini sized creme brûlée? It's my go-to at the other location, but last night they young woman served it to me in a small foil container. It was no bigger than the size of my spoon yet the price was the same. See pic attached.  Also, I told her we were dining in yet she served me in to go containers. Wasteful.

I got delivery 3 times. All three times they sent me a burnt pizza. 

The food here is tasteless. The pizza is almost always burnt, little to no sauce, and is really salty. Every pasta dish i have had has hardly any flavor.

Not to mention the prices are extremely high for what you get. $15 on average for a pasta dish that fazzolis can do a better job of making. 

The menu looks legit, sounds tasty, and makes you believe you are getting authentic Italian food that is going to blow you away. In reality though the food is terrible and is outrageously overpriced. 

Apparently they recently took new management and it this place used to be great. 
I don't see this place lasting much longer. 

My advice is to just go somewhere else. I'd rather eat grocery store bought ragu sauce and noodles than eat here. 

The service is sub par as well.

The workers here were very rude. When you walk in the door, nobody greets you. In addition to that, When my mother asked the woman at the register to repeat what she said, the woman yelled in my mothers face. I was absolutely appalled. The place itself is also very cramped and unorganized. There are people practically walking over each-other and just to get to their tables. There is also an issue with the cleanliness, the fact that there were flies and other bugs constantly coming around me and my food was very unsettling. In addition to the cleanliness issue, the floor did not look swept and the tables did not look wiped down. As well as, the woman who is supposed to be cleaning is talking to the other workers and not keeping up with the mess in the dining area. This is not what i expect from ANY restaurant, i am shocked and I will not be coming back here again.

If I could leave 0 stars I would.  My appointment was for 12 pm, but I was not seen until 1:15.  I do not believe the shampoo girl has a license as she had no idea what she was doing.  She was responsible for doing my color, blow drying, and treatment.  The only thing Tah did was straighten my hair.  Tah is very rude as she did not greet me as a new client, she just walked right past me for over an hour. All the stylist were preoccupied with watching Game of Thrones during the time they were doing my hair. I'm natural, but the shampoo girl combed my hair from the top of my head, instead of starting at the bottom and working her way up.  I advise you, save your money, find a stylist who can really take care of your hair, because Tah is not it.  The environment is extremely loud instead of being relaxing, as it should be.  I am so disappointed and I will not ever be back.

If I could rate a ZERO I would.  DO NOT WASTE TIME OR MONEY THERE.  The prices are cheap however it's probably due to the horrible food, decor and appearance of the workers.   ABSOLUTELY MY WORST DINING EXPERIENCE!

I would not recommend this location, I have been to New Orleans a few times and have eaten and Drago's Metairie which was amazing. The food was excellent the service was amazing. 
I was in town and decided to go to Drago's at the Hilton location, got there at are 7:45 got to the hostess who was slumped over with her face propped up in her hands. We were informed that the wait for a table for three was an hour which normally will not be a problem but it being we had just gotten in town and was exhausted from traveling we opted to try it another night. I asked if we could make a reservation for the following night which the half asleep hostess said they don't accept reservations, again no problem there we decided that the following day we will return and wait while we get a few drinks at the bar. 
The following day came we showed up at 6:45 got to the hostess (not the same from the night before) asked to place my name on the list, the response was they are not taking names until 8pm since they are only seating customers with a reservation which puzzled me for a second since the night before I was told they don't take reservations. 
Well to get to the point and not keep going on we ended up eating at this location another night and at the other location on this trip again, and can say the food and service at both location are very different. I would highly recommend taking a short Uber ride to Metairie where the true culinary experience of of New Orleans is guaranteed. 
Drago's Hilton location will leave disappointed and make you miss in my opinion the best charbroiled oysters at Drago's Metairie.

Putrid Smell.  

 Just returned from dinner at Boulevard Burger. When we took our seats my husband and I both remarked on a horrible smell. Kind of a rotting garbage smell. We mentioned it to our server, and her reply was " tell me about it, I have put up with it all week". Glad it was all about her. The smell was so invasive, that it made every bite of food taste horrible. Could not wait to leave. When we getting in the car to leave, kitchen staff was out back taking a smoke break. I mentioned the rancid smell, and they said, " yea that is all the beer and food trapped under the deck smelling up the place. I almost tossed my dinner in the parking lot. What's next? Rats?  Gross. Won't be back. I am a resident of SPB, and it's off my list. Sad.

Well today is $5.00 martini day so I order a martini was not told that the martinis that are on sale are only certain ones none of which appear on the list of martinis. Why is that oh I get it they really don't want you to buy $5.00 they want you to pay $7 or $8 or $10. Pretty crappy if you ask me bartender never said a single word about there being a different list for the $5 special.
be sure to have a snack before you eat here - the lobster roll was good however it was tiny and unfulfilling, about the size of a hotdog -- not to mention $17 :/ oof

Absolute crooks. Don't waste your time or hard earned money purchasing a vehicle here. I made that mistake. I bought a used vehicle with a 30 day warranty. 5 days after purchase and 120 miles later the check engine light came on. Brought back to the service department to have issue repaired. Service diagnosed the vehicle as needing 8 Spark Plugs and 8 ignition coils. At a cost of over 1000 dollars. Of course this is not covered under the "powertrain" warranty. The dealers solution was to give me one spark plug and one coil. A joke.  They didn't even install the parts! This place is a poor excuse for a business. Prepare to be disappointed by their actions .

Hot , lots of drinks needed, long lines . VERY hot condition .

It's hard to enjoy a bowl of pho when the atmosphere is like 98+ degree , some other foods wasn't anything special , the drinks were good but they were running out due the how HOT the outside temperature was .

Maybe if they have had a Giant fan/ac room , maybe that might have given them another star.

The view was good , just not worth the stop

Side note : I forgot to add , the locals seem to enjoy this hot temperature and hot pho , but most northern / tourist wouldn't be able to , although again the drinks were all gone even before the tables were all seated

Wound up here because not much else was open. They sold me a coffee -- ok. But the guy on duty was a dick to the (polite) homeless man who came in. Come on man, a lot of people out here have it rougher than you do.

Food is good but not worth the hassle. I've been going for years and each time they tell me something different about reservations. 1st they don't take them, then they do and now it's they only take 3 per half hour. You have to call & leave a message with instructions that they will call you back which they never do.  The worst part is how they handle the confusion. Anyway, we will go someplace else that doesn't waste our time.

I waited months to get my hair cut and styled. I had pics of what I wanted. My stylist was named Rebecca. Very sweet lady. I showed her my pics. And specially asked her if she could do it. She said yes. My hair was one length and was long. She cut off 4 -5 inches and different layers. The haircut was not what I asked for. I was so bummed. Is it possible to get what you want from any stylist? I'm afraid to go back as now I don't know what I'll get. Very sad.

I've stayed here before and it is a nice RV park. But-now with new owners, if you have an RV that's over 10 years old, you have to provide pictures to prove it isn't a pile. Well, needless to say, my 1977 bus is older than 10 years old and I wasn't going to deal with the gobbly goop of taking pictures. I stayed instead at Boomtown without question.

I am only giving it one star because it wouldn't let me give zero. The worst car wash I have ever had. When I  pointed out missed spots their response that I should get it detailed.    Do not go here!

The person at the door couldn't tell if my ID was 'fake' or not because it was a NY license.

There was an obnoxious bouncer flashing his flashlight at my wife and I while we were eating, for no apparent reason. The place was empty, the lights were on, I did not understand why he did that. Perhaps to inform me of his 'presence?' We get it brother! you're a bouncer.

The food was a disappointment. I can usually finish sub-par food, but I couldn't even get through a quarter of the pulled pork sandwich.

Absolutely the worst dealership I have ever been to period. Me and my wife were searching for a new vehicle for a few weeks. We went to many dealerships all over edmonton, finally we came to sherwood dodge and that's where it all began.. we were test driving a car from another dealership at the time they ended up giving us keys to one of their models so we drove that instead because they dident want us going back to the last place for obvious reasons and they made us wait in the waiting room for 6 hours with our 3 month old baby because they assured us the financing was almost done. They came back several times to tell us it was almost done etc. But really they were just wasting our time and convincing us we shouldn't leave. Hours go by, still nothing we went looking for someone to talk to because we wanted to leave and of course they had our car keys and nobody knew where they were nor did they care to find them. Finally they came and told us everything was ready at 9 at night and when we got done talking price they told us we would have a check for myself because of the 2 previous dodge vehicles I purchased as a referral/loyalty cheque it's been 3 weeks since we signed papers and they cant seem to figure out how to get a 300$ cheque out especially after buying a 40 thousand dollar jeep. 

TLDR: dealer held us hostage by not giving our keys to the car because they misplaced them waited 6 hours in waiting room with hungry crying 3 month old baby assured everything was ready when it wasent and cant even figure out how to sign a cheque of 300 dollers that was promised to us after buying a 40 thousand dollar jeep. Now they wont wander phone calls and dont call or text back. We dealt with almost all the people there and they all dont seem to care they just want s signature and that's it no respect

7 PM on a Friday night and over half of the menu is out. Ordering online all the mac & cheese is gone, half the items on the sandwiches are gone, what's the point of having an app if you can't order half of the food. It's not like it's 1030 and they close at 11. It's 7 PM on a busy Friday

Dropped to one star. Asked for bread and got apple. They are out of French bread.

Pathetic
Pretty dirty location compared to others. Very very chincy on the servings of meat and rice, I had to order double meat which should have been the regular amount. Won't be back here any time soon.

I have had an absolutely horrible experience with Lowe's! I ordered storm doors almost a month ago and Lowes gave us the wrong parts for the doors. It is taking several weeks for the rest of the parts for the doors that we already paid for to come in. We bought the doors from a retail store in Montgomeryville Pennsylvania and I've spoken to the store manager who's name is AJ several times about this. AJ has been extremely rude and unprofessional to us and told us that our $500 purchase is not worth Lowe's expediting the parts faster. AJ threatened us if we called corporate and told us that corporate would do nothing for us except pass the message along back to him. Well he was right! We have talk to corporate several times and was promised by several supervisors that the regional manager will contact me to give us some type of compensation for the issues that we've been having. I have never ever received a call from any supervisor or regional manager from Lowe's that was promised. Lowes has our money and we do not have doors and we do not have anyone from the Montgomeryville store apologizing to us or trying to solve our situation. I strongly recommend that no one ever buy products from Lowe's if they are improving their home buying, a new homeowner, or selling their house because if there's a problem corporate does not have your back and does not care about you. It's more than obvious that the employees of Lowes have no idea how to do their job except on how to take your money. Do yourself a favor and shop at Home Depot Lowes is absolutely horrible!

I've been here twice and can only comment once on customer service- mainly because the last time I came here, no one could get up from a desk to greet me. I'd understand if they were busy but clearly they were not. I get that I look young, but I'm not. I'm looking at cars that will be a good fit for being a mom and for car seats and family life. I will never come back here again. Shout out to the Porsche dealership across the street though, they answered all my stupid questions about safety and were happy to give me a bunch of stuff to research. And their time of day.

I'm not exactly sure why this is even a diner. The biscuits and gravy were frozen biscuits covered in a canned or powdered gravy with weird little square pieces of "sausage". I mean, seriously, the same thing you would get complimentary at 2 Star hotel. The bacon was not sliced thick bacon. Again, it looked like the pre cooked stuff in the box. The coffee was about equal to what I make at home with Folgers. When you walk by cooler you can plainly see they use a big gallon jug of Prairie Farms OJ and just pour it in a glass for you. The waitress was nice and kept filling up the coffee. I wouldn't recommend this place at all. Hardee's at least has fresh biscuits and it costs less. The restrooms were clean, but looked run down and possibly remodeled by a blind man. Lol Just saying...

So the first time a came here with a couple of friends the food was amazing, quality was apparent and the staff was friendly. I went here today, excited and had been raving about this place to me friends, kids and family for a few months only to be incredible disappointed. The person that greeted us when we got there was not warm and friendly, our waitress was attentive but the food quality was very poor. My kids had chicken Alfredo and did said the chicken was distasteful, I had snapper and it did not taste fresh. The snapper had a hard meaty taste almost like it had just been removed from the freezer. Snapper is normally soft and flaky when cooked. I will admit that the gravy over the snapper is the only reason I did not send it back. The waitress came with the dessert menu but I didn't give it a 2 second thought because I did not want to be disappointed any further. My last visit to Baco's.
Waitress added an additional $10 to the tip I gave her on my credit card. I was on a business trip and had to eat the additional charge.  The food was good an so were the margaritas.
Worst customer service ever, next time back to Marriott or Hilton.   Removed my rewards account.  Rude manager!

I don't really understand the five star reviews.  First, I came knowing that it was expensive, and this review has nothing to do with that.  I was prepared to pay top dollar, and in that, my expectations were met.  

Maybe we should have sat below deck.  The downstairs was beautiful.  But we wanted the open air.  It was a beautiful evening, about 70F and no humidity, so why not?  We got our table for five after a minimal wait, which was OK.  It didn't seem to be terribly busy, and there were plenty of waitstaff around.

We sat down and there were only four place mats for the five of us.  Oops.  So we swiped one from an empty table nearby.  

No place settings.  The waitress (who was pretty casual about keeping an eye on our table in case we needed something and pretty skilled at avoiding eye contact as she cruised past our table) took our drink orders and returned shortly with picnic style place settings - a knife and fork for each of us, all unceremoniously dropped at the end of the table, each wrapped in a paper napkin.  Should they be placed by each person at the table?  This didn't impress me, given my expectation that I'd be paying about $45 average for entrees and $15 for appetizers.  

Our table was no more than ten feet from the bar, so why did it take fifteen minutes for our drinks to arrive?  And no draft beers, another minor thing piled on top of several other minor things.

The appetizers were tasty but the portions were sub-par.  Three shrimps?  About a half teaspoon of lobster in the lobster bisque?  You can do better.

The entrees were delicious, no complaints there.  It took a while for it to arrive, but we were in no hurry.  

Dessert was not up to par.  A couple of us ordered them, and it was obvious when they arrived, after a considerable time, that they weren't made to order, as I would expect considering the price, but merely taken from the freezer.  So why would it take so long for them to arrive?

No coffee!  I asked for a cup of coffee (I didn't order dessert) and was told that they didn't serve coffee on the deck because it was so far from the kitchen.  What?  What kind of BS is this?

Finally, the music was SO loud.  I guess I should have asked if they could turn it down.  It wasn't like anyone was dancing, but it was loud enough to drown out normal conversation.  

So except for the dessert, I give the food four or five stars.  Sitting on the deck enjoying the open air was very nice.  But the indifferent, inattentive service rates only one star.  I feel like for the prices you can expect to pay, you should expect attentive service and at least a little pampering.

I stopped in one day 30 minutes before closing. I order and eat quickly. You could tell the host was not happy to have someone come in close to closing. I wish he hid it better because I can't enjoy my food as much if I feel rushed. The background music was already turned off so the silence left the ambience of the place lacking. I just had a roll of sushi, so did my dinner companion. The food was fine but the service and atmosphere were a bit cold. There are lots of other food options in the area I will try before returning here.

Getting a reservation was hard enough but to have lackluster food is another reason I won't return. Hubby and I went for brunch. The chicken and waffles was bland and cold and the turtle soup was mediocre at best. I just lost interest and didn't bother to order the bananas foster anymore. There are many other places in NOLA where you can get better food including bananas foster.

Oh my God!!!  Placed an order online for pick-up. 2 sandwiches and a kids meal. Picked it up, got home...no drink for the kid's meal and my Reuben was meat, cheese, and bread...no sauce; nearly chocked trying to get it down. HERE'S THE PROBLEM!!!...I called to let the Manager know. Phone rings 2 times: "hello". I said "hello", he again says "hello"... I said "am I calling you at home?"He said "no". I said "am I calling Which Wich?"  Manager takes the phone away and answers with appropriate greeting. Didn't seem to care that our order incorrect. Bottom line, that place is managed and operated by children. Good Luck.

This clinic was so unprofessional. Didn't even ask history of pain, started sticking needles in me SITTING UP didn't even lay me down. The needles were so painful. When I asked for a cup of water they wouldn't even bring me one, said it's self service. There was no after care, they just pulled out the needles and pushed me out. Never had a acupuncturist experience like this.

Excellent smoothie disgusting floor for a Monday morning. When your shoes literally stick to the floor and there is trash everywhere you have got to wonder if this lack of cleanliness transfers to the food preparation.

I placed an order online and got there when the expected time for my food to be ready. Took five minutes before someone spoke to me and my food was ready. But for some reason it took at least another ten minutes for someone to grab my food from the window. By the time I got home my food was barely room temp and was really mediocre. Maybe a quarter of the restaurant was full...

Worst experience ever!! Rude, nasty, condescending manager called to inform me of inability to deliver on correct date. She mocked me & used my words against me. DO NOT GIVE BUSINESS TO THIS SHOP! THEY DON'T DESERVE TO STAY IN BUSINESS!!

Call to place a small order from work, Owner tried to over charge me and when I questioned him about the price. He became very rude and mean about it... asking me harshly "do you want it or not, If so give your credit card?" Why would I buy from you after were so RUDE to me..I would worry that you would SPIT in my food SO NO!
 I DO NOT I WILL NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM SOMEONE WHO TREATS THEIR CUSTOMERS RUDELY.
Must came in when the waitress was having a bad night. Worst service ever and food was mediocre. I would never go back. They need new waitress and need to step their game up with the food

My husband and I had been here once or twice before, and really liked it.  However, when we went again on 4/14/18, we found it to be lacking.  The gnocchi was extremely salty, and we both ordered the monkfish.  The fish was smothered in barbecue sauce and chili oil to the point that the fish itself could not be tasted.  I almost never send food back, but did on this occasion.  The restaurant did take my fish entree of the check, but the waiter was not overly pleasant about it.  For the price, I would say that both the service and food were lacking.

Walked in on a Friday afternoon after hearing some good music coming from inside. The entire bottom level was packed with old couples. It was hard to make your way through without bumping into walkers or canes. Went upstairs to get away from that and ordered a shiner and my friend ordered a mixed drink. It wasn't as busy up there but the bartenders seemed to be more interested in talking to each other, rather than work. 
I ordered one more beer before we left and when I saw my bill was $14 for two shiners, I was pretty annoyed. 
Shiner is a very inexpensive beer so it was annoying to have to spend that much on it. It's way overpriced for what it is. Won't be coming back.

First off...I would never go to an Asian fusion brunch restaurant. Most of the reviews here are in regards to the brunch...if those sheeple had my dinner, they would never dine here for brunch... Do you people eat sushi? If you can't get uncooked food right...I will never eat your cooked food...From start to finish, this place is at best 2 stars. I'm trying to save you money here people...go somewhere else. The Media location which I've been to many times is nice, however very average. I've given this place 3 tries... After terrible service, a bone in my sushi, cartilage in my wife's sushi, small terrible sushi rolls, and cold coffee to finish it off...I'm done. OK, I get that this is a "Hip" place for Mainliners...but WOW... I'd go to the Asian bistro down the street that got closed for a cockroach infestation over this place. And the sad part is....that place is still open!!! Very comical...maybe the same owners??? I'm sorry I have to say goodbye Azie...some Mainliners are fooled, but I am not...Sorry to be so blunt with my review...but the only thing you kinda have going for you, is that hot rock Kobe beef appetizer. Maybe focus more on the cooked food?...but wait...my coffee was cold, so... my suggestion...If you want to spend $400 on sushi...go to Nectar. The servers are terrible as well...but the food is above average.
Put the doors back on the bathroom please. I love Barnes and Nobles but really, I don't want to hear the man with diarrhea while I'm in the bathroom because you all took the doors off.

It seems that they have tried to replace employees with kiosks and self serve machines here, but very few work. Bought tickets ahead of time and none of the kiosks were in working order. The drink machines are not responsive, and even 2 of the paper towel dispensers in the bathroom were broken. After we sat down we realized that we accidentally did not get the 3D+ seats, nor did we receive our glasses. When I went back out to get the glasses and asked about the seats, I was told only 3 rows had the special seats and was not given an option to upgrade, even though the theatre was not full. The customer service was terrible all told. Invest in people and not machines and you'll have a better business. The woman at the ticket booth was the only person there, and I bet I would have gotten better service if she wasn't so overworked. The movie was fine, but they need to maintain the facilities or this place will fold. Again.

i was recommended by someone that i didn't know to come here but my experience was horrible i came for two things but couldn't get them the wraps are only sold mon.-thurs. and the cupcakes i couldn't get because there were gnats flying all throughout the cupcakes i told someone about it she pretended she was going to do something about it all she did was open the door and close it they continued to sell those cupcakes to people i mean if you like bugs flying on your food go ahead and try them but the food is not worth the price its food that i can and will just cook at home or find somewhere better also nobody cleaned any of the tables the entire time i was there they ran out of practically everything even drinks no lemonade or orange juice so i had to get tea for me and my kids they didn't even put up signs or anything to let people know so it was a guessing game

We were sitting at our table to order and I saw the waitress picking out the onions and peppers off of a cheese steak with her fingers. Needless to say I was totally grossed out and we had to leave. Let alone that poor woman who was about to eat a sandwich that had someone else's fingers all in it. If something comes out of the kitchen wrong, then you need to make it again!!!!

I ordered the coconut milk soup. It's so hot that it tastes like mace. I guess I could save it and throw in a burglar's face. The pad thai I ordered without shrimp ....came with shrimp. But it is still good

I recently tried this place for their Chinese and sadly the food was very greasing. I will probably not go back to this establishment. 

I noticed their sushi lunches only come with soup or salad while the Japanese restaurant down the road (Hachi) gives you soup and salad. Furthermore, Hachi also has better options for sushi lunches. So, if you are looking for somewhere good to go for some sushi, drive a little further down the road.

Worse dealer experience I've ever had hands down. I was an out of town buyer and would never receive a call back from the salesman so I escalated it to a manager he had an attitude and tried to talk down to me, i then escalated it to the GM and he just referred me back to the manager that was a joke. I have never had to TRY to give. Someone business so hard and not have any customer service. If I could give them a half star I would. So instead I spent another $5k on a car from a dealer that cared.
This theater was remodeled and they are not keeping it up that well. Dirty chairs and floors are absolutely unacceptable. Corporate will be notified!

Well, that didn't go very well. I came in with my parents for the first time, excited to take them to a new restaurant (to us) in the city. We weren't starving so we just ordered the bone marrow croquettes and the fettuccine carbonara. The bone marrow bites were fine, I don't know if I'd get them again but no real complaints there. 

I have real complaints about the fettuccine carbonara, though. We ordered the full sized portions and thought the server made a mistake and gave us the half size when they were brought out, the servings were TINY! For $26, I wanted to have a meal. The noodles were over cooked, and it lacked that creamy, cheesy goodness carbonara usually has. I swear there were about 7 noodles in the tiny portion of the gigantic plate where the food is meant to be. 

My parents said I've never failed before on choosing a restaurant for their visit, but this was the first time. We actually left looking to go somewhere else to have an actual meal, for far less $. We were really disappointed and won't be back.

This is what the roast pork sandwich looks like. 

FYI - This pork came from the Mexican spot next door. Gross!

No sautéed spinach, garlic or olive oil like the description. 

Take this off your menu if you aren't serving it correctly.

What.a.disappointment

Arrived at Somo excited to try the cocktails and the bar had a few open seats. When I asked a couple if they could shift down, the bartender was very rude and told them not to move. There is no quality service and an utter disregard for customer satisfaction.

Sincerely,

Not impressed

Came here with a friend while visiting New Orleans. It was a busy Saturday night, but we found a table, and a friendly server came right away. We each got a cafe au lait and shared a plate of beignets. The coffee didn't taste like cafe au lait but more like watered down coffee with a whole bunch of skim milk. The beignets were super hot when they arrived at the table, but don't wear black or dark clothes, because you'll be covered in powdered sugar after the first one. They were good but nothing I would return for. I'm glad I came to experience the experience, but I don't need to come back. It's cash only, so be sure to bring your greenbacks.

Ugh, c'mon Target!! I got most of what I needed. But was so excited to see a rack of cute Eagles shirts mixed in with some ugly men's playoff ones , of course THOSE had tags, and literally not one of t of the cute baseballs 3/4 length tees had a tag on them. So I brought my cute Henley to the register. The manager came, didn't even look at me, or acknowledge me just told the nice woman helping me at the register to go put them back in the back and walked away. Didn't apologize, nothing. Rude! The associate then apologized and I payed for my stuff and left. But honestly what the actual fck? It's on the floor so just make something up and sell it to me. I was ready Buy 2, in my hand, at the register. The manager said " they aren't supposed to be out yet" buuut they said nothing about the playoffs or super bowl. I don't get it AND I'm annoyed and not going back to that one because it will bring up bad memories . Let me get over it and I'll be back!

Easily the slowest Starbucks I have visited. Staff seems content with being slow and lines inside and in the drive through are long and slow.

Also quite disappointing that they never get orders correct.

4 Star food but 1 star service. We had a reservation and still had to wait probably 45 minutes for our food despite having a reservation and many empty tables around us. Server didn't even bother to refill our waters until we were halfway through the meal even though we clearly finished the water containers she originally brought to the table 15 min after sitting down because we had a large group. She was very friendly, just very lazy. Perhaps they had a large breakfast rush and she was just tired because it's the weekend but still not an excuse for how bad the service was and how slow the kitchen was despite there only being 2 or 3 smaller groups in the restaurant while we were there. I finished most of my sandwich and moved the meat to the side of my plates in hopes of getting a box. Instead of asking whether or not I was finished with my plate she took it literally when my head was turned because we were mid-conversation. She wasted a perfectly good piece of chicken, pickled pot belly, and fries which just bothers me because I feel like this restaurant is trying to make themselves appear "sustainable." While, sustain this, HIRE BETTER WAIT STAFF

I've been ordering delivery from this location for about one year now. Usually the timing and food are impeccable. Today, not so much. I ordered a $16.00 unwich. The purpose of a lettuce wrap (an unwich) is that one can still pick it up like a sandwich but without the bread. I think this may have skipped an employee's mind today. They were probably wondering how the heck I was going to eat this thing without utensils. Or...they skipped training 101. I emailed a complaint to HQ and was given an apology letter. Thanks for your apology but I'm not accepting it.

I bought a piece of shit toy for $15. It was a Rocky Balboa squeeze toy. The threads are coming out and my new pup swallowed some of them - they were in his poop and hanging out of his little asshole. 

What if the threads got caught in his intestines??

I took the toy into the store and explained this. The girl had zero sympathy and said that I can't return toys. I trashed it. I'm out fifteen effing dollars.

I will NEVER, EVER shop there again!
Food came fast but nothing to write home about had the roast beef open faced sandwhich it was average. I was then rushed as i write this review to get a box sorry but that is not good in my book.
The employees are rude and nice customer service on the phone will always hang up so we had to look around the store and upstairs I cant find even 1 Employee.

Inconsiderate hotel patrons are shooting off fireworks literally outside my window in my hotel at 11:30 pm. I call the front desk and ask if anything has been said to them and the front desk clerk says in a condescending tone, "like what?" I said, "Like don't shoot fireworks in the hotel parking lot." He replied with attitude and said it's not illegal. WTH. I said, that's cool, I'll call corporate. Had I been playing music loudly in the parking lot at almost midnight in a sleeping establishment I'm sure I would have been deemed a nuisance. Not everyone is on holiday. I have to work tomorrow. I don't appreciate the attitude.

I hardly could say that the sushi here was as good as in some other places I have had visited in Tampa Bay Area. I used to have lunch and dinner in both locations of the restaurant in New Tampa and Dale Mabry Avenue so that it is fair to say the restaurant should improve the quality of the food a lot if they have ever wanted to boost the business. Otherwise, it would not be my favorite AYCE sushi restaurant in Tampa. The nigiri, for example, had too much rice while the fish cut was thin and cheap. The fish like salmon or white tuna were not very fresh also. As for regular pieces of fish, they were all pale in color - the salmon, if it was fresh, should be deep pink/orange, but rather a light orange. The hibachi steak was pretty chewy and harsh. Sometimes, the sushi rice was dried and bland as I could not taste any sour flavor of vinegar as the sushi rice was supposed to be. Thus, I would pay few dollars extra to have a better AYCE sushi experience elsewhere.

I have been there twice for gel refill and pedicure . The services are mediocre. The first visit , the technician did my refill sloppily , she put too much acrylic on my nails ( thick nails ) ,and they weren't shaped evenly . I thought I would give them one more chance to redeem themselves  so I went a second time . I picked a gel color for my toes and they used a " similar " color on my nails that was quite different from what I asked for . I showed the technician a picture of how I want my gel refill and she didn't do what I asked for . My gel refill was better than what it was last time but it was still not what I wanted. 4 technicians worked on my nails in one visit which is not good . Then they overcharged me for services which is probably why prices are not listed in a visible area so that they get over on people .

A friend and I ate here after a party we went to. I ordered the spinach salad and explained to the waiter that I was on a vegan diet and could not have any meat. My friend ordered a hamburger and a side of mac and cheese. When the food came out my salad had bacon in it. I asked the waiter about it and he hunched his shoulders and walked off. My friend never got his mac and cheese. And at the beginning of the night the bread that they brought out had been reheated in the microwave and was hard as a rock.  My friends Burger was okay. At the end of our visit when paying for the bill I asked the waiter about the bacon and the conversation that we had about my diet his response was that he was sorry and did not know there was bacon on the salad. I probably will not return for another visit seeing that this visit was below-par. My friend and I chose this restaurant because we had seen it many times and always wanted to try it. Now I can say I have tried it do not like it and will not return.

The worst experience a bride could ever have. The samples were only in size zero or two so if you don't want to be humiliated don't go there. They make you squeeze into dresses that no normal size girl could were. Sample dresses don't appear to be well cared for either.

Horrible customer service. No body at the ticket counter people standing in line. 20 minutes after them paying someone to come to the ticket are she walks up slowly texting on her cell phone.  Continues to stay on the phone 
Now to the gate.  Flight delayed over 39 minutes at this point. No plane at the end of the ramp and the Frontier worker refuses to close the door.  It's freezing outside and the cold air is blowing through the door. Are you people trying to make others sick???? This is ridiculous.

Not only is she rude but has no sense of your freezing people to death out here 

Will never use them again. Piss poor customer service and rude thoughtless employees. Not to mention I ama handicapped person with sever blood pressure issues and this treatment is not helping.

For a restaurant in the French Quarter of New Orleans named "Gumbo Shop", their gumbo was quite unremarkable! It was broth over rice and little else. We also tried their Shrimp Po Boy. Instead of deep frying the shrimp, it was cooked in a tomato based sauce. Which in turn made the French baguette soggy.

You can skip this place and be assured you didn't miss anything!

Terrible staff, they would not allow me to help my crying 3 year old son because I was not allowed to get on an inflatable to help him down. Who does that? Their staff believe they are jump police, I'll never return here.

I love their food but I haven't been back since they put up those white supremacist "Don't tread on me" flags on their building. It sends a real clear message about the owners. So I guess they don't want my business any more. ‍

We were not impressed. We expected something over the top. Shrimp Po-boy was mostly bread and not flavorful.  The staff/ hostesses were cutting up and talked to each the whole time. Our waitress  Whynter was good and sweet though. Concerned with how we saw food handled with long fake nails reaching in the food as they were walking by to serve it. 
15.00 a plate should have be so much more. I don't usually put negativity out there but have to be honest.

Mac Jr meat is like a hocky puck.  
Little to NO SAUCE  ( 1pk of ketchup was more than SS)   AWFUL.  NEVER GOING BACK
This cafe serves oversized flavorless food at a decent price point.

No..No...and No....
Stopped in for a late lunch during the week.  The falafel was hard on the outside & dry on the inside.  The hummus was tasteless.  My husband ordered the lamb gyro...The land was dry and the pita was soggy.  
To top it off there was very obnoxious & loud Aretha Franklin music blaring. 

Will not be back.
We are the food and then two hours later, vomit! !! And out the other end. Not top notch! Where is the zero stars button

I don't know what happened this time with the food but it was just not correct!  I have eaten there at least 3 other times and the food was really good but this time I swear it was like eating at an unknown place!  I ordered a to go order of Pancit Bihon, Shrimp Sinagang and Lumpia.  The lumpia was good as always.  Pancit Bihon, no shrimps and mixed in was some kind of organ meat (looked like chicken livers??) and the Shrimp Sinagang was only a thin shrimp flavored broth with about 5 pieces of long bean and no other vegetables and certainly no shrimp.  We ended up dumping the "sinagang" out beause my dog wouldn't even eat the broth. Next time (if I go back) I will make them open the containers before I leave.  So disappointing because the food is not cheap!!

You know what you get, a decent room with basics near highways.  You won't get any extras, you won't get attentive service. People are in, people are out.  Front desk people will talk on their phone before serving you, will casually say "shlt" and chat as friends together while upset they can't remember their system password and talking about how overbooked they are.  

They don't mean to be rude, they just don't care and are not held to any standard except getting intake forms and passing out plastic keys.  

This is McDs of hotels, their granola bar and apple "breakfast" closes at 9:30 on weekends.  The linger of smoke is not gross but omnipresent.  Get your room, take your shower and get going.  If you need more, pay more.
Make sure you always get your receipt back. They just tried to not give me 5 dollars back. Disappointed in Starbucks. Smh

I'm furious we spent so much money here. After hearing a tips about a "good seafood buffet" we went to check it out. I'm from Kentucky so Florida & seafood are the dream but we have a seafood buffet in KY that's better than this. The food was dry, it had been sitting out for hours, it was cold, it was not tasty... there were not many options for people who could not or did not enjoy seafood... the unlimited wine isn't very unlimited when your server doesn't check on you to see if you need more.. I had to ask him to refill my boyfriend drink because he would only refill mine.. it was a nightmare.. our total was over $100.. for a buffet .. that (as mentioned before) was quite similar to Golden Coral.. they ask you if you want to pay $10 to add on crab legs at the beginning of the meal... they didn't even have any cooked when we got there. All in all this place sounds like a great idea, looks fancy, smells good... but tastes like left overs that have sat in your fridge way too long. Disappointing end to a very amazing vacation.

I have always had great experiences at Peter Piper Pizzas until I came to this location. I work with a youth program where I get reimbursed for my expenses and the manager refused to write me a handwritten receipt for the money I spent on tokens. Simple. Not only did he say we "don't do that here", he was beyond rude to the point where my youth wanted to leave. I will NOT be coming back here and will be telling my entire group of 50+ people to never come to this location.

Well I've been here for seven months now, and I can see why someone checked off that my initial review was funny. The staff at Solaris Key are very nice to you when you're looking to rent, however, once you've moved in, not so much.  The apartments here are very small and the walls are very thin.  Subsequently, you can hear your neighbors when they get up and when they go to bed. For a short term lease, this is probably not a bad deal but long-term I don't know about you, but I don't want to be awakened at 5 o'clock in the morning with my upstairs neighbors moving their appliances.  I was told when I moved in that there are visitors parking spaces on the side of the building, so when my guests arrived for a holiday weekend I instructed them to park on the side of the building not realizing that there's only three spots that are designated for visitors; my guest's car was towed; no warning, no call, nothing just towed. The front gate was broken for about three months, and the primary reason why many of the residents moved here is for security purposes. During the time the gate was broken, several vehicles were broken into.  Just recently, I had knee surgery and my mother picked me up from the doctors office and was parking the car and I no sooner got into my apartment when I got a call from Cole, a salesperson in the rental office, stating that my car is double parked, pictures have been taken of it and it needs to be moved immediately.  Mind you, this was on a Monday there's no other cars in the parking lot but mine and clearly we had no intention of leaving our car double parked, I just needed the space to navigate my walker from the car to my apartment. The office clearly needs to focus on their customer service skills, getting new renters and stop harassing the current residence.  There is a lot of competition in the rental arena, so needless to say, if I were the management here, I would focus on keeping their current occupants happy, not harass them.  Needless  to say I cannot wait to move out of here! No, I do not recommend this place unless you are looking for a short-term situation.
If you are looking for an apartment, you need to be observant about potential neighbors in the building.  Notice the noise levels, how tidy the buildings are being kept, and what the atmosphere is at night to gain insight on the neighborhood.

PLEASE GO TO ANOTHER HONDA DEALER NOT PIAZZA HONDA ON ESSINGTON AVENUE. We dropped our truck off to have a cylinder replaced the driver door. Upon drop /pre-service off their inspector completed the Multi-Point Checklist which they use to make notes of external defects, damages, normal wear and tear, mileage and engine lights. This checklist never indicated any issue with any door handles.                                                 Upon pick-up/post service. the itemized bill has a note on it which read: door handle loose will break soon... We informed the staff, left the truck to be assessed the next day 7/17/18. After multiple conversations & presentation of the matter Manager Greg Trower made a business decision to state we can buy the part with an employee discount to have It repaired. We declined -as we know the driver handle was in great shape @ drop-off & had to be damaged upon the cylinder replacement.  We find it ironic that normal business practice for car service companies usually notify a customer with a phone call if not present to indicate there is a problem in an area they are working on in Advance to allow the customer to decide if they want it fixed or not as they wan to minimize liability for themselves. In addition to make  another sale for themselves.  My  husband nor myself were never Notified via phone nor any other way that any issues existed with the driver door handle being prior to their servicing.

I came here for the first time a couple weeks ago. It wasn't crowded just a few people sitting at the bar. When we sit at the bar a notice a man sitting at the bar with his lab top. I come to realize he is either the owner or manager, because all I hear is him discussing the employees hours so everyone at the bar can hear. He would call over all the employees and talk about the hours. He was also talking about cutting a bartenders hours or make a major change and you could tell it upset her! It was extremely comfortable for anyone that was in there. I get that maybe he has to make changes but you don't do that in front of customers! One of the employees was looking for something so they came out to ask him where to find it and he stormed in the back and make it seem like they were all idiots. It bothers me just knowing the employees are being treated that way. Food was good and our service was good. But unfortunately we will never go back. It was the most awkward situation to be in. I couldn't help but feel bad for the employees.

Lazy people, showed up with over 2 hrs left before they close and they refuse to take anymore walk ins, they had technicians standing around but didn't want to do anymore work. Is a shame that Apple will hire people with such poor work ethic.

Regardless that we made a phone order 30 minutes before closing, everything is advertised as fresh and made to order so I was excited to go pick up my food. Only to get home and find the wings we're not crispy. The fries were lukewarm at best and soggy like they've been sitting all day under a heat lamp. Very disappointed and a waste of $20+. The management of this location needs to reevaluate their policies and make a change ASAP. All the reviews are negative, it's obviously for a reason.

Very disappointed in Tanque Verde Papa Murphy's. Usually very good but last two times including today very poor.
Picked up two fave's pepperoni and cheese. Called in about 3:30 under "Bob". Picked up at 4:15PM Sunday, November 25.
Had company over. When my wife was putting in the two pizza's in oven found the pepperoni very sparingly on pizza and the cheese had about 1 1/2" - 2" around the edge without any cheese or filling.

Called store around 6PM. Young man said not unusual to have space around edges. Not sure why only the cheese was this way. Also said we weight everything and you have probably been getting too much filling on my previous orders.

Amazed with his response. Started to do survey but website said I had to have store receipt. Store did not provide me a receipt.

Just left the store and what has happened to customer service?! That is why stores are going out of business! If you don't have a great shopping experience then people are going to shop online. Well at checkout I am pushed out of the store! My bags are still on the counter and he is on to the next customer so I have to put my bags in my cart and with my arthritis!  I will have to move on!
You should always read your reviews before you try a business! That way you dont get ripped off!

I sat at the bar. Food was decent and service was horrible. No bartender working apparently. Waited entirely too long to just get the bill. Took about 20 minutes after asking to settle up to just get the bill.  I won't be back.
Red Robbin was my first choice for a burger. I showed my state issued ID card and the waitress refused to serve me a beer.

It's 2018 and they still use fake mashed potatoes. That tells you how the buffet is.

Best thing too, at dinner time, you get to hear the music and bass from the adjoining club. Elderly people certainly love that sh!t.

This place has really changed maybe ownership but maybe 3  to 4years ago  it was so different the menu had none of the things it used to have good ole home cooked country breakfast such variety now i couldnt find anything on the menu that was different than pizza ....so i had a drink and went on my way  what happened? Anyone know where the original chef went?

Don't care about a good relationship with customer and lexus brand only a quick sale.  Sold me a car missing a key feature and discovered when I got home.  When I brought it up them they said that feature wasn't in sales price so they didn't mislead me.  But said they be more happy to sell me a better version and trade in the car I just bought.  Which I would lose 5K on because it was months later after determining what could be done about it.   They just wanted to make another sale. 

I actually b/c of this have decided to switch cars completely and brands to Audi.

ZERO stars!!!!
Seems to be an on going theme here with packages being reported delivered and not. I was supposed to have a package delivered Monday at 11:30 am as reported by Lasership. The package showed up Tuesday night at 6:30pm busted! 
Clearly it's the delivery personnel who they probably do nothing about. I will make sure to contact the company I ordered through too to let them know how their merchandise is being handled.

The ordering system is totally insane, you go all the way up, order on a tablet and then backtrack through the line to pay on a separate tablet. So needlessly frustrating. If they just switched the person that's there to explain everything to each confused person to a cashier everything would run much more smoothly.

This is a sad excuse for a Whole Foods, people nickname it Ghetto Foods,  the overall feeling when you walk in is of neglect. Flies everywhere, dirty restrooms, and a staff that has some sort of attitude problem, both towards each other as staff and towards customers. The chip on their collective shoulders is alarming. You can cut the hostility with a knife, they could use some sensitivity training.  Very disappointed in this location.

This is the second time in approximately 3 years I've had my oil changed at Franklin Oil Stop using a Groupon.  The first time I was suspicious that they didn't change the filter (which was included in the price of the Groupon) because my vehicle has a metal shield under the engine that has to be removed in order to get to the filter.  However, I figured maybe they had a special tool I didn't have when changing my oil at home that would enable them to reach the filter without removing the shield so I dismissed my concerns.  However, this time I taped a Sharpie marker to the end of a broom handle and reached down through the engine compartment with it and put a distinctive mark on the side of the filter with the Sharpie prior to going to get my oil changed.  Fast forward to me leaving Franklin Oil Stop after receiving a receipt that states they changed both oil and filter...I drive over to the Home Depot parking lot and pop the hood and guess what's staring back up at me when I look down through the engine compartment at the filter?  The same Nissan branded oil filter bearing the same distinctive Sharpie mark I put on the filter prior to leaving home.  While it's not out of the question to skip changing the filter every other oil change there's no way these guys would know if this is the 2nd or 22nd time they skipped changing your filter which puts your engine at risk of damage.  More importantly when you agree to perform certain services for a fee and knowingly don't perform all services for that fee that is tantamount to fraud.  Once again I am reminded of my grandmother's words of wisdom, "If it seems to good too be true, it probably is."  Before going to Franklin Oil Stop look at the price they're charging and then look at the overall cost of materials (oil & filter), even using the cheapest prices around for oil and filter you're looking at a situation in which the materials cost almost as what Franklin Oil Stop is offering to do the entire job for.  You can't offer a deal at almost break even pricing when you haven't even included labor, insurance, utilities, insurance, etc.  Unless playing Russian roulette with your vehicle engine is your idea of fun, stay away from here.

I rarely take the time to leave reviews, but given how disappointing this place was, I'm willing. I took my daughter here to celebrate her birthday, along with my father that I hadn't seen in a year. Our seating arrangement on the balcony was nice and the gentleman, Arrow, who sat us was an absolute delight. The rest was pretty upsetting. The menu description did not adequately describe my $24 pasta dish. It was smothered in flavor hindering cheese and when I asked for a side of corn for my 10 year old, noone mentioned it would be too pepper hot for even myself to eat. My dad ordered a $13 spicah salad and it was the size of a side salad and was limp.
I decided it was worth letting the manager know about the experience we were having so I went downstairs where the host was located to ask to speak to someone. Both the manager and the server took it upon themselves to chastise me for "how" I asked to speak with her and told me I should have just stayed upstairs in my seat and asked for her there. 
They took the meal (and the corn) off and that's fine, but I left hungry, having spent $90 plus a modest tip, and scorned. 
With so many choices in New Orleans, I'm upset with having wasted both the time, the money, and what could have been a great experience elsewhere. I do not reccomend this place.

I had been looking forward to trying Verde, as it is new, and the menu looked great. I ordered chicken fajitas for lunch and had them delivered via Door Dash. When my food arrived, I found that there were no tortillas for my fajitas. This is the responsibility of the restaurant to ensure my order is packaged up correct, not the delivery man.  I didn't have time to worry about the tortillas, as I was on my lunch break. The vegetables didn't seem like they were even cooked. The chicken had an odd texture to it. And the tortilla chips were stale. When I called the restaurant to complain, I got an employee on the line who couldn't have cared less, and actually said in a rude tone "so what do you want me to do about it?" At this point, I just gave up. It's too bad that this happened because the restaurant looks really nice, but I will not be going there.

I know this is a chain, but their meats are very dry, and without any essential flavor.  I don't know what I'm missing with these stellar reviews.  I can only imagine there is an original location that is still doing something right.  The sides are just as lackluster as the rest of their menu.  Three strikes and they're out for me.

Went there for Thanksgiving dinner and the whole experience was horrible. We showed up at 7:30 pm which by my standards should be prime time, however by that moment they had already run out of two options from their prix fix menu. One of them was turkey for the main dish, so literally they didn't have one out of two options for the main course. Running out of turkey Then, the service was insanely slow. It took over two hours to get to the main course. The food was not bad, but nothing really that I could have called amazing. The dessert (tiramisu) had bitter taste. At the end of this all we had to talk to the manager and she agreed to our complaints and shrank the bill, so an extra star just for that.

I think the reviews are wild! The bacon was burned, the biscuits taste like cornbread. The gravy was really good. The ordering process and entry door Isn't clear when you first walk up. The staff was polite and food come at a decent time. It just wasn't great food. I was hoping the biscuits were amazing and that I'd be eating and supporting local but they were below average. Cracker Barrel biscuits are better unfortunately :(

A brand new hospital and you would think it would have been designed better.  Apparently the architects nor their loved ones have ever stayed at a hospital.  What were they thinking?   

It's late at night and my daughter-in-law is in labor & delivery.  The waiting room for guests is so uncomfortable.  Amenities are nonexistent, not to mention the lack of courtesy with their staff.  As we made our way to the nurses station (since there was no one on duty to advise us), we were told that we had to wait in the waiting room.  Well, maybe if there was a receptionist we wouldn't have  had to "bother" the nurses for information.  There is a lack of courtesy and compassion with all the staff we encountered.  From the moment we arrived it was like pulling teeth to get the security guards to stop chitchatting amongst themselves to direct us.  We explained that our daughter-in-law was dilated 8 cm and we were eager to get upstairs.   The entire experience thus far has been extremely irritating.  

No doubt I will have more to post as the evening continues.  With all the money this hospital generates from their patients, this hospital is run poorly.   It's all about their bottom line, greed.
It took an hour to receive our food for them to get the order wrong. Our food was cold and mediocre.

After a delightful dinner and a long walk, my wife and I decided to swing by this little froyo spot to satiate our sweet tooth. As many of the froyo spots are, this place does not give you the sample cups, but the staff will have to walk over and pour it out. As a consumer, I prefer the self-serve, but didn't mind the service. Unfortunately, the young lady behind the desk gave us the most unwelcoming, tired, and judgmental glares, as she rolled her eyes with two sample request, making me feel terrible for trying out froyo. I was not a super big fan of the sugary froyo flavors, but her glares made it that much more intolerable. We threw in a dollar in the tip jar and will never return unless further management training will tailor to a customer-centered environment.

This is a super honest review. I never do reviews, but I felt I should to save future residents anymore time and money to live here.
I have lived in vista for 2 years. (not anymore bc I was DONE with this place) all I can say is thank the Lord I am out. The first year was okay but vista just spiraled downhill for some reason. My experience in Vista was terrible the last year. I don't even have words to express how exhausted I became only after 3 months of living there. I tried to get out of my lease, but since it was a year long contract, I couldn't. And they told me I had to find someone to take my lease. That didn't help bc almost everyone I knew was put off by the price of living there ($700/person for a 2 bedroom and over $1000 for a single bedroom).. yeah. There was no way I was able to market my place to college students. Anyway, what made me so frustrated was management. It was by far the worst. My roommate and I dealt with constant music till 3am on weekdays from our neighbors and we talked to management 3 times in person, countless times by email and phone ... nothing was done to help us. We have also called security numerous times during the night and guess what? Security number hardly ever worked. Our neighbors also fought so many times, it was not even funny. Even when it was 4am ( walls are super thin here) It got so violent with the fighting that cops had to come to vista and one of the residents had to be removed from that room. By the way, management kept reassuring us that things would change. We would feel reassured and then let down each time. It was very frustrating. We have also left countless notes on our neighbors' doors and have let management know this. Still, no changes. 
I hardly ever right reviews but I really don't want anyone to have to go through this while spending over $700 or more for rent. Save yourself please and find a decent apartment complex if you are able to drive off campus. Sure.. it's close to campus but trust me. Its not worth the money and lack of sleep and the amount of frustration. 
I eventually moved out and decided to pay 2 months of rent even though I wasn't living there bc YES it was that terrible. I could not handle it any longer. 
ALSO, if you don't have a car and need to live close to campus, just live on campus dorms. Dorms at least has some sort of regulations and rules. Vista has none from what I could tell. If they did, it was not reinforced. 
If you took the time to read this, please know that I am being brutally honest here. As I mentioned, I never right reviews for anything bc I find it boring, but I am simply hoping to save people from this place and tell you that your money is worth spending elsewhere. Thank you and God bless.

Terrible service
My roasted chicken was cool and my wife pork chop was raw.
My water has a piece of paper.
Maneger never aproching to our table no until 15 minutes later.
From 1 to 10 i say 2

Sadly this place is just not the same anymore.  I'm not sure if they have new owners or what but I was very disappointed yesterday.  I've liked this place literally since before I was born (my mom ate here a lot when she was pregnant with me).  I ordered two Biff Burgers and two Biff Deluxe, simple order right?  The guy working the drive thru says?  "Oh, you want doubles?"  No, just two Biffs and two Biff deluxe.  After going back and forth he finally got it.  I waited for the food and I checked it before I drove back home.  All four burgers were ice cold.  Went back and asked for a refund and the guy says "wait, I have some cooking on the grill now."  So after waiting he slings the bag out the window and says " I made them all doubles" like he was doing me a favor.  I said, "I didn't want doubles" and he gave me a dirty look.  I was over it and just checked the bag to see if they were warm.  When I got home they were smothered with a ridiculous amount of mayo and biff sauce and didn't look all the way done.  Check your burgers before you leave or bite into one since this place can no longer be trusted.  Here's a tip for Biff, don't serve ice cream, fish sandwiches, wings, BBQ, etc. if you can't even handle a basic burger order.  You're welcome.

Very disappointed in my bouquet and the staff that was there seemed very out of it. I pay $40+ and receive it and notice some of the fruit was not good quality. I don't understand why there would be bad fruit in something I spend good money for. I will not be back. Incredibly disappointed.

Don't take the 5:00 o'clock dolphin ride. The lady working was running her mouth the entire time. You see a few dolphins the first 10 minutes of the ride then they drive you around for an hour and a half hoping you'll buy beers and snacks with absolutely no dolphins. Then pulling back in they get all excited that you pass the same dolphins in the marina from the beginning. Not to mention if you're even 1 min delayed they started pulling off the dock without 2 people from our group. They could have turned around from the cruising part one minute early and not had a delay at all but they might have missed an extra $1 from someone buying one bag of pretzels

If Lainey is in your boat I would recommend requesting a refund before you step foot on the boat

The food was good but the service was terrible. My waitress left without saying anything in the middle of my meal. No one noticed that I had no server. My to-go order hit dat in the window. When I finally said something the exec chef came over. He said they would deal with her (whatever that means) but made no offer to discount my meal. I wasn't going to spell it out for him so I just paid and left with no intention of ever going back. Too bad too, I liked the ribs

Let me start by saying this place is very clean and the techs were nice and friendly.  Thus said, my daughter and her friend needed a fill and gel polish.  I looked at the brochure and the pricing, I thought, looked reasonable.  When it was time to pay, however, I was irritated that the price was much higher.  When asked how they came up with the price, they pulled a different pricing list from behind the counter to explain.  This was not ok!!  Display your prices!!  

Also, during the manicure, the tech was answering texts and was gone for about 10 to 15 minutes.  This, I feel, was not very professional.  My daughter, also, explained to the tech that she had a bruise UNDER her nail.  The tech proceeded to file the nail and finally told my daughter she could not file the color out of her nail any more or she would put a hole in her nail!!  The bruise and color is UNDER the nail...think please!!

Luckily we are out of town guests and will not be back here.

"Well we don't do anything for free" - Caucasian male in his 60s. What horrible customer service. If you don't know how to speak to people with respect and dignity then you shouldn't be the front man for any business. If this man hadn't been so unpleasant and arrogant I may have left my car there. But nope, not giving my business nor money to this place EVER, and I teach right next door. It's hard to find decent people nowadays.
Quite overrated, had American Burger, it was served undercooked with less than ripe tomatoe, it seems that someone in Nashville has pushed everyone's ratings, I found no impressive food in 3 days

Terrible pace of play, no ranger. Called pro-shop, was asked "what do you want me to do about it". That's a joke. Having played here in the past and enjoying it this was a real shame, won't be returning.

Husband took our 7 year old dog that was attacked through neighbors fence,had a hold of her wouldn't release.   She had a chunk taken out of her neck.
