They REFUSED to talk to me the money person on the phone to tell me why they needed surgery they were to busy.   Took her out of there thankfully they finally agreed to give us antibiotics and pain killer for her.  Just like most after hours vets extremely expensive.  Will not go back unless I absolutely have no other choice

Just moved to town, and needed to get my dog's shots updated & nails trimmed. 45 minutes in, neither of those things had happened yet, and the vet talked NON STOP for the entire time, as she did her soft pitch for the wellness plan and rattled off a ton of information, Rainman-style about my dog, and dogs in general, and dog foods and dog medicines and dog anxiety issues. The vet was about to leave the room so that the vet tech could go over the wellness plan details with me. I never expressed an interest in the wellness plan, mind you. Plus, I had already been there 45 minutes! I actually had to cut the appt. short, because I needed to go back to work, so my dog didn't even get her routine shots or nails trimmed, which was the only reason I was there. Mostly, it was a complete waste of an hour, along with a $40+ charge. 

I have no idea if the wellness plan is a good deal or not, but I do know this place sells it HARD, and I do not want to sit through a sales pitch. I really just wanted to ask what the amount of money was that I needed to get this person to cut my dog's friggin' nails. Yeah, all the shots. Great. Sure, gimme that heartworm medicine you like. Love it. PLEASE JUST STOP TALKING.

LG&P security has been completely unprofessional and the "officers" have overstepped their power on numerous occasions. The entire security team has created a hostile environment at the Summit Student apartments and have handcuffed many of my friends for nothing more than noise complaints. One night, a couple of friends and I were on the balcony of an apartment and the security guards were offended by us calling them "rent-a-cops" and came pounding at the door minutes later. This led to 2 of the tennants in handcuffs and a completely ILLEGAL search of the entire apartment when they had no probable cause. It has gotten to the point where the security guards just harass the same apartment units when they have nothing better to do. LG&P is completely unprofessional and the officers have become unbelievably strict at a college living complex!! 0/5 stars, this so called "security" is costing the Summit alot of business and will continue to if they remain, as many of my friends have declined to renew their lease because of these clowns!

The whole experience was awful. The owner had to cancel on me on the same day of my massage due to her personal injury. When I text/call back for reschedule, she never bothered to answer. Through the website I got re-assigned to Michael. His place is a closet-like space in a sports club with LOTS of noise outside of the door. His operation is on an old and dirty-looking mattress that I am positive that he didn't change sheets between. Besides the awful environment, his competence is questionable and the worst is the attitude. After he sensed my back and glutes are tight, he kept making comments like "do you stretch... at all". I did some small talk at first but didn't feel like answering questions like this as I do lots of stretches but I went there for a massage because I know I have tight back and glutes and I don't need to defend my life style during a massage which was supposed to be a treat to myself. And he had to share the knowledge that my spine goes into brain... I would never go back nor recommend to any friends or strangers ever!

I used to eat here in the late sixties. The quality of meat has deteriorated substantially though the general atmosphere is virtually unchanged 
The wine selection is unchanged and the house wine is better than many choices.

I live 3 minutes from this store. Haven't been there for awhile. Yikes my sandwhich was so wet and soggy I couldn't eat it... I quit going for a long time because the owner had his own policy some time back to hide olives and other items unless u asked for them specifically for them. So say everything and you wouldn't get everything. Either way this latest experience no good. Save your money.

Gorgeous spot. Not great food. The restaurant has been a lot of things, and Manatee's is still a beautiful place. The food was unnecessarily spicy. It was not a well-placed (or well-advertised) use of some unique or helpful sauce. It was just peppery. Even the kids' food, which is usually bland for good reason, was full of pepper. My chicken quesadilla was spicy. It wasn't advertised as "Pepper Chicken" or "Tobasco Chicken". Nope. Just full of black pepper. The fries were oddly peppery. Not sure why, but disappointing nonetheless.

My friend and I were recently visiting Tampa and we went to Panara pick up and they messed up our order so terribly as well as did not supply us any utensils for Mac and cheese and salad. It was a truly disappoint experience and the woman on the phone who took the ores was rude and kept putting us on hold 4x to be exact without telling us or saying anything to us.

Arrived at the bar around 6:30 pm. Sat at a table and server stopped over and gave us the wine menu. 15 minutes later and he still hadn't come back. People who arrived after us received their drinks and one of the managers stood at their table for 10 minutes and didn't acknowledge that we hadn't received service. My husband got up and went to the hostess for assistance. Although she immediately spoke with one of the bartenders, we still didn't get waited on. After waiting an additional 5 minutes, we got up to leave and that is when the manager finally acknowledged the issue. Worst experience at what should be a 5 star restaurant. We will not be back. There are too many great restaurants in the area to waste our time at a restaurant that apparently doesn't understand how to manage!

They have great wines but they are not customer focused. My delivery was unsuccessful without anyone ringing at our door and the package was returned to Craft & Curd. Tom charged me $48 for this fail of the delivery company. I canceled my order and will not shop with them again.

The flatbread and salads were a good size but our server wasn't very personable and didn't really show any enthusiasm about being at work.

Our flatbread took longer than main entrees at another table.

I used to order from this place, through GrubHub, at least three times a week spending over $100. Normally the food is amazing but something I ordered came out completely different from what was advertised. So I called the restaurant and was greeted by the rudest manager on the planet. Not only was she disputing every little thing I said but she refused to come to some sort of compromise. She then told me she was going to call the owner to ask what the owner wanted to do about the situation and then call me back. I waited 30 minutes, no call back, so I ended up having to call GrubHub and let them negotiate the situation. I will never order from this rude restaurant ever again. They obviously have no idea what the they obviously have no idea what the words customer service mean. If there were an option for negative star they would be getting a negative 5!

Horrible experience here on a Monday night. Took forever to be served and food way below average. We were told we couldn't sit in the booth we wanted because "something happened there" before we walked in. Probably someone throwing up from the food. Staff was acting very strange the whole time. Carpet was filthy. Soup was cold. Nothing fresh. Me and my partner were actually laughing about how bad our experience was on the way home. From the time we sat down and the time we left, a full hour and 15 minutes had passed. Best thing we had tonight was the ginger that accompanied the Sushi. The 60 dollar bill was icing on the cake. Never go here. Go to Ninki

WHAT THE HELL!!!! Went to pick up lunch last Sunday 2/25 and they weren't open it was 11:30am!!!! Sunday hours are supposed to be 10:30!  So I called a lady answered the phone and she said not enough employees showed up so can't open yet!!!! What kind of customer service is this??? Boy has this place gone down hill ! The place has just been remodeled!!! Guess this justifies the 1.3 star review! If i didnt open my store on time i would be fired!!!

Online it says that they perform battery replacement of iPod Nano 6th generation.  I called ahead to confirm and they said they did repair that model, but they couldn't quote me a price without them plugging it in to do a diagnostic.

So, I drive nearly a half hour to get there, hand in my iPods.

A couple minutes later she walks back out w/ my iPods and says that they don't service that model?  

WTH?  The website they do that work, they affirmed it on the phone, only to waste an hour of my time and no fixed iPods.

Without doubt, this is the most poorly managed Pep Boys in the franchise.  Because they're somewhat close and can accommodate weekend appointments, they're my go-to for the regular oil change. 
I went online & grabbed a Sunday morning 9AM slot. I arrived at 8:45.  Someone opened the door promptly at 9, then informed us that no one had arrived. We had to wait half an hour for staff to arrive and another 15 before taking keys. 
POOR SERVICE!!

Absolutely atrocious customer service. We rented a car for Christmas and the man working the counter was rude and unprofessional. Something was wrong with his credit card reader, so he took a separate card to hold the reservation and manually entered the information himself, having us verbally agree to the contract before signing. When we returned the car, the cost was double what we were quoted, and the highest level of insurance had been selected by the employee upon receiving the car, despite declining coverage in the reservation and retrieval of the car. The manager gave us an incorrect number to reach him to settle the issue once we flew home, and never followed up as he stated he would after the holidays. Several run-around phone conversations later, with local and corporate representatives, the issue has still not been resolved. Any other company would check records, question the employee as to what happened that day, or at the very least offer options to make this situation right.
I got food poisoning from the food here. I work in the food industry myself. Thanks for serving me bad food I threw all my food away... SMFH never coming here again!!

Rather disappointing. All the reviews I read about this place made it seem top notch. Food was average at best. Hot chicken biscuit wasn't all that good. The home made tots are bland tasting. Not sure if it's how they make them, or if they're suppose to be mushy inside. Only good call out, they have Big Red as a fountain drink!! I'm a big fan of Blake, but go to Aldean's, it's better.

PS. Service was horribly slow!

I swear it's impossible to find a good Italian restaurant in the South. I cannot pinpoint what the problem is, so like every north easterner, I'll blame it on the water.   We opted to sit at the bar as we did not have reservations. The service was excellent and the bartenders were very friendly. 

We were provided with complimentary bread which was my favorite part of the meal.  It was freshly baked and came out piping hot.  I ordered the the Tagliatelle Bolognese. The bolognese came with prime beef and Berkshire pork. The meat was too chunky for me and sadly, the sauce tasted the Ragu. The seasoning seemed right but maybe it was the tomatoes? The tagliatelle was also a little to thick. 

For dessert I ordered the Chocolate Budino and it completely missed the mark.  The budino itself was grainy and there was barely any caramel sauce or it was too thin to notice.  I wish they did a salted caramel to bring out more of the caramel taste.  

I wouldn't recommend this place if you're used to authentic Italian food.
Overpriced Burger King. Do not eat here. They do not give  you enough food and the service took forever.

My husband and I ate here yesterday and I vomited last night and was unable to sleep and my husband vomited this morning! We are both sick from eating at this place. The reason we ventured to this place was that we had a buy one get one free on the axcess card. When we first walked in my husband said that it looked "a bit dodgy", but I persisted and said it would be fine. We are not fine. Please be warned.

This restaurant has been our place of choice since we usually stay at the Marriott next door. Our previous experiences have always been great. The service was impeccable; however, today, for Mother's Day, there's a different story.

We were seated upstairs. A new one for us. We waited almost 10 minutes for someone to come to our table. Our server wasn't pleasant to us at all but was the opposite to the white guests around us. We had to ask for everything, and, when we did, he stayed gone forever although he was still waiting on the other guests. He took our water glasses for refills but didn't bring them back until we asked. While this was our daughter's first trip here, we were embarrassed because we highly recommended the restaurant for this special occasion.

So while staying at the new opal Sands Hotel we decided to venture across the street for breakfast. Please don't it was a huge mistake! After my wife receiving this horrible omelet for breakfast we decided to call it to the waitress attention that it was very dry and burnt. Egg should be yellow not brown or black in any manner. She immediately responded with well I can't take the whole thing off the bill they are expensive. Well we didn't win anything off the bill but maybe one that wasn't burnt would have been good. I told the waitress nevermind we just wanted to bring it to your attention that most people may not like burnt food.

Ultimately we didn't have anything taken off the bill but we would not return. The food was bad the service was worse. There were no redeeming qualities in the restaurant it was old and dated and combined with bad food and four waitresses who chatted with each other like they were mad at the world why return?

Do yourself a favor find somewhere else to eat.

Certainly was looking forward to having a high end steakhouse in Metairie. Bread with Bri butter was good. We all started with onion soup and all thought it was spectacular. French 75 cocktails were also very enjoyable. Steaks.. 4 ppl we tried several cuts. Two chose the filet, 1 bone in ribeye, and 1 dry aged ribeye. 2 were cooked medium and 2 requested med rare. Complaints were the same across the board, fairly dry, not very flavorful, not all that tender.  Sides we had brussel sprouts and Fleming's potatoes...both were average, forgettable. Very disappointing.

Mediocre customer service. The employees always seem irritated and so does the manager. He's an older guy. This time I went I was so annoyed because I ordered a sprite with very light ice. The girl at the window gave me a cup full of ice and I asked her to please give me less ice. She scoffed and remade my drink. The manager then cam over and poured sprite from another cup into my cup. I just thought that was poor leadership and is also cross contamination. Although it was my cup, they should have discarded it and gotten me a new one and filled it up enough.
Hot fudge container has been broken for months.  Very disappointing for the Baskin Robbins lovers.   Very very bad!

Save your time and money and DO NOT GO TO NTB. I went in on a Sunday for an oil change and was told I needed brakes and a filter. I replaced the filter that day and came back two days later for brakes. When the brakes were complete I was told that my water pump was leaking badly. I asked if it was that bad why wasn't that something they saw two days prior? They saw that I needed a filter but not that my water pump was leaking? They didn't have an answer for that. I was told that for my vehicle I also have to get a new time and chain. I asked for a printed out quote. Which I was not given at that time just told that it was over $1000. They suggested that I get a sealant that may work. I got the sealant and they put it in and told me that it did slow it down. I left and before I made it to my destination my car overheated. I brought it back and they put more coolant in it and told me they would look up another sealant that would work and would call me back. I waited a few hours and called them back and was placed on hold for 10 mins. I called back and an extremely moody manager answered. I asked if he was having a bad day and said that he was just frustrated. I'm the one that should be frustrated! I finally got a hold of the guy I was dealing with and told him I needed a quote. He said he would call me when he was done with it. I definitely wasn't about to wait on that again so I went up there. He quoted me around $1100 and told me it was about a 5 or 6 hour job. I asked if they could adjust the price since it was something major they had missed and my car was FINE before I took it to them. He said he would talk to the moody manager when he calmed down. Of course I never got a call back. I left a review and corporate contacted me saying they would do something to help and get the issue solved. They contacted the store and was told the amount of time it would take and that they could get it down to around $900. I was quoted $800 somewhere else and told them they should honor or beat that price. They said I should get a call from the store with a price. I get another call from corporate the next day where one person now tells me the location doesn't have the tools to do the work, which is a complete lie, and a corporate manager who says the district manager doesn't feel comfortable with the location doing the work all of a sudden. A mechanic at that location told me he had replaced a water pump and time and chain three times on a Charger but all of a sudden you don't feel comfortable doing it??? It was the worse experience I have ever had and I have been going to them for 12 years! Absolutely no point in corporate contacting me to hand me more bs and waste my time with excuses and lies. Don't waste yours! Go elsewhere for repairs!

Really disappointed by this place. I had been here once but hadn't gotten my nails done so I was really looking forward to going today. I went an hour before their stayed close time. When I walked in, there were "at least" four employees within eyesight that saw me walk in but ignored me (one on their phone, one cleaning, one at register, and another I'm not sure ). It was not busy there were a couple people in seats as though they were waiting for someone and there (to the best of my knowledge) was only one person being serviced. I asked "are you guys about to close?" The guy looked up from his phone and said "yea" then went back to it. I know nail salons aren't known for their customer service but I was a bit surprised they weren't more friendly (I had in my mind this salon was going to be just awesome all around for some reason). As I walked it I noticed the door said they closed today at 7, so I went back in and asked about it. They guy looked up from his phone to say "no 6" then again went back to his phone. Overall I just feel they should practice better customer service and if their sign is wrong, they should change it or tell people. It really saddened me to know it won't be a place I regularly visit.

The first time I went here it was great and the lady who did my dip polish was wonderful. Probably the best looking one I've gotten in the year+ that I've been getting dip manicures. 

The next time I went was a totally different experience. The chick that did my nails was unprofessional. She left the foils on way too long and my cuticles were super dry afterwards. They don't need to be left on the entire length of a pedicure, especially since they use plastic gloves to heat the acetone. 

She rushed my dip manicure and kept asking other nail techs if they would give her a manicure. She left while I was still drying at her station and started getting a manicure herself next to another tech! So there were 2 techs tied up giving 2 other techs manicures, 4 total employees! I've never ever ever seen a nail technician receive treatment while the salon was open, much less two at once. 

My nails and cuticles look TERRIBLE. I'm going to have to go to my normal salon and get them fixed, I don't trust this place now because of the horrible inconsistencies and lack of professionalism.

Holy shit this place is so messed up.  They have arguably the best setup for football watching but the staffing is a complete shit show.   One.  Yes one single bartender serving their massive dining room and bar.   Worst service I've had in a LONG time.

After ordering the bartender admitted that her service would be bad.   Then after ordering wings she said "those are going to take a long time"

Never once saw a manager come to the rescue. 

It's really a shame since this could be a go to destination for Sat/Sun football but given their staffing challenges I would avoid at all costs!

Erik Torres and Chad Zamora completely betrayed my trust and rolled out all the classic lies that give car salesmen a bad name. The first visit started with Erik showing my wife and I new and used Outbacks and ended with him giving us an invoice and a quote for our trade-in. All negotiations revolved around the invoice price. 

I called back a week later when he was busy, so he had his partner Chad call me back. After learning we were shopping around, Chad agreed to $6,000 for my trade-in. I emphasized I needed to agree on that price ahead of time as I had to tow the trade-in car from our home an hour from the dealership, and get childcare, to finalize the deal for a new Outback. After arriving at the dealership as promised, the story started to change. Suddenly there was a "huge miscommunication" and they were no longer able to agree to the $6,000 quote. Oh and by the way, they wanted to start negotiating from MSRP. 

I partly blame myself for not getting the deal in writing via email before arriving there. They knew I was jumping through hoops to get the deal done and were just using that leverage against me. They just had to get me in there and could then completely change the story. (I now understand why Eric Torres has worked for six dealerships in four years.) 

We ended up walking away, selling our car to CarMax for $8,000 and buying our Outback from Gold Rush Subaru, which was a great experience.

Based on the pictures I saw on Facebook, I was expecting a meal prep kit with an emphasis on healthier choices. Instead, I was sent what essentially was a Lean Cuisine-like pre-packaged meal that tasted like cardboard for about 3-4X the cost of a Lean Cuisine.  Huge disappointment.
Food is overpriced for the portions. Servers are rude I was left unattended to for almost 15 min after I sat down

Lacks organization - you pay and they tell you to wait over at the picnic tables. After 15 minutes we go up to find out why other people are going and you aren't only to find out that you were forgotten. Then you wait another 15 minutes to harnessed and instructed. Then you have one hour until closing in our case. Suggest they use a better system to notify people when it's their turn - PA system. Fun course though!

Incredibly unsanitary! The dog did not go unnoticed by the manager...instead it was thought to be cute. What is wrong with people that they can't go 10 minutes without their animal by there side. The kid in the picture was here to buy alcohol for his party. This has to be stopped.  Next message is to be health board, or what ever regulatory agency is responsible for policing this.

Came in to have a nice dinner with the wife and was sorely disappointed. After sitting at our table and waiting for our food to come out for quite a while I realize me and my wife are both sweating... come to find out the air conditioning is broken and the restaurant is HOT. Finally get our food and my wife's plate which was a plane burger and fries has several random food items scattered in her fries and on the side of her burger. So hot in the restaurant we can't sit and wait for a new plate, poor experience and will never come back to this place.
Horrible service by far  the most worst server ever.  I would recommend trying another locatio in st pete or clearwater.  BUT HED THE WARNING STAY AWAY FROM Fords Garage in Brandon.

First off, this is a very nice store. The employee's  are very nice, it's pretty convenient. I'm pretty much always in and out. But my concern is the security in the store. I was profiled all because I was walking around looking at stuff in the store after I made a purchase. Yes I know, why would I still be in the store after I made a purchase but I was just in there waiting on my ride. I'm always in this store. I am appalled by his actions. I called the store to speak to a manager and all she said was that she'll talk to him. I'm pretty sure it'll happen again!! I will no longer shop here bc it's funny how I was singled out!!!!

If there was a lower rating than 1 star it would have been zero. The business has an incredibly rude owner no matter whether calling for repairs or buying-selling appliances. Prices are not competitive at all. Don't waste your time, remember, it's your money as a customer and nobody, has to take the dirt Abe Bidarian hands out.

I got married a month ago. I went to this locations out 6-8 months before the wedding and my experience started out ok. I had gone in 3 times to find my dress and each time I had an appointment, and each time I had to share the consultant. It didn't bother me too much but I thought it odd to have an appointment and still have to share. So I finally found a dress, the one I tried on was too big but they said in the right size with some altering it would fit where and how I wanted. They ordered the dress and it did come in early which was great. I asked when I should get it altered and they said there would be plenty of time and to bring it in ( this was January 18 my wedding was in March) Once I started dealing with the alterations department is when my experience went downhill. I went in to fit my dress. The lady was very nice, did my fitting and I went on my way. I didn't have any extensive alterations, a hem, bra cups, and I added some pretty straps. Fast forward to 3 days before my final fitting and when I was supposed to pick up my dress. I get a phone call saying that they pulled my dress out to alter it, and when they started the work somehow there were slash marks on my dress it must've been out while working on another dress and it got cut, and they couldn't fix it. They were going to have to get a new one (mind you this is now February 18th, my wedding was March 7th but it was an out of state wedding and I was leaving on the 3rd) she said they'd put a rush but I'd have to come in again for a new fitting. I was scheduled for a new fitting for the expected arrival time. The dress came in early which was nice but the alterations manager still wanted me to come in on the original date. She said and I quote " We're so busy and booked we'll try and fit you in". Excuse you???? This is not my fault and my wedding is only a couple weeks away and you are acting like you're doing me a favor by squeezing me in? Not to mention losing wages because I had to leave work early to make appointments that should've been taken care of already. I ended up getting in a day early but not by their insistence, but by mine. I went in and the lady was nice and did my fitting and I left. The next appointment to come in was a day BEFORE I left for my wedding. I went in with my sister who was picking her dress up. She was leaving later for the wedding so she had more time. We walked in and the alterations manager was there and she went on about how busy she was and how she was the only one there with all this work to be done and she had OTHER brides coming in and walk in pinnings to do. It made me feel like I wasn't worth the time and all those other brides were more important and that I should be sooo grateful that she was squeezing me in. That was the theme of my experience, we're squeezing you in so be happy, which was ridiculous since this whole thing WAS NOT MY FAULT. I tried the dress on and one of the bra cups was a third showing and the straps were gapping. I asked why the straps were not supporting anything and were falling off my shoulder, she said the the bodice is supposed to hold everything up and it wasn't the straps job, it is the straps job to stay on my shoulders though....whatever. She had to alter it so she said we'd have to wait. I asked her how long  and she said, again, that her next fitting with another bride was at 630 it was 430. So my sister and I had to wait around for 2 hours. We finally came back and when we walked in she asked did you want to try it on again?? I said uh yes, I'd like to make sure it fits. I tried it on and it was better and so I took the dress home, but I had a sad feeling about how everything went. It was an added stress that I didn't need and didn't deserve.



***Update***
I did end up emailing the lady from David's bridal from the comment below on April 16th and received absolutely no answer back. I think they post that response to make it look like they try to make it better or actually care but they don't. Just another disappointment from David's Bridal!

Came late night after arriving in Reno from Burning Man. Didn't look super busy, it was around 4am, my boyfriend and I were seated and almost immediately I noticed a small cockroach crawling across our table. We let the staff know, they didn't seem phased by it. We asked for another booth (should have left after that, but we were desperate). 
Once we got situated in a new booth our server did take a while to come grab our order, he seemed overworked. My cheeseburger didn't have cheese, I had to ask 3x for it. They ran out of milkshakes! Food sucked!

I liked the dancing and music. Disappointed that there were no views out of the rooftop, also at the end I didn't like that I could not use the restroom they told me they forbid me to use it even though I am pregnant and really had to go. Also when we were exiting and just stood next to the elevator for a minute the male worker treated us like cattle and mind you we were a quite group of young women. So customer service is

IHOP - Riverview FL
Unlike the IHOP in Valrico, this one seemed clean and well managed, until, that is, the food came.
Although the table service was good; congenial, responsive and attentive, nothing makes up for food that misses the mark.  This chain, who holds itself out as a "premiere pancake restaurant" served overcooked pancakes that broke apart at first contact with a fork.   For your local greasy spoon, this may be understandable if not forgivable, but not for an IHOP.  The eggs were overcooked as well so this made the visit regrettable. As with many IHOP locations this one was a bit crowded.  But that's no excuse. Focus on the basics; perfect, light and spongy pancakes.

We have moved several times in the past but be assured if we move again we WILL NOT USE FOX MOVING !!!!! Beware if your a senior, we were lied to, our things destroyed,and we bought there insurance ( SCAM) one of the owners of this pitiful excuse for a moving company told me we filed to late. We have both had serious health problems and we had to help this lousy crew on a 100 degree day while the lead man was gone to get a Second Truck (FIRST LIE) that we wouldn't have needed if he had stayed and done his job. This guy was gone for hours leaving a bunch of kids to do his job, oh, lets not forget the nice lunch the crew had around our dinning room table. That was a special moment!!!  So to sum this up, If you have to depend on help, DO NOT CALL this so called moving co. Oh I didn't mention the storage units. We moved 500 miles and had to put our things in storage. The lead guy said we didn't have enough storage units(SECOND LIE). Just like we needed the 2nd truck. Well guess what ? WE DIDN'T ! That's when our things were destroyed. We both had to leave because of illnness due to trying to help them and driving most of the night. When we came back the boxes marked fragile, glass, do not stack on. These boxes were on the bottom or just thrown in some random place. If they had not been packed so well by my wife, All of the things would have been destroyed,but instead, some of them. Broke a leg from one of our den chairs by stacking a concrete birdbath on top of it. It looks like when we left they started throwing things off the truck. BEWARE !!!

If I could give them negative stars I would. My insurance company called and requested to put a car on hold. I called hertz the night before to confirm and they asked me if I could pick up the car tonight seeing as I was in the emergency room I told them I would be in either tonight or tomorrow morning, the man I spoke to said that was fine. I went in at 9am to pick up the car and they had the audacity to say we never confirmed when I called the night prior and they do not have any cars for me now.

I don't usually get my nails done, but I figured it was time to treat myself. Found this place through yelp and the reviews/pictures pulled me in. I made an appointment for a regular nail polish. When I came in, they immediately seated me. And before I chose a color, I wanted to make sure I was getting regular nail polish, for which the lady nodded her head and said yes. It wasn't until they put my hands under the UV that I realized it was gel. By the end of it, they charged me $30 and assured me it would last 2-3 weeks, which was fine by me because, as I've mentioned, I don't usually get my nails done. My nails were a pretty pink/nude and I was happy with it for pretty much 5 days until it started to chip. I called them the next day and with no problem, the lady on the phone (Coco?) told me to come back and they'd re-do the chipped nails. 

So I come back about 1.5 weeks after my first appointment and again, they seated me immediately. They decided that they only needed to work on my right hand, and the middle finger on my left hand. They sanded and buffed out the gel, but I noticed they didn't use any nail polish remover. They applied the new polish and within 30 minutes, I was good to go. You could tell one hand looked brighter than the other, but it was also bumpier because they just slapped on new nail polish over the old one. Literally one day later, the new polish chipped on my thumb, and you could see the old nail polish. On top of that, the nails that were colored from the first time started chipping too. 

I was honestly hoping the nails would last for at least 2 weeks, especially having gone TWICE. I have only done gel polish once before, but they definitely lasted longer than this. I gave them 2 stars for their immediate response, and their attempt to re-doing my nails. But the quality and the shoddy-attempt to fix it are why it's only 2 stars.

So, I walked in here hoping for a great selection and good service. However, I bought my little yorkie mix, who is a service animal, specifically an emotional support animal for children. Upon entering, I was told I couldn't bring my dog in. First of all, this is Fishtown, which is extremely dog friendly. Second of all, I told the guy he was a service animal and he said and I quote, "we don't allow all service animals, for example, emotional support animals". This isn't just illegal, it is absurd. Walked out upset and annoyed and definitely didn't order anything. The menu wasn't anything to write home about anyhow.

First time here, we came in for the Party at the Peak event. Our wait for 5 people was quoted at 45 min which we were ok with since there was a lot to see. Our total wait was 1 hour and 20 mins, when we got sat service was quick and efficient. We ordered chips and salsa, chips were store bought and ok. I ordered a bbq beef sandwich which was ok, the corn on the cob that came with was cold, table bread was something worse than wonder bread with good butter. My husband ordered the Top Sirloin, he asked for medium but got rare. He isnt one to send something back so he ate it, shortly figured out it was mostly unedible since it was all fat. Our friends shared a filet mignon and said it was fine but didnt have any special to it.

At a certain time of night this McD only does cash and refuses to give you a receipt. Sketchy. A large woman was cleaning the cafe machine with no gloves or anything but was serving drinks and touching caps. Gross. Waited in drive thru for over 10 min for an unsweetened tea and Big Mac. Nobody addressed me , so I didn't bother to tell me they gave me $3 too much back from my $10. Hope you enjoy your corporate complaint filed by a former McD employee that actually cared about its franchise.

Pro: bowling is tons of fun, music and well lit lanes 
Cons: service is terrible! Ordered food and drinks and drinks never came until requested after three times. Then no napkins, and utensils. I guess I'll just put my oily hands into all the balls.

Rude service at the bar. We ordered food from the counter and made to sit at the 20% full bar. The bartender told us the bar was for customers only. Fine, but he was a real jerk about it. He then aggressively told me I was taking napkins from the wrong spot. Foods okay, about what you expect, but there bar cop was overly aggressive.

I wanted to like this but it was nearly impossible. The hostesses were extremely friendly and we got our table immediately.
Off to a good start! Started flipping through the drink menu and noticed there was just wine. Asked our waitress- who seemed less than thrilled to be there- if there was a beer list and she informed us that there were pages missing from the menu we had- she brought us a new one.
My husband and I both ordered the blood orange IPA. The waitress left and 5 mins later came back to tell us that they were tapping a new keg and it would be a few mins. No problem. Came back 5 mins later and said they were having trouble finding the keg. I ordered a new beer- Wicked Weed sour, only to find out that they were out of that one too. I decided to not have a beverage. Later I noticed all of these yummy mixed drinks being ordered at tables around us-- our menus must have been missing the mixed drinks page, too. 
I ordered a bowl that included root veggies and eggs. Decided to pay the extra and get seitan added. Found out they were out of that, too. Clearly some restocking issues. Received my bowl. Not bad. It was supposed to come with an herb hollandaise but of course mine didn't have it.
Told our waiter and she told the manager and came back to our table to say, "it should be on the bottom". Well, it wasn't... but I don't understand why it had to be questioned. 
Overall the food was okay. The service was mediocre and they clearly need to update their menus. It's really disappointing to go somewhere and be out of nearly everything you order. We won't be back.

My wife & I had lunch here on 8/21/18; table 14/1; server: Cody. We were seated promptly, but took a good while before the server arrived to take the order; and then took almost 30 minutes before we were served. She had pulled pork sandwich; I had brisket sandwich. Sandwiches of precooked meats should not take 30 minutes. French fries were very good; onion rings not good at all. Pork & brisket were so-so; nothing special here. On the plus side, we were seated next to the window on busy Bloomingdale Avenue and no traffic noise was to be heard.
Don't stay here if it is still close to the date of this post. They are doing renovations. I can still hear the saw going off. It doesn't stop.

I can't find a single price on their online menu. And I'm not a tightwad. But I like to look over a menu before I head to a restaurant and have an idea what I might order. I also look at the prices. No price = I'm slamming you in the review.

If you are thinking of this venue save your money. Go somewhere else for the amount of money spent they treated people disrespectfully.  Servers did not even put water on the table.  Food was disgusting.  It took forever to get any service.  There service was poor.

They rounded my drain plug off to the point that they couldn't get it off then tried to blame everyone else but themselves. Thankfully they refused to do any more service and sent me packing before they could mess anything else up.

This is my first time staying at this particular Marriott location despite having grown up in New Orleans.  This Marriott has been in operation since at least my grade school days--over 40 years ago.  Great location, cute elevator system, valet only parking at $42 per day, and a nice expansive lobby area. I'm not sure the "upgrade" to club level is worth it though.  The M Club is certainly an interesting concept, but a trip to the gift shop is in your future if you count on a late night trip to the M Club to satisfy your craving you will be disappointed.  Also you should  plan on bringing your own phone charger--three out of 4 usb room chargers did not work. 

Over all I would suggest  if you visit during a special event--in our case a Saints game and the Sugar Bowl NCAAF bowl game--be prepared to pay $$$ more than you'd expect for a similar moderate hotel.

Located walking distance from Quarter, Bourbon Street, Riverwalk, Convention Center, Harrah's Casino.

I have been to this place a few times and I had a great experience with a great massage therapist who has since left. This time I selected a new therapist on a recommendation. The massage was fine but nothing out of the ordinary.  I would be willing to try other therapists that would be more my style if it weren't for my experience in the waiting room. 

I got to massage about 15 minutes before my massage. When I got there the receptionist was on the phone.  I hadn't been there in a while so she asked me to fill out the paperwork again. However she said to the person on the phone "one sec" then ask me to fill out the papers and get right back on the phone. Then again asking me to select my music with "one sec" and right back on the phone with what clearly sounded like a social conversation. Then back on the phone, stops again with her "one sec" and says to me "it's 11:50 you're like super early will it be okay if you're therapist is a few minutes late?"  Super early wtf my appt is at 12.   I confirm the appt time with her and say that it's fine. 

She gets back on the phone then steps out into the hallway. I can still hear the entire conversation and at this point it is escalating and she is cursing and screaming. This goes on for a while and then she comes back in says bye (insert diminutive) and sits down and then pleasantly asks me if I want a water as if nothing happened and she hadn't been ignoring me for 15 minutes. 

The massage therapist apologized for being a few minutes late and I told her I wasn't worried about that but the receptionist was incredibly unprofessional. She apologized and said she was actually a GENERAL MANAGER. Needless to say if this is how they run their business I'm not going back.  I know it's not a super fancy salon but I could get better service across the street at rite aid!

And surprise surprise miss unprofessional didn't even apologize to me for her behavior.

Came here for brunch party of 4. The wait wasn't too crazy, we waited about 20-30 minutes for a table. Decided to try the shrimp and grits. Grits were way too grainy. Grits are suppose to be smooth and rich and creamy, this was the total opposite. Also my plate of shrimp and grits didn't have as much gravy as my friends so it was super dry. Whatever, ended up paying extra for the gravy, thanks to the server who DIDN'T give us a heads up on the extra charge. Service was bad, our server looked like he didn't want to be there. Also the people handing out the food just put plates down and didn't ask who ordered what. Mediocre service and food, save your money and go elsewhere!

Gah!!  Super expensive!!  I was totally surprised by the cost of things here.  I found what I wanted on Amazon for much cheaper-- the same exact thing at this store was much more expensive!

Pros: It's a big store with lots of items-- so great for just wandering around looking at everything they have.  You'll probably find what you are looking for or something crafty to do.

Tip: Do NOT buy anything here unless it's on sale/ clearance or you have some type of coupon.

I also didn't care for all the religious propaganda everywhere  :-/

This was awful, and the water park wasn't worth it either. We will not be back... Rooms are very old. Towel holder broke, bathroom was not clean and carpets in hallways were dirty.

The water park was eh, again I wouldn't spend money here ever again. Lazy river was good. But no real open water for kids to play in, very small section with basket ball hoops and seemed overly crowded... Not to mention, that when we went to eat, inside water park, waiting in line 45 minutes, then even longer time to wait for the expensive "fast" food to come out. No ketchup, asked for them to refill it, and nothing happened for 15min...
The breakfast buffet was very basic, and not my image of a breakfast buffet. Scrambled eggs were tasteless.

 Overall, definitely not worth it in our experience.

You better have plenty of time.  You won't get your car washed on your lunch hour I will tell you that.  Very slow.  I paid $22.00 for a full service car wash and a $3.00 tip up front.  Bad mistake.  I only had an hour.  Needless to say I only got the outside washed.  They got it vacuumed and I did not have time to stay as I had to go back to work.  I talked to the owner who really did not care.. Did not offer a refund or to make it right.  Just made excuses and got real defensive.  I will never go back.  Way to slow and disorganized!!!
Very poor customer service, had my vehicle for a full day and did not touch it. Said they didnt have time, i made a appointment a week ahead.very disappointing.

My family and I loved going to this place and sometimes we would go twice a week. I typically get the same think( steak with lobster tail and 2 lemon drop martini's). Thursday March 29, 2018 I asked my husband to meet me at Miller's to try their Prime Rib Special. He arrived before me and went to the bar to order me a Lemon Drop Martini. When I got to the restaurant our seat was ready and he gave me my drink. I asked him where was the rest of the drink because it looked like 3 big sips were missing simply because going there for 9 years I have NEVER had a martini that was not filled to the rim. I went to the bar to ask for my alcohol in the glass because it was no way that a drink of that size should have not been served. The bar girl had an attitude and I saw when she threw the drink out and made another drink. She brought the complaint to the Managers attention (older white man with glasses) and he came back with the second glass of my lemon drop that still wasn't full. He asked with the half glass of martini in his hand," Do you have a problem with this drink?" I immediately asked for my money back because as the Manager he had no intention to accommodate me in no way and I knew he was going to say something like the alcohol is measured. He offered absolutely NOTHING to help me be happy! After a long day of work and I talked about going to this establishment afterwards, I was so disappointed and especially because I also work in a customer driven environment, I should have not been treated this way. My family and I never ate because I was so humiliated how the Manager did not accommodate my small situation that turned so bad for us. We will never go back to this establishment again.

Server was polite and this place reminded me of the type of places you'd see in the old movies. Cute but Huevo rancheros were a joke. No sauce nothing. 

My partner had the steak fajitas and he was starving but after one bite he passed. We still had to pay full prices for the food even though he barely ate anything and the fajitas was horrible. Get real. Your food makes Los Betos look like a 5 star restaurant and we pay way less there.

Service was terrible.  Food quality horrible.  Don't come here.  Waste of money.  We even got up charged for a double drink that was never ordered.  Go some where else.  A kiosk for $15 pistachios would be better spent.

If I could give 0 Stars, I would. I NEVER give a bad Yelp review, but this has to be done. McAlisters has a window for phone orders--yet nobody will answer the phone. Repeated calls went unanswered. Pulled up to the window to let the gentleman know and and hopefully place an order. He told us calls went to a call center and he had no control over it--and didn't seem to care. Now, there is NOBODY in line--NOBODY and he refused to take our order through the window since it's for "call in orders only". I had looked forward to this opening but will never darken the door again. 

Could it be the call center? Probably so, but you take care of the customer first. Period. Very bad first (and last) impression.
Short version of the review - just go to Chilis. Much better airport food choices that here. The food selection is tiny and below the quality of the stuff at Chili's.

Stopped by on a Wednesday and tried to order a quarter pounder without onions and mustard.  They kept asking me to repeat my order as if they did not understand but I know they did.   Laughing going on in the background. Ghetto and really bad service here.  By looking at the reviews it has been going on for some time and nobody seems to care.  Where is corporate.

HORRIBLE AUTO PARTS STORE - BEWARE

In addition to the fact that they are rude, ignorant, and completely unprofessional, they do not back the warranties that they supposedly provide.

STAY FAR AWAY!!

Don't do it! 

Pros-Prices very reasonable.  My primary cleaner, Shande, was super nice.

Cons - Cleaning just meh.  
Two no shows.  After the second no-show in as many months, I fired them.  The first no-show was the initial cleaning.  Ok, things happen.  There was a call and no message the day before and the day of the 2nd no-show.  When I called to inquire why no one showed, the woman who answered  didn't know who I was, insisted that they left a message, although she had no idea what the message might have said and speculated, "Maybe they came to your house and couldn't get in."  There was no, "I'll follow up to see what happened."  There was no apology, no "how can I make this right."  This company is completely disorganized and unprofessional.

I was excited to see this establishment re-open so quickly after it closed under a different business name. The long and short is that I was served the worst breakfast I had ever gotten in my entire life. Parts of the signature dish "farmers breakfast" were missing completely. ( the potato cakes specifically ) on top of the fact that biscuits and gravy generally come with 2 standard 3"-3.5" round biscuits split equaling 4 pieces.. this plate served 1 dried out husk the size of a half dollar.. The gravy tasted like they had poured a few cups of flour and water in it to stretch the volume.. the mixture tasted like starch and nothing else, they also forgot the side I ordered, which I had to request. The scrambled eggs were standard but entirely forgettable, and presented in a very sloppy manner. Extremely disappointing and sad,  I left hungry and confused because i literally was not served the full meal i had ordered. My date was happy with her waffle - the coffee was decent. Likely will not return, but I do wish them good luck.

This is what I like to call a dice roller of a restaurant.   Dirty.  Duck tape on the booth seats. Food on the floor. Bathroom smells like a truck stop and if you want to chance washing your hands there is a giant bottle of soap you can grab with your greasy hands to pour out and then wipe your hands on your jeans. Plenty of other places close by ... I'm crossing my fingers I don't feel sick in an hour... clean it up folks.

It 's really hard for me to write such a negative review but something should be said. Our family has been going to this location for some time now and the service has been disappointing lately. First of all, as a customer, I do not care if you are having a bad day- I don't deserve your attitude. Secondly, if the app is not functioning properly, it is not our fault that machines have glitches. Don't give me an attitude saying I came at the wrong time to pick up my food because your system failed you and not even apologize. Lastly, be consistent with the amount of food I receive. I'm paying for a large and my bowl if half-filled. As I mentioned before, I've been going there for a while now so I know what a large should look like. 

Hopefully, you will be able to treat other customers with some respect after reading this.

I only gave one star cause giving 0 stars wasn't an option. I will never go here ever again!!! I use to be a regular but I'm completely disgusted now!!! All the good employees don't work there anymore, they prob quit cauSe the manager always had his butt crack handing out of his pants. When I'm eating with my family, I don't want to see your booty crack. Buy some bigger pants Mr. Jamie sir.
And last week I was using the restroom and there was 3 bloody pads stuck on the bathroom wall. That's when you know the whole place is gross, especially the employees! The new workers all act like they are on drugs and high all the time an they look dirty! I have heard the employees yell and curse at each other. DONT GO HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO GET A DISEASE!!!

Don't even waste your time anybody that wants to give you attitude on the phone and you're calling to give them money for service just will never understand why Uber took over their industry LOL hello McFly is anybody home

Bad service...seated 20 minutes without a server.  When a server finally came by, they asked us to wait a while longer..  this place has some work to do to get it together.. unsatsfied customer.. update... i ordered a cider beer at the bar and they said they were out.. sitting at a table (with no service for 20 min) the table next to us was served 2 while we were waiting...

Well the food is amazing it's no denying that ! But the staff and customer service is horrible. PLEASE DONT GO THERE A HOUR OR 30 MINUTES BEFORE THEY CLOSE THEY WILL TRY TO FORCE YOU TO-GO AND IF YOU CHOOSE NOT TOO THEY WILL RUSH YOUR FOOD. I went too this place everyday out of the month sometimes twice and I've never been treated horribly until the time they had to re roll my sushi. First off they rushed my food for maybe the 100th but this time the presentation of my food just couldn't be ignored. I asked if they can take the sushi back and fix it and the bartender flipped out and  argued with me to tell me how she wouldn't serve me anymore if I ever come back etc etc. WOW ! sorry geisha but I don't eat slop. Can you believe I brought my issue to the owner and he didn't care not one bit; If you care about how you're treated and not only great food but great presentation as well.....DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!

CAUTION, CAUTION, CAUTION... I visited this market with my sister.  The market itself is wonderful.  However, the woman who runs the smoothie food truck is dishonest and not to be trusted.  My sister and I ordered 2 large smoothies, @$10.  I gave my sister a $50 bill to pay the $20 owed. I went to the restroom. When I returned my sister was quite upset.  The owner took the $50, gave her the smoothies and no change.  When my sister asked for $30 change she said she only gave her a $20.  When I approached I noticed the proprietor peeking out to see if my sister was gone.  When I approached and requested the change she came out and started shouting "Your calling me a liar and a thief".  She was very unprofessional and seemed a bit high.  Rather than arguing anymore we wished her good karma and left.  I'd like to add the smoothies tasted like wash water.  I will return to capture a picture of the dishonest vendor and her products.  BEWARE of the Dishonest Vendor. She seems to have this down to a science.

Do not waste your money coming here. I've been here twice and had horrible service both times. Today we had bad service all around. Our drinks were bought out and set on the table without being passed out, by the time they were passed out they were all watered down. Food was BAD, no sauce and barely any meat in the wraps and on the plates. The hookah man never used one word when he came to our table, he didn't say excuse me, just scooted his way in. Our waitress got nothing right and blamed our bad service on the other people who were helping her. Save yourself the bad vibes and stay away.

This was the worst Vietnamese restauranr Ive ever been to. Its not even run by Vietnamese, which explains the blandness. $13 for a deluxe and its small as shit. There were two pieces of meat and a half of a sausage. Do not ever go here. If you want really good Pho, there are so many other places in Philly thats more authentic and priced way better with much better portions.

As an elder care attorney, representing victims of abuse, I was shocked by the rude and condescending behavior inflicted upon me and my elderly guest, whom I was treating to a birthday brunch at this establishment. My guest wanted to order a specialty omelette, which included ingredients that are basic to many omelettes, tomato and peppers. The server informed us that those items were out of season and unavailable. I expressed my surprise, with a smile, that there was no way to get tomatoes or peppers of good quality when this place specializes in omelettes to order. I was a bit taken aback by the server's  rudeness in delivering this information, especially when I could see that berries and avocados were being served and they are also out of season! Apparently this caused our server to say something unkind about us to the manager who then proceeded to come over and berate us and make a scene. I was astounded and calmly expressed my dismay at her behavior toward customers. Food was good, no issue with the chef; but the atmosphere was noisy and lacking comfort. The service was undoubtedly deplorable. So much misery was inflicted on me and my guest for requesting tomatoes and peppers that it's unconscionable.  When the manager marched over she announced that she heard we had an issue. I told her we were surprised that tomatoes and peppers were unavailable...that's it. She then proceeded to go off on a tangent and jump down my throat, behaving so unprofessionally that I was shocked. This manager continued to attack me by coming back to our table a second and 3rd time, continuing her outrage by throwing down a phone number and telling me to call the owner, storming off in fury. It was a shocking thing to witness! Needless to say I will never come here again or recommend it to anyone! I believe the owner would fire her on the spot if she had seen how this woman treated her customers, as well as the male server who must've said something horrific to cause this incident to begin with. My final comment was that tomatoes and peppers may be out of season, but so are the berries and avocados they were serving, and I didn't know why she was attacking customers! I was trying to protect my guest from feeling put-down and embarrassed. My guest is nearly 80 years old and I am 60; I did not ask to speak with the owner or for the owners phone number. If you believe the customer should come first and deserves to be treated well and to have an enjoyable experience at a dining establishment then do not waste your time at this place. Apparently respect for elders and common courtesy in a service-oriented business is not part of this place's training. I apologized to my guest when we left and tried to keep it light, but I could see that she was hurt and embarrassed. Her words to me expressed her dismay about how we were treated and I felt it absolutely necessary to leave this review.

This was the worst ever. They had no two things that match Chicken fajita no sour cream. Then they advertise the grinch mint chocolate no grinch mint chocolate. Steak and no sauce. Food served cold. Waitress didn't know nothing about nothing., but they did give us a 20% discount.

Stayed for a single night in August of 2018.  Had planned to stay for 2 nights, but decided to check-out early.

Staff/service was fantastic - very accommodating and helpful.  This review has nothing to do with their hospitality.  I've stayed at other Indigo's across the US, and all of those experiences were great. This particular hotel, though, is just simply to "compact" for a comfortable stay.  Feels like they tried to fit too many rooms into the building they renovated.  Each room will fit 1 individual with no issues, however for anyone planning to stay here with a partner or significant other, the rooms  will likely be too small (especially if one of you is over 6 feet tall).  The showers are very "economical" in terms of space saving, and there is just no way 2 people can fit into the bathroom at the same time.
Just walked out. 15 minutes of waiting for someone to acknowledge. Never got a menu or anyone to take beverage order. Disappointing indeed

So first time I tried this spot was in Southern California and now here. The first time was hmm then I was like I got to try it again boy was I wrong . This time I started feeling sick and beating my self up for going .

Awful and over priced. Avoid if possible. I wish we had. I ordered enchiladas verdes, and they were awful. The meat was so dry and there was just no flavor at all for anything else. The Spanish rice tasted just like the boxed one I buy at home. It was just awful. Not sure how long this place will stay in business this way.
The one star is because the sandwiches are decent. I advise not to get delivery. It is anything but fast. The previous reviews are correct about the deliveries taking over an hour. It's sad.

I'm an A-list member, so I visit this location often.  For some reason, this location ALWAYS has problems on the first night of a movie premiere.  I have gone 4 times so far and sat for up to 2 hours to wait for them to get the movie together.  There's always an issue:  hard drive error, projection issue, movie wasn't uploaded, etc.  Sometimes they give credits, other times they just leave you sitting and wondering and offer nothing. When you go out and speak to a staff member, their "go to" line is,"The movie will be on in 5 minutes."  Last week, we went to a movie that was supposed to start at at about 9. The movie didn't start until 11:20. Ridiculous. At least offer free drinks to the people that stick around.

I only give a one star if I don't want anyone to go there. My Son and I had very bad diarrhea and puking after eating there. That aside they're prices are different for Friday thru Saturday. For my 6 year old my Husband and I the bill came out to $48. I would have gotten better food at a favorite restaurant that puts linen on the table for less money. So overpriced and we got very sick. Don't go. Not worth it.

Such a piece of shit bar.  Showed up on a Thursday, and their 2 bartenders and 2 barbacks were overwhelmed by the 20 people in the bar, so much so that it took me 10 minutes to get a bartender's attention.  When I finally did, she told me it would be ten minutes before she could make the two cocktails I asked for (basically whiskey and bitters, and vodka and cordial).  Don't waste your time.

Pizza was burnt! I called and Isabella asked if we ate them already? Yes 1 slice, i took a bite and couldn't finish it. Pizza is hard. She didnt offer me a free one for next time i come again. She just said we'll work it out next time. So what is that mean??
Service was terrible. Very few diners and they forgot half our order. Won't be back any time soon.

I really wanted to love this place because it is so close to home. The staff is very friendly and they offer you drinks upon arrival. They have a fantastic color selection for both regular and gel colors and all of their equipment is new and very clean. However their work was a little sloppy both times I went. My pedi chipped after only a couple days, which is virtually unheard of. My gel mani had sloppy edges around the cuticle and actually chipped after a week, which is also uncommon. Not sure if they're doing something to thin out their polish or if they are using cheaper brands, or may they are just rushed because they are usually pretty crowded. Whatever the reason, I won't be back.

This used to be a favorite of our family but no more! Who staffs a Chinese restaurant with about 4 people on Christmas? The owner was extremely rude and could not care about the customer service that is offered at her restaurant. We had a 6 o'clock reservation and didn't get a waiter until 6:45. We tried to give the whole order to save time and the waiter couldn't handle that and only took the appetizer order. Those came out one at a time and some forgotten. We had to ask for a waiter at least 7 times to get the rest of order, tea, more place settings, etc. Finally, placed our order for dinner and that came 1 at a time for 4 entrees(1 forgotten). To finish the meal at 8 o'clock! At the end we tried to talk to the manager about the experience and she told us to not come back, not I'm sorry, what can we do for you. Who does that? 
It is sad because their food is good but not that good to withstand incompetence!

Dinner was good but dessert was lacking. Not sure I would have called that a Jingle Bell cruise as there was very little that seemed holiday about it. Boat was too hot and too cramped. Out tables were so tight that the manager had to move tables to make an adequate walkway.

Absolutely great pizza. However had a horrible experience. Waiter "Georgios" came back after not checking up on us the entire time, and told me that I "really scarfed down my food" and that I "don't even need a box for how much I had eaten" I ordered the smallest pizza they have, and was given these horrible comments and when I asked for another water, his response was "I guess so". Horrible service, incredible rude waiter. Would NOT recommend if you don't like feeling fat shamed inside a restaurant.

So.....running errands this Sunday afternoon and decided to stop in for beer and appetizers. We have been here a few times and is usually busy but service is good...food is typical bar fare which is sometimes just what you want. Today was pleasantly surprised to see it was not busy...lots of empty tables inside. But that was where the pleasant ended. Our waitress was ....just not there......????
We ordered beer and a few appetizers. The beers eventually arrived and were leisurely finished.....no waitress......food arrived but was difficult to eat wings with nothing to drink (had not been offered water). After waiting and looking around (and never laying eyes on her) for another 10 minutes we flagged down another waitress and asked if she could find our waitress....she said sure and asked if she could bring us anything....we asked for water and a refill on the beer. Our waitress suddenly appeared and put a water in front of me (one water.....none for the other person)....no words; turned and walked away. We shared the water..... the beer didn't show up until we were done eating.....I had to ask for the check.....incidentally the other wait staff were hustling to and from their tables....just not ours. 
If it was busy I might understand but it was not...not sure what the problem was but not worth over $70 for two people for 2 beers and appetizers and service not worthy of the stop in. Will be back sometime but not soon....maybe after staff has a turn over.

I ordered the black beans and rice and the Miami cuban. 90% rice, 10% black beans - it was ok. Lived for 20 years in Tampa - never remembered salami on my cuban sandwiches, so I ordered the Miami version. Not very good, had minced (bbq?) pork on it, and did not have a good flavor. My suggestion is to pass on this one.

This place used to be good but stick with cheesesteaks,  pizza or calzone. 
Everything else starts to fall off.

Just today ordered online just to give them a second chance and what I got as a take out, is simply not how a takeout should be handled. 

Lunch stromboli was just put in a brown bag with a plate underneath and voila,  good day. No utensil,  no napkins, nada.

Way to make a paying customer want to take the business somewhere else. 

Do yourself a favor and go to somewhere else. Really disappointing.

I was so excited that my new town would have a Costco! I do enjoy the selection here however the customer service is a joke! Not just once a few times. I don't understand why I always Treated horribly at this location and the manager yelled at me when I asked for clarification on something. Hella weird I have never been treated so poorly in a Costco I travel a lot for work and spend a lot of money at Costco. I've been to Costco's all over the nation and I HAVE NEVER BEEN TREATED SO POORLY.  Get your stuff and leave not a fun place like most Costco's

This hotel is one of the WORST hotels I've ever stayed in!!!!

1. Horrible Customer Service!!!

Checked-in and  i was told that i was confirmed on my Choice Privileges Points.

On check-out,  I requested a receipt for my business travel. The clerk quickly told me NO. He said I needed to get it from my 3rd party EXPEDIA agency. I then tried to verify I got my Points for Choice Privelegies and he said I would NOT get them because I used a 3rd party agency.  (Extremely Rude)

As for the the other desk clerks, they were self absorbed in their tasks at the front desk abd did not pay attention to the customers. One clerk just watched TV on his phone and had turned the volume down on the TV in the dining room area for breakfast.

2. Breakfast was recycled and NOT fresh.
3. Orange juice dispenser was out of date and tasted bad. The attendant installed 1 or 2 more bags of concentrated orange juice and tested them. she subsequently pulled those out to until she got one that did not dispense bad orange juice.
4. Hotel room in dis-repair. Shower curtain rod was sagging and appeared to be broken on one side.

Toilet handle was broken.

Took several times to flush the toilet.

Water pressure was horrible for the toilet and shower.

Hotel room door was NOT square and subseequently would NOT shut good.

5. Room cleaning service did not make the bed one day. Also they kept on turning my room lights off after cleaning. I would leave a room light on because it was dark when I would return from work.

The young man that did my pedicure was very nice and polite. Good service from him, but he definitely needs more experience before he's performing pedicures on his own. I had to ask him to remove the skin around my toes. Scrubbing my feet lasted about 1 minute. Another lady to finish my polish because he wasn't familiar with white (total learning and I understand that); I just wish they would have told me I had someone new (and had someone guiding him along the way). 

The manager was real nice about it; came over and thanked me for the feedback and gave me a small discount.

if i could give negative stars, i would! let me start off saying that i have used this location many times prior to send packages out and never encountered a problem until the past 2 weeks. 

i had 2 packages with pre-paid return labels to be sent out to 2 different places. The employee scanned them for me, printed out my receipt for the packages being dropped off. They were printed labels and told me he will tape them onto my 2 packages to be sent out. The employee made a mistake and switched the labels and they were sent to the wrong places.

1 package was found and is currently being sent back to me, the other has not been found which costs over $100. The claim has finally been filed today after 2 managers and the owner have given me the round around. (had to contact both companies, and 2 different UPS reps multiple times because store would not)

My main issues are: the employee does not seem like he is owning up his mistake, 1 manager was away for the weekend and said he will call me back after speaking with him and never did. The other manager kept implying there is nothing they can do and did nothing to help resolve the issues. THE OWNER "Ray" (if thats his real name he gave me) called me with a restricted blocked number, told me it is MY FAULT that the packages were sent to the wrong locations because i did not place the labels on them myself (their employee is the one who offered to place the labels on for me). He does not want to take responsibility of his employee that made the mistake, nor did he try to help resolve the issues. He was very rude, loud, and disrespectful with his voice over the phone which is totally unacceptable and bad business. 

A rep from one of the companies that my package was supposed to be sent to was on the phone with me while the manager from this store was not trying to help resolve any issues. 

Small business franchise for UPS needs guidance by some real UPS reps. Will never use this location ever again and hopefully my claims will get resolved and i wont be stuck paying out of pocket for THEIR negligence.

I'm a Marriott Reward Member, and have never posted a Yelp review before. But my stay here was bad enough to merit my first post. Customer service was poor, there was no TV remote in my room, and the bar/restaurant was understaffed. Plus, no internet. Definitely don't eat there, but also don't stay.

{Update #3} 
It seems to me that you only like it when you guys receive positive reviews. You and your staff are not able to handle when someone is telling you that they were treated poorly and didn't like the service. This is business 101. You and your staff should figure out where you guys dropped the ball instead of putting energy into going back-and-forth with me on a public platform. You should probably invest that energy into making sure that unfortunate things like this don't happen again. I would not recommend this place to an enemy. We did not deserve that treatment, and the fact that you're trying to justify it reflects poorly on you. Learn how to take criticism and charge the issues instead of arguing with multiple customers on your short comings. You failed as a leader because you are not  people directing your team, instead you are telling them that customer are not always right. But what can I expect when their leader does not know leadership. I would not advise anyone to visit this restaurant because of the lack of compassion that was given from the owner or co-owner of this establishment. There is no need to try to win me back over as I am already done. Again I do not want or need your apology, but you should do better for the sake of the business and not desire treat them in the manner that you have. 

{Update #2} 
I just received a private message from the "co-owner" of this establishment which definitely shed a ton of light on the situation that happened. If the leader does not practice good customer service then the staff WILL NOT!! This makes so much sense because we were treated horribly by the staff here and nothing was being done about it. But this message I was just sent from the co-owner explains why. She does not take pride in serving others so why should the staff. Horrible and sad! She has fallen as a leader. 

      -Response: "I was out of town when you visited our restaurant. My response was not rushed as I waited until after speaking to all employees involved. 

I did not blame you 'just for coming to the establishment' but simply explained the situation to you in it's entirety. 

I am quite aware of what customer service is and should be. My staff does as well. We aren't always perfect, but that's because we're human.

I do not promote a 'customer is always right' mentality because, simply put, they aren't. Customers are human too. Clearly mistakes were made in this situation by guests and staff and for that we apologize.

Enjoy your Sunday,
Maria"

{Update} 
I really appreciate your urgency to respond to this negative rating. However, the treatment we received was UNACCEPTABLE and that same urgency should been extended then! I appreciate that you pointed out that my replacement food was free and you hoped I enjoyed it, as I did not even eat it because it became cold as I'm trying to deal with rudeness and unprofessionalism for the staff. Forget the food, I'm just trying to get comfortable at this point. So if you're the "co-owner" then you should know a thing or two about decent customer service and leadership and should have lead your team on how to properly handle situations like this instead of blaming us just for coming to the establishment. I would recommend sitting down with your team and using this situation as a teaching tool on what NOT to do to your customers who thought well enough of this place to have our girls gathering there. This was heartbreaking to say the least. I don't need your apologies, just do better as a leader.

1 Star because I actually got my food. That's about it. 
Sat at bar and was given a menu. Bartender probably looked at me 20 times and never took my order. 
This is my second bad experience here.. Must be a glutton for punishment but it's right next to my fav hotel when I'm here and I was hungry and tired and looking to eat and go.. 
This is one of these places that don't really care about customer service because the next set of chumps is walking in the door so who cares anyway. Typical of a chain place. 
Newsflash to bartender / waitstaff: We tip for good service not ignorance and bad attitudes. 
Avoid this place if you can...

100% the worst place to live. Everything here is always broken. The fire alarms have been broken for the past 4 MONTHS and continue to wake me up regularly at 2,3,4, 5 am, which is why I am angrily writing this yelp review at 2:48 am. No one ever answers your calls or fixes your issues. On top of that the package system here is always broken and everything gets stolen. 
Pay the extra money and live down the street somewhere else. You will not regret it.

If you're looking to end up with massive medical bills and permanent physical and psychological damage, The Round Up is just the place! This place has a pattern of violence and negligence with their staff.  This is my sister-in-law and brother's story from the original Round Up:  

This is the same as "Round Up" Tampa. Same staff, same owners, they just moved to a different storefront.

I went to the Round Up for my birthday. I was walking to the Tiki Bar with my boyfriend, and one of the bouncers slid his hand up the back of my shorts, in an attempt to grab my butt. He was a big guy, I would estimate he weighed as much if not more than my boyfriend and I combined. My boyfriend asked him (calmly, with no threats) to apologize. Instead of apologizing, the bouncer and 2 of his bouncer friends beat him continuously. They punched him, bodyslammed him, kicked him, stomped on him, and pummeled him, putting him in the hospital.  He now has permanent injuries that he will have to deal with for the rest of his life. Anyone who tried to help was restrained by other bouncers. My boyfriend was dragged out (literally), and I followed. While waiting for the ambulance to arrive, the owner came  out.
