He was extremely rude and unhelpful, and threatened to have me thrown in jail for speaking against him. This is the same man that owns the "new" location.

If anyone doesn't believe the story, please let me know and I can furnish you with the police report and ambulance report from that night.

Margaritas were warm. Food arrived quickly, but was cold. Service was nearly absent. We dined as a party of 2 at the bar at 4:30pm, one of maybe ten other small parties in the entire restaurant. The entire staff seemed more inclined to socialize and take shots at the bar than ask about the quality of our experience. I was a longtime fan of Rosalita's, but after today I won't be back.
This was the worst KFC I have ever had. Chicken was dry, and disgusting. Went back and asked for a refund. The manager was rude, and refused. I will never go to this run down KFC ever again.

Here are some. Examples of recent visits: drive-through closed early staff outside smoking and when approached they said they had to close early to clean the lobby; Breakfast on a weekend no eggs due to staff not  taking the eggs out of the freezer; Excessive wait times even when no one in the lobby; Lobby not clean when empty; served cold nacho fries (felt like they came right from the Coker and not cooked to all. The staff is made up of young people that seem to not care about their jobs and act like they don't want to be there. The owners needs to check in on this location because the team is costing them money.

This place use the have good food and decent service. It now has horrible food and even worse service. If you go, expect to wait forever, possibly never receive a menu (I used my phone to pull up the menu) cold food that is unappetizing (Kraft cheese on a mushroom and cheese omelette) and to feel sick and possibly throw up after you leave.

I have had two very bad experiences here. Went with some friends a few months back. You have no idea if you are supposed to seat yourself, or if someone is going to seat you. Once seated, you see every waiter pass your table, but it takes forever to get service at your table. My first trip, we waited for almost 2 hours for our food. We got chicken biscuits, which were pretty good. 

Fast forward a few months, and my girlfriend and me tried all the other Hillsboro Village breakfast spots only to find they were all packed (per usual). She said let's try Jackson's. I told her I wasn't a fan, but was down to try it again. Same poor service as last time. We both got omelettes and they were honestly disgusting. The flavors weren't the worst, but the texture was awful. 

Overall, poor service and food is not good.

This place has gone downhill. We waited about 5 minutes at the front desk before anyone acknowledged us and it was not busy at all. Our daughters meal was wrong when the food came but they did fix it and make what she ordered. We only saw our server a couple of times and we finally grabbed our own to go box. When paying was told the app was not working for the VIP points. They told me to put my phone number down and they will add it later to my account.

I hadn't been in a while and it became very obvious that the new owners have ran this once amazing Theater into the ground!
 The main things that I noticed were:
The staff does not show you to your seats anymore. 
My seat was really dirty and covered in what looked like popcorn butter
The seats were really worn out and the vinyl on the arm rest was all cracked which is really uncomfortable for a 3 hour movie.
The food runner touched the rim of every glass of beer he delivered
**The lady across the aisle from me accidentally spilled her beer right after it was delivered and the staff did not clean it up for the whole movie!!!!  The 4-5 people sitting in her row had to sit the entire movie with their feet in a puddle of beer. The staff made NO attempt to clean this up and kept running food and popcorn the whole time.  
After the movie I asked the staff member at the ticket counter if they could  validate my parking slip, she said she did.  when I left the garage 10 minuets later and scanned my parking ticked it rang up as a "general rate" costing me an extra $20! instead of $7.  So all in in all $28.34 for 2 tickets + $31.00 for popcorn, M&M's & 2 beers + $20 for parking =$79.34 to see a movie!  Never again.  The Broad Theater has every this place has + it is clean and the staff would never let you sit in beer for a whole movie!!!!

Wow. Stopped in completely ready to sign up for the Black Card membership. Spoke to the woman at the front desk who was the fastest, softest voiced person I've spoken to in along time. I had to keep saying excuse me, because it was almost impossible to understand what she was saying. It was as if there was a race to answer my question so she could get rid of me. I heard a lot of what she couldn't do, and no real offers to help me get signed up so I could take an orientation class tomorrow.  It seemed so difficult, which is why I just canceled my membership to Orange Theory Fitness. Working out doesn't have to be complicated. 

I work in sales, and it would have been so easy to close me in this deal.  Glad I don't own this business.

Have been several times before with no problems. Stopped on my way to work for coffee and scone. A guy ahead of me was checking on his order and was told it would be ready when it was done. True statement, but not the best way to suggest customer service was a priority. I left, unlikely to be back.

Worst valet parking! If you're a business traveler, don't use this lot. My car wasn't available 3 times when I got to the lot and I had called while in the terminal. I had to wait for 2 to 3 shuttles before getting on the bus to the airport. Non business travelers build so much time in prior to boarding vs business travelers and yet they didn't give consideration to this. I almost missed my flight because of this and I had arrived at the Parking Spot and 1 hour and 15 minutes prior to my flight leaving. So so disappointed.

We were a party of 3 for brunch on a saturday morning. We ordered a bahn mi sandwich, wild mushroom scramble skillet and the french toast.  If there were any wild mushrooms in my scramble, I must have missed them, and my two eggs over easy came hard cooked, plus the portion was a little dinky for $11. My husband's french toast was really a slice of warmed-over bread pudding, just OK tasting and smallish in portion.  Our friend's bahn mi was quite generously sized and apparently tasty, but it was served with a side of onion rings that resembled intestinal tape worms.  Service was friendly, chatty and cute, but slow and forgetful.  Overall this restaurant felt a bit amateurish to me, like a business run by high school students as a class project.

Is it clean? Yes. Is it in a great location? Yes. Is the shuttle service accommodating? It depends. You might need to walk a little to your destination. Is an Uber or Lyft quicker? Yes. Does this hotel charge you to park your car? Yes. Do they have continental breakfast? No. 

So you a probably wondering why I gave them a one star rating, right? Truthfully, if I could leave this place 0 stars I would. The only thing they have going for them is the live music downstairs at the commodore. And I can't forget to add how friendly and helpful our shuttle guy Josh was. He's the only good shuttle guy they have. The cleanliness and location are great as well, but that isn't enough to have me running back here. 

I am quite surprised that no one has really commented on how paper thin these walls are. Thin enough to hear full blown conversations. I've stayed at plenty of hotels and never once have I experienced one as nearly as loud as this. It sounded like people were at one point tossing furniture around. To top it off, it wasn't just the one room beside us it was both. 

The bathrooms are small and the showers have barely anywhere to put your toiletries. Make sure you check your bill too. My mom was quoted one price on the phone when she booked it and was never sent a confirmation number. Then when we arrived the person at the front desk tried saying it was going to be over $800 for 3 nights. That wasn't what my mom was quoted. Upon checkout, my mom reviewed the itemized bill only to find a charge for overnight parking when we never parked overnight. We rented a card for 1 day and were charged the $12 daytime fee on top of the $22 overnight fee. Review your bill always. I would never recommend this hotel and the next time I come to Nashville I will be staying somewhere nicer.
